intrals deafe dumbe thing creature profitable men sheep ox horse like looke vppon wee cannot onely admire wisedome power god creation also ought giue hereby thanks maiesty creation conseruation vnanswerable argumets presence power god moue bee action proceedeth power vse sences follow attaine thing profitable avoyd al hurtful thing contrary nature build house place habitation make prouision food victual proceedeth wisedome nourish young one loue one another al outward appearance liuing flock togither knowledge society consent vnanimously work labour likewise token visible emblem goodnes v cleare light omnia diuinitatis esse plenum thing full diuinity seeing sparrow lighteth ground without poet saide god middest beast men market sea heere cannot containe selfe relating word aristotle trust man blame alledge write thing truely fitly although another man word regarded saith sayed spoken thus therefore writeth among creature lesse acceptable sences nature common mother hath ordained many delightes pleasure men vnderstand cause reason nature liberally thing absurd farre reason cannot looke vppon ymages vpper face creature naturall thinges painted framed without also behold wit art painter therefore take lesse pleasure worke workemans sake attaine true cause shall lesse kisse imbrace contemplation action naturall thinges woonderfull diligence alacrity cause base thinge despise nature constitution smaller viler beast fit boyes childish mind work nature wherein wonderfull thing therefore true heraclitus sayed followed vnto hothouse wherein sat warme body perceiued affraid avthors vetus testamentum cum annotationibus seb munsteri eiusdem munsteri dictionaria hebraicolatinum quadrilingue epistola presbyteri ioannis vt vocant hoc est aethiopiae regis ad pontificem rom de rebis aethiopicis arabicos hoc est ex arabica lingua translatos nominabo inferius inter obscuros greeke avthors actuarij liber de serpentibus venenis breuiter ex dioscoride contractus est ada mantij physiognomica aescuyli tragoediae aetij non omnia sed plera que euolui excerpsi tegrum vero librum qui est de venenis venenatis animalibus aeliani historia animalium petro gillio interprete cum eiusde additionib ex oppiaplutarcho porphyrio helidorio vt libri titulas habet sic autem aeliani omnia adiecta sut vt nihil ad rem pertinens omit teretur nam si quando stilus luxuriari videbatur leuiter euagari aut hominem cum brutis conferendo reprehendere quod saepius facit ut qui professione rhetor fuerit plerun que contraximus pius em variae historiae libri pius em de instruendis aciebus liber alexadri magni epistola ad aristotelem derebus indicus cornelio nepote interprete alexandri aphrodisiensis problematum libri alexander trallianus medicus ammonicus de differentijs vocum annomus periplus apollonij argonautica cum scholijs apostolij byzantij paroemiae appianus historicus aratus cum scholijs arislides rhetor aristophanis comoediae cum scholijs aristotelis libri integri quod particulares historias ateinet de historia de generatione de partibus animalium physiognomica de mirabilibus de coloribus parua naturalia vt voc nt problemata c teris libris aut nullam aut rarissimum vllius animantis nomen occurret michaelis ephesij scholiain libros de generatione quae ioannis philoponi nomine publica ta sunt ni hus scribit michaelis ephesij scholia libros de generatione extare expositionem non extare ari ni periplus euxini ponti eiusdem periplus rubri mari eiusdem de rebus gestis alexandri historiae eiusdem indica athenaei dipnosophistae biblia sacrum hoc est vetus mouu testamentum graecae callimachi poemata quaedam cl galeni libri alij quide multi sparsim nobis cogniti integri vero propter animalium historiam qui sequuntur libri de simplicium facultatibus de antidotis de theri c ad pi nem de cibis honi facultati libritros quoru cu ar medica circa nullas secundus ad solonem tortius ieno iptus incipit isulus oricus tiu de vitis philosophorum dion historicus dionisyus afer de situ orbis eustathius interpretes dioscorides epigramatum graecorum authores diuersi epistolarum graecarum authores diuersi quos aldus olim vno volumine coniunxit etymologicon virgilium sextus platonicus de remediis ex animalibus sexti aurelii propertii elegiae sextus pompeius festus de lingua lat sexti iulii frontini strategamata silius italicus poeta statius papinius neapol poeta titi calphurnii siculi bucolica liuius historicus valerius maximus aesculapius nescio quis ex animalibus remedia descripsit quae plera que eadem apud sextum platonicum reperio alberti magni de animalibus libri innumeris erroribus inquinati ita vt niphus totidem fere errores esse sribat quot verba alexander quidam author obscurus ab alijs eiusdem farinae authoribus citatur ipse non vidi vt rodolphus leuiticum arnoldus de villa noua ijs quae de animalibus scribit vt libro de theriaca arabum eorum interpretu tum nomina tum errores sequitur bartolemaei anglici de proprietatibus rerum libri auerrois libros aristotelis de generatione de partibus paraphrastice reddidit licet meo iudicio perperam interpretetur niphus ego cum ex scriptis nihil egregii sperarem ne que apud no reperirem accersere nolui vt ne que auicennae de animalibus libros quibus plera que omnia aristotelis esse puto si quid praeter illa adiectum est alberti luc brationibus quibus no vsi sumus contineri auicennae opera medica de eiusdem libris animalium alberti magni mentione iam dixi elluchasem elimithar medici de baldath tacuini ferdinadus ponzeto cardinalis de venenis cobus dondus patauinus quem vulgo aggregatorem vocant iorac cuiusdam liber de animalibus ab alberto magno saepe citatur ab alijs obscuris autem eu frequentur falsa scribere kirandes etiam nescio quis ab aggregatore alijs recentioribus remedijs praecipue ex animalibus subinde citatur matthaei syluatici pandectae medicinales r moses petrus aponensis venenis rasis libro desexaginta animalibus semeryo vel haren semeryo ab alberto magno historia animaliu frequentur citatur serapio vincentij belluacensis de animalibus libri nempe decimus septimus speculi naturalis cu sex sequentibus speculi doctrinalis etia libro decimo sexto rursus de ijsdem breuiter agit liber de natura rerum auth ri innominati passim apud recentiores illos quorum impurus sermo latinis est citatur vincentium albertu ex quibus no omnia quae prorsus absurda erant mutuati sumus andreae bullunensis glossemata auicennam vtilia sane erudita quamuis dictionis non admodum purae fuit enim lingua arabicae peritus ita vt orthographiae etia scriptarum abeo dictionum maior sit habenda fides quam ab alijs quorum pleri que misere illam corruperunt lauren russius hippiacrita peritissime scripsit quanquam stilo non satis latino isidorus etymologici sui libro de animalibus quaedam scripsit non inutilia meretur autem mediu fere locu ni fallor inter classicos barbaros authores vt monachi illi quorum commentarij mesuen ante annos circiter octo venetiis excusi sunt eiusdem ordinis fuerint petri crescentiensis de rust libri aeneae syluij asiae europae descriptio alexandri ab alexandris ic neapolit dy geniales alexandri benedicti veronensis de mo bi curandis diuersitate vocis animalium eiusdem generis lib de animalibus quae sapere dicu tur vnum de quae sicco morantur du o de animalibus septem de quae colores immutant vnu de quae latibula faciunt vnu de antomatis sic puto vocat que non ex coitu sed ex putredine nascuntur animalibus vnum compendij ex aristotele de animalibus libros de animaliu prudentia moribus vnu de fructibus animalibus versus mille authores veteres quoru libri de animalibus scripti extent enumerat mutuatus ex indice plinij qui loco primo libri habetur authores enim aliquot quos octauo praecipue libro plinius nominat tanqua omnes de animalibus simpliciter scripserint nipho numeratur cum illi obiter tantu operibus suis velres gestas vel rem rustica continentibus animalium quoruda miminerint iuba hieron attalus philometer beast mention made among auncient writer except suidas epistle alexander vnto aristotle interpreted cornelius nepotius bred india syria contrey abod breed neere riuer euphrates delight much drinke cold water thereof bodie like body roe haue horne growing forth crowne head long sharpe alexander affirmed pierced sheeldes souldiers fought irefully time company slew trauelled india eight thousand fiue hundred fifty great slaughter may occasion rare sildome seene day cause thereby breeder meanes continuance consisted multitude weakened destroyed horne great made like saw cut asunder braunches osier small tree whereby commeth passe many time neck taken twist falling boughes whereat beast repining cry bewrayeth himselfe hunter taken vertues beast vnknowne therefore suidas sayth antalope good parte ape ape called latine simia sometimes simim simiolus cycero claudian martial horace greeke word simos viz signifieng flatnesse nostril ape called haebrewes koph plurally kophin ierom translated king whence may probably coniectured came latine word cepi cephi ape haue tailesof name sometimes called haebrewes bogiah chaldee kophin italian samada maionio bertuccia munkey gatto maimone auncient graecians pithecos later mimon arkobizanes reason imitation moore bugia spaniard mona ximio french singe germaines aff flemishe simme schimmekell illirians opieze generally held subtill ironical ridiculous vnprofitable beastthe smal vse ape whose flesh good meate sheepe neither backe burthen ass yet commodious keepe house like dog graecians termed gelotopoion made laughter athanaeus anacharsis philosopher banquet wherein diuers iesters brought make merry yet neuer laughed among residue length brought apeapes made laughter sight whereof hee laughed hartily demaunded cause hee laughed aunswered men faine merriment whereas ape naturally made purpose moreouer ape much giuen imitation derision called cercopes quality ape wicked craft deceipts imposture flattery wherefore poet fained two bretheren wicked fellowes turned ape seate habitation came pithecusan island virgill calleth inarime arime old hetrurian word ape island seates varinus docibility ape gyants god ouerthrowen copulation burned appeare monstrous shape horsses head horsse haue web eye mingle togither milke asse blood doue dew cabadges anoint therewith take dirt asse hath made water way therewith annoint scabbes sheepe recouery one stroken scorpion ass dung must presentlye applyed else profiteth nothing malady hinnvs jnnus ginnvs mannus mannulus befi burdones c language beside greeke haue wordes expresse beast latines haue deriued termes beast small size dwarfes among men therefore seldome seene part world called hinni caelius rh dcollumella conceiued horse shee asse althogh take denomination male yet resemble female ancient time male conceiued horse shee asse called hinnuli pliny likewise asse mare muli young one little goat deerhermol u hare like although take innuli young hart hinni hinnuli breede horse asse appeareth two kindsvarro transplanted hinnus lesse mule ruddie hauing ear like horse mane taile like asse lying wombe foling twelue monthes like horssenonius brought vp like little horsses whose age discerned teeth sometimes procreated horse mule aptnes beareperot called burdones else bardus reason folly slownes manni mannuli little low horse gentle easie handledporp yrius called also among ciuilians burdi france farre gration polis kind mule countrey speech called iumar bred asse bull heluetian alpes beyond curia towne speluga haue bin sincerely informed horse conceiued bull mare therefore scaliger saith foale called hinnulus whereof hee reporteth seene many himselfe two instant onely one female betwixt whose eares two bony bunch bignes halfe walnut giuing euident testimony forehead father syre bull say kinde want vpper teeth vnderchappe doeth deformed manner stretch foorth selfe beyond vpper many fish called gabala aruerni befi day court france conclude make ditch pit vnder apple tree laying vpon mouth rotten stickes couer earth strawe vppon herbes beare commeth apple tree falleth pit taken herbe wolfebanie libardine poison fox wolues dog familiar court come owne chamber listed would goe abroad field wood returning home againe owne accord would hand foote rub kinges chamber doore haue opened hungry locked happened certaine young noble men conspired death princea history came chamber doore rubbing custome beare king doubting anye euill supposing bene beare opened doore presently slewe fable certaine wilde beare huge staturecaelius terrified looked vppon pythagoras sent kept himselfe verie familiarly vsing stroke milke length wearie whispered hir eare bound oath departed shuld neuer harm liuing thing saith fable obserued dying day beares care thing dead therefore man hold breath deade harme gaue occasion esope fable two companion sworn friend trauelling togither met beare wher amazed one ranne away gate vp tree fell downe counterfetted himselfe dead vnto whome beare came smelt nostril eares breath perceiuing none departed without hurting soone friend came tree merrily asked companion beare saide eare marrye quoth warnd neuer trust fugitiue frend thou art diddest forsake greatest necessity thus far esop bury one another dead tzetze affirmeth receiued many nation child haue bene nursed beares parris throwne cittievarrinus nourished beare fraunce noble house vrsons whose firste founder reported haue bene certaine yeares togither nourished beare cause called vrson affirme arcesius deceiued name mother callisto name lytaons daughter raigned arcadia whereof many giue diuers reason say callisto companion diana vsed hunt verie like vnto one day iupiter came likenes diana deflowred childe diana asked happened callisto answeared happened fact wherewith goddesse angry turnd beare shape brought forth arca wandring woodes taken brought presente vnto lycaon father vpon day beare ignorant law entered temple iupiter lycaeus sonne followed arcadian would haue slaine iupiter pittie tooke heauen placed among starres say callisto turned beare iuno afterward diana slew comming knowledge callisto placed signe heauen called vrsa maiore great beare time called hamaxa reason fable rendred palaephatus callistus going beares den beare deuoured foolish companion seeing none come foorth beare fondly imagined virgin turned beare another constellation next great beare called arctophylax bootes little beare whose girdle bright starre called arcturus constellation beares commeth denomination artique antarctique pole affirme two beares helice cynosura two nurse iupiter sometime named cause whereof apparant greeke tongue helice starre hauing taile roled vp cynosura taile length like dogge also barbarously terming parandrus pyradus coniecture beast polonians call tur thuro howsoeuer confound tarandus another beast called rangifer kind vrus haue many property common buffe yet reason polonian tur buffe head mouth differeth beastes also cause taken sarmatia common people call daran darau although later writer call duran daran translate bonnasus meanes agree beast name daran easily deriued tarandus tarandos also polonion tur buffe obiected horne thereof cragged braunched thing pliny attrybuteth buffe whereunto answer auncients confound buffe elke rangifer discription elke vary diuers time mistaking one another reason wrote altogither report none seene contries therefore may easilie deceiued buffe well elke chiefe author opinion haue beene sir thomas eliot georgius agricola contend man giue better reason pliny maketh buffe beast proportioned betwixt hart oxe sort rangifer shalbe manifested yet neuer appeare rangifer doth change colour like buffe also make euident distinguishing buffe rangifer presuming polonian thvro tur buffe proceed discription pliny seueral part siluius hesychius head beast like head hart horne branched ragged body part like wilde ox haire deepe harshe like beares hide hard thicke scithians make breastplate dart pierce colour part like ass hunted feared changeth hew whatsoeuer thing seeth among tree like among greene bough seemeth greenea myracle subscribe hereunto first see face men beast thorough feare ioy anger passion doe quickly change ruddy white blacke pale pale ruddy againe beast hath head hart also hath feare hart higher degree therefore secret operation may easily alter colour haire passion reasonable man may alter colour face thinges reported pliny beast india called lycaon shall afterward declared besides two among creature couered haire chaungeth colour another reason forcing yeeld herunto sea polypusfish earth among creeping thing chamaeleon doe also change colour like sort fashion whereunto may replyed chamaeleon polypusfish pilled bare without haire therefore may easily versecoloured thing impossible nature haire receiue tincture passion answer nature multiply diminish power lesser smaller beastes according hir pleasure reserueth operation nayles feather bird finnes scale fish making one sort diuers colour therefore may doth forcibly worke haires buffe skinne chamaeleon adding much force transmute much farther stand blood like archer setteth arme bow higher shoote farther therefore worthy obseruation beast hath best defence skin aboue hath wakest timerous heart aboue buffes bred differ quantity nature mannerthe diuersity ox al cutries one another therefore doe require seuerall tractat first ox italy famous much learned men haue firmed name italia varro first deriued greeke word italous signifieng ox aboundance bred nourished part great account auncient romanes made heereofoxe italy appeareth notable example punishment banished certaine countrey man killing oxe rage denying eate thereof killed man likewise italy theyr ox alike campania part white slender yet able manure countrey wherein bred vmbria great body yet white red coloured hetruria latinui compact wel set made strong labour stronge apennine although appeare eie beautifull egyptian dwell nilus haue ox vvhite snovv exceeding high great stature greater ox graecia yet meeke gentlearistotle oppianus aonia aelianus leo affric easily ruled gouerned men aonian ox diuers colour intermingled one within another hauing whole round hoofe like horse one horne growing middle forehead domesticall tame ox affrique small one would take calues two yeares oldeaffrica ox affricans saith strabo dwell betwixt getulia coast countrey haue ox horse haue longer lip hoofes graecians tearmed mecrokeilateroi armenian ox haue two hornesarmenian ox aeliantus vvinding crooking fro like iuye cleaueth okes exceeding hardnesse wil blunt sworde stroke vppon without receiuing impression cut thereby opinion onely excellent breede cattell boeotia neere citty tanagra called poemandra reason famous cattel varinus baeotia ox ox called coprophaga reason eate dung man also doe ox ciprus ease paine smal gut caricians part asia pleasant behold hauing shaggye haire bounches either shoulderscaricia oxe reaching swelling neckes vvhich either white blacke refused labour epirus yeeldeth also great large ox vvhich inhabitant cal pyrhicae epirus first stocke seminary kept king pirrhus hovvsoeuer say haue name fiery flaming colour called also larini village larinum larinus chiefe neatheard ahaeneus maketh mention foure yeares old least therefore vvere called atauri setaeuri vvere proper good king neither could liue place epirus reason whole country ful sweete deepe pasture al ox eubaea white time caluingeubaea three amphoraes water amounting least thirty english gallon wine measure whereby may bee coniectured great quantity beast bare indian king people make small reckoning beastes meane vulgar ox swift course wil runne race fast horse course cannot know oxe horse waging gold siluer vpon head king themselues much delighted pastime follow wagon owne mouthes handes prouoke beastes runne speedily heerein oxe exceedeth horse bycause wil accomplish race sufficient celerity except rider draw blood side spur ox rider neede lay hand prick al vpon onely ambitious nature ouercomming carrying swiftly assigne reason vniuersall bone skull hath comissure ioynt opened cannot receiue humour flowing vnto reason hardnesse resisting vaines belonging bone weaker smaller also vnfit conuay nourishment place neck beastes must needes dry lesse stronge bycause vaines little ox haue bunch growing backes like cammels vpon doe beare burden taught discipline men bend knee receiue load aelianus nomadian oxenamong nomades winter cattell marishes maeotia also certaine cattell without horne whereof naturally haue horne sawed soone grow forth part body onely endure cold aelianus oppianus phrygian aboue two thousand fiue hundred twenty eight pound thing strang like beene beforetime obserued entent succeeding age might mistrust memorable report said earle caused full picture said oxe set vp themarabian cowes feeding continually generous liquor naturally doeth encrease pyrrheaen kye admitted bull till foure yeare old leastpyrrhecan cowes thing causeth grow high tall stature whereof euer death herb eate hearbes whereupon falleth honydew milke bee wonderfull sweete plentiful foode good cowes greene countrey afforde especially kye loue wet watery place although butter comming milke beastes wholsome made fed dryer pasture like care drinke although loue coldest clearest water yet time caluing much beter haue warmer waterspalladius therfore lake heated made raine wholsome greatly female coniecture longer true cow admitteth one bul conceiueth first coniunction cause egyptian decipher woman bringing forth maiden child bul looking left hand likewise bearing man child bul looking right hand admitted copulation two yeare olde least may foure yet hath bene seene heighfer yeare old hath conceiued another foure moneths old hath likewise desired bul taken monster neuer thriued one valleyes mountaines quickly grow hart want first deep fat pastur aboue haue regard match equally yoak one may overbeare ox loose teeth year old al horse doth nerues harder hard bulles flesh dry melancholike horn greater larger buls reason eunuch gelded person neuer baldtheir seurall part copulation weakeneth braine bul hath stronger forehead oxe humour grow forth horne hardned vnder bone horn kie also bigger buls may thorough heat made flexible wax water bend euery way thus made soft doe slit cut foure euery horne twoe growe afterwarde euery beast foure horne sometime thorough thicknes scull closing vp part horne growthe reason ox polled smalnes vaines place feede horne come horne al remaine pouled reported haue little stone head feare death breath teeth al touch one another changed twiceaelianus chew cud like sheepe wanting rowe vpper teeth foure themaristotle eies blacke broade heart full sinnewes yet without bony substance although pliny affirmeth sometimes hart ox horse found bone crest called palea commeth pilus haire nothing else longe strake haire whereby generosity stomacke beast apparant pliny part cow different ox cow hath two vdders vnder loines fower speans like goat sheep concoction iuice meat may better discend lower part vpper nauell filled many vaines haire short soft taile long harder haire part body melt long rounde rain like raines seacalfe reason dry body growe fat fat easily dissoluedgalen manner feeding maintaineth strength eat much slowe chewing speedie concoction better preserue fat eate slowly eat hastily greedinesse hath bene already shewedthe manner ox feed fat ox eat flesh teare wild beast piece people prasias giue yoaked working ox fishherodotus also prouince aden horsses sheepe ox eat dried fish reason abundance pressinges grape dryed clensed turned wine mingle chaffe cattell eate grape themselues much better pressing small twigges leaues meat drinke fat oxe speedily like may added boughes laurell helme leaues also nut acornes wearied fed acornes till loath fall scab march aprill giue hay april vnto iune giue grasse greene meat may found abroad afterward summer autumne may satisfied leaues elme bay holme especially kinde oake without prickle therefore cannot abide iuniper nouember december seede time lasteth must haue much giuen desire either forenamed food else better neede require must principally regarded cartell fal leannesse winter time leanes mother many sickness cattel vtter ouerthrow therefore benefit full feeding many may appeare comon prouerbe bos ad acervum oxe whole heape signifie men liue plenty aboundance like care must bee drinke neatheard must diligently looke vnto drinke may alway cleare reported riuers crathis sibaris cattell drinke water doe turne white whatsoeuer colour former time time oxen agethey liue strength perfection twelue yeares whole life part twenty kie liue long meanes know age teeth horn obserued teeth grow black age horn waxe circled grow yeares although dare affirme euery circle betokeneth yeares groweth haue written yet assured smooth horne sheweth young beast moreouer although kie endure much cold heat winter summer yet must haue regard ox therefore required winter cold weather kept dry housed stals must conuenient quantity euery oxe may lodged vppon straw flooer made higher vnder forefeete hinder vrine may passe away stand hurt hoofes also allowed standing lodging euery oxe eight foot bredth length answerable like regard must theyr maunger rack whereof staues must stand aboue one foot rather lesse one another may draw meat stampe vnderfoot diet foode wit man ordaine manner good regard bodily healththe med in preserue oxe strength preseruation strength cause must receiue ordinary medicine euery quarter yeare end spring summer autumne winter place thus made giuen potion take cypre lupineleaues equal quantity beat small set water open ayre day night afterward giue vnto euery one three dayes togither warmed feauer nowe signes feuer immoderat heat ouer whole body especially mouth tongue eares teares falling eies hollownes eye heauy stooping drowzie head matter running nose hotte difficulte breath sometime fighing violent beating vaines loathing meat remedy whereof let beast fast one whole day let let blood vnder taile fasting afterward make drinke bolewort stalkes sod oyle lickquor fishsauce let drinke fiue day togither eat meat afterward let eat top lentil young small vine braunches keepe nose mouth clean spunge giue colde water drinke three time day best meanes recouery cold meates drinkes neither must beast bee turned dores till recouered oxe sicke cold giue blacke wine presently helpe oxe meate tast hen doung belly wil presently tormented swell vnto death remedie giuen mallady take three ounce parsley seed pint halfe cummin two pound honey beat togither put throat warme driue beast vp long stand let many stand rub belly vntil medicine worke purgation vegetius addeth ash elme wood well sod oyle put downe beast throat cureth inflamation hendung time happen oxe get mouth throate horseleech first take fast holde sucke place hold mouth throat till haue kild beast canot take hold hand put ox throat cane little hollow pipe euen place leech sucketh pipe put warme oyle soone leech feeleth presently leaueth hold fortuneth sometimes oxe stung bitten serpent adder viper venimous beast wound take sharpe trifoly groweth rocky place straine iuice beat salte scarifie wound oyntment till wrought fieldmouse bite oxe dint teeth appear take little commin soft pitch make plaister wound get another fieldmouse put oyle let remaine till bers almost rotten bruise lay sore body shal cure whose nature gaue wound ox also much troubled disease called hidebound remedy whereof beast taken worke panteth let sprinkled ouer wine put peeces fatte mouth perceiue amendment seeth laurell therewith heat backe afterward oyle wine scarifie ouer plucking skin vp ribbes must done sunshine else warme place scab take iuice garlicke rub beast ouer medicine may biting wolfe mad dogge cured although affirme hoofe beast brimstone oyle water vineger present remedy better thinge butter stale vrine vexed wormes poure cold water vpon afterward annoint iuice onion mingled salt oxe wrinched strayned sinnewes trauell labour stumping roote hard sharpe thing let contrary foot legge let blood sinnews swel necke svvell let blood necke vvinding vveake broken let blood eare side head bendeth neckes bald grind two tile togither nevv one olde vvhen yoake taken cast pouder vpon neckes afterwarde oyle little rest haire vvill come againe oxe hangeth dovvne eares eateth meat troubled vvith cephalalgie paine head vvhich seeth thyme vvine vvith salt garlicke therevvith rub tongue good space also ravv barly steeped wine helpeth disease sometime oxe troubled vvith madnesse vvhich men burne betvvixt horne forehead till bleed sometime fly vvhich biting continually driueth madnesse vvhich vvoont cast brimstone bay sprig sod water pasture feede knovv vvhat good come thereby ox troubled vvith fleam put sprig black hellebore throgh ear wherein let remain til next day houre al euils eye part cured infusion hony mingle therevvith ammoniacke salt boeticke pallat roofe mouth swelled beast forsaketh meat bendeth one one side let mouth pared sharpe instrument else burned abated way giuing greene soft meat til tender sore cured vvhen cheekes svvell remedy thereof sell avvay butcher slaughter falleth often grow certaine bunch tongue vvhich make forsake meate thing cut toong aftervvard rub wound vvith garlicke salt till al fleamy matter yssue forth vvhen vaines cheek chap swell vlcers soften wash vineger lee till cured liuersicke giue rubarbe mishroms gentian mingled togither cough short breath giue twig vine iuniper mingled salt vse betony certaine hearbe called asplenon citterach consumeth melt ox found occasion creete ryuer called protereus running betwixt two citties gnoson gortina side thereof heards cattell fed neere gortina spleene fed neer gnoson full spleene physitians endeuored finde true cause heereof found hearbe growing coast gortina diminished spleene cause called asplenon come disease brest stomack first al begine cough new may cured pint barly meale raw egge halfe pint sod wine cough old take two pound beaten hysop sod pint water beate lentil root onyons washed baked wheate meale giuen fasting driue away oldest cough shortnesse breath neatheardes hang necke deatheshearb hartswort liuers lung corupted appeareth along cough leannes take root hasell put ox eare like equall quantity iuyce onyons oyle mingled put pint wine let giuen beast many day together oxe troubled crudity raw euill stomach shall know signes wil often belch belly rumble forbeare meate hanging eies neither chew cud licke himselfe tongue remedy whereof take two quart warme water thirty stalkes boleworts seeth together till soft giue beast vineger crudity cause belly stand swell pull tayle downewarde force binde thereunto motherwort mingled salt else giue glister anoint woman hand oyle let hir draw dung fundament afterward cut vaine tayle vvith sharp knife distempered choler burne leg hoofes vvith vvhot iron aftervvard let rest vpon cleane soft stravv vvhen gut intrals payned eased vvith sight duck drake vvhen small gut infected take fifteene cypre aples many gaules mingle beate vvith vvaight old cheese foure pint sharpest wine get diuide foure part giuing beast euery day one quantity excrement belly doe depriue body strength power labour wherefore vvhen troubled vvith must rest drinke nothing three dayes together first day let forbeare meate second day giue toppes wilde olyues defect thereof cane reedes stalkes lantiske myrtill thirde day little water vnto adde dryed grape sixe pintes sharpe wine giuen euery day like quantity hinder part lame congealed blood whereof outward appearance take bunch nettle rootes put mouthes rubbing whereof condersate blood remoue away ox come first winter grasse fall grassesicke pisse blood seeth together water barley bread larde giue altogether drinke beast praise kernel walenuts put eggeshels cure take bloody water selfe blow beastes nostril heardmen experience haue found better thing hearbrobert stay pissing blood must also kept stall within doores fed dry grasse best hay horne annoynted wax oyle pitch feele payne hoofes except case beast treadeth presseth anothers hoofe case take oyle sod wine vse whot barley plaister poultase layed wounded place plough share hurt ox foote lay thereunto stonepitch grease brimstone hauing first seared wound whot iron bound shorne wool returne taming instruction ox said busiris king egypt first euer tamed yoaked ox hauing name giuen purpose ox nature meeke gentle slow stubborne bycause depriued genitals tractable cause requisite bee alwaie vsed hand familiar man may take bread hand tyed vp racke gentlenesse best tamed thereby willing strong labour roughly yoaked suffered run wild without society sight men varro sayth best tame betwixt fiue three yeare old three soone bycause tender fiue late reason vnwealdy stubborne taken wild vnruly take direction taming first haue old tamed oxenhow tame yoke wild ox ioyne together wilde tame please may make yoake holde neckes three ox beast would rage disobedient old one example strength draw hlm keeping starting aside falling must also accustomed draw empty cart waine sled towne village som concourse people plow valloed ground sand beast may discouraged waight strength businesse keeper must often owne hand giue meate mouth stroke nose may acquainted smell man likewise put hand side stroke vnder belly whereby beast may feele displeasure touched country wash ouer wine two three dayes togither afterward horne giue wine drinke doth wonderfully tame although haue beene neuer wilde put neckes engins tame substracting meate affirme wilde oxe tyed halter made woollrasis presently waxe tame leaue euery man particular inclination businesse onely let chaunge oxen side set sometime right side sometime lefte side beware auoide ox heele get habite kicking wil hardlye refrained againe hath good memory forget man pricked whereas wil stirre another like man fetter dissembleth vengance vntill released paieth person hath grieued wherefore good vse young oxe goad rather awaken dulnesse whip vnderstanding oxenthese beast vnderstand owne name distinguish betwixt voice keeper stranger also said remember vnderstand number king persia certaine ox euery day drew water susis water gardensguidus number hundred vessel custom grew obserue therefore one would halt loyter businesse till whole accomplishedaelianus number fulfilled goad whip meanes could make stir fetch another draught burthen said loue fellowes draw yoake tenderly seeke mourning wantingthe loue ox yokefellow likewise obserued licking themselues haire cicero saith bend right side licke presageth storme bend left sideof licking ox natural obseruations foretelleth calmy faire day like manner lowgheth smelleth earth feedeth fuller ordinary betokeneth chang weather autumn sheep ox dig earth foot lie downe head head held assured token tempest aptnes go astraythey feede company flockes nature follow one straieth away neatheard present restraine wil follow owne danger angred prouoked fight stranger irefullythe anger ox kye vnapeaseable contention seene rhaetia betwixt curia velcuria heardes two village meete certaine plaine together fought longe threescore foure twenty slaine wounded eight excepted inhabytantes tooke anill presage mischiefe ensuing calamitye therefore would suffer bodyes bee couered earth auoyde contention skilfull neateheardes giue cattell strong hearbes garlike like sauour may auert strife come ox buls bugils must weare red garment gillius ox prouoked coulours cause nature ryseth prouoked rage see colour great enmity betwixt ox wolues wolfe flesheatingcreature lyeth waite destroy said great natural feare wolues tayle bee hanged racke manger oxe feedeth abstaine eating beast simple though aspect seeme graue thereof came prouerbe ox yokerasis called ceroma wherewithall wrastlers prizeplayers anointed foolish heauy man annoynted said ironically bos ad ceroma againe folly beast appearerh another greeke prouerbe saith oxe raiseth dust blindeth owne eye signifie foolish indiscrete men stirre vp occasion owne harmes manifold epithet giuen beast greeke latine sundry author doe demonstratiuely shew manifold condition beast called plower wilde earth tiller brazen footed reason hard hoofes cerebrons brayne wit horned stubborne hornestriking hard rough vntamed deuourer grasse yoakebearer fearefull ouertamed drudge vvryfaced slovv ill fauored vvith many note nature ordination condition remaine yet discourse ox tvvo necessary tractatsthe naturall v seueral part ox one naturall morral vvhich natural contayns seueral v particular part first flesh held singular norishment cause labour bringeth leannesse vse put sagination sayd english feeding country hath seuerall manner customhow fatte cattaile sotion affirmeth giue cattell come fresh pasture cabbage leaues beaten small sharpe vineger poured among afterward chaffe winowed siefe mingled branne fiue day together much fatten encrease flesh sixth day ground barley encreasing quantity little little sixe dayes together best time feede winter cockcrowing afterward morning twylight soone let drinke summer let haue first meate morning second seruice noone drinke second meate eating third meate euening againe let drinke second time also obserued water winter time warmed summer time colder feede must often wash roofe side mouth therein grow certaine wormes annoy beast hinder eating washing rubbe tongue wel salt therefore carefully regarded wil grow fat especially ouer aged young time feeding reason age teeth grow loose fall youth cannot exceede fatnesse bycause groweth aboue heighfers barren kye exceed fatnesse varro affirmeth saw field mouse bring forth young one fat cowe hauing eaten body aliue selfe thing reported sow arcadiaa strange report fat cow true kye also grow fat calfe especially middest time turk vse greatest feastes marriage rost seeth oxe whole putting ox belly whole sovv sowes belly goose goose belly egge note forth plenty great small thing best flesh young oxe worst olde one begetteth ill iuyce concoction especially eate troubled vvith cough reumy fleame party consumption woman hath vlcers belly tongue oxe cow salted slit asunder accompted delicate dishe vvhich priestes mercury sayd belong bycause vvere seruants speech hovvsoeuer al sacrifice beast tongue vvas refused prophane member yet priest made choise thereof vnder colour sacrifice feede dainty stomacks horne ox art man made flexible straight whereof made combes hasts kniues ancient haue vsed cup drinke cause bacchus painted horne crater taken cup deriued kera horne like manner first trumpet made horne virgill alludeth vnto sentence rauco strepuerunt cornu cantu day become familier carriage gunpouder warre reported husbandman seede cast earth ox horne called old time cerasbola reason certaine coldnesse well neuer spring vp well earth least well sowed hand man skinne vsed shooes garment gumme spongy matter therein contayned also make gunpouder vsed nauigation shot hath pierced side ship presently clap raw oxe hyde mouth breach instantly keepeth water entring likewise wont make buckler shieldes hide ox bugils seuenfolded doubled shield aiax nothing else shield made oxe hyde many time layed one piece vpon another caused homer call sacos heptaboeion teeth ox know vse scraping making paper smooth gall sprinkled among seede sowen maketh come vppe quickly killeth fieldmise tast bayne poyson creature come neere bread discerne bird eate corne touched ox gall put hot water first lee wyne wax thereby astonished likewise emmet come vppon place remaineth sauour gall cause anoynt heerewith rootes tree dung ox beneficiall bee hyue bee annoynted therewith killeth spider gnat dronebees good heede taken worke like effect vpon bee themselues cause vse smother burne kinde dung vnder mouthes hiues spring time displayeth disperseth little enemybees beehiues neuer breed againe prouerbe stable angia angia rich cattell defiled countrey dung whereupon prouerbe grew hercules came vnto promised part countrey purge stable clensed yearely labour ox hercules vndertaking labour turned ryuer vpon clensed angia saw stable purged art labour denyed reward phyleus eldest sonne reproued regarding man well deseruing cast family euer manifold vse member ox kye medicyne remaineth briefely touched horne beaten pouder cureth cough especially type point horne also receiued ptisicke short breath made pils hony pouder cowes horne mixed vineger helpeth morphew washed annoynted therewith infused nostril stayeth bleeding likewise mingled warme water vineger giuen splenet cke man three dayes togetherthe medcins seueral part ox kye wonderfully worketh vpon passion pouder hoofe oxe water put vpon king euill helpeth water hony helpeth apostemes swelling body burned put drinke given woman lacketh milke encreaseth milke strengtheneth hir much take tongue cow dry long till may beaten pouder giue woman white wine broath dust heele oxe ancle bone taken wine put gummes teeth doe fasten themrasis remoue ache away ribbes ox beaten pouder doe stay fluxe bloodfu nerius restrain aboundance monthly course woman ancle white cow layed forty day nightes wine rubbed face white linnet taketh spot maketh skinne looke cleare man biteth liuing creature seeth flesh oxe calfe fiue dayes lay sore shall worke ease thereof flesh warme layed swelling body easeth also doe warme blood gall beast broath beefe healeth loosnesse bellye comming reason choler broath cowes flesh marrow cow healeth vlcers chinkes mouth skinne oxe especially leather thereof worne shooe burned applyed pimple body face cureth skinne feete nose oxe sheepe sod ouer soft gentle fire vntill arise certaine scumme like glue afterward dried cold windye aire drunk helpeth least easeth burstnesse much marrow oxe sewet helpeth straynes sinnewes anointed therewith one make small candle paper cowes marrow setting fire vnder browes eyelid balde without haire often annoynting place shall haue decent comely haire grow thereupon likewise sewet ox helpeth outward poyson leprosy botch scuruinesse skinne mingled goose grease poured eares helpeth deafenesse also good inflammation eares stupidity dulnesse teeth running eye vlcers rime mouth stiffenesse neck one blood liquid apt runne forth body may well thickned retayned drinking oxe blood mingled vineger blood cow poured wound thither digge foundation citty found ox head whereupon discouraged build supposing omen betokened euill vnto perpetuall slauery labour misery ox liue afterward tryed another corner grounde wherein ornament table great noble men caused fiera make distichon assiduos habeant vitulum tua prandia vsus cui madida sapida iuncta tepore caro est principally germanes vse chawtherne head feete beginning meales part either roasted baked sometime sod broath buttered spiced sauced eaten onyons pliny medicinesthe medicine arising beast come fire spoken especially flesh calfe doeth keepe flesh new wound applyed thereunto swelling sodden precious bitings man teeth mad dogge hath bitten man beast vse pare wound quicke hauing sodden veale mingled sewet heele lay woundmarcellus make patient drinke broath broath soueraigne bitings serpentes horne calfe sodde soft good intoxicate poyson especially hemlock poulder calues thigh drunke woman milke cureth filthy running vlcerspliny braine calfe make oyntment loosen hardnesse bellynicander marrow softneth ioyntes driueth away bunch arising body hauing operation soften fill dry heate take oyle waxe rust marrow calfe bounches face calues marrow equll quantity whayrasis oyle rosecake egge soften hardnesse cheekes eyelidsmarcellus laied playster mixed cumin infused eares healeth paine also easeth vlcers mouth marrow sewet composed together cureth vlcers corruption secret men woman fat pounded salt cureth louzye euillpliny likewise vlcerous sore head mixed fat goosemarcellus iuyce basill wild cumyn infused eares helpeth deafenesse paine thereof fat taken thigh calfe sod three porringer water supped vp good haue flux dung calfe fryed pan layed buttock secret doth wonderfully cure bloody flixeleonellus also layed raines prouoketh vrine sod rue cureth inflamations seate man woman sewet calfe nitre aswageth swelling codspliny applied like plaister sewet alone doth cure pieling nayles liuer sage leaues cut together pressed liquor drunke easeth paine small belly gall mingled poulder hart horne seede marioram cureth leprosy scurfes gall alone annoynted vpon head driueth away nittes melt calfe good melt man vlcers mouth glew made stone thicke hony annoynted vpon leprous place cureth suffered dry thereupon dung calues perfume place hurt scorpion ash dunge vineger stayeth bleeding marcellus magnifieth aboue measure cure gout take fime calfe neuer eate grasse mixed lee vineger also deafenesse eares paine al take vrine bul goate calfe one third part vineger well sod together herbe fullonia put flagon small mouth let necke patient perfumed therewith supposed beast cacvs late writer take cacus spoken virgill eight book aeneid wilde beast virgill describeth word hic spelunca fuit vaslo submota recessu solis inaccensam radijs semporque recenti os virum tristi pendebant pallida tabo ore vomens ignes magna se mole ferebat nequeunt expleri corda tuendo pectori semiferi atque extinctus faucibus ignes semihominis caci facies quam dira tegebat caede tepebat humus foribusque affixa superbis huic monstrovulcanus erat pater c cacus halfe beast halfe man caue earth sunne denne replenished heades men hee himselfe breathing fire earth warmed slaughter men slaine whose slaughter fastened vpon owne doores supposed sonne vulcan affirme cacus haue wasted depopulated italy length hercules slaine geryon came spaine thorough italy ox taken geryon cacus drew diuers caue tailes hercules missed daily cattell knewe way strayed last came denne cacus seeing steppe stand forward reason cattell drawne backeward departed going away heard loughing ox fellowes whereby discouered fraud cacus whereuppon presently ranne tooke club monster within caue closed vp mouth thereof wonderfull great stone hid himselfe feare hercules went toppe mountaine digging downe vntill opened caue leaped suddenly slew monster recouered ox truth forged cacus wicked seruant euander vsed great robbery mountaines reason euill life called cacus ca o greeke signifieth euill said breath forth fire burned vp corne growing field last betrayed owne sister cause deified virgin vesta made sacrifice therefore shall ydle prosecute fable farther albertus magnus doth like fable alcida poet faine bird earth inuincible burned vp al phrygia last slaine minerua camell although diuers sort camel according seuerall countryes yet name much varied taken generall sence denomination euery particularof name haebrewes call gamal chaldaean gamela gamele arabian gemal gemel egeb algiazar persian schetor saracen shymel turkes call company camel reason name camelos greeke burden load layed vpon kneeling lying deriued may seeme camptein merous bending knee slownesse pace wherefore man slow pace among egyptian deciphered camell cause towne si called gangamela house camell erected darius sonne histaspi allowing certaine prouision food therein wearied tyred camel epithites giuen beast many among author tearmed rough deformed thirsting iuuenall deformis poterunt immania membra camell persius fifth satyre saith tolle recens primus piper e sitiente camelo diuers kindes according country wherein breed india kind camel arabia bactria india saide didimus bred mountaines bactrians haue two bunch backe one breast whereupon leane haue somtimes bore theyr fyre feedeth flock shecamels mule horsses couple together copulation also bore camel camell ingendred sometimesthe generation bactrian camel roughnes haire like boares swine strength body sufficient euidences worthily called bactrians first conceiued among hauing two bunch backes whereas arabian hath one colour camell part browne puke yet heards white one india part colour camel ptolomeus lagi brought two straunge thinges egypt blacke camell man one halfe white halfe blacke equall proportion caused egyptian wonder maruaile shape proportion camell laugh man whereupon grew prouerbe camell among egyptiansthe seuerall part camell pliny matter fearefull first ridiculous last head necke beast different proportion others yet ethyopians haue beast called nabim neck resembleth horse hed camell haue teeth side although want horne meane arabian bactrian camell whereof aristotle disputeth reason thirde booke partes creature fourteenth chapter neck long nimble whereby whole body much relieued necke toward neather part throte place called anhar wherein camell dooth speare sword easily receiue mortall deadly wound siluaticushis belly variable great small like ox gall distinguished within like beast onely carried great veynes therefore haue thought none assigned cause long life betwixt thighes hath two vddersaristotle pliny haue foure speanes depending like cowes genital part confected standeth vpon sinnew insomuch may stringe made bending strongest bow tayle like taile asse hangging knee haue knee euery leg hauing former leg hinder foure haue ancle like ox small buttockes proportion great body foot clouen vnder part hath two fissure cleftes opening breadth finger vpper part foure fissure cleftes opening little hauing little thing growing like foot goose foot selfe fleshy like beares therefore shod leather trauaile least gauling foot cause tyre auicenna affirmeth seene camel whole foot like horsses foot although fleshy tyed together little lunge neuer weare manner going pace like lyon walking left foot neuer outgoeth right whereas beast change setting forward foot leane vpon left foot remoue right alter step step left foot behind followeth right hinder foote followeth lefte camel conceiued bore strongest fall quickly myre although load twice heauy camel loue grasse called schoennanthi especially barley eat vp wonderfull greedily vntill stomachthe food camel chewe thereupon night long greatnesse belly lodge meat concoction better benefite vpper teeth ruminate chaw often pleaseth certaine herbe hath seede like mirtle seed poyson wormessiluaticus seede foode cammels wherewith grow fatte therefore called camellthorne astergar aarabian toung prouince aden sheepe ox horse camel eate kinde fish better drie stalepaul venet philostratus calius new fresh reason immoderate heat region burneth vp pasture fruites neither beast easily fed camell drink cleare cleane water muddy slimie therefore stamp feetetheir drinke must cleare indure thirst three foure dayes together come drink suck aboue measure recompensing former thirst prouiding come kind bactrians least trobled thirst stale one side another otherwise beast doe beast hot nature therfore wanton full sport wrath braying fearfully angred engender like elephant tiger female lying sitting ground male imbraceth like male continue copulation awhole day togethertheir procreation ingender goe vnto secretst place finde herein excelling expiation death first deuiser except beguiled party sufferd also som smart penalty adiudged himselfe death longer worthy liue nature benifite violated wombe first conceiued therfore running fro finde hangman himselfe last found sleepy rocke whence leaped downe end life although could preuent offence yet thought best cleanse away mother adultery sacrifice bloud first conceiued wombe wherein hee defiled camel kept heards swift horse according measure strength onely nimblenesse also stride reach doth gather ground cause vsed indian racethe pace agility camel goe fetch golde said kept formicae cyrus army came ioyne neither camel would aproach horse horse camell whereupon accounted base vnprofitable thing man nourish camel fight yet persian fighte cyrus lidia euer nourished camel horse together take away feare one anotherof labor employment camel therfore vsed carriage perfourme greate facility taughte keeper kneell lie downe take vp burthen reason height man cannot lay alwaies asia turkish prince conuey carriage vpon europe likewise doe arabian affricke must obserued affrican camel much woorth asian endure trauaile fortye fifty day togither little meat except sometimes euening vnloaded go hedge thornes greene place eat small thing meet withall leaues like wherewith remaine satisfied whereas asian performe iourney except kept fat well fed hath beene proued good experience one affricans hath trauailed fifty day without meat first wearing away fat bunchy backe skinne breast lastly ribbes neuer giuing ouer till able beare one hundred waight asian must alway carry prouender sustaine beastes neuer trauailing haue one camell loaden meat loaden carriage indure double charge affricans go martes fayres returne emptie vnloaded take thought camel food camel distant court nine hundred mile messenger performeth vpon one ragnahils within space eight dayes beginning springe frolicke vnruely incline generation time rage fall vpon many come vnto especially whome haue receiued blowes remembring time requiting former iniuries vppon wronged whome take ther mouth lift vp ayre cast downe againe vnder foot tread vpon distemperd venerous fury remain forty day easily endure thirst fiue nine fifteene day necessity neither wil keeper giue drinke three day thirst feare harme camel plesant profitable also seem participate nature wearied spur stroke make hasten could dance sound timbrell thereunto taught young meanes first brought roome like stable pauement wherof made hot fire vnderdeath without door stood musitian playing timbrell camell loue musick heat vnder feete lifted vp first one foot another doe daunce heat increasing likewise lift vp faster whereunto accustomed space ten moneths euery time one houre halfe time timbrell still sounded last vse forefeete dog thingsthe game food cat man doth hand beast woonderfull nimble setting vpon prey like lyon leaping therefore hunteth rat kind myce bird eating onely also fish wherewithall best pleased pliny secret smell presence hir mortall foe keepe cat hunting hen vse tie litle wild rew vnder wing likewise douecoates set windowes dare approach vnto secret nature haue said cat fight serpentes toadsof loue hatred kill perceiuing hurt presently drinketh water cured cannot consent vnto opinion rather true weasell shalbe afterward declared ponzettus sheweth experience cat serpent loue one another sayth certain monastery cat norished monkes suddenly part monkes vsed play cat fell sicke whereof physitians could find cause secret poyson al assured neuer tasted last poore laboring man came vnto affirming saw abbeycat playing serpent physitians vnderstanding presently conceiued serpent emptied poyson vppon cat brought monkes stroking handeling cat infected therewith whereas remained one difficulty namely came passe cat selfe poisoned thereby resolued forasmuch serpentes poison came playe sporte malice wrath therefore venom thereof lost play neither harmed cat al much endaungered monkes like obserued myce play serpent aelianuscats also hunt ape follow wood egypt certaine cattes set vpon ape presently tooke himselfe heeles climed vp tree cattes followed celerity agility fasten clawes barke runne vp speedily ape seeing himselfe ouermatched number aduersaries leaped branch braunch last tooke hold top bough whereupon hang ingeniously cat durst approch vnto feare falling departed nature beast loue place breedingthe loue home neither tarry strange place although carried farre neuer willing forsake house loue man contrary nature dogge trauaile abroad maister although maisters forsake house yet beastes beare company carried forth close basket sackes yet returne againe loose themselues cat much delighted play hir image glasse time behold water presently leapeth water naturally doth abhorre quickly pulled forth dryed dieth thereof impatient alw e keepe cattes within doores hunting bird abroad must cut eares albertus way make cat keepe home cannot endure haue drop raine distil therfore keep themselues harbor nothing contrary nature cat wet water cause came prouerbe loue wet foot neate cleanely creature oftentimes licking hir body keepe smooth faire hauing naturally flexible backe purpose washing hir face fore feeta coniecturall secret obserue put feete beyond crowne head presage raine backe cat thinne beast courage value loue fire warme place whereby falleth often burne coatestheir copulation desire lie soft time lust commonly called catwralling wilde fierce especially male whoe time except gelded keepe house time haue peculiar direfull voyce maner copulation female lyeth downe male standeth female aboue measure desirous procreation cause prouoke male yeeld lust beate claw onely loue young lustaristotle meale libidinous therefore seeing female neuer engender time hir young one sucke hee killeth eateth meet prouoke female copulation againeaelianus depriued young seeketh male accord female warily keepeth sight time copulation female continually cryeth whereof writer giue double cause one pinched talants clawes male time lustfull rage thother seed fiery whot almost burneth female place conception haue litered commonly say kittened rage dogges suffer none come neere young one best keep littered marchchoyse young cat go young fifty day female liue aboue sixe seuen yeares male liue longer especially gelt libbed reason short life rauening meate corrupteth within cannot abide sauour oyntments fall madde therebygillius caelius alu mundell disease sometimes infected falling euill cured gobium needelesse spend time louing nature man flattereth rubbing skinne one legges whurleth voyce hauing many tune turnes hath one voice beg complain another testifie delight pleasure another among hir kind flattring hissing puffing spitting insomuch haue thought haue peculiar intelligible language among themselues therefore beggeth playeth leapeth looketh catcheth tosseth foote riseth vp string held ouer head sometime creeping sometimes lying back playing one foot somtime bely snatching mouth anon foot aprehending greedily thing saue hand man diuers gestical action needelesse stand vpon insomuch coelius wont saythe hurt commeth familiarity cat free study vrgent waighty affaire ashamed play sport himselfe cat verily may well called idle man pastime beast hath beene familiarly nourished many haue payed deare loue requiret losse health sometime life friendship worthily loue beast high mesure haue much lesse charity vnto man therefore must considered harmes peril come vnto men beast certaine breath sauour cat consume radicall humour destroy lungsahynzoar therefore keepe cat bed haue aire corrupted fall feuer hectickes consumptionsalex benidict certaine company monkes much giuen nourish play cattes whereby infected within short space none able either say reade pray sing monastery therefore also dangerous time pestilence onely apt bring home venomous infection poyson man looking vpon wherefore men naturall dislike abhorring cat nature composed onely see neere vnseene hid purpose fall passion fretting sweating pulling hat trembling fearefully haue knowne many germany reason whereof constellation threatneth body peculiar euery man worketh presence offence creature therefore haue cryed take away cat like may sayd flesh cat cat flesh sildome free poyson reason daily foode eating rat mouse wren bird feede poyson aboue braine cat venomous aboue measure dryponzettus alexander stoppeth animall spirit cannot passe ventricle reason whereof memory faileth infected person falleth phrenzy cure diamoschu cat doth much harme venemous teeth therefore cure biting prescribe good diet sometime taking hony turpentine oyle rose melt together laied wound centory sometime wash wound vrine man lay braines beast pure wine mingled together mathaeolusthe haire also cat eaten vnawares stoppeth artery causeth suffocation haue heard child hath gotten haire cat mouth hath clouen stucke place could gotten hath place bred either wen king euill conclude point appeareth dangerous beast therfore necessity constrained nourish suppressing small vermine wary discret eie must auoyde harmes making account vse person spaine gallia narbon eate cat first al take away head taile hang prepared flesh night two open cold aire exhale sauour poyson finding flesh thereof almost sweete cony must needes vncleane impure beast liueth onely vpon vermin rauening commonly said man neezethperottus hath eaten cat likewise familiar witch ordinarily appeare shape cat argument beast dangerous soule body said bread made wherin dung cat mixed wil driue away rat mouse conclude story beast medicinal obseruations tary longer breath creature compounded good euil reported flesh cat salted sweetned hath power draw wen body warmed cure hemorrhoid paine raines backe according verse vrsinus et lumbus lumbis praestat adesus opem galenus medicinall vertues cat aylsius prescribeth fat cat sod gout first taking fat annoynting therewith sicke part wetting wooll towe binding offended place paine blindnesse eye reason skinnes web nailes approued medicine take head blacke cat hath spot another colour burne pouder earthen pot leaded glazed within take poulder quill blow thrice day thy eie night time heate thereby annoy thee take two leaues oke wet cold water binde eye shall paine fly away blindnes depart although hath oppressed thee whole yeare medicine approued manye physitians elder later liuer cat dryed beate poulder good stonegalen dung female cat claw oule hanged necke man hath seuen fit quartane suffering fluxe little rozen oyle rose stayeth humour web eie horse euening morning blow poulder cat dung shall cured wilde cat cat beginning wilde therefore doe interpret ijm esay wilde cat german call bonumruter treerider hunteth bird foules tree treee spaniard calleth gatomontes place france called chatcaretz great store heluetia especially wood sometime neere water also colour like tame cat longis perfigere telis prouince malabar cattes liue vpon tree swift run leape agility haue thought flye verily flie haue certaine skin lie quiet cleaueth shrinketh vp belly stirred spreadeth forefoot hinder like wing bat vertue whereof stay vp themselues aire passing form tree tree like foule also doth pontique mouse shall declared afterward skinnes wild cat vsed garment skinne warmer experience white blacke pretious especially english blacke aspersed white siluer haires vse buckes durable yet heauier harsher belly soft gentle easie therfore set bythe vse flesh pliny although lesse continuance flesh white sweet especially young one fourteen twenty day olde haue deuised cruell delicate meat cut yong one dam belly dresse eat trust man among christian inhumanely gluttonous deuise approue sweetnes foule dish tame one good spaine eat tame cony euery creature doth partake tast ayre wherein liueth therfore tame cony kept close vnsweet ayre reason owne excrementes cannot tast well wholesome run wilde mountaines field free infection euill ayre loue aboue place rockes make dennes earththe place abod whereas said psal stony rock cony vnderstood though foot cony could pierce rocke also hils lower ground wood rock england rocky countrey wheresoeuer forced liue diggeth hitholes wherein daytime abideth morning euening commeth thence sitteth mouth thereof copulation engender like elephant tigres linxes istheir copulation procreation tho gypson male leapeth backe female priuy part framed meet one another behind female render vrine backward secret seed male small begin breed countryes sixe moneths old england yeare old continue bearing euery moneth least seuen time one yeare litter march winter engender al therefore author say hare abound procreation reason whereof little store wil serue encrease great borough young littered blind see til dayes old dam hath suck til hath bene six seauen houres maletho gypson least sixe houres cannot suckle greatly desiring go bucke permitted presently shee farre displeased wil inclined againe day haue bin also credibly informed one kept tame cony littered three time within fourteene day littered foure ordinary number one litter fiue sometimes nine neuer aboue haue seene doe hath nine belly two three haue perished bene oppressed wombe suffocation male kill young one come like borecats therefore female doth also auoid carefullythe cruelty male female couering nest litter grauell earth may discouered also female vnnaturall caring yong one suffer perish neuer prouide warme littour nest also forsake littered else deuoure remedy euill loueth keepe profit must take deliuered pull haire flesh vnderneath belly put vpon nest young one commeth forth may perish cold dam taught experience paine like herselfe thus inferiour lybian horse belly parted blacke strake drop part body red yellowish colour haue long foot longer eares eies blacke horn ornament head swiftnesse doth onely appeare vpon earth also vpon water foot cut water swim oares therefore loue lake strong streames breaking flood come fresh pasture sweet rush bulrush horne grow onely vpon male set sixe seauen braunchess rpsius female haue none therfore also differ horne fallowdeere cannot called platycerotae horne palmed like handalbertus although branchy yet shorter differ much common deere horne whereas horne beastes hollow toward roote whereunto entreth certaine bony substance horne also vulgar bucke elke solide without emptinesse onely full porespliny p anias vi u e chach eiesight hath also beene beleeued roe doth change horne neuer found whereas truth fall yearly doth hart hide intent found hath likewise beene thought roe called greeke dorcas quicknes hir sightorigen super ca tex see perfectly night day onely selfe learned physitians haue obserued certaine viscous humour hir bowel taken forth annoynted vpon man eies darke heauypliny neere blind hath effect quiken eiesight also said neuer winke sleepe conceit blood prescribed purblind taile beast shorter lesser fallowdeerescardanus insomuch doubtfull whether taile place aboadethey keepe part mountaines among rock swift pursued dog martiall saith hang vpon rock horn deceiue dog strange manner ready fall kill themselues yet haue harme whether dog dare approch appeareth epigram pendentem summa capream de rupe videbis casuram speres decipit illa cone yet doth better agree wild goat roe shall manifested due time concord beast columello aelianus saith cynoprosopy men dog face liue vpon flesh roe bugle wildernesse egypt also vsuall conclude park wil agree naturally hare swine wherfore lordship varro bought piso seene sound trumpet roe boares would come vsuall place meate although bee naturally wilde yet quickly grow tame familiar hand man blondus nourish many rome wilde hunted dog shot gun taken netsof taking falleth sildome liue among rock easily taken wood chased desire run wind coldnesse aire refresheth course therefore hunt place dog wind sometimes hunter mindsbellisarius ey contrary taketh hir course way hart heare barkings dog run wind sauor foot may passe away often take counterfaiting voice hunter doth taking leafe hissing vpon cresconius vse fleshthey good meate philostratus affirmeth indian dresse feast whole lyon roe ghests eate sophist banket described athaeneus roe therein therefore fiera preferreth fallowdeere alledging agreement betwixt body man dressed according art hic optata feret nobis fomenta caloresimion sethi auicenna tr anus vda leui modicis mox que coquenda focis therefore also affirmeth excelleth wilde beastes whatsoeuer onely fitte nourishment sicke haue chollicke falling euill timpanie therefore best yeare olde vnder likewise broath pepper loueage seede rue parsley hony mustardseed oyleapicius sauce meate take pepper rue hony melted onyon sometime also seeth hanches hippes make pasty side ribbes beast full feare therefore flesh thereof although dryof disposition passion yet engender melancholy feare martiall saith thus tam despar aquilae columba non est hec dorcas rigido fugar leoni doue eagle roe lyon afterward grew vnto prouerbe hath also epethets among author doe confirme disposition ful feare flying weake wanton like yet fight one another fiercely sometime kill feare also wolfe whereof came prouerbetheir enemy nature first roe wil ioyned wolfe expresse incredible matter haue also beene vsed sacrifice diana saphriae woman patras lay vpon hir great altar whole hart bore roe beast aliue coptitae eate malessacrifices roe religiously worshipped female daring eate thempausanias aelianus beleeued isi loued dearely beast came island capreae beyond surrentum campania tiberius famous castle ennobled presence since decay thereof celebrated multitude quailes found thereinthe medicine arising roe marcellus remedy medicine comming beast first flesh eaten good paine small gut dryeth stayeth belly pliny affirmeth teeth dragon tyed sinnewes hart roe skinne wore one necke maketh man grations superior fauorable pitifull supply cation white flesh brest hiaena seuen haires thereof genitall hart betyed piece roe skinne hanged woman necke maketh wombe shall suffer abortements thing triuiall beleeued pleasure know taile dragon tyed nerues hart roe skinne sewet roe goosegrease marrow hart onyon rozen running lime doe wonderfully help falling euill made plaister sextus saith one giue braine roe drawen pressed ring infant preserue euer falling sicknesse apparitians liuer roe sod salt water eye purblind man held ouer fume reak thereof cured blindnesse seeth little cup annoynt eies scumme froth comming liuer burned poulder dust cast man bleeding staieth yssue fluxe gall beast mixed wine meale lupine waight groate hony take away spot face gal mixed water helpeth sunburned face freckle hony atticke taketh away dimnes eies iuyce gourd annoynted vpon eie browes causeth haire hath beene pulled neuer shal grow againe gall alway better age thereof hypocrates prescribe must kept siluer pipe boxe tingling eares take gall oyle rose iuyce onyon beaten together instilled warme eares present remedy also oyle rose onely helpeth payne teeth hony atticke swelling paine iawes chappes putting thereto myrrhe saffronsextus pepper gall little hoggsbread poulder burnt alumme anyse seede made suppository procureth loosenes party haue hemerrhoides also gaull taken hony iuyce eglantineaetius cureth exulceration virile member annoynting spleene drunke helpeth windinesse melt commended chollicke biting serpent laundise take dung roe dryed sifted drinke winegalen also drunke cureth ague bycause roebucke doth wonderfully loue female affirme woman eate bladder roe likewise make husband loue exceedingly first kind tragelaphus may called deeregoate plinyus another kind like deere although conceiued buckegoate female hart cannot expresse figure briefe narration thereof placeof generation beast like deere except beard bristle growing shoulder pliny affirmeth found riuer phasis arabia arachotae citty india called arachotus riuer issuing caucasus graecians call tragelaphos athenaeus country beast name heerof german ein brandhirse thinke beast mentioned name ako deut doubtles beast aristotle calleth hippelaphus attributeth selfe thing pliny ascribeth beard bristle deepe haire shoulder hangeth downe like mane horse similitude proportion quantity holdeth hart feete clouen female thereof doth want horne horne male like horne roe therefore howsoeuer haue imagined beast found world rather pittied confuted doubted neither auncients euer haue seene diuers maruailous shape beastes found many remote far distant place world especially arabia india many desarts therefore reason affirme neuer saw vnderstood rare picture beast called ancient time canathra zenophon plutarch coelius whereupon child carried pageant shewes gaue occasion think men deuises god neuer ordained creature georgius fabritius sent picture doth among thinges write vnto probably kinde onely distinguished informe name strength kind strange lesse knowne among men called graecians tragelaphus greater vulgar deere deeper haired blacker colourof part saith taken riding forrests misena bordering vppon bohemia common sort hunter hold opinion reason loueth lie cole madeof country beast dust feeding vpon grasse groweth place therefore germanes call brandhtrze fox resemble colour called brandfusche certaine greater stronger hart agricola strength colour vpper part backe blacke neather neere belly white hart rather blackish genitals blacke haue seene horne haue seauen spire braunches growing one palmed top like called achaeines greeke reason paine sorrow kummerer germane cause liue continuall sorrow young one able runne dennes belike fearing instinct naturea secret pa sion least tender weake age betray hunter able runne away figvre another tragelaphus deeregoate expressed bellonivs another tragelaphus saith whereof finde name among french wanteth beardthe description seuerall part haire thereof resembleth ibexgoate whose description followeth afterward among goates horne heereof like goat crooked bending compassing behinde rammes doe neuer looseth face nose eares like sheepes skinne cod thicke hanging downe leg white like sheepes taile white haires long necke stomacke would thinke bearded haire shoulder brest blacke hath two gray spot flank either side nostriles blacke beake face white also belly beneath description heereof seemeth rather agree pygargus musmon shall speake afterward doe rather approue relation another kinde sent vnto learned english physition iohn cay writeth vnto brought yeare countrey mauritania clouenfooted liueth part mountaine partes countrey quantity betwixt fallowdeere hart body like hart side branded hanging downe shorter thicke necke colour winter blacke red set one another beard like goate deuided turned backeward haire long euen knee mane full bristle stretched length whole necke especially toppe shoulder blade standeth like bunch colour darker part body hinder legges couered longer harder haires downe pasterne thinke cause defend harme leaping hoofe beast strange clouen saide outward hoofe sorelegges longer greater inwarda secret hoofe contrary hinder inward cloue thereof longer greater outward smaller shorter either side would thinke one hoofe goate hart hollow without soales whereof giue reason pleasure nature hath prouided whereas beast liueth among rockes sharp place mountaines footesteps hollow hoofes firme stable mean stone sharp pointed rock entreth stay vp slyding strange female hoofes haue vpon top vpper face three foure pleasant impression carued imbrodered flower man marke earnestly think giuen vnto ornament delight either sexe loose euery yeare hoofes hart doe horne nature may shew resemblance foot hart doth head goat eare short like goat eie genitall stone taile like hart though somwhat shorter horne like rammes crooked distinguished middle blacke line length two roman feete one finger compasse roote one foot one palme halfe standing one another differ aboue one foote three palmes one finger halfe rugged circle going toward top bunchy toward bottom roote low beaten notch impression quantity length breadththey top distant one point another aboue one foote palme length face crowne tip nose one foote three finger breadth forehead broadest two palmes one finger height beast aboue three foote halfe except mane standeth whole length heere crown head taile foure foot halfe two finger hath onely teeth beneath neather chap number aboue sixe neither obserue defect cheweth cud like clouenfooted beast nostril blacke vpper lip deuided long perpendicular line gentle pleasant wanton beast dispositionof vlcers eies also keepeth teeth white gum sound young horne soft eaten antidote henbane poysonfull herbes right horne hid hart earth good poyson toadespliny hart horne hath power dry vp humorssextus newly shauen vineger killeth ringwormessextus burned sunne afterward face rubbed washed therwith thrice together taketh away pimplesspots face poulder drunke wine annoynted head killeth louse nit vinegermarcellus wine oyle rose annoynted vpon forehead easeth headache proceede cold galenusa perfume made horne castoreum lime brimstone causeth dead child strangled mother wombe come forth horne taken raw rubbed vpon gum keepeth cheekes annoyance toothache fasteneth loose teeth sereneus said quod vero assumpsit nomen de dente fricando ceruino ex cornu cinis est galen prescribeth poulder horne iaundise spitteth bloody matter stay vomit taken reere egge comforteth also rheumatike stomach tryed cure kinges euill pacifieth melt dryeth spleene driueth kind wormes belly drunke hony easeth chollyck expelleth away mothes helpeth strangury paine bladder staieth flux woman whit red mingled barly meale water twig cedar beside many property teares beast hath beene hunted serpent turned stone called belzahard bezahar haue spoken thus transubstantiated doe cure manner venom auenzoar cardinall ponzetti affirme many trial serenus also expresseth distichon seminecis cerut lachryman miscere liquori conuenit atque artus illine miscere calentes liuer beast helpeth sore feete worne shooes dried pouder throat windpipe beast mingled hony eaten helpeth cough ptisicke sighing short breathing without great paine sildome neuer suffering abortment also little bone found heart euery one beastes performeth quality instead whereof haue thinge sell venice aetuis holding great price brasauola affirmeth opened heart two hart found little gristle much vnlike crosse whereof one beast new killed soft much harder beast slain six day bone left side hart vpon spleene moueth sendeth forth greyhound well kind frame body called latine leuinarius leuitate lightnesse therefore may well called lighthound also called word lorarius loro leame wherewith led dogge excellency condition namely smelling swift running doth follow game eagernes taketh prey iolly quicknesse dogge called tumbler latine vertagus sort dogges compasseth craftes fraudes subtilties deceiptes english men call tumbler beck motion gesture shal please exhibite make either going forward drawing backward inclining right hand yealding toward left making mencion fowles meaning patridge q aile hath found bird keepeth sure egiptiacum iuice peach leaues skilfull hunter affirme hang dog necke stick citrine wood drieth wormes come forth dy th euil wash wound water rub pitch time dung oxe vinegertardinus afterward apply vnto powder ellebor dog troubled maungie itch ringwormes first let blood fore leg greatest veyne afterward make ointment quick siluer brimstone nettleseedalbertus rasis twice much olde sewet butter
