scories iron chip flie smithes hotte iron beateth mingled vineger shall perfectly remooue tike lyce flea annoint dog bitter almond staues acre root maple cipers froth oile old annoint also ear saltwater bitter almondes shall fly summer time enter bee waspes beast sting dogge lay sore burned rue water greater fly hornet let water warmed dog shall neuer infected plague put mouth time common pestilenceblondus powder stork craw ventrickle part thereof water thing ought regarded creature soone infected plague dogge mule therefore must either beginning receiue medicine else bee remooued ayre according aduise gratius sed varij mitus nec omnibus vna potestes disce vice quae tutela est proxima tenta woolfewortpliny apocynon whose leaues like leaues iuye smell strongly kill beast littered blind wolues fox beares dog eat thereof likewise root chamaeleon mezereon water oyle killeth micediscorides swine dog ellebor squilla faba lupina haue operation gourd called zinziber water tast thereof like ginger flower fruite leafe thereof killeth ass mule dog manie fourefooted beastes nut vomicae poison dogges except care cut presently made bleed cause leape strangely vp downe kill within two houres tasting preuented former remedy theophrastus chrysippus affirmeth water wherein sperrage beene sodde giuen dogges killeth fume siluer leade hath opperation dog grow lean want meatalbertus good fill twice thrice butter doe recouer signe worme vnder tongue annoieth must presently pulled naule needle satisfie cannot liue short time perish noted oaten bread leauened make sluggish dog become lusty agile full spiritblondus dog also many time bewitched onely sight inchaunters euen infant lambes creature according virgil verse nescio quis teneros oculus mihi fascinat agnos bewitching spirit entereth eie hart party bewitched remedy whereof hang necke chaine corrall holy hearbs hold vnprofitable cure watry eye dog take warme water first wash therewith make plaister meale white egge lay thereunto reason saying eccles cap bribe gift blind eies iudges vnicentius euen dumbe dog turneth away correction haue deliuered greene crowfoote forced mouth dog maketh dumbe able barke dog becommeth deafe oile rose new pressed wine infused eares cureth wormes eares make plaister beaten spunge white eggetardinus shall cure third kind quinancy called synanche killeth dogspollux niphus bloweth vppe chap includeth breath cough noisome dog wherefore keeper must infuse nostril two cuppes wine brused sweete almond tardinus disease prescribeth great parceley sod oyle honey wine giuen dog shortnes breathblondus bore thorough eare helpe preuaile bone sticke mouth dog hold vppe head backward powre ale mouth vntill cough shall eased dog hath surfetted falleth loth meat eateth hearbe canaria releeued surfet also bitings serpent wormes belly eateth wheate stalke gowt maketh dog leg grow crooked neuer cured course two grow lame againe skin flyeth nailes take meale water bind therunto remedie part disease wherewithall dog infected either cured heat eating grasse part conclude sicknes cure dog saying gratius mille tement pestes curaque potentia maior concerning madnes dog venemous bitings speakeof bitigs mad dog cur first al reasonable man ought doubt teeth mad dog harme sound healthy one rage anger teeth euery beast creature receiue venome poison head well obserued aegineta time fastning teeth harm time simple biting dog sufficient vse vrine dog much venome wound vrine also wil draw prickle hedghog wound haue little poyson also aetius prescribeth soueraigne wound first couer rub sore palme one hand powre vineger nitre may discend bottome wound afterward lay vnto new spunge wetted vineger nitre let continued space three day working thereof shal whole also generally obserued bitings men dog first requisite wound well rubbed ouer palme hand vineger poure wound vineger mixed water nitre laying also spunge thereupon bind vpon place hauing first wetted cloathes wherewithall bind said vineger mixed let remaine bound vp three day together afterward follow common course curing euery vulgar woundes else lay thereunto pellitory wall mingled beaten salt changing euery day vntill crust vpper skin thereof fall away also good sometimes hole small wet lint vineger purge wound pouder annisseseed cumin laying lint vpon annisse two three day thus purged story man whose arme bitten mad dog twelue yeares sore brake forth againe died within two dayes reason heerof likelihood coelius one nature infecteth dog dog men men reason similitude naturall sympathy receiue consuming poyson speed another nature infect betwixt inclination passion dissimilitude antipathy betwixt dog man poison receiue greater opposition bee much longer receiue predominant nature without bitinges others haue teeth ass mule fall madde time vntill bitten othermishal ephes u also hath bene obserued sometimes mad dog hath bittenaug niphus hath followed harme whereof reason wi l follow vpon beast young egs couered hen presence remedypliny wash hand sprinckle themselues beast water whereby euill cured gall mad dog bignes lentill seed eaten killeth within seuen day else doth harme passe seuen day without operationbortrutius mad dog suddenlie tore peeces garment one body taylor bot tooke mend forgetting put side breach mouth stretch fell mad immediately men thus affected feare al water virile member continually standeth suffer many conuulsions oftentimes barke like dog certaine mason zuricke finger greeuously bitten madde dog iuly whereunto layed garlicke rue oile scorpion seemed healed wherefore tooke counsell phisiti n august following taken feuer first cold hot continued sweating day two could endure cold aire thirsted much yet water drinke brought afraid thereof could drinke sweat cold felt colde ayre hee cried feare bin water thus remained trembling offering vomit sight water many time howling perished two day ended dog mad may knowne signes neither eat drinksigns kno mad looketh awry sadly ordinary body leane casteth foorth thicke fleame nostril mouth breathe h gaping toong hangeth mouth eares limber weake taile hangeth downeward pace heauy sluggish vntil run rash intemperate vncertaine sometimes running presently stand still againe verie thirsty yet abstaineth drinke barketh knoweth man biting stranger friend head hangeth downewardbertrurius ponzettus fearefull runneth secret place whelp fellowes often barke eat bread vppon blood hath fallen eies grow red hee many time dieth feare water discerne laying nut graines among nation euer knew ethyopians payed tribute vnto king persia euery yeare twenty teeth hung gold ietwood sold waight many deceiue world bone fish insteed hereof true yuory paler heauier falling vpon ground easily breake whereas bone fish tenatious light strong like chernites wherein darius entombed marble called lapis coraliticus corrol stone like vnto alagi stone paederos iewell yuory made expend lesse thirty thousand talent greatnes appeareth vse polybius reporteth relation galussa nobleman great traueller affrica made post house cenalis rack lay cattels meat vpon likewise fold enclose apelles made inke iuory called elephantes inke painted therewith hath bin affirmed aelianus writer following pliny teeth horn elephant hornd beast errour rose vpon occasion word pliny plin u wh ther elephant haue horne elephantos arietes candore tantum cornibus assinulatis santonum littore reciprocaos destituit oceanus aelianus finding resemblance betwixt ram elephant white horne contented apply name appertaineth onely one pliny himselfe lib sheweth meaning another like speech whetting horne vpon tree rhinocerotes vpon stone except named horne first place might haue beene questioned whether rhinocerotes horne rather teeth second place whatsoeuer wordes opinion pliny certaine herodotus auncient writer safer call teeth horne breefely set downe reason philostratus haue teeth afterward grapaldus aelianus pausanias would make horn leaue reader consider whether opinion thinketh agreeable truth first horne alledged horne fall grow euery yeare againe especially hart grow forth head teeth called fannae gangteeth standing mouth fal together giuen weapon defence beast elephant againe horne hath certaine line circle neere roote couered euery yeare commeth vp like stony substance without circle couer therfore cannot horn moreouer creature said haue horne haue clouen hooues hath clouen hoofe onely fiue distinct finger vpon foot lastly horned beast haue empty hollownes horne except hart sound full thoroughout except little passage middle like hole tooth thus say haue called teeth contrary haue horne make argumentes first elk haue horne grow eyelid rhinocerotes ethyopian buls nose vnnaturall elephant haue horne grow mouth againe horne fall come againe old beast teeth therefore horne teeth power fire cannot alter teeth teeth breake go change proportion figure horne ox elephant may stretched bended altered straightned applied fashion euer againe teeth grow gummes cheekebone apparant horne growe scull temple elephant obseruation euery man may discern lastly nature hath giuen another shape greater proportion body elephant beast also vnreasonable vary placing horn grow downeward mole quantity body sufficient arme feare death thus argument horn elephant poet haue prety resemblance dreames comparing true dreames horne false dreames iuory falshoode euer burnished naked ragged trueth besides eie man translucent containeth horny substance eie alway receiue best assurance mouth signified teeth many falshoods vented horne turne vpwarde heauen fountaine trueth teeth elephant growe downward towardes earth mother error cause aeneas virgil homer said come horny gate somnus go forth iuory virgil verse sunt geminae somni portae quarum altera fertur altera candenti praefecta nitens elephanto vbi dum natum anchises vnaque sibillam cornea qua veris facilis datur exitus vmbris sed falsa ad coelum mittunt somnia mane poesequitur dictis portaque emittit eburna leaue prosecute discourse horne teeth proceede outward part beast toung small though broad truncke called proboscis promuscis aelianus large hollow thing hanging nose like skinne groundwardaristotle feedeth lyeth open like skin vpon bill turkeycock draw meate drinke vsing hand therefore improperly called hand receiueth keeper whatsoeuer giueth ouerthroweth tree soeuer swimmeth draweth breath crooked gristly inflexible roote nexte nose within hath two passage one heade bodie breatheth mouth whereby receiueth meategillius herein woorke god woonderfull onely giuing vnto diuerse proportion anatomie also giuing reason knowe benifite long water holdeth vp trunck perish hee fighteth warre able take vp small piece money earth hath beene seene pull downe toppe treevartomannus twenty foure men rope could make bend driueth away hunter chased drawe vp therein great quantity water shoote forth againe amazement ouerthrow persecute moore say hath twoe heartes one withall incensed another whereby hee pacified trueth aristotle dissection hearte obserued double ventrickle bone heart elephant hath liuer without apparant gall side liuer cut whereon gall shoulde lye certaine humour commeth foorth like gall wherefore aelianus sayth hath gall mawgutte full sinewes one would thinke foure belly receiueth meate hauing receptacle intralles like vnto swine much greater liuer foure time greate ox residue excepte melte hath two pappes little beside breast vnder shoulder betweene hinder legges loynes small cannot seene sidearistotle reason hereof giuen first hath two pappes bringeth forth one time stand vnder shoulder like ape hee hath hoofes distinct foot like mannes also bicause breaste floweth aboundance milke genitall parte like horse lesser proportion bodie affoordeth stone outwardly seene cleaue raines female hath genitall betwixte thighes forlegges much longer hinder legges foot greater legges equall quantity aboue beneathe knee hath anckle bone verie lowe article doe ascende high creature kept low neere earth bendeth hinder leg like man sitteth reason great waight hee able bend side together gill either leaneth right hand left sleepeth false haue ioynts article leg please vse bend moue grow old vse lie downe straine reason great weight take rest leaning tree bend leg could neuer go ordinary stayed pace foot round like horsses reach middle euery way two span length broad bushell hauing fiue distinct toe vpon foot toe little clouen intent foot may stronger yet parted treadeth vppon soft grounde weyght body presse downe legge deepe hee hath nailes vpon toe taile like ox taile hauing little haire end residue thereof peeled without haire hath bristly hair couer back thus much seuerall part v inward natural partsthere creature capable vnderstanding elephant therefore requisite tarry somewhat longer expressing seuerall property naturall quality thereof sundry variable inclination cannot choose bring great delight reader haue wonderfull loue owne countrey although neuer well delighted diuers meat ioyes place yet memory thereof send forth teares aelianus tzetze place abod loue also water riuers marishes vnfitly called riparij liue riuers side although cannot swim reason great heauy body vntill taught also neuer liue solitary great flock except sicke watch yong one either remaine aduenturous vnto deathpliny eldest leadeth herd second driueth forward meet man giue way goe sightleo afer voice called word barrire bray thereupon elephant themselus called barrifestus philomelae avthor voice commeth mouth nostril togither like man speaketh breathing wherefore aristotle calleth rawcity hoarsnes like low sound trumpet sound verie terrible flyeth flye away vsuall resting place stryuing shall goe foremost time come wide deepe ditch cannot passe ouer without bridge one descendeth goeth downe ditch standeth transuerse crosse great bodye filling vppe empty partes residue passe ouer vpon backe vpon bridge afterward ouer tarry helpe fellowe ditch trench againe slight deuise one putteth downe legge ditch windeth trunke residue stander cast bundels sprig mouthes elephant warily speedily putteth vnder feete raiseth himselfe trench againeaelianus tzetze plutarch departeth fellowes fall cannot finde helpe meanes come forth laye aside naturall wilde disposition contented take meate drinke handes men whose presence abhorred deliuered thinke vpon former condition forgetfulnesse thereof remaine obedient deliuerers thus taken hath beene said also expedient expresse art meanes cicurated tamed first therefore takenthe art taming elepha aelianus fastened tree piller earth neyther kicke backeward leape forwarde hunger thirst famine like twoo stronge forcible ryders abate naturall wildenesse strength feare hatred men afterward keeper perceiue deiection minde beginne mollified altered giue vnto meate hand vpon beast doth cast farre fauorable cheerefull eie considering owne bondage last necessity frameth vnto contented tractable course inclination indian great labour industry take young calues watering place leade away intising many allurementes meate loue obey grow vnderstand indian language elder indian elephant doe hardly sildome grow tame remembrance former liberty band oppression neuerthelesse instrumentall musicke ioyned coutrey song ditty abate fiercenesse bring downe high vntractable stomacks without band remaine quiet peaceable obedient taking meate layed pliny solinus prescribe iuyce barly giuen mitification whereunto also agreeth dioscorides calling kind drinke zythus reason heereof bycause tarte sharpnesse barly water stand little therfore also prescribe vineger ash rub beast mouth hath power pierce stonesplutarch al sharp thing penitrate deepe flesh alter nature inuention whereof attributed democritus thus tamed grow ciuill familiar v caesar ascended capitall betwixt foure hundred elephant carring either side burning torch heliogobalus brought foure waggon drawne elephantes vaticanum men commonly ride vpon apollonius sawe neere ryuer indus boy thirteen yeare old ryding alone vpon elephant spurring pricking freely man leane horsse taught bend one hinder legges take vp ryder also must receiue helpe present stander bythe taking vp rider else impossible mount backe high september time elk annoyed falling sicknes hath strongest vertue cure others others affirme wanteth operation cut young one neuer tasted carnall copulation hath bin dulled thereby howsoeuer certaine wilde remaineth e latine namesthe latines call beast viuerra furo furetus furectus shall afterward manifested preyeth vppon cony hole liueth vppon stealth earth kil cony six time bigge selfe abroad germain fret deriued common syncope time georgius agricola called germany furette frettell english word seerueth also deriued fretta latine like syncope contracted viuerra indifferent learned man may appear first sight deriuationwhether ferrits ictys heerein seemeth vnreconcilable difference reported ictys gaza interpretour aristotle greedye hony cause seeke hyues bee enter without feare sting pliny speaketh ictys doth cal viuerra attribute vnto loue honie rather hatered loathing thereof high degree tast falleth consumption hardly escapeth death thing scaliger alledgeth cardan onely prooue ictys viuerra two destinct beast cardan mistaken affirming seuerall name expressing one beast answere whereunto may easie althogh pliny leaueth rehersal loue hony doth necessarily follow loue aristotle constantly affirmeth scaliger nameth author bringeth reason demonstrate hate honey harme insueth eating thereof therefore authority may strabo opposed thired booke speaking cony spaine hunter starter hole taketh nameth indifferently without distinction exception viuerra ictys one niphus translateth ictys martall without reason man finding aristotle war betwixt locust serpentes fitly called ophiomachia whereas aristotle nameth akris locust hee falleth doubt whether better ictys martell copy haue aspis aspe meanes agree vnto kind locust called ophiomachum continual combat serpent therefore stande longer vppon difference ommitting also coniecture tzetze confoundeth ictys miluus glead kyte canot stand reasonable homer saith kind cap made haires ictys yet albertus newe found name ankatinos auicenna katyz french fissau poulcat descend description part quality wherein author themselues variance make owne reconcilement attributing thing ictya ferret except obscure authour saith ictys ankacinor big greyhound wiser industrious youth tender age perfection strength yeares ferret lesser maelitean gentlewoman dog firste brought affricke spaine therefore called strabo affrican weasils g z seueral partes similitude weasils spaine italy france germany haue beast bred among brought country england breed naturally quantity aforesaid tamed hunt cony earthcountrey breed bolde audatious beast enemy except owne kind drinking sucking blood beast biteth eateth flesh warriner setteth downe hunt dorus per ttus drinking bloud agricola prouocation hut hee first maketh great noise fray cony abroad hole hauing frighted pitcheth net putteth tame ferret earth hauing long string cord bel hir necke whose mouth muzzleth may bite cony onely terrifie borough earth presence clawes perfourmed dog chased net ouerwhelmed aforesaid history cony theyr body longer proportion quantity may affoord haue seen two span long thin smaltheir colour eye colour variable somtime black white belly commonly yellowish sandy colour like hermeline wooll died vrine head little like mouse therefore whatsoeuer hole chinke putteth body easily follow eies small fiery like red hot yron therefore seeth clearely darke voyce whyning cry neither doth chaunge cat hath onely two teeth neather chap standing ioyned growing together genital male bony substance wherein pliny scaliger agree cardan straho ictys also therefore alway standeth stiffe lesser one time pleasure sence copulation yard genital part nerues muscle tunicles wherein said genitall runneth copulation female lyeth downe bendeth knee continually cryeth like cat either male pincheth claweth skin sharpe nailes else rigidity genitallthe number yong one female desireth copulation except shee bee conuenient speede brought male suffered come swelleth dyeth fruitfull procreation bring foorth seauen eight time bearing littie belly aboue fortie day young one newly littered blind day togither within day see may set hunting noble men france keep pleasure greatly giuen hunt cony sold ther french crown young boy schollers also vse put hole rockes walles hunt birdes likewise hollow tree bring bird clawes foot nourished tamed milketheir food barlie breade fast long time go contract long backe make stand vpright middle round like bowle touched smell like martell sleepe much wilde liue vpon blood cony hennes chicken hare thing finde ouermaister sleepe also dreame appeareth whyning cry sleepe whereas long fly called fryer flying flaming candels night accounted among poysons antidote resister thereof pliny affirmed goat gall liuerthe medicine ferret mixed ferret wilde weasill gall ferret held pretious poison aspes although flesh teeth ferret accounted poyson likewise gall ferret commended falling disease onely gal saith marcellus whole body rosted dressed eaten fasting like young pig said rasis albertus head wolfe hanged vp douecote neither cat ferret weasil stoate noysom beast dare enter therein ferret kept little hutch house fed sleepe much whottemperature constitution therefore quickly disgest meate wild reason fear rather seeke meat night day time fitch povlcat difference poulcat wildcat isidorus name notation thereof strong stinking sauour therefore called putorius putore ill smell al weasils incensed prouokt wrath smell strongly especially poulcat likewise spring time endeuour procreation cause among german would expresse infamous whoore whooremaister say stinke like iltis fitch poulcat french call beast putois poytois found carolus figulus sauoyens pouttett illirians bohemian tchorz polonians vijdra scaliger calleth latine catum fuinam another name putorius greater ordinary weasill lesser wilde martell quantity nature b st stumpsius agricola yet commonly fatter haires neither smooth one length one colour short haires somewhat yellowish long one blacke one would thinke many place body spottes diuers colour yet mouth ordinarily white skin stiffe harsh rugged handling therefore long lasting garment yet beast alwaie fat sauor rankthe skin vse great request moreouer said offendeth heade procureth ache therein therefore sold cheaper foxe skinne fattest alway worst skinner approue skin fitch martils best killed winter flesh lust much lower therefore rendereth lesse hurtfull smell time taile aboue two handes palmes long therefore shorter martilles partes bodye equalleth martill exceedeth little hauing thinner neckes larger greater belly taile legges breast also blacker colour belly side yellow haue deliuered left legges thereof shorter right leg founde vntrue daily experience keepe toppes house secret corner delighting kil eat hen chicken whose craft deuouring prey singular lorus meate subtletie descryed intent silly creature deuoured may bewray housekeeper first part lay hold vpon mouth heade hen chicken mean stayeth cry cropping head fitch wander keep wood thereby liue vpon bird mise thing againe liue sea side rockes take fish like beuers otter creepe caues hollow tree eat frogges delight neare stals cattel hayhouses house meet oftentimes egs wherein delight aboue al kind meat thus much beast fox fox called haebrew schual chaldee thaal seueral name fox sundry language therefore psal haebrew readeth schualim chaldee translateth thealaia arabian call thaleb auicen calleth foxe sometime chabel also chalca l greeke septuagint alopekon centries breeding fox aelianus amongst caspian abound multitude maketh tame comming citties attending vpon men like tame dog fox sardinia rauenous kil strongest ram goat also young calues egypt lesser seemeth sprinkled darkned coledust vpon white top hair apeare blacke foot stalke white birkfuchse throat al white kind splendent white pretious second called kreutzfuchse crosse beareth vpon backe tertars shall set vpon ear h may go forth way forasmuch wolfe enemy foxe layeth mouth den herbe called seaonyon contrary nature wolfe greatly terrified therewithzoroastres gillius hee neuer come neere dig way owne pleasure deuouring beast forsaketh nothing fit eatenthe food serpent killeth hare connies breath draweth fielde myce hole like hart draweth serpent breath deuoureth deuoureth also kind vnto ready bite himtext r striketh taile betwixt leg owne vrine wetteth instantly striketh dog mouth whereof haue tasted many touched commonly leaue follow farther teeth exceeding sharp therefore feare assault contend beast exceeding stature strength quantity somtime leapeth vp tree standeth seene bayed dog huntersoppianus like champion fort castle although fire cast yet discend among dog yea endureth beaten pierced hunter speares length compelled forsake holde giue ouer enemy downe leapeth falling vpon crew barking dog like flash lightning layeth hold neuer looseth teeth aswageth wrath til dog haue torne limb driuen breath body time take earth terriour dogges ferret den againe place take vpon take net sildome proueth teeth teareth piece yet calentius deuise allowed verse et laqueo vulpes decipe casse foinas must wrought vnder earth caues dennes furrowes made purwhich performed two manner way one placing gin perch wood assoone beast taken necke may presently fly vp hang otherwise teeth hee sheare asunder escape away aliue else neere place rope fastened slippe vppon heade foxe bee placed thicke collor brace hee neuer bite asunder french haue kind ginne take legges call hausepied haue heard haue found fox legge gina noble instance fox corag bitten owne teeth body rather putting himselfe torment owne teeth expect mercy hunter went away vppon three foot haue counterfeited themselues dead restraining breath winking stirring member saw hunter come take ginnethe subtlery fox take snare comming taking legge forth suspecting life soone foxe perceiueth himselfe free away hee went neuer gaue thankes deliuerance cause blondus saith truely onely wise olde hunter fit take fox haue many deuises beguile men deliuer themselus hard know safely taken vntill throughly dead also vse set vp ginnes bayted chicken busnes hedge setter hand soone foxe insnared daungerous beast deliuer selfe place againe set vp iron toyle hauing ring foxe thrust head sharpe pike farther end whereof placed piece flesh hungry foxe commeth bite meate thrusteth head pike sticke fast necke ineuitably insnared moreouer harmefulnesse beast hath troubled many also haue deuised moe engins deceiue take cause another pollicy kill bowe full bent sharpe arrow tenderly placed trap mouse assoone euer foxe treadeth thereon presently arrow discharged owne bowel waight foote againe killing beast vse sleight take bacongrease bacon much one hand rost little therewith annoint shoesoles take liuer hogge cut piece come wood beast lodgeth must scatter said piece footesteps drawe carcasse dead cat sauour whereof prouoke beast follow footstep haue cunning archer handler gunne obserueth watcheth secret till beast come within reach giueth great deadly wound fox earth haue found denne take course worke take long thing like beehiue open one end yron wiers like grate open end set little doore fall downe vppon mouth inclose fox entereth touching small rod supporteth doore frame set fox den milk wrung papes growing betwixt leg therewith calfe licking receiued beestings afterward male kid begotten goate like vdders whereat owner much amazed prodigious thing satisfaction asked counsell oracle receiued answer betokened nothing plentifull encrease cattle female haue two vdders vnder loines next smal bellyorthagorus aristotle except libian goates vdders lye vnder breast forepart belly like ape naxus goates haue greater gal part world forepart held prodigiousnaxvs aelianus contrary chalcis goates haue gall haue many belly round melt thing hornedbeast hath except sheepe male haue harsher haires femalesof cilicia cloth made goat hair libian goates haue haire long woman rough curled inhabitant sheare euery year therewith shipwright make gable rope cilicia phrygia sheare make stuffe called zambelot another kind cloth called mathaliaze bellnu arabia make tent cloth compiled ass goates haire seemeth cilicia receiued name kind cloth called latine cilicium else cloth first inuented among wherevpon receiued denomination among grammarian poet lana caprina goates wooll grew prouerbe signifie thing weight moment horace alter rixatur de lana saepe caprina propugnat nugis armatus another sort goates called syrian goates mambrin goates commonly indian goates noble country coytha likewise region damiata membrin syrian goates mambre mountaine neere hebron whence probable word mambrin commeth wherefore haue thought good expresse figure greatest kind taken antonius musa brasaualus physitian noble duke hercules de este ferraria one goates brought thither seene lesser found pictured old manuscript germany booke intreate holy land greater goate coniecture leo afer calleth adimain founde mauritania tall asse hath long broad eares pendant vnder next neckes two thinges like dugges pappes hange downe throate fruitefull milke libians plowe keepe stead kie cattle milke milke make butter cheese haire short gentle familiar saide leo affirmeth young man loued rash wanton sport wherewithall youth delighted hee gotte vp vpon one rode quietly vpon back aboue quarter mile keepe wilde desert lybia time stray wander nymidia fieldes thereof accounted people inhabitauntes prodigious monstrous thing lesser kind coniecture right mambrine syrian goat although late writer call indian goat reason hath said cal al strange beast name indian find owne countrey eares large broad picture describeth eares haue goates gallianarbon least broade man spanne colour like wildegoates horne verye sharpe standing farre distant one haue stone like stone horse al part vnlike vulgar common goat albertus goates ke breath varro curious heardsmen alcmaeon archelaus haue deliuered world goat take breath thorough eares phyle approueth concept hee scene experiment goat mouth nostrilles stopped fast neuerthelesse seemed troubled want breath also alleadged authority oppianus writeth certaine wilde goat called aegari haue certaine hole passage middle heade betwixt horne goeth directly vnto liuer stopped liquid waxe suffocateth stifleth beast true woulde way extenuate authority writer likely haue without difference attributed kind goat propper kinde alone former opinion reasonable describe man hath excellent eare expresse goat mind kind goates illyria haue whole hooues like horse onely founde region nation worlde clouenfootedthe vse ir seuerall vse seueral part singular firste al beginne skinne people sardinia saith nymphiderus nourish goates skinnes whereof make garment dressed haire vpon affirme strange virtue namely heat body winter coole summer haires growing vppon skinnes cubit long therefore man weareth winter time turneth hary side next bodie warmed summer raw side haire keepeth sunne piercing skin violence heat also vsuall sueuia woman weare garment goat haire winter also make childrens coat thereof according virgil saying moreto suida var u et cinctus villosae tegmine caprae cause merchant buy rough part sauoy neer geneua choyse young one die vpon certain bottels made goat skin ful wind placed middest theatre dauncer vse one leg intent might often fall slippery bottels make people sport wherevnto virgill alluded sayingplinyus mollibus deliuered youngto increase goat milke albertus maketh abound milke others goat milke preserue wine corruption sowrenes first put wine twentyeth part much wine let stand vessell couered three foure day secret milke goates myrepsus afterward turne sweet fresh vessell remaineth preserued annoyance sourenesse cheese made goat milke wont called velabrenses casei among roman made velabrum smoke whereupon martial made distichon non quemcunque focum nec fumum caseus omnem sed velabrensem qui bibit ipse sapit aristotle iulius pollux doe commend sicilian cheese made sheepe goat milke together athaeneus called caseus tromilicus simonides stromilius rhaetia heluetia excellent cheese made goates milke cowmile mixed together milke also goat mixed woman milke best nourishment man fathermolaus yet galen saith eaten without hony water salt curdleth belly man like cheese strangleth vsed purgeth belly thence came fiction poet iupiter noursed goate afterward warre titanes giant slew goate counsell themis wore skin armour hauing obtained victory placed goate among star wherupon called aixourania heauenly goate germanicus caesar made verse vpon iupiter himselfe called agiochus illa putatur agio husnutrix esse iouis si vere iupiter infans vbera cretae mulssit fidissima caprae sydere quae claro gratum testatur alumnum flesh male goat wholsome man body flesh female spring fall leafeof flesh goat reason good nourishment may eaten without danger worse bulbeefe sharper concoction hotter wherefore disgest well increase melancholy liuer goat eaten doth bring falling sicknesse yet salted good space sodde vine braunches broad leaues keepe asunder wine poured water almost sod become sweet delicate meate therefore athenian praised lacedemonians feast called copidae slew goat held deuine meat also clitomachus academicke carthage relateth certaine thebane champion excelled strength champion time eat continually goat flesh strong remaineth long season body doth much good disgested notwithstanding strong ranke smell thereof otherwise dangerous already said therefore fiera hauing commended kydd hee commeth speake goat writeth thus cum male olet siccat fit iam caper improbus absit draw goates vnto though receiued great commodity thereby likewise would haue white haires grow part horse shaue haire annoint place gall goat shall haue desire sabcans reason continuall vse mirrhe frankinsens grow loathing sauour remedy anoyance perfume house burning stirackes goat skin thus much seuerall part goat ancient time three kindes heardsmen receiued dignity one aboue another first called bucollici neatheards keepe greater cattell second opiliones shepheards attendaunce vpon sheepe third last lowest kind termed aepoli caprarij goatheards keeper goates locrentians called ozolae theyr filthy smell parte conuersation amonge beastes goateheard keeper cattle must sharpe stearne harde laborious patient bold chearefull one easily run ouer rock wildernesse among bush without feare griefe must follow flocke like heards goe must also light nimble follow wandering goat runne awaie fellowes bring back againe goates nimble mooueable inconstant therefore apt depart awaie except restrained heard dogge neither haue goates captaine bellbearer like vnto sheepe follow euery one directed owne heerein appeareth pride beast scorneth come behind either catell sheepe alwaies goeth also owne heardes among themselues bucke goeth female reuerence beard aelianus saith labor goatheard must see cattel well fed abroad day time well foulded night first rule therefore husbandry deuide flockes put great number together heerein differ sheep loue liue together multitude affecting society thriue better mourne much alone goat loue singularity may well called schismatiks among cattell therefore thriue best lying together small number otherwise great flockes soone infected pestilence therefore france care haue magnos gregos sed plures great flock many number flocke ought exceede fifty whereupon varro writeth story gabinus roman knight field vnder suburbes containing thousand akers pasture ground seeing poore goatheard bring goat euery day citty receiued milke peny peece led couetousnesse proponed himselfe gaine stored said fielde thousand milchfemalegoates also receiue milke thousand penny day whereupon added action intent filled fielde thousand goates euent fell otherwaies expected short time multitude infected one another lost milke flesh whereby apparant safe feed great flock cattell together indian region coitha inhabitant giue milchgoates dried fish eate epigram martiall whereby declared mutuall fight killing one another feare dogges flesh desired men beast first epigram describing wilfull fight one killing another sauing labour hunter kill themselues hand thus frontibus aduersis molle concurrere dama spectauere cane praedam stupuit que superbus vnde leues animae tanto caluere furore aspicis imbelles tenent quam fortia damae mortem paruis concurrere frontibus audent vidimus fati sorte iacere pari venator cultro nil superesse suo sic pugnant tauri sic cecidere viri second epigram dialogue speaking emperour tooke care encrease game seeing onely men enemy also one another wherevpon writeth distichon praelia tam timidis quantum sit ixa feris vi caesar damis parcere mitte cane thirde epigram complaint weake vnarmed state hauing neither teeth like bore hoenes like hart defend themselues lie open violence enemy dente timetur aper defendunt cornu ceruum imbelles damae quid nisi preda sumus whitish yellow colour back nourished sometime pleasure somtime profit possessor wil suffer hunting like deere also tamed milke like goat heere finde especiall mention among author beside already rehearsed wilde goat figure heluetian alpian wilde rockegoat wildegoats transfigured many similitude also dispersed many country beyond sea alpes picture alpine wilde goat heere set also found italy mountaines fiscela tetrica varro insomuch tame goat nourished said deriued wilde goat calld cinthian goat bred mountaines delos called cinthus found top libian mountaines great ox whose shoulder legges abound looseshaggy haire shinnes small face rounde eies hollowe hard seene horne crooking backward shoulder like goat stand farre distant one another among goat indued singuler dexterity leaping leap one top another standing great way asunder although many time fall downe vpon hard rock interposed betwixt mountaines yet receiue harme hardnesse member resist violence theyr horne breake fals neither offended thereby head leg goates soractum cato writeth leape rocke rocke aboue threescore foote kind goates spoken history tame goat thought breath eares nostril swift strong horned loue betwixt dammes kid kind admirable damme doth carefully educate nourish young younge one againe doe thankefully recompence mother carefulnesse much like vnto reasonable men keepe nourish theyr owne parent old decrepit age loue god nature doth enioyn satisfaction owne education doe young wild goates toward owne mother age gather meate bring likewise runne riuers watering place mouthes sucke vp water bring quench thirst parentes body ruffe vglye looke vppon younge one licke ouer tongue making smooth neate time damme taken hunter young one doth forsake till also insnared would thinke behauiour imprisoned damme towards young kid likewise kid towards damme mutually contend one giue selfe dam forseeing yong one houer handes enemy continually follow sighes teares seemeth wish perswade depart saue themselues flight could say language men fugite filij infestos venatores ne miseram capti materno nomine priuate say runne away son saue selues harmefull greedy hunter least taken euer depriued name mother young one againe side wandering mother bleate forth many mournefull songe leaping hunter looking face pittifull asspects said vnto adiure oh hunter maker v al deliuer mother thraldome sted take v hir vnhappy child bend hard hart feare lawes god forbiddeth innocent punished consider reuerence owe olde age mother therefore againe pray let liues satisfie dammes liberty poor creaturs see nothing moue vnexerable mind hunter resolue dye cannot deliuer thereupon owne accord giue themselues handes hunter led away mother concerning libyan goates spoken liue top mountaines taken net snare else killed dart arrowes art hunting time discend downe plaine fieldes lesse troubled waues great water therefore man slow pace may taken without great difficulty greatest benefit ariseth skinne horne skinnes clothed winter time tempest frostes snowe common weede shepherd carpenter horne serue steed bucket draw water running streames wherewithall quench thirst may drinke cup great man able drinke one draught cunning artifficers haue handling make receiue three time much selfe thing wryten wilde goates egypt said neuer hurt scorpion great citty egypt called coptus wont much addicted worship isi place great aboundance scorpion sting poyson oftentimes giue mortall deadly woundes people whilest mourne chappell worship goddesse funeral lamentation stinging scorpion egyptian haue inuented thousand deuises whereof principall time assembly turne wild fem goat naked among scorpion lying ground whose presence deliuered escape free woundes serpent whereupon coptites doe religiously consecrate female goat deuinity thinking idoll isi wholy loue therfore sacrificed male neuer female reported plutarch wilde goates doe aboue meate loue meale figges wherefore armenia certaine black fish poyson pouder meale fish couer figges cast abroad goates haunt assoone beast haue tasted presently die wilde goat pictured called latine rupi capra capricornus greek gargos aigastros homer ixalon germanes gemmes gemmuss writethalbertus french cal chambris ancient tongue ysard great bodye hath crooked horne bend backeward back whereupon staieth himselfe falleth slippery rockes mountaines plinyusthese horne fit fight small weake therefore nature hath bestowed vpon cause aforesaid goat least hath red eies qu cke eiesight horne blacke nine ten finger longe compassed diuers circle top none sharp crooked like hooke arise roote paralelwise equall distance one another hollow bredth one thumbe residue solide like hart male kinde differ female neither horne colour proportion body bignesse like common goate somewhat hier colour betwixt brown red summer time red winter time browne hath beene seene white blacke distinct colour one another reason heere chaunge colour many time year altogether white seldome found inhabit part rockes mountaines top like ibe k neither doe leape far foresaid goat come somtime root alpes licke sand rockes like village tame goates procure appetite heluetians call place naturall tongue fultzen salares place hunter hide themselues secretly gun bowes instrumentes suddendly shoote kill hunted step vp steepest rock inaccessible dogges meanes prouiding safty bu hunter presse clime vpon rock hand foot leape thence stone stone making waie top mountaines long euer able goe climbe hange horne heade ready fall caused martiall write thus pendentem summa capream de rupe videbis casuram speres decipit illa cane poet attributeth roe belongeth wilde goat hange many time till perish cannot loose themselues againe else shotte gun fall downe headlong else driuen hunter day saint iames vse themselues coldest partes mountain vnderstand winter approaching making custome shield cold weather haue bene made tame haue discended downe flock tame goat whome auoide like ibex wilde goat hath herbe called doronicum grecian doronieu giuen name among germaines geniesseh wort wildegoatsherb excellent cure collick therefore highly esteemed among arabian graecians mauritanian hot dry second degree countrey people heluetia giue dizines head wilde goat oftentimes feed vpon yet neuer troubled infirmity although runne round mountaines hunter drinke blood goat comming hot body immediately wound giuen sicknes fat milke wilde goat mingled together haue cured one long sick ptisick wilde goat creet wounded poysoned dartes runne presently eate hearbe dittani vertue iuice whereof onely auoid arrow sticketh skin also death cure poyson kyd hauing formerly discoursed seuerall kindes goatesof name followeth also intreat kid yssue goat first seuerall name therof called haebrew egedi signifieth also lambe put vnto haissim plurall masculine gedaijm feminine gedioth gen caldean translation hath gadeia persian buskahale else cahali busan persian render cahale sheter haebrew busan issim septuagint render erifon vulgarly day grecian cal eriphoi truth eriphoi kid three foure month old time vntill procreationvarinus called chimaroi latines cal hoedi ab edendo eating isidorus saith flesh tender fat tast therof pleasant italian call cauretto capretto ciauerello rhetians speak italian vlzol spaniardes cabrito french chereru german gitse kitslain polonians koziel question whether nature would finish part vpon young one dam belly wherefore triall made vpon kid neuer saw dam vpon season dissexion made vpon femalegoate great young belly young one taken aliue could neuer see mother kid put house many boales full wine oyle milke hony lyquid thinges also lay beside diuers kindes fruit vine corne plant last kid seene arise stand vpon feete somebody told legges made walke vpon shooke moistnesse brought mother belly afterwardes scratched side foote went smelled former vessel last comming milkeboule supped licked thereof behoulders saw cryed hipocrates rule true animalium naturas esse indoctas say nature creature formed art owne inclination nothing wanton kid whereupon ouid made verse splendidior vitro tenero lasciuior hoedo often iumpe leape among themselues promise faire weatheraelianu keep continually flock depart mother continually sucke licke vp meat also forshew storm therfore must gathered fold according poet saying si sine fine modoque pabula delbent cum tutas vesper adire compellat caulas monstrabunt ad fore nimbos goose swallow haires kid goat die thereof kid separated dammesa atolius varro weaned till three month old time may ioyned flockes nourished young manner year old except must narrowly looked vnto least lasciuiousnesse ouerthrow age besides milk must giue vnto three leauedgrassepalladius iuy toppes lentiles tender leaues vrine goate heades scallion bruzed iuyce infuse eares mingled oyle rose little nytre cureth paine eares infusion smoke perfumed goat horne twenty dayes together naturall deafenesse take horne goate newly slaine fill vrine hang vp nine day smokegallus afterwards vse vrine goate made warme instilled eares fime annoynted fat good vaines throat dropsie drinke one spooenfull mingled cardus warme fire also mingled wine water expelleth stone bladder according saying serenns nec non obscaenus caprae potabitur humor obruat hic morbum tabefact aque saxa remittit physitian prescribed goat trindles drunke wine iandis stay flux woman dung tied cloath vnquiet child especially womenkind maketh still mingled wine cureth bitings viper dung taken goat belly annointed vpon sore cureth speede vertue hath heale men wounded scorpion decocted vineger cureth also biting mad dog mixed honey wine laid vpon wound keepeth swelling hath vertue mingled barleymeale healeth king euill vsed also ripen sore rupture applyed suppuration keepeth downe swelling woman brest first dried steeped new wine laide sore disgesteth inflamation eyelid thicke hard red bald take goat dung mouse dung eyther like quantity burned twice much powder graecian cane honey atticke anoint therewith heate vineger put vpon sore cureth tetters ring wormes disperseth carbuncle belly also heated vineger cow milke oile cipres laurell purgeth cureth al wound leg shin pulleth thorn sharp prick body learned physitian mytiae hath proued sheepes dung also doeth laying round wound cureth burning draweth heat oile rose vineger gallen writeth also commended broken ioynts suffereth swell start set therefore must vsed honey wine hath operation broken ribbes openeth draweth healeth also decocted vineger healeth paine nerues although ready rot easeth paine ioynts fime fat goat cureth gout contraction shrinking nerues dressed vineger made thick hony helpeth trembling member verie dry therefore arnoldus saith cureth fistula making plaister thereof meale beanes wine leigh hath beene seene wonderfully drie vp fistula oxymel vineger cureth aleptius must burned take seauen bals goat dung worke vineger anoint forehead therewith easeth paine head else mingle oile rose spred vpon cloath laying temple change morning euening shal find great ease thereby eies swolne time bind dung vnto mingled liquid pitch honey healeth sicke quinansie gargarized mouth sicke olde cough let take dryed trindles put best wine drinke shall presently auoid fleame filthy humor healed remedy wilde goat vertue goat spoken also belong wilde goat blood taketh away bunch flesh mingled seapalme causeth hair fall ointment made fat goates profitable haue web eies fat mountaine goat helpeth infected lightes liuer broiled vpon coales taken alone helpeth flix certainely dried drunke wine gawle good many thing especially treacle poison suffusion whitnesse blindnesse eies annointing cureth purblind web eie generally hath property euery part tame goat spoken like may said kyd young goat first kyd slit assunder aliue warme flesh laide poisoned wound doeth assuredly heale others take warm flesh kyd perfume hair sauor whereof driue away serpent skinne newly pulled put vppon body beaten stripe taketh away paine others againe vse crampe without reason tender skinnes lambes goates sprinkled dipped warme oyle giueth much strength patience endure convultion praxagoras prescribeth flesh falling euil gargarizing broath sod cureth quinsie sorenesse throat demetrius saith braine drawne thorough gold ring giuen hawke hath fallinge sicknes worke admirably vpon blood dried decocted marrow good intoxicat passion mingled sharpe vineger congealed helpeth spitting blood eaten cureth kinde flixes taken three day together gallen rehearseth antidot vrbane among thing blood kyd draw deade young one dammes belly fatte ointment made rose water heale fissure lippes nose much desired woman onely rehearsed virtue also annointing keepe face sunneburning french italian call pomato smelleth like apple put also muske rosewater pound kyd sewet warme bath vntill bee white wash saide rose water afterward repose glasse ointment caled amongst themhares sildom tamed neither placidae faerae tame wilde middle betwixt cardane giueth reason vntamable nature perswaded men enemy scaliger writeth saw tame hare castle mountpesal example tame hare whoe hinder legges would come strike dogges owne accord defieng force prouoking follow therefore meate may tamed accustomed hand man remaine vncapable al discipline ignorant teacher voice neuer brought obedient call command teacher neither go come pleasure simple creature hauing defence run away yet subtile may apear changing forme scraping footstep shee leapeth forme may deceiue huntersaelianus also keepeth young one togither one litter layeth furlong one another may loose altogether peraduenture men beastes light vppon themthe subtility hare neither carefull feede selfe alone also defended enemy eagle hawkethe defence hare enemy fox wolfe feareth naturally neither peace made betwixt rather trusteth scratching bramble solitarie wood ditch corner rockes hedge body hollow tree like place dissembling peace aduersaries wilde hawke taketh hare setteth one talants earth holdeth prey striuing wrastling beast vntil haue pulled eies killeth fox also compasse poor hare cunningalbertus night time falleth footstep restraineth breth holdeth sauor going forward little little vntil find form hare thinking surprize suddaine leapeth catch watchfull hare doth take sleepe carelesse manner delighting rather suspition security pereciueth approaching guest windeth nostril thinketh better goe home make feast foe wherefore leapeth forme runneth away speed foxe also followeth farre hearing aduersarie betaketh selfe rest againe vnder bramble bush supposing ground shee hath gotten shal neuer recouered againe prouerbe old true faire softly goeth far fox seldome getteth meat winneth wit heel foloweth fast ca slow pace ouertaketh hare rest whe perceiueth forth shee goeth againe forsaking quiet sleepe sauegarde life hauing gone much ground betaketh rest second time hoping shee hath quit selfe foe fox belly hath eares therefore hunger like thousand whip whole kennel hound forceing forward game hare better sauegard getteth vp smal tree sleepy weary fox pursute fox commeth tree shaketh rootes wil suffer hare take rest hopeth time trauel wil bring hir dish leapes away againe letteth grasse grow vnder foot hoping heeles shal deliuer fox teeth followes fox length greater pursse ouer waigheth smaller great horsse warre ouerwearieth little hunting nag doth lusty limbes fox outlast weake legges hare go needes must weakenes betray hir foe hir flight want rest like sicknesse death fox presence like voice passing bellaelianus contrary labour foxe like gentle kinde exercise preparing stomacke feast fift least kind wolues also enemy hare weasill craftily sport play hare vntill haue wearied hangeth fast vpon throat loose holde rume hare neuer fast till last want breath losse blood falleth hand cruel playfellow turneth sport good earnest taketh nothing blood leauing carcasse deuoured hand others manner seely hare hunted beastes let v heare hunted men hunting haresit expressed euery limbe hare composed celerity therefore neuer trauelleth iumpeth eares lead way chase one harkeneth voice dogges stretcheth forth like saile hasten course alwaies stretching hinderfeet beyond former yet hindering sometimes ardent desire maketh straine fly dogges falleth nettes state miserable runne one perill fal another according saying holy scripture esay scapeth snare shall fall ditch noted hare wit runne forth right neuer turne could easily ouertaken loue place breed taken looseth life beginning preferreth place aboue safty againe elder hare assoone heare dogges flye toppes high mountaines easily runne vppe hill downe wherefore hunter must studiously auoid disaduantage keepe vallies path hygh way shee runneth speedily wherefore must kept also hare mountaines oftentimes exercise themselues plaine practise grow acquainted nearest way lodging time husbandman set vpon fieldes dally till seeme almost taken suddain take nearest way mountain suspected hunter take sanctuary vnaccessible place whether dog horse dare ascend hare keep bush able indure labour swift reason paine foot growing fatte thorough idlenes discontinuance running must hunted sort first al go young wood hedge grow thicke thicker hedge leape ouer come many thicke place must leape ouer quickely fall downe tired dog first go carelessely cannot see tree suffer run wood following farr scent vntill last get sight better exercise skill easily ouer take campestriall fieldehare leaner body oftner chased taken difficultie reason singular agility therfore begin course leapeth vp ground flew afterward passeth bramble thicke bush al expedition time come deepe grasse corne easilie deliuereth selfe slideth thorough saide lyon tailes stirre vp strength courage eares beast like angel wing ship sailes rowing oares helpe flight runneth bendeth backward vseth insteed sharpe spur prick forward dulnes hir course taketh one way maketh heades like laborinthes circumvent trouble dog may go whether wil alwaies holding vppe one eare bending pleasure moderator chase neither vnprouident prodigall strength spend al one course obserueth force prosecutor slow sluggish shee profuse celerity onely walketh gently dogges yet safely clowches reseruing greatest strength greatest necessity knoweth shee outrunne dogges pleaseth therefore vaine conceit trouble selfe vrged dogge following swiftly residew setteth forward force shee hath left hunter dog great way behind getteth little hill rising earth raiseth selfe vpon hinder legges like watchman tower obseruing farre neare enemy approacheth perceuing shee deliuered pursuit daunger seemeth deride imbecillitie force younger hare reason weake member tread heauier vppon earth elder therefore leaue greater sauour behind ancient time hunter taken young leuerit let go againe honour diana yeare old runne swift sauour stronger wood plaine field hare followed foote discryed especially soft ground high way go rock mountain hollow place vncertaine lie vpon earth loue red fallow ground easily descryed started plaine field run far wood make short course heare dogges raise themselues legges runne fearefull immagination oppresse oftentimes sad melancholy supposing heare noise dogges none sturring doe runne fro fearing trembling fallen mad footstep winter time apparant summer night longer trauell farther neither smell winter morning soone day vntill frost yce thawed especially footstep vncertaine full moone leape play together scattring putting sauour spring time also ingender confound one anothers footstep multitude goe foorth hunt take pleasure pastime must rise earely least depriued smell footesteps shall dogges able waie find hare hunter game pastime nature footstep remaineth long suddenly manner vanisheth awaie euerie houre againe must set hils rockes riuers also brook net gin thereby stopping vp starting hole path way wherein hare part trusteth whether broad narrow best time effecting bringing heereof sunne rising twy light breake day least nett set neare hare forme scar ed away set farre daunger departure sunne vp shee giueth selfe sleepe net must set manner let rodes bee pitched vpright fastning snare top raising net middle hange long stone one side hare net may go againe hare raised hee followeth net must driue great cry net must gently restraine dog make signification hunter taken else faile let shew contrary keeper net must keepe silence least hearing voice auerted hunter must take dog go forme start hare fashion auntient time among pagan first call vpon apollo diana immagined goddes hunting speede sport whome promised part game dog sent forth much winding casting falleth footsteppe hare let loose another seeing runne one course vncouple houndes let follow speaking dog name saying nowe b hoika c like word art pressing eagerly beginning gentlie encoraging pursuit dog take signe ioy glad gratifie maisters run along gallant cry turning ouer doubtful footstep one way another like cut indenture rough plain crooked straight direct compasse wagging tailes glistering eies vntil find hare form make signification thereof hunter tailes voice pace nowe running together standing stil deuided asunder set vpon beast sudainly riseth turnes cry hound hir flight must hunter cry io dog boy io io b io c shortest word fittest applawde dog let hunter also runne neuer meet hare trouble hound poore hare get sight run place first started fall net way keeper net must giue token hunter hollowing voice vsuall manner woodman oha ohe game end call dog name hare run farre stand long foot dog passe ouer hare footstep discry must hunter recal peculiar hunting terme lead place casting neare rebuking dogges range vncertainties exhorting diligent haue found footing againe run al alacrity mean season let hunter stand still til dog infalliably demonstrat vnto haue found game againe let hunter proceede exhorting dog sport last al day hunter must regard restrain keepe dogges wearyed hare least start fresh one labour lost summer noone let rest dogges strengthning feete till heat ouer snowy weather winde set northerly footesteps remaine long easely melted south winde blowe foote step quickly shortened neither snowe falleth fast winde bloweth strong must dogges ledde foorth hunting snow burneth dogges nose frost killeth heat hare foot let hunter take net companion go woodes mountaines tracing footstep beast snow vnto forme steep shadowed place windes blow ouer snow place doth hare seek lodging hauing found let come neare least raise hir seat cast round find footing place may take graunted hare found hauing done let leaue seeke another snow melt footing dashed hauing respect time day may inclose take euening let draw net round compasing whole plat wherein shee resteth raise stoole auoide net must follow foot vnto next lodging place far follow close snow doth weary clot vpon hinder foot hunter may take hand kil staffe blondus showeth another way taking hare hunter spread deuide themselues vntilled rough wais leading greyhound slip beating bush hedge thornes many time sending quicke smelling hound raiseth hare muse let goe greyhound hunting term cryes exhorting follow game many time dog teare hare many piece hunter must pull bleeding mouth dog others againe lie waite behinde bush tree take hare sudden vineyard fat resty easily ouertaken especially cold winter cyrus appeareth zenophon taught make ditch trapping hare course eagle hawkes watch hare raised hunted houndes set vpon right side whereby kill take true said beginning hare hunted men beast hauing thus discoursed hunting taking haresof park warren hare followeth also word two discourse parkes inclosed warren wherein hare cony deere boares beastes may alwaies bee ready storehouse seminary serue pleasure vse maisters grapaldus saith first roman euer inclosed wilde beast fuluius herpinus gillius saith varro first warren hare manner saith columella richmen possessed whole town lordship neare village inclosed peece land paile mudwall bushe storing diuers wilde beastes one lordship varro bought marcus piso tusculanum quintus hortentius saw lawretum wood inclosed containing fifty akers wherein nourished sortes wild beast within compasse wall quintus althea commanded forester call beastes together guestes sitting supper instantly founded pipe voice whereof assembled together great company sort admiration beholder quintus fuluius parke tarquinium wherein included onely beastes spoken also wilde sheepe contained forty akers ground besides two pompaeius erected parke france containing compasse three thousand pace wherein hee preserued onely deere hare connies also dormise bee beastes manner whereof ought thus first walles pale high close iointed neither badger cattes may creepe wolues fox may leape ouer wherein ought also bush broad tree couer beastes heate cold secret place content nature defend eagle rauening foules three foure couple hare quickly multiply great warren also good sowe guoards miseline corne barly peies like wherein hare delight thereby quickly waxe fat fatting hunter vse another deuice put waxe eares make deafe turne place feed freed feare sound want hearing grow fat kind concerning vse skin country make sleeues breech especially lynings outward colde diseasesthe civil vse seuerall part heliogabalus lay vpon bed filled flew wooll hare nothing soft cause grecian made spunges thereof clense eies men goldsmithes vse feete legges hare steed brush broomes take dust plate flesh hare hath euer beene accounted delicate meate among fourefootedbeastes thrush among foules aire according saying martiall inter aues turdus si quis iudice certet inter quadrupedes gloria prima lepus auncient time coelius saith brittons forbidden eate hare like iewes law moses leu deut plutarch inquireth reason whye iewes worship swine hare eate flesh whereunto answer made abstained hare colour eares eies like ass wherein ignorance god law appeared abstained hare god commandement clouenfooted egyptian accounted swift creature partaker diuinity flesh ingendereth thicke blood therefore bee prescribed dry diet bindeth belly procureth vrine helpeth paine bowel yet good ordinary diet hot dry second degree therefore nourisheth little hard gallen witnesseth blood farre whot flesh thinne therefore watery like blood fearefull beaststhe bloud flesh eaten hinder part loines delicate meate called latine pulpamentum wont dressed salt coriander seed yet forepart sweeter manner dressing whereof leaue euery man humour beleeued eating hinder loines hare would make one faire procure beauty wherupon martiall receiued hare gellia friend message mosus septem marce diebus eris retorted iest manner vpon gellia si non fallis si verum lux mea dicis edisti nunquam gellia tu leporem lampridius writeth certaine poet played vpon alexander seuerus emperor eating hare fleshe made faire whereas truth hee black manner pulchrum quod vides esse nostrum regem quem syrum suum detulit propago venatus facit lepus comesus ex quo continuum capit leporem emperor seeing verse emperor hauing long eares hand made answer vnto followeth pulchrum quod put esse vestrum regem vulgari miserande de fabella si verum putas esse non rascor tantum tu comedas velim lepusculos vt fias animi mali repulsis pulcher ne inuideas liuore mentis man finde fault emperor verse erasmus hath already answered obiection king emperor subiect lawes versesieng besides aunswer greeke translated eating hare procureth sleepe thus much flesh part epethites hare expressing nature arethe epithits hare eared trusting foot feareful careful fruitefull flying raging vnhorned little crafty tender sharpsmelling swift whining wandering beside many greeke name xerxes gathered army goe graeciastories monstrous hare man brought forth hare foreshewed great armye worke strange effect another mare three yeare old broght forth hare spake soone littered biting mother teeth killing looked vpon sucking dam blood fethers grew backe fashion wing done moster lifting vp voice spake manner fundite iam lachrymas suspiria miseri mortales ego hinc abeo say ye wretched mortall men weepe sigh go away word flew away neuer seene present sight heereof seuen publike notary called witness made instrument thereupon antonius bautius writeth epistle petrus toletus lyon yeare december whereunto saide toletus made answer day shall come saith except mercy god preuent child shall thinke doe obedience parent put death shall grieue borne say adulterate hare borne maire likewise reported lisander corinthian refused conduct lacedemonians lacedemonians besiedging citty fell much afraid vnwilling scale walles while stood amaze suddenly hare leaped towne ditch thing lisander saw exhorted souldiers saying afraid ye spartanes sluggish vnexercised people see stirre citty suffer hare lodge vnder walles whereupon came prouerbe dormire lepores submoenibus hare sleepe vnder walles signifie slothfull secure sluggish idle vnthrifty people eagle norway lay younge one hare skinnes themselues pull also bird scithia bignesse bustard bringeth forth two time keepeth hare skinne hangeth vpon bough hare dedicated loue xenophon saith man seeth hare remembred hath loued say citty bocas laconia builded signe good fortune taken hare inhabitant driuen countrey went oracle desire place dwell receiued answer diana shew dwelling place going countrey hare met consented follow build hare lodge followed myrtle tree hare hid selfe place builded citty euer afterwards retained veneration myrtle treepausanius thus conclude morrall discourse hare epigram martiall made vpon occasion hare sport passed mouth teeth tame lyon saying ambitious offering life lyon teeth wise non facit ad saeuos cernix nisi prima leone scilicet magnis ad te descendere tauris desperanda tibi est ingentis gloria fati quid fugis ho dentes ambitiose lepus et quae non cernunt frangere colla velint non potes hoc tenuis praeda sub hoste mori powder hare oyle mirtle dryueth away paine head burned cureth cough powder thereof good stone bladderthe medicins hare pliny also blood fime hare burnt raw pot powder afterwards drunke fasting wine warme water cureth stone sextus saith hee made triall putting spoonefull powder water wherein sand stone stone instantly melt disolue likewise young hare cut dam belly burnt powder hath operation wastcoat made hare skin straighten body young old also dipped oyle laide sore place horsses legges skinne ouer reatching often cureth sore blood taken warme body amendeth sunne burning freckle pimple many faultes skinne face celsus prescribeth bee doone first washing place many houres together morning blood afterwardes annoynting oile vertue fat swannes mingled oyle according saying serenus cygnaeos adipes hilari miserto lyaeo omne malum propere maculoso ex ore fugabis sanguine vel leporis morbus delabitur omnis also cureth taketh away thicke skin eie adorneth skinne produceth haire able place easeth gout cutim perduco pilos sedo podagrani sanguine si fuerint membra perunctameo fried helpeth bloodyflixe vlcers bowel old laske taketh away poyson arrow annointed vpon whot outward vlcer ripeneth bath cureth great leprosie washing rennet hare staieth loosenesse flesh profitable vlcers bowel breaketh stone beaten decocted like fox easeth gout shrinking vp sinnewes fat flower beanes beaten together draweth thornes flesh naile sticke sole foote beat together fat hare rawe seacrab lay place right vpon foote lay also two three beane flower let lie day night shal cured draweth poisoned arrow horsse andreas reporteth gesner hath often heard sewet hare layed crowne woman head expelleth secunds dead child wombe powder made wool haire stauncheth bleeding haires pulled liue hare stopped nose powder wooll hare burned mingled oyle mirtles gal bull allum warmed fire annoint vppon heade fasteneth haire falling also powder decocted hony helpeth paine bowel although broken taken round ball quantity beane together medicine must vsed haire hare wooll sheep flower rose cureth inflamations woman secret childbirth also hipocrates prescribeth shel cuttlefish beaten wine layed sheep wooll hare haire helpeth falling downe wombe woman child man feete scorched cold powder hare wooll remedy head hare burned mingled fat beares vineger causeth haire come fallen gallen saith haue vsed whole body hare burned mingled foresaid cure layed manner plaister eating hare head trembling nerues losse motion sence member receiueth singuler remedy thinges also preserueth teeth aking powder hare head burned salt mingled together rubbed vpon teeth ye put thereunto whitest fennell dryed beanes cutle fish indian burne together hare head mouse purpose one mouth smelleth strong powder spicknard asswageth smell braine good poison heart hare hath yt theriacall vertue also braine proued haue power comforting reparing memory sod eaten helpeth trembling hapeneth accession sicknesse one cold shaking fit ague bee noted trembling hath originall cause infirmitie weakenesse nerues apparant olde age although immediat cause may cold constitution aboundance cold humor drinking cold drink like trembling cured eating braine hare roasted saith exceede ordinary staying thereof take braine heereof drunke wine tooth hare layed part teeth ake easeth take mawe dung itrasis wash old wine dung may mingle therewith giue one sicke bloody flixe shal drying quality dissolueth congealed coagulated milke belly also clotted blood within stomach effectually rennet beast alway better age mingled vineger drunke poysondioscorides also man beast bee winter part hermolaus biggnesse cony like hogge beset compassed ouer sharpe thorney haires well face feete sharpe prickle couered kind soft mosse angred gathereth foode striketh vp admirable instinct nature sharpe pinnes needle haire beginning afterwardes grow prickle lesse marueiled bee mise egypt pliny saith haue haire like hedghogs hath none prickle belly therefore skin part like hog albertushis stone inward cleaue loin like bird hath two hole vnder taile eiect excrement creature liuing hath beside meate apple wormes grape findeth apple grape earth hee rowleth himselfe vppon vntill haue filled prickle carrieth home den neuer bearing aboue one mouth fortun one fall way likewise shaketh residue walloweth vpon fresh vntill setled vpon backe againe foorth hee goeth making noyse like cart wheale hee haue young one nest pull load wherewithall loaded eating thereof please laying vppe residue time come nourished home house brought vp tame drinke milke winetheir copulation hearbe called potomagiton whereof tast die presently carnall copulation stand vpright ioyned like beastes imbrace one another standing belly belly prickly thornes vppon backes suffer haue copulation like dogges swine cause little copulation cannot stand long together vpon hinder legges female bring forth young one feeleth naturall paine deliuery pricketh owne belly delay put misery paine whereupon came prouerbe erasmus saith echinus partum differt hedghog putteth littering young also applyed put defer necessary workes god nature hath prouided vndergoe poore man defereth paiement debt vntill value summe grow far great principall heir inward nd di tionthe inward disposition beast appeareth bee crafty full suttlety licophron saith nauplius cunning crooked wit called hedghog hide themselues den haue naturall vnderstanding turning wind south north norished tame house immediatly change remoue one wal another wild one haue two hole caue one north thother south obseruing stop mouth wind skiful mariner stiere turne rudder sail occasion aristotle saith haue held opinionoppianus naturally foreknow chang weather mortall hatred betwixt serpent hedgehogthe enimies hedghogs serpent seeketh hedghogs den falleth vpon kill hedghog draweth selfe vp together round like football nothing appeareth thorney prickes whereat serpent biteth vaine laboreth anoy hedghog wounded harmeth selfe yet notwithstanding height minde hate heart doth suffer let goe hold till one party bee destroyed hehghog rowleth vpon serpent piercing skin flesh yea many time tearing flesh bone whereby scapeth aliue killeth aduersary carrying flesh vpon speares like honorable banner aduersary field wolfe also afraid flyeth hedghog also story hatred hare hedghog said hare seene plucke prickle hedghog leaue bald pieled naked without defence fox also enemy poore hedgehogge lieth waite kill prouerbe true multa nouit vulpes echinus vero vnum magnum say foxe knoweth many deuises helpe himselfe hedgehogge knowes one great one rowling vp selfe said shee opposeth thornes back fox teeth alone sufficient secure greater aduersary wily fox perceiuing fasten teeth without danger himselfe pisseth vpon hedghogs face poisoneth hir wherupon poor beast forced lay open himselfe take breath fox stincking excrement thinge foxe espying looseth oportunity presently teareth hedghog peeces thus poore beast auoiding poyson falleth mouth enemy manner hedgehog whensoeuer hunted men draw vp leg put downe head mossy part belly nothing taken prickle perceiuing shift wil serue turne case growing desperate render owne body certain vrine hurtful skin back enuying good thereby euer come mankind therefore seeing naturally know manifold v owne hide heere cunning hunting cause first render vrine afterward take vrine maketh thornes back fall euery day therefore take course last refuge case hunter must poure vppon hedghog warme water feeling warmth presently vnfolds self lyeth open hunter must obserue instantly take one hinder legges hanging vp till killed famine otherwise commeth benefit taking skin flead brush made garment coelius eating flesh complaine il affirme good profitable story hedghog earth dedicated goodgod among foolish pagan water hedghog euill cittye phrigia called azanium great famine troubled inhabitant sacrifice could remoue one euphorbus sacrificed hedghog dutifull inclination seruice man wherein neuer faileth peace warre euery way neare vnto labour trauell therefore deare food man onely excepted must needes account noble necessary creature
