commendeth marcus cato triumph censorship vno caballo contentum et ne toto quidem partem enim sarcinae ab vtroque latere dependentes occupabant say contented one horsse saddlel yet totally one neither packes hung either side possessed greatest part true deriuation word seemeth accord caxe signifieth manger ali aboundance riding horsses plentifully fed horsses also vsed plowing according saying horac optat ephippia bos piger optat arace caballus grecian call hippo seemes deriued standing vpon feete beast onely seemeth one number called armenta besides history filled appellatiue name horsses alastor aethon nicteus orneus horsses pluto aetha mare agamemnon remembred homer aethion statio eous phlego pyrois horsses sunclaudian lampus podargus xampus arnon horsses erymus whose ayde hercules saide ouercome cygnus sonne mar balius xanthus pedasus horsses achilles boristenes adrianus made graue dion writeth bromius caerus calydon camphasus cnasius corythe herpinus two name brittaine horsses cited martial gillius cylarus swift horsses castor dimos phobos horsses mar enriole glaucus sthenon horsses neptune parthenia euripha mare belonging sentaurs hippodamia slain ornomaus harpe another mare phoenix corax horsses eleosthenes epidaminus wan prize sixty sixe olimpiade caused statue made olympus said horsses charriot called pantarces beside cnacias samus also podarces rhoebus strymon tagus theron thoes volneris horsse prasinum reported verus emperor much affected horsse onely caused brought owne pallace haue meate alway giuen presence made picture manger wherein grape corne whence came first golden horsses prize chiualry primus equum volucrem massyli muuera regis haud spernenda tulit vnto may added affected name poet loue fauorites rholandus vegiantinus baiardus horsse rainaldus rubicanus argalifas hippogrysus rugertus frontinus fratalatus sacrapan rondellius oliuerius epithits belong horsses either generall particularthe epithits horsses general may rehearsed place following brassefooted continuall hornefooted soundingfooted foming bridlebearer neighing maned dusty fourfooted fretting saddlebearing watery sweating wholefooted many others among greekes latines howsoeuer may containe diuers alegories therefore may seeme figuratiuely set downe yet thought good opinion reckon heere beginning reader may consider would vnwilling omit thing story might way tend dignity subiect intreat expressing nature wherefore wee firste beginne description naturall partes good horsse haire horsse falleth euery yeare neather eye lid browe hath long haires growing vpon therefore nicon famous painter greece hee curiously limbed forth horsses perfection faild part nature artthe naturall outward inward part horsses onely placing haires vnder eie onely fault h e receiued disgracefull blame haire mane ought long part groweth betwixt eares vpon temple hanging downe betwixt eye graecians tearme procomion latines caprona english may called foretop graunted horsses onely ornament sake also necessitie defend eiesaelianus horsses naturally proud locke mane may appear mare kept procreation mule copulation ass first despise ingender shaueling short haired stallion wherefore keeper shaue mane foretop afterwards leading water wherein mare behold owne deformity grow shamed deiected discouraged euer admit quietnesse ass couer therefore neuer good cut mane fetterlockes except necessity require mane foretop ornament necke head fetter locke legges feete keepeth horsses must well regard haue comely outward grace stronge able necessary labour many vse cut neckes riding horsses euen doe drawing horsses thing although may seeme done greater encrease farther groweth haire yet vnseemely honest rider againe cut stand compasse like bow many vse armenian fashion cutting mane rowes leauing longer batlements church best fashion persian cut whereby one halfe thicknesse cut away left side right side smoothly turned ouer combed according saying virgill densa iuba dextro iactata recumbit armo horsse double maned haire fall halfe one side halfe cut middle haires away leaue side whole inuention parthian coult young foale hinder part hier fore part grows yeares likewise forepart groweth higher hinder beast hath two bone head two discending forehead nostril two inferior gumbes cheekebones forty teeth say foure twenty grynders foure canyne twelue biting teeth seauen crosse ribbes necke seuen raines hole taile hath twelue commisures two ragulae foreshoulders shoulder legges two legges knee two moe knee twoo supporter shin article two mo sixteene small bone bottome hoofe one brest inward part six twenty rib hinder part top reynes etius two grinding bone hinder part head two moe two little ribbes vpper part thigh gamba thence haire pasternes two little one hooues sixteene bone number accounted hundred seuenty followeth declare measure number member twelue step degree roofe mouth tongue halfe foot long vpper lip hath twelue ounce vnder lip fiue euery one cheek ten forelocke nostril hath one foot length two eares containe six ounce eies foure ounce peece forelocke mercurius contained ynches backbone containeth three thirty crosse rib conuulsial reines top taile twelue commissure length sagula containeth also twelue ounce shoulder legges six leg knee foote length article hooues foure ounce whole length sixe feete stature couragious middle horsse know bigger lesser quality measure nerues sinnewes middle nostril heade necke backe bone dubble file thred toppe taile contayneth twelue foot length two broad sinnews necke containe fourefoot shoulder knee two sinnewes knee bottome foot foure sinnewes foreleg ten sinnews hinder legges ten sinnewes reynes stone foure sinnewes whole number amounteth thirty foure consequently number vaines declared pallet roofe mouth two vaines vnder eies two brest two legges two foure vnder pastrones two ancles foure crowne pastrones foure thighes two loines two gambaes one tayle two wombe matrix whole number nine twenty certaine vaines aboue eies diuided horsses wherin let blood making small incision blood also taken vaines pallet roofe mouth auncient custome letting horsses blood vpon saint steuens day reason many holy day one succeeding another custome growne vse also take blood matrixe vaines admitted gelding stone lose great part heat excepting extreame necessity pallat bloode may bee let euery moneth stallion kept mare vaine mouthes bee opened fal blindnes although good part husbandry let bleed yeare wherein admit copulation vacuation blood seede dubble charge nature organicall vaine necke best letting blood stoned gelded horsses later leach make incision great vaine called fontanella inen thymus iugulis eies horsse grey glassy reported augustus eies much brighter men resembling horsses eies see perfectly night yet colour varieth doth men according caprine glazie humor sometimes falleth one horsse hath two eies distinct colour eies horsse hang outward called exophthalmos faire eies best bucephalus horsse alexander eies eies hang inward called coelophthalmoi parthian count best horssescoelius whose eies diuers colour therefore called heteroph thalmoi breed horsse said take beginning parthian reason people loued horsses fearefull apt run away warres eares horsse token note stomacke taile lyonaristotle teeth changed yet grow close together like man hard thing horsse haue good mouth except stallion teeth bee pulled chafed heated cannot helde backe rider disdaineth bridle wherefore three yeare halfe old teeth ought pulled forth old age horse teeth grow whiter creature blacker mare hath two vdders betwixt thighes yet bringeth foorth one time many mare haue pap al like dammes heart horsse little bone like oxe mule hath gall like mule ass wholefootedbeastes howsoeuer say lyeth belly others cleaueth liuer gutcolon smal gut horse lie neare gut oneside belly may bee free full passage hence commeth best horsses runne trauel hard haue noyse rumbling belly hipbone horsse called haunch arabian say taile therwith driueth away fly called muscarium ought long ful haires legges called gambae campo signifying treading hooues horsse ought neither high low neither ought horsse rest vpon ancles horsses haue straight bone article hinder knee set harde grounde weary ryder bone short place dogges horsse also breaketh woundeth one legge another therefore horsses called cynopodae haue also quicke flesh hooues hooues sometimes called horne vppon better trauel men haue deuised fasten yron plate shooes hoof ought hard hollow beast may bee offended goeth vppon stone ought white broade alwaies kept moist may trauel better hauing strong foot hard sound hooues cause graecians call eupodes forasmuch requisite euery man prouide horsses best racethe horse diuers notion kind diuers place world courser horsses many time beguil simpler sort buyer lying deceiptful affirmation wrong country best horsses thinge bringeth confusion many kind horsses nation therefore declare seuerally country breeding horsses region aire maketh much alteration reader may short view see muster horsses made nation wildernes arcauania winges appolonius writeth lib aethiopia reported breedeth horsses hauing wing horn varro commendeth apulian horsses volatteranus writeth horsses rosea fit warre meaneth aboue horsses italy haue bene paulatimque auidos post terga relinquunt cum se threicius boreas super extulit antro c etiam emerito vigor est iuuenilis aeuo non prius est animo quam corpore passa ruina quem mittit modo sit gentile dexterity running parthian make pace easie trotter hard footing horsses manner gelding shall bee declared afterwards persia preferreth horsses aboue censure patrimony aswell cary hauing easie pace thessalia viz let thessalian mare tried battaile prouerbe excellent worth old time chiefest praise thessalian mare apparant oracle deliuered aeginensians suidas relateth know author thessalia hath excelent horsmen thrasia expert shooter india light armor hath likewise creet caria erasmus writeth thessalia fit feed horsses far excel arcadian epidaures strabo witnesseth lib caesar said dictator haue made first shew among romaine horsses fighting bulstextor killing whereof lucianus writeth thus thessalius sompes bellis feralibus omen say thessalian horsse profitable fence deadly conflict also thessalia citty named pella whence deeme pellaean horsses called gratius yet place called pella macedonia achaia wherof gratius writeth thus spadix vi pellaei valuere cerauni et tibi deuotae magnum pecuaria cyrrae phaebe decus nostras agere sacraria tousas cerani mount epirus cyrrha towne phocis scituate foot hil parnassus appollo cyrrhaeus worshipped tyrrheans excellent warrior commended oppianus island tyrrhenean sea especially corsica sardinia short horsses good courage gentle withall thracian horsses foule illshapen rough al ouer bodyes volatteran hauing great shoulder greeke named calomysten one wil cast downe rider ground backe crookbackt bunched el diuers kind therefore haue vnsure reeling pace course yery vnconstant absyrtus saith thracian horsses best thuringean horsses neighbor hessis pliny volatteranus supposed called mediterranean cimbri suppose venetian discend people paphlagonia called venetaus destruction troy came place make argument coniecturing good regard wholy imployed breeding horsses time faileth altogether former day careful follow businesse training vp young mule whereof homer writeth dyonisius tirant sicilia ordained breede horsses fetcht hence make warlike combat among graecians excellencie venetian breede remaine great breed horsses got praise vuallachus daie called saxones gelded horse brought countrie sometimes called dacia lycospades lycophotians shal spoken heerafter choice good horsses paladius aduiseth obserue foure thing choyse stallion horsse forme outward proportion colour merrit beauty necessary obserued choise coltes elder horsses may generous race hauing soft leg lofty pace gent e treading lead way affraid waterthe member eligble horsse bridge suddain noise hauing gentle necke sharpe head short belly fat backe dapple colour nimble eares thicke mane lying right side dubble bone discending loin sounding hoofe leg cannot stand stil virgill expresseth word nec non pecori est idem delectus equino tu modo quos spem statuis summittere gentis precipuum iaminde teneris impende laborem continnue pecoris generosi pullus arui altius ingreditur mollia crus reponit primus ire viam fluuios tentare minaces audet ignoto sese committere ponti nec vanos horret crepitus illa ardua ceruix argutumque caput breuis aluus obesaque terga luxuriatque toris animo sum pectus honesti spadix glaucique color deterrimus albis et giluo tam si qua sonum procul arma dedere stare loco nescit micat auribus traemit artus collectumque praemens voluit subnaribus ignem densa iuba dextro tactata recumbit armo ac duplex agitur perlumbos spina cauatque tellurem solido grauiter sonat vngula cornu varro sheweth first foaling colt man may obserue certain signes proue perfectionsigns chuse good colt cheareful bold terrified strange sight run company wanton contend equales course ouerrun leape ouer ditch go ouer bridge water prouoked appeareth meeke true signes elegiable colt also considered whether rise quickly stird rest run away speedily body great long full muscle sharpe hauing little head blacke eies open aad wide nostril sharpe pricked eares soft broad neck long thicke mane curled falling right side broad ful breast large shoulder shoulderbones round rib little belly dubble backebone least thin bunchie extended loines pressed downewards broad well set little smal stone long taile curled haire highe straighte equal legges round knee great bending inward round buttockes brawny fleshy thighes highcolumella varro albertus hard hollow round hooues wel set crowne pasterne hauing vaines conspicuous apparant ouer al body colt time foaling hath moste highest legges likelyest common reason proue able noble age al ioynts body knee legges grow least haue flexible ioynts infancy wil nimble flexible ageof chois horse vn backed neuer ridden thus much part colt next place must likewise take consideration horsse vntamed ready saddle outward partes bodie saith xenophon yeeld euident signification minde backed plato willeth state body bee straight articulate head bony cheekes little eies standing sunke head flaming like blood looking cruelly body blacke blacke eies body white doe argue gentler better disposition short little eares crowne head greater residue broad nostril whereby onely looketh terribly breatheth easily one horsse angry another rage wont stretch nostril vehemently beake snout horsse ought stand like swynes bend downe little crooked head ioyned necke may bend commodiously necke small next head necke stand rider eies appeare feete although bee full stomacke yet neuer violent stiffe necked ought also considered whether cheekbone sharpe tender vnequall standing one aboue another imparity maketh horsses necke hard stubborne backebone aboue shoulder higher commodious set saddle vpon whole body better compacted backe bone duble smooth shall rider sit easily forme horsse appeare delectable large brest sheweth comlinesse strength making fit take longer reach without doubling legges broad breast leg stand asunder large side ribbes swelling aboue belly shew ability horsse food worke round euen belly loines broad short causeth forlegs lifted vp easily hinderlegs follow smal loines onely deforme enfeeble oppresse horsse therefore loines ought bee duble ribbes broad fleshy agreeable breast side buttock sollide broad long taile reaching downe heeles hinder legges thighes full sinnewes bone legges thicke like postes whole body thicknesse ought neither vaines flesh quickly inflamed wounded trauile rough sharpe way flesh cut little commissure parte asunder causeth horsse halte aboue thinges haue regard foot therin especially hoof thick better thin likewise hard causeth pasterne stand higher ground pace soft hard part foote doe equally sustaine one another hard hoofe yealdeth sound like simbal goodnesse horse appeareth sound feete contrary side good also set downe fault signes reprobation horsses first therefore great fleshy head great eares narrow nostril hollow eye long necke mane hairy narrow breast hollow shoulder narrow side little fleshy sharpeloines bare rib hard heauy legges knee apt bend weake thigh strong crooked leg thin full fleshy plaine low hoof thing auoided choise horsse choise stallion breeding mare next place let v consider choise horsses mare appointed breede procreation haue shewed already stallion principally consider colour forme merit beauty stallion called italy rozzone france estalon germany ein springhengst latine admissarius quia ad generandam sobolem admittitur bicause sent beget engender graeci anabates ocheutes color first therefore beginne colour horsse best one continued colour although oftentimes rufus saith horsses despicable colour proue noble cheefe colour bay white carnation golden russet mousecolour fleabitten spotted pale blacke blacke bay preferred oppianus maketh distinction horsses colour manner gray blewish spotted fittest hunting hart bright bay beare leopard blacke flaming eies lyon naturall colour wilde horsses ashe colour blacke strake head along backe taile among tame horsses many good one black white browne red fleabitten colour yet remembred seldome neuer coultes foaled white rather colour degenerating afterward increase age horsses liuely durable healthy kinde therefor plutarch commendeth white horsse sylla swiftnes foot stomacke among al colour r nu first blacke bay next white last gray commended camerarius commendeth certain colour cald latin varius may bee englished daple gray diuers intextures colour although many nation doe disalow yet vndoubtedly colour saith signe argument good nature constituted builded vpon temporate commixture humor black white yellow haires appeare sight one nothing inferiour equestriall party coloured caparison among horsses diuers coloured haue star forehead one white foote commended thrasian horsses admitted copulation virgill speaketh manner thracius albis portat equus buolor moculis vestigia primo alba peda frontemque ostentans arduus albam blacke horsses also haue one russet swart spot face else black toung highly commended generation pale coloured horsses way admitted couer mare colour acount likewise seldom seen fole proueth better sire bay colour hath bin receiued without exception best trauailers supposed baudius amongst latines deriued vadium quia inter coetera animalia fortius vadat among creature goeth surelye also behoouefull stallion horsse mane bee colour bodyartificial eane ke mare conceiue best colourd colt horssekeepers haue deuised make mare conceiue strange colour mare would go horse paint stallion diuers colour bring sight presence mare suffer stand good vntill perfectly conceiue imagination true idea ful impression picture suffer couer performed conceiueth foale colour like manner pigeon conceiue younge one diuers colour german mingle colour horse haires especially bring blacke among white take root fearue sage seeth together leigh wash horsses ouer therewith making horsses white take fat ariseth decoction moule earthen pot withal anoint place would haue white also shaue haires put vpon balde place crude hony badggers grease maketh haires arise white many meanes vsed horsseleatches afterward shalbe shewed olde age horsse hair doth naturally change white aboue beast know reason brainpan thin slender bone greatnesse body would require appeareth receiuing blow place life indangered hurting member acording obseruation homer et qua fetae haerent capiti laetaleque vuluus precipae sit equis thus much shall suffice colour stallion followeth form outward proportion bodythe forme ought great solide stature aunswerable strength side large buttockes round breast broad whole body full rough knot muscle foot dry solide hauing high hoofe heele part beauty little dry head skin almost cleauing bons short pricked earesthe beautye stallion great eies broad nostril long large mane taile solid fixed rotundity hoofes one thrusteth head deepe water drinketh rib loines like ox smooth straight backe hippes long broad fleshy legges large fleshy dry sinnewes ioynctures thereof great fleshy neare hoofes hinder part body higher forepart like hart beauty better appeareth leane body fat fatnesse couereth many fault former part thus expressed horace regibus hic mo est vbi equos mercantur opertos inspiciunt nesi facies vt saepe decora molli fulta pede est emptorem inducat hiantem quod pulchri clunes breue quod caput ardua ceruix make triall stallion whether fit procreation hipparchus teacheth experiment presse genytall member two finger locke woll draw seede drawne cleaue hang together cut easily parted demonstration good stalion hang together like birdlime easily go asunder like milke whay horse admitted couer maresthe age stallion horsses olde among faultes engender foales lame feete therefore kept admitted copulation war rage like weake fire among wet stuble according verse morbo grauis aut segnior annis deficit abde domo nec turpi ignosce senecta frigidus venerem senior frustraque laborem ingratum trahit si quando ad praelia ventum est vt quondam stipulis magnus sine viribus ignis cassum furit therefore behooueth stalion horsse vnder three yeares old couereth mare best beginne fiuecollumella indure generation onely till twenty yeare old also thirty forty yeares country hath beene often proued bee admitted couer aboue fifteene one yeare young horsse aboue ten twelue one yeare residue may suffered obseruation strength nature king babilon beside horsses war eight hundreth stalions admitted couer sixe thousand mare euer one twenty peecepalladius ther also place syria neare apamia one plot ground nourished thirty thousand mare three thousand stalions coelius saith euery stalion hundreth mare couer place number exceedeth proportion nature also remembred stalions seperated mare al yeare long except time procreation also must largely fed according verse animaduersis instant sub tempus omnes impendunt cur denso distendere pingui quem legere ducem pecori duxere maritum florentesque secant herbas fluuiosque mini strant farraque ne blando nequeant superesse labori inualidique patrum referant ieiunia nati ipsa autem macie tenuant armenta volentes atque vbi concubitus primo iam nota voluptas sollicitat frondesque negant fontibus arcent saepe etiam cursu quatiunt sole fatigant cum grauiter tunsis gemit area frugibus cum surgentum ad zephyrum paleae iactantur inanes hoc faciunt nimio ne luxu obtusior vsus sit genitali aruo sulcos oblimet inertes sed rapiat sitiens venerem interiusque recondatabsyrtus also obserued male designed procreation ouer much labored wil weake generation yet suffered bee idle certaine fleamie humour increased likewise disableth copulation thus much male almost al thing haue bin elegantly described poet turne themselues west standing vpon rockes draw cold aire oftentimes maketh conceiue wondering conceiue rather east sunrising south westerly wind bordering vpon north poet word continuoque auidis vbi subdita flamma medullis vere magi quia vere calor redit ossibus illae ore omnes versae zephyrum stant rupibus altis exceptamque leues aura saepe sine vllis coniugijs vento way follow direction columella absyrtus prouoke naturall meanes like buls kyne first male giue taile hart burned mingled wine annoint therewithall stone generall member shal dul stallion prone venery also kind satirium giue drinke powder horsses stone likewise female refuse take shrimpes beaten softe water thicke hony therewithal touch nature mare hir purgation afterwards hold nose else take hennes dunge mixed rozen turpentyne annoynt secret mare shall far increase lust cureth lothsomnesse better shrimp increaseth lust must regard leane ill fauoured mare annointed horse quickly wearied lust delighteth tickled therewith without thing againe doe first bring vulger horsse mare prouoketh stirreth lust neare facte filling lead away generous stallion couered none meanes preuaile doe rub secret nettle causeth suffer horsse enter democritus also saith power cause horsses bring forth male femalesto ingender male female suffer couple north winde bloweth third day full moone bind leaft stone hee shall get male south wind bloweth three day full moone binde right stone horsse proue female also time copulation horsse leape mare right side token male left side wil female carnall copulation acceptable horsses lesse grieuous vnto neate kind man excepted venereous nimble generation horsse mare male know female liue although haue bine day together strange female fall company expell away biting feeding single alone female themselues male stone horsse come within walke presently make force female stir restraine biting time rage neither regard rider aduersary bridle cruell stripe steep hill rock caues earth wind amorous sauour fellowes according saying virgill verse nonne vides vt tota tremor pertentet equorum corpus si tantum odor attulit aura ac neque eos iam frena virum nec verbera saeua non scopuli rupes que cauae atque obiect ae retardant flumina correptos vnda torquentia monte hath beene also receiued barren mare shal conceiue take bunch leek bruised small put cup wine twelue french fly called cantarides water put two day together genitall mare like glyster afterwards put horsse anointing secre said ointment two seuerall time horse leap else take nyter sparrow dung rozen turpentine thrusting mare genitall whereby hath proued fecundity oftentimes followed also vse syler mountaines procure conception mare cowes true signe conception nature fluent humour secret ceaseth month two three pliny saith mare filled changeth colour looketh red vnderstood haire skinne lip eies haire standing full let seperated malesthe ordring mare foale varro palladius exempting moist place cold labour enemy foaling cause abortement likewise must haue much meate little onely temperate dyet softe lodging better ordering elegantly described virgill verse non illas grauibus quisquamiug ducere plaustras non saltu superare viam sit passus acri carpere prata fuga sluuiosque innare rapaces saltibus vacuis pascant plenum secundum flumina viridissima gramine ripa spleuncaeque tegant sacrum procubet vmbra certaine woman flower touch mare foale sometimes doe see causeth cast foale purgation first virginityorus like manner smell snuffe candle eat buckemast scythian perceiue mare quicke foale aristotle time going young ride vpon holding opinion thereby cast forth foales lesse paine difficulty carry young one wombes hath beene already said twelue moneths sometimes come eleuen moneths ten day commonly male male sooner perfected womb female commonly female foaled twelue month ten day tary longer vnprofitable worth education mare easily deliuered young among beast beareth commonly one time yet hath seen twin hath proceeded time deliuery shee hath lesse purgation blood great molde body affoorde hath foaledaristotle shee deuoureth second also thing cleaueth foales foreheade piece blacke flesh called hippomanes neither doth shee suffer young one sucke vntill haue eaten smelling thereunto young old horsses kind would fal mad thing haue imposter world vsed phyltre amorous cuppe draw woman loue virgill speaketh thus quaeritur nascentis equi de fronte reuulsus et matris praereptus amor againe hinc demiem hippomanes vero quod nomine dicunt many monstrous horsseheads verie great poison contained hippomanes arcadian phormis made horsse brasse olympia put hipomanes horsses time seene brazen horsse weare farre inraged lust halter band could hold breaking runne leaped vpon said brazen horsse although wanted taile yet wold forsake beautiful mare runne couer neither came vnto found heeles sounding hard brasse woulde despaire copulation noise mouth rage endeuor body labor leape vpon althogh slippery brasse gaue admission stay abod vpon backe substance neither could drawne saide brazen image vntil great strength cruel stripe rider forcibly driuen away thinke little peece flesh cleaue forehead others loynes many genitals howsoeuer vnspeakeable part god prouidence make mare belly sepulchre poison remaine male female whole race horsses would vtterly perish destroied throgh rage lust cause keeper breeder horse diligently obserue time maresfoaling instantly cut colte reseruing hoofe mare procure stallion carnal copulation colt cut piece flesh sacrificed manifest faith elianus mare neuer loue foale whence shee hath eaten consumed peece flesh poison onely powerful brute beast also reasonable men time chance ignorantly tast heereof likewise fall madde praecipitate luste raging gesture voice caste lustfull eye vppon euerie kind woman attempting wheresoeuer meet rauish ingender besides oppression minde body consumeth vadeth away three day colt foaled hee hardly touch ground head good touch harmed often handling onely profitable suffered damme warme large stable neither vexed cold daunger oppressed mare thorough want roome also hooues must looked vnto least dung sticking vnto burne afterward waxeth stronger turne field damme least mare ouermourne selfe want hir foale beast loue young one exceedingly three day let mare bee exercised rid vppe downe pace foale may follow shall amend encrease milke colt haue soft hooues make runne speedily vppon hard ground else lay little stone vnder foot meanes hooues hardned preuaile take swine grease brimstone neuer burned stalkes garlicke bruzed mingled together therewithall anoint hooues mountaines also good breeding colt two cause first place hooues hardned secondly continual ascending discending body better prepared induring labour thus much may suffice educating nursing foales weaning obserue rule first seperate dam twentyfoure houres togither next morning let admitted sucke belly full remoued neuer suckled atv moneths old begin teach eat bread hay yeare old giue barly bran two yeares old weane vtterly handling taming breaking horsses appointed breake horsses called graecians eporedicae hipodami hipocomi latin equisones arulatores cociones italian io cozone absyrtus opinion foales vsed hand begun tamed eighteene moneths old backed onely tied heade halter racke maunger may terrified extraordinary noise cause vse brake best time three yeares old crescetiensis teacheth many chapter wherefore begin handled let touch rough partes bodie mane place wherein horsse taketh delight handled neither let bee ouer seaueare tyrannous seeke ouercome beast stripe cicero saith faire meanes hunger famine haue vsed handle sucking hange vp presence bit bridle sight hearing gingling thereof eares might grow familiar came hand lay vpon backes litle boy flat belly afterward make sit vpon formally holding head three yeare old commit labor vntill foure yeare old yet domesticall small horsses ordinarie vse tamed two yeare olde best time effecting heereof moneth march also good riding young horsse light often get vp againe let bring home vse stable bottome whereof good paued round stone else plank oake strewing litter vpon lieth may lie soft stand hard also good regarded plankes bee laid vrine may continually run hauing little close ditch receiue horsses foot may hurt thereby good maister horsses must oftentimes go stable may obserue vsage beast manger also ought kept continually cleane receiuing prouender filth noisome thing mingled therewith ought also partition euery beast may eat owne allowance greedy horsses onely speedily rauen vp owne meat also rob fellowes others againe haue weake stomackes offended breath fellowes eate except eat alone racke also placed according stature throat may much extended reaching high eye head troubled placed low ought also much light stable least beast accustomed darkenesse offended sunne light winke ouer much able indure beam led abroad yet stable must warme hot althogh heat preseru fatnes yet bringeth indisgestion hurteth horsses nature therefore winter time stable must ordered beast may offended fall disease ouermuch heat suddaine cold vegetius summer time let lodge night day open aire also stabling horsses must auoided namely sty swine stinke breath gruntling hog abhominable horsses nature hath framed simpathie concorde betwixte noble couragious spirite horsse beastlie sluggish condition swine remoue also far awaie horsses stable kind fowle woont haunt place gather vp remnantgraines prouender leauing behind little fethers horsse licke vp meat sticke throat else excrement procureth loosenes bellie must also regarded stable must kept neat sweet cleanecamerarius absence horsse may notly like place swine instrument also implement thereof horsse cloathes curricombes manecombes saddle bridle disposed hung vp order behind horsse maie neither trouble eating lieng yet giue occasion gnaw eat deuour owne damage hurt nature wanton horsses pul assunder destroie whatsoeuer reach therefore oftentimes exercised backed principally bee kept good diet want food deiecteth spirit noblest horsse also maketh meane horsse vse contrary good diet doth onelie make meane horsse seruicable also continue worth value best thing poet considered fained arion horsse neptune others made cere goddesse corne meane witted man may intetpret signifie abundance prouender nature horsses farre aduanced aboue ordinary like sonnes god perform incredible thing whether therefore eat chaffe hay grasse graine according diuersities country let wholesome cleane fresh sweet without dust grauel mustines euill smell morning giue barley prouender little time distinct seueral portion twice thrice one another may chew eke disgest thoroghly otherwise rauen wil hauing much time rendreth dung whole disgested three houres hath eaten prouender giue little hay three houres dinner allowance graine morning afterwards two three clock hay againe drink last giue allowance prouender supper bottle two hay ought plentiful former seruings yet rule vnderstood though might altered time prefixed may preuented ocasion require best prouender oat barley yet barly ingendreth thinner better blood therefore preferred measure prouender lefte discretion horssekeeper meate wholsome horsse barly chaffe wil make ful life also able indure labor yet ouer fat england many place giue horsses bread made fitch bean pea one make iourney horsseback let giue horse much prouinder noone somewhat hay bread steeped wine also let serue sooner night ordinary beast may take rest refuse giue horsses wet prouender steeped bread conceiue breed loathsomnesse meat truth reasonable horssekeeper preuenteth mischeefe besides meat horsse altogither drie beast himselfe indangered sicke disease therefore safe giue moistened foode sometimes well giue bread mingled saltcamerarius horsse weary sweateth let drinke eat prouender walked litle giue hay first al couering large cloath remember hay cast horsse reeke first must pulled shaken betwixt handes auoiding dust filth restrain horsse much may eating litter vnder foot euen best meat defiled vnholsome also good sometimes suffer picke vp meat ground betwixt foreleg make necke grow thinner leanner comely let necke fast bound stable letherne collar bind manicle forelegge hinder leg contrary side shal leg preserued health cannot mooue place difficulty concerning drinke horsses something added place namely brackysh troubled water runneth softly great pondes fittest horsse water hot thicke nourisheth better swift water colderr ius therefore vnholsome yet hot time summer sweet clearer water conuenient custome bee horsse except drinke freely neuer fat let mouth oftentimes washed within salt wine make eat drinke liberally yet running water wholsome horsses whatsoeuer moueably fluent lesse subiect poyson standeth still horsse sweat weary safe let drinke thing except first stale case followeth distention better turne lead forth horsse water bring vnto time necessity cause done let water cleare fresh stable lodging ought ordered neither offend cold winter yet thorough heat summer extremeties pernicious therfore weather extreame colde must horsses backe belly couered cloath contrary exceedeth heat must litter taken away also heate must bee couered linnen auiode fly cold woollen helpe nature likewise good toward night picke cleanse open hooues artificiall instrument thrust hollow cowdung defect thereof horsedung little strawe may shake againe good done euerie daye rather euery second day good mingle therewith sewet greace el new laide egge warme shes auncient time vsed shoo horsses yron vntill day catullus remembreth custome saying ferream vt soleam tenaci voragine mula seemeth deuise first al inuented mule horsseshooes ought round like foot heauy least horsses nimblenes thereby hindered great care must nailing seting least tender fleshy part foot thereby piercedpollux another charge horssekeeper keepe horsses lippes soft tender gentle may sencibly feele bit cause let often rub hand warme water neede require oyle also handling horsse must obserued generall rule neither come horsse right face behind taile dangerous rider least heeles mouth hee harme side may safely set vpon handle horsse leadeth must likewise goe side likewise good painefull dressing horsse small meanes retaine sound perfect health therfore must often touched currycomb afterward handfull strawe hand may follow stroke lay haire smooth fashion old time brush ouer horsses little tone linnen instrument made like sword whereby excusse dust beast heerein wisedome beginne head mane descende part touch horsses backe gently may wash head mane bony daungerous least combe offend greeue beast except layed tenderly good wash legges daily washing softneth hoofe sliding downe water therefore sufficient onely stroke downe hand neather part also belly kept ouer clean clensed water horsse pained thereincamerarius horsse dressed good bring stable open ayre hee may tyed longer halter seeme liberty whereby shall brought cleannesse tractable gentlenesse standing vppon smooth stone till dust loofe haires combe brush driuen away meane time stable emptied performed horsses watering must also regarde skin wherein horsses yard runneth kept cleane stopped hindereth vrine maketh horsse sicke horsse dressing let haue manner meat either hay prouender let ledde water twice day wash therein legges belly except winter time wherein safe wet beast often appearance sicknesse infirmity haue purpose giue vnto kinde medicine must altogether forbeare water vse wash horsses legges warme winelees refresh ioyntes sinnewes hard iournies custome seemeth allowable vegetius vse insteed thereof warme dishwater kitchin backes wash colde water salt vnderneath tail neare yard shal find summer time much annoyed fly therefore needefull part horssekeepers watchfulnes looke place driue away charge take better rest euermore must nourished mutuall beneuolence betwixt horsse horssekeeper beast may delight presence person attendant cause may kept hunger wet litter cold winter fly summer furthermore dilligent caution must beast prouoked thorough ouer much severity horsse keeper violence often driuen racke maunger auoid stripe either hurteth shoulder legges owne weight force else groweth trembling presence man neuer yeeldeth louing obedience el faleth furious vnreclaimable euill quality master therfore ought often enter stable take view horsses vsage whereby beast wil quickly take notice especially haue one great follie peece ill husbandry trust seruantes ouersee cato wont say frons occipitio prior forehead nape necke meaning thereby nature hath set highest formost hide himselfe take place vppon discharge safe part wisdome see another man eies worke altogether deputy men must also affraid lending horsses german haue pretty prouerbe trust wiues great feast sight commonly learne euill fashion much horsses lending returne home againe maisters alteration strength quality adorning furnishing horsses cannot approue cut horsses taile foretop one receiued beginning ignorant perswasion increasing strength horsses backethe furnitur horse triming immagined comelines triming ribben deuised knot hindred horsses sight first beast wronged depriued helpe againste fly decency hinder part second nature acused adorning horsses forhead gawdy variable coloured hair prouiding bunch haire weaken eye neither tollerable wise man imagine therefore spend time confute vaine adorning horsses let horssekeeper take heed harme beast putteth bridle little negligence quickly bringeth great offence touching wringing oppressing tender part horsses head mouth must alway put bridle left side horsse owne accord open mouth bit musthe gently open mouth one finger put vppon meanes open mouth presse wring lip vpon great canine tooth thing causeth horsse open mouth also must regarded horsse leading drawne made hard headed vnwilling follow againe cheekes must pinched bridle least skin grow sencelesse also must hange long loose mouth alway biting bit giue lesse obedience rider camerarius writeth hath seene put salt vpon bit whereof horse licking tasting became willing take mouth better performance heereof necessary obserue often triall kind fashioned bitt best beseemeth fitteth horsses mouth finding keepe thereunto continually put neither wring cheekes let rowle betwixt teeth saddle also must fastned backe may turne rowle vpon wherefore layeth thereupon come left side gently without violence noise set vpon beast neither girth peytrill sturrops trapping crupyard fall betwixt backe saddle neither couering therewith horsses wither yet touching hip loynes first let peytrill breast buckled girth order neere foreleg vpon belly vpon belly wil sliding rule riding bene equitant qui bene cingunt say ride well bind fast ought done open place rider horse may haue liberty wherewithal generous great stomacked beaste much delighted neither must tyed drawne hard till rider seated looke also often girthes wring side pul skin riding sitting horsebacke get vp mount horesebacke take hold lower part bridle neere bit lefte hand distance may keepe rising giue offence take aduantage get saddle right hand take raines toppe shoulder mane hold giue checke horse mouth mounting rule among rider wherewithall meddle onely good vse horsse backing sadled bare aswel plaine ground block rising inuented ease man therefore goe horssebacke first stroke horsse make much gentle word conuenient sound horsse vnderstandeth stand willingly til backe thing plutarch excellent story alexander great bucephalus first presented father king phillip thassalian called phillonix king perswaded go forth fielde try quality beast highly comended rare partes valued price none king might yealde horsse beganne snort kicke admit man come vnto within length rain kept aloft like wild vntamed horsse yealding obedience voice signes rider whereat king fel exceeding angry bid lead away vnruly vntamed horse alexander present complained ignorance fearefulnesse rider cause generous gallant beast better manned hearing wherof king phillip smiled yet carried himselfe though heard word sonne vntill alexander repeated saying second time whereunto father replyed sir boy make selfe skilfull old cunning rider lay imputation feare ignorance yes said alexander aduenture handle horsse better yea saide phillip punishment wilt thou vndergoe thou faile performe thou hast said punishment said alexander giue price horsse whereat king laughed strok vp wager alexander raines horsse deliuered presently turned sunrising might bee terrified shaddow beholder led vp downe softly two three turnes last wan horsse hand gently stroked applauded gotten perfect intelligence vnderstanding horsses stomacke cast cloake addressed himselfe mount backe holding raines bearing hand whole body checke pinch horsses mouth inclined first al lay away stirred angry minde afterward paced fro gently horsse indured last put spur vnto made runne leap carrier curuet terror first beholder afterward singular admiration praise himselfe caused company traine applaude fact forced old man father send forth teares ioy alexander desended horsse hee could containe himselfe must needes goe kisse embrace sonne whereby manifest man ride generous spirited horsse hoshal bend endure burthen gentlenesse familiarity beast may still know loue rider likewise maister mounteth requisit seruant side horsse hold stirrop shall get vp surely set himselfe mor softly horsses taught bend knee take vp aged sick maistersxenophon may lesse offended ascending back custom saith pollux first al begin among persian ancient german singularly exercised horsmanship standing vpon ground holding speare launce handes mounted without stirrop vantage vppon horsses back onely ordinarily attired common garment also armed tho iulius caesar take glory chiualry yet adaies inuention saddle stirrops easie horsse horsseman better pelethronian inuention time rider saddle well seated must sit chaire chariot bended together rather keepe body vpright onely bowing outwardly knee shal better able defend himselfe offend aduersary must rather seeme stand sit horsebacke rider maister horsses must spare horsse heate summer dog day colde winterrussius neuer time ride past twylight euening horsse empty prone make water full therefore must hindered desire alway staling ride fast vntil nerues extended let forth vrine contracted setled drawne together againe winter time horsse passe ouer foord water wil ascend vp aboue belly let stale first alabsirtus least fall strangury also little eased loade beast reioyseth celerity swiftnesse horse soone turned hand instantly runneth away speedily doth walke softly time pleasure except prouoked aboue desire counsel xenophon ride fast wager bend vpper part body forward stretching hand carrieth raines drawing letting length againe therefore good case vse short raines horsse course stretch forth raines owne accorde signe vnskilfull rider weake tireable horsse polluxadde spur great necessity guide prouoke voice riding rod quick good metled horsses spur made fierce gentle natured beastes made sluggard like ass often beating seem neglect dispise stripe must also shorten lengthen iournies time riding may neither certaine beast yet ouer long specially long iourney take shorter ride vpon horsse first let vsed plaine equal way leape goe vppe hill precept old graecians rider must lay raines necke horsse time either fierce sluggish ordinary may holp meanes wildenesse fiercenesse horsses like anger rage men therefore occasion offence word deede must auoided therefore assoone rider vpon backe let rest little set forward also let horsse moue pace men offended sudden violence imperious gesture also horsses horsse stirred race bee forward whot ordinary must gently restrained bridle better qualifie rage long spacious direct iournies often winddings turning man simple thinke length iourney race horsse wil meeke may tyred hee deceiueth himselfe rage man inuenteth hurtful reuenge turneth malice continuance also horsses procureth headlong ruine preuented horsse rider therefore horsse generous spirit neuer prouoke ferocity wilde fierce wicked harmefull also better vse light gentle bridle heauy sharpe except rider art frame sharpe gentle bitte also rider must frame himselfe art ryding commotion horsse hee may touch member part onely backe whereupon sitteth must also learne different termes incite stir vp horsse run forward graecians call clogmos else restraine keepe call poppysmus one closeth lippes toucheth palat horsse fearefull thing must shew thing plainly custom may learne skittish let smell thereunto till learne afraid men beate feare ill handled suspect thing wherof afraid cause stripe like sort go one side turne back againe good vse spur encrease terror peruersenesse therefore peaceable encouragement friendly perswasion best meanes perswade man feare like course must taken horsse may goe straight without doubt trembling learne account thing horrible nature horsse tyred wearied iourney man would iudge vnfit labour take saddle burthen put stable greene fielde may tumble towle ouer ouer shall easily recouer ancient time horsses trauailed snow made bootes sackcloth weare iourney disposition horsses generall among flockes heardes horsses captaine leader going gouerning residue among ox sheepe elephant nature instable moueable swift high spirited beast therefore hath receiued body furnished member apt swaied spirit lactantius truly obserueth desire glory victory conquerours exsult reioyce conquered ouercome mourne hange downe heades thinge virgill expresseth verse insultare solo gressus glomerare superbos plainely ouid triumph conquering horsse saying hic generosus honos gloria maior equorum nam capiunt animis palma gaudentque triumpho seu septem spatijs circo mexuere coronam nonne vides victor quanto sublimius altum attollat caput vulgi se venditet aura celsaue cum caeso decoratur tergaeleone quam tumidus quanto que venit spectabilis actu compes atque solum generoso concita pulsu vngula sub spolijs grauiter redemitis opimis pliny affirmeth ioyned together chariot vnderstand theyr encouragement glory comendation therefore beaste high stomach horsse naturall disposition horsses loue wet place bath cause called philolutra also loue musicke hath beene already declared whole hoaft army sybarite taught horsses daunce sound pipe coelius writeth heereof manner great saith riot wantonnesse sybarit common feastes brought horsses daunce men thing knowne crotoniatae offered warre agreed vppon fight whereupon day battell crotoniats brought diuers piper minstrils vppon signe giuen sounded instrument whereupon sibaritan horsses came running dancing among aduersaries betraied selues rider enemy like story reported athaeneus people called cardiani also taught horsses daunce vpon hinder legges worke many straunge feates forefeete hearing certaine measure played vpon pipe bisaltans waged warre cardians captaine certaine man called onaris hee boy sold cardia hee serued barber time seruice oftentimes heard oracle foretolda history cardians ouercome bisaltans therefore preuent worst ranne away maister came home safe bisalta owne country countrey men created captaine warlike force vnderstanding trickes cardians taught horsses dancing brought cardis certaine pipe taught diuers bisaltans sound play measure vpon cardians taught horsses whereupon ioyned battell cardian horsses force cardians lay horse commanded piping bisaltans sounde musicke horsses vnderstood presently stood vp vpon hinder legges would fight goe ouerthrowne aduersaries solinusthey haue also singular pleasure publike spectacle therefore haue beene obserued prouoked pipe instrumentall musicke also song vocall harmony variety colour burning torch dion also writeth saw horsse taught know reuerence king textor affirmeth saw horsse paris triumph tilt turnaments made marriage lewes twelueth mary lady brittaine commaunded ryder salute queene presently bend knee vnto rose againe running away fast bird could flye homer seemeth also affirme horsses diuine qualityes vnderstanding thing come tyed manger mournd death patroclus also foreshewed achilles happen vnto cause pliny saieth lament lost maisters teares foreknow battailes virgill writeth thus horsse pallas post bellatrix equus positis insignibus aethon lachrymans quisque humectat grandibus os accursius affirmeth caesar three day died found ambling nag weeping stable token ensewing death thing beleeue except tranquillus life caesar related thing addeth moreouer horsses consecrated mar passing ouer rubricon let run wilde abroad without maisters man might meddle horse god found weepe aboundantly abstaine meat whereof could cause giuen loue former maisters also reported rodatus captain charls great death emp made monk horse would neuer suffer come back except maister likewise abstained riding many yeares happened certaine pagan brake vpon said monastery whereupon poore rodatus went vnto horse many year discontinuance willingly tooke vp aged maister vpon back carried vntil riumphed ouer aduersaries maruaile dog horse louing men brought vp carefully liberally recompence good turnes benefactor obserued nature horse seldome hurt man child except madnes yet malitious horse well men reported pliny tzetze foale hath lost dam residue mare giue suck bring vp seldom found variance except barren mare pull away foales naturall dam creature louing young one mare neither desirous young cause barren themselues labour steale away others wont runne ras would performe vpon maresaristotle newly deliuered foal tyed vp foal home led mare begining race making end thereof foales stable putting beast forward runneth homewardes speedily remembrance foale feare horsses enemy nature horsses afraid elephant battaile likewise cammell cause cyrus fought cra sus ouerthrew horsse sight camel horsse cannot abide looke vpon camell horsse tread footpath wolfe presently falleth astonished likewise two drawing charriot come place wolfe hath troad stand still charriot frozen earth sayth aelianus pliny aesculapius also affirmeth thing horsse treading beares footstep assigneth reason secret betwixt feete beastes haue shewed already mare strike wolfeorus treade footsteppes thereof presently casteth foale therefore egyptian signifie woman suffering abortement picture mare kicking wolfe dextanian horsses gelded dare fight lyon gelded like al horssesoppianus afraid lion stripe spur able bring presence caropion horsses excepted al kind swine enemy horse estridge also feared horsecardan horsse dare appeare presence like difference also betwixt horsse beare bird called anclorus neyeth like horsse flying horsse doth many time driue away somewhat blind cannot see perfectly therfore horsse doth oftentimes ketch deuoure hating owne voice creature vnlike himselfe reported aristotle bustard loueth horsse exceedingly seeing beastes feeding pasture dispiseth abhorreth soone euer seeeth horsse flyeth vnto ioy although horsse run away itaelianus therefore egyptian see weake man driuing away stronger picture bustard flying horsse horsses also taught leape man take rain go ouer ditch holding fast pulling vnwilling let another come behinde strike whip rod leape ouer without delay thus haue vsed leape empty likewise accustome loaded first ouer smaller ouer greater hedge beginning let leape softe ground wel practized harder beginneth leape let rider put spurres vnto performe leape safety himselfe rider custome hee may leape runne wel downe hil vp hil therefore persian nodrisians vse accustome horsses run hil vp hil epethits following serue expresse nature horsses ful stomach generous magnanimious strong ardent sharpe couetous fierce bolde threatening terrible foaming horsses arcauania argose mysene aria elis epid spaine thesalt farsalis country bucephalus horsse alexander ballasia prouince addicted mahomet hath many excellent great swift horsses whose hoofes hard neede yron shooes although trauaile ouer rock mountaines arabian also haue horse kingdom senega haue breed horsses reason heate countrey doth onely burne vp pasture also cause horsses fa l strangury cause doe buy horsses deare vsing stead hay stalkes pea dryed cut asunder millet seede stead oates wherewithall grow exceeding fat loue people great horsses giue horsse furnished nine bondslaues please well fourteen haue bought horsses send witch obserue therein ceremony make burning fire stickes putting therein certain fuming herbes afterwardes take horsse bridle set ouer smoking fire annointing thinne oyntment muttering secretly certaine charmes afterwardes hanging charmes necke red skinne shut vp close fifteene day together bring forth affirming meanes made valiant couragious war loue knowledge horsses men discourse horsses belongeth nature either louing killing men nature alexander horsse spoken called bucephalus sufficiently said except may added long naked without furniture would suffer man come backe afterwardes sadled furnished hee could endure none alexander maister offered come neare ride first terrified neighing voice afterwardes troad vnder foot ran away alexander indian warres ryding vpon horsse certaine battaile performed many valiant act improuidence fell ambush foe fro neuer bin deliuered aliue puisancy horsse seeing maister beset many enemy receiued dartes owne body violence pressed middest enemy hauing lost much bloude receiued many woundes ready die paine staied course till hee brought maister king safe battellgillius set ground performed place hee gaue vppe ghoast dyed comforting himselfe seruice owne death hee saued life king cause alexander gotten victory place horsse died built citty called bucephalon textorit also reported limus emperour would haue horsses teare piece daughter christian himselfe one bitten death neocles sonne themistocles perished biting horsse neither heerein onely nature horsses terrible also haue taught teare men piece said busiris diomedes feede horsses man flesh therefore hercules tooke like reuenge diomedes hee gaue horsses eaten diomedes verse made vt qui terribiles programen habentibus herbis impius humano viscere pauit equos like also reported glaucus son sysiphus fed horsses man flesh potnia city boeotia afterward could make prouision deuoured maister whereof virgill writeth thus et mentem venus ipsa dedit quo tempore glauci potniades mali membra absumpsere quadrigae thought fiction expresse feeding keeping horsses consume wealth substance thus much natural inclination horse seuerall kindes horsses seuerall kind horsses require particular tractate themselues firste martiall great warlicke horsse profit poet coupleth sheepe lanisierae pecudes equorum bellica prole part horsse already described stallion residue may supplied xenophon oppianus must singular courage docibility maime fear infirmity must able run vp steepest hils leap bite fight battail direction rider strength body mind discouered aboue al one neuer refuse labor though day spent wherefore rider must first look institution first instruction horsse knowledge martiall affaire naturall men horsses therefore except information practise adorne nature cannot either feare heady stubbornes ouerthrow themselues rider first must gelding fearefull must bee wil reioyce gather stomacke voice musicke trumpet ringing armour must afraid horsses refuse combate able leape high far rush battell fighting said heeles mouth principall thing must learne thesexenophon first haue lofty flexible necke also free needing spur sluggish need often agitation fro hand rider el full stomacke sullen nothing flattery faire speech much troubleth mind rider run battell outward aspect body doth vnto flocke company mare lowde voice high necke willing minde great force shall terrible looke vppon valiantly puissant combate wherefore rider must cary hand reynes may draw horsses necke easily common trauelling gelding rather sharply greeuance little wil taught signes token fight stand still run away manner institution may bee thisthe institution warlicke horsse dressing furnishing horsse aforesaid likewise backing first al moue stir walk horsse gentlie vntil wel acquainted cariage hand whole body afterward accustome greater speedier pace exercise vse also run longer race also drawing hand stay stop suddenly horsses instructed stay themselues speediest course vpon instant without circumambulation shaking violence course like ordinary trotting nag mounting vp little forefoot alway remembred mounting horssebacke must first al begin left hand bending hand waie also right hand would haue horsse turne side aboue thing horsses deligh ed w crooked bending round course circle ring must accustomed horsses leauing behind himmen haue perished rashnes riding likewise turning toward making face headlong precipitate course hunter make without guiding body hand horsse euermore avoided manie men haue perished horsses poet witnesse nipheus leucagus liger clonius remulus amycus also among historiographer agenor fulco ierusalem phillip son ludonicus crassus king france bela king pannonia horssemen order chiualry knighthood principal horssemen world celebrated story training ruling guiding horsses according art warre may dignity knighthood wher withall honoured equestrial order deriued recited place manifest pontinus romaine equestrial order middle betwixt senatours common peoplethe honour horssemanship first e difference betwixt equites index badge cognisaunce note honour power weare ring gold consulship marcus cicero title turned equestriall name knight man armes meanes reconciling himselfe senate affirming deriued order time came equester ordo said people recorded people latter creation thereof yet beginning time onely firste came order commonwealth called celeres vnder romulus one celer command romulus slew remus made chief iudge three hundred afterward called flexumines eyther swayed mind iudged else probable martialling instructing horsses war afterward tooke great company horssemen without aide footmenfestus citty trossulum thuscia called trossulai trossuli yet ignorant person honored title trossuli remembrance victory ashamed thereof vnworthy dignity forbidden weare purple like senator golden ring badge peace war maister horsse among romains called graecians hipparchus latines magister equitum degree honor next dictator marcius dictator made first maister horssemen called spurius suidas set place next himselfe equestrial men knight state wont publican least ordained man called order except father grandfather free men worth value twenty thousand pound turon tiberius made law afterward grew remisse obserued whereby bond men scribe rewarded dignity emperour oration pleasing speech yet decuriall iudges chosen rank indeed primary institution flower seminary roman gentry pliny complaineth dignity wont reward military men aduentured liues honor country bestowed corruptly mony vpon meane bribing person seeme euery one horsse honor giuen note one grown fat vnweeldy able manage gouern hors taken cato took away horse scipio iaticus intercepted mony hence cam term allowance equistrae aes mony paid horse one kni pararium aes double fee equestrial manthe athenian order among athenian highest order medimni plowd much land sowd corn next degree equites knight horssemen defence citty able euery one norish horsse war wer ancient time c afterward increased vnto sacrifice wer made pomp triumphsaristophanes coelius suidas called hippades liberty norish long ha forbidden men tax sacrifice least halfe talent least crown sacrifice made health thei horsses two maisters created ouer wage order war ten inferior gouernours warden look prouision norishing horsses among lacedemonians foure gouernments monarchy king aristocraty old men olygarchie ephori commissioner democratye young men gouerned managed instructed horsses nestor ancient knight commended skill therefore giuen title hippotes among chalcidensians rich man took order cretians likewise euer highly account hereof made highest degree honor euen roman sometimes gouern whole prouinces egipt peculiar order senator might president gouern among achaean degre high estimat like german bataui state cittizens capua disguised perpetuity honour latines war reuolt roman among gaditan wer honored herewith one time one battel created title hath spred adornd selfe many degree among french caballarij equites aurati knight ierusalem diuers religion feat armes whereas persian vsed certain kind garment warre called manduas hence commeth knight vper garment called mantel al persian horssemen noblest horse coulde run speedily swiftly ioyned together chariot race course spectacle game combat great value prize nempe volucrem sic laudamus equum facili cui plurima palma feruet exultat rauco victoria circo againe ouid saith non ego nobiluim venio spectator equorum horace n c te nobilium fugiat certamen equorum primus certamine one anniceris cyrenian skilful practise according vain humor men little proud heerof loue plato would need academy shew schollers skill therefore ioyning horsses chariot togither made many course euen delineat proportion horse wheeles neuer wandered hair bredth circle place limited alway kept road footstep whereat euery one marueiled plato reproued dubble diligence vaine practise man saying manner cannot man hath trauelled laboured much art skil worth vse common wealth euer addict mind graue serious profitable businesse applyeth part power body soule lesse able vnapt thinges alone worthy admiration ancient custome vse men horsses combate therefore funerall patroclus homer bringeth menelaus vsing horsse agamemnon foure seuerall place wherein game horsses chariot wont bee obserued kept called place olympia pythia nemea isthmia olympiad cheefe whereof story full celebrated olympus euery fifte yeare inclusiuelie end euery fourth yeare writer chronicle agree game olympus first instituted hercules yeare world beginning worlde noah flood beginne record number first olympiad yeare world seuenteene yeare building rome olympiad last computation account fell abovt yeare lord birth iesus christ blessed sauior world perfection game began twenty fiue olympiad time pagondas theban pronounced victor swift horsses brought game called teleioi perfect agility growth called pindarus monampycia afterwarde came synoris two horsses succession colt mare mule course thus expressed virgill ergo animos aevumque notabis et quis cuique dolor victo quae gloria palmae nonne vides cum praecipiti certamine campum corripuere runt que effusum carcere currus cum spes arrectae inuenum exultantiaque haurit corda pauor pulsans illi instant verbere torto et proni dant lora volat viferuidus axis iamque humiles iamque elati sublime videntur aera per vacuum ferri atque assurgere aura nec mora nec requies vt fuluae nimbus arenae tollitur humescunt spumis flatuque sequentum tantus amor laudum tantae est victoria curae sin ad bella magi studium turmasque feroces aut alphaea rotis prelabi flumina pisae et iouis luco currus agitare volantes primus equi labor est animos atque arma videre bellantum lituosque pati tractu que gementem ferre rotam stabulo frenos audire sonantes horace expresseth maner sunt quos curriculo paluerem olympicum collegisse iuuat metaque farindis euitata rotis palmaque nobilis terrarum domino euehit ad deos woman wont excluded game vntill cynisca daughter archidamus king spartan first woman nourished trained horsses currule charyot game brought horsses olympus obtaind prize therfore horse wer consecrated iupiter olympus figure remained brasse temple plinyit also said echerates thessalian ouercame olympian game mare great foale also reported miltiades son cimon stesagora one tenne captaines athens ran away pisistratus tyrante time absence twice victor olympus foure mare first time bestowed glory vpon cozen german miltiades mother brother sonne second time tooke himselfe cause slaine son pisistratus mare also buried ouer inscription four game olympus appeared hee ranne diuers time neuer missed victory athens obserued course horsses honor theseus called place running hippodromus latines call stadium curriculum appointed plain valley according prouerbe equus planiciem middest whereof building called circus whereon beholder stood looke vpon pastime also place containe horsses chariot till turned run called carceres according verse silius sic vbi prosiluit piceo de carcere preceps ante suos victor equus horace also vt cum carceribus missos rapit vngula currus instat equis auriga suos vincetibus illum preteritum temnens exstremos inter enutom heereof came pouerbe carceribus ad calcem signifieng beginning race latter end eurithonius inuented chariot called harma firste euer ran olympus foure horsses virgill writeth thus primus erichthonius currus quataeior ausis iungere equos rapidisque insistere victor hence came tearme quadriga chariot foure horsses chariot athens drawne one horsse game thereof called polemysteri likewise rome consuallfeasts celebrated honour neptune ran horsses ioynd single likewise game rome called aequitia equiria celebrated euery yeare twelfth calender may wherein horsses coursed fox tyed peeces wood set fire called latine also tarneamentum italian scoppa hagiostra french formierim also playe horsses child cald troya first inuented ascantus besieged alba broght taught romaine virgill speaketh saying incedunt pueri pariterque ante os parentum frenatis lucent equis cornea bina ferunt praefixa hastilia ferro par laeues humero pharetras tres equitum numero turmae ternique vagantur ductores pueri bisseni quenque secuti signum clamore paratis aepytides longe dedit insonuitque flagello olli discurrere pares atque agmina terni diductus soluere choris rursusque vocati conuertere vias infestaque tela tulere inde alios ineunt cursus aliosque recursus aduersis spatijs alternos que orbibus orbes impediunt pugnaeque cient simulacha sub armis et nunc terga fugae nudant nunc spiculum vertunt infensi facta pariter nunc pace feruntur hunc morem cursus atque haec certamina primus ascanius longam muris cum cingeret albam retulit priscos docuit celebare latino hinc maximum porro accepit rom patrium seruauit honorem troiaque nunc pueri troianum dicitur agmen greatest horssemaisters nourishers horsse reported king salomon forty thousand stable horsses chariot twelue thousand warre lybians went warre fight chariot therefore said fight vpon two horse centaures first euer taught men fight horsseback roman turnia consisted two thirty horssemen captaine whereof called beeurio people nomades called surgatij brought eight thousand horssemen one time field neither vsed armor brasse yron except dagger rope leather thonges wherewithall entred battaile ioyning enemie made certain ginnes loopes thereupon cast vpon neck horsses men multitude drew vnto draught strangled indian vse selfe armour horssebacke foot yet lead empty horsses chariot leape vp vpon refresh fighting horsses number horssemen one time fourescore thousand pharnuches arabian riding horssebacke dogge ran betwixt horsses legges wherewithall horsse amazed suddainely leaped vpright cast rider brused fall fell consumption whereupon seruantes commaundement maister brought saide horse place cast rider cut legges aboue knee also fashion horsses sight battailes without bridle fuluius flaccus romaine ouerthrew celtiberians spaine caused pull bridle horsses might runne voilence without restraint rider vpon enemy whereupon followed victory many time falleth horsse hath courage rider wherefore good horseman must haue skill annoy enemie defend himselfe likewise make horsse come without feare dread according necessity prouerbe greeke choris hippeis seorsim equites horssemen assunder whereof suidas giueth reason datys inuaded territory athenian ranging destroying pleasure man daring abide force departure ionian climed vp tree signified vnto athenian horssemen broken ranke assunder whereupon miltiades set vpon scatered company obtained noble victory fighting warre vpon horsses cruell fearefull kind fight arming horsses called auncient time catafracti clibanarij acatafracti ferentarij fighting first speare afterwardes sword shielde casting sometimes also dartes one another bearing bowes shoot arrowes horsses making roome way soeuer went sharpe pike crookedkeenecuttinginstruments fastened armour chariotwheeles violence course wounded killed ouerturned cut assunder whatsoeuer flesh came reach auncient horssemen romaine brestplates polibius affirmeth therefore naked fore part prouiding daunger behind defending breast owne celerity shieldes made oxe skinnes plighted pasted togither little round compasse like fashion man belly also great vse swift horsses warre romaine souldiors caryed two horsses peeced n taught exercised like indian neede flie leape vpon empty horsse sparing therefore called amppiphi apt carry maisters danger hence aelianus saith romaine tooke patterne phalanx called antistomus vsed terrifie barbarian setting horse doubble front appeared headed way also custome al germaines number horssemen equall mingled footman light horsesalexander experienced runne suddainely horseman leaped battaile surprized enemy flying away fashion spaniard also vse strabo saith terrifieng enemy making foot men fall battell among horseman shoot dart horsebacke called hippotoxotiae therefore aristophanes discourse byrd calleth hawkes name resemblance betwixt horse bearing rider hawkes called swiftnes course talants hauke crooked like bowes arianus writeth horseman alexander carried speares handes fourteene cubit long whereunto cannot consent eight cubit common size much souldier horsebacke able vse battaile wing horseman called like wing couer protect army also legionary horseman ioyned legion souldiers company elephant footman horssemen wont goe king called agema company horsses set like tower quadrangular forme fielde called pergus armour horsses front forepart called prometopidia vpon eares parotia vpon cheekes paria vpon brest prasternidia vpon side parapleuridia vpon loines parameridia vpon legges paracnemidia time arming horsse knowne euery souldier riding meade persian armenian first inuented art riding shooting strabo saith pausanias cald neptune hippeos cause supposed first inuented art riding pollidorus ascribeth bellerophon lysias orator saieth aamazonian woman first mortall creature first aduentured backe horsses others ascribe centaures leaue inuention come art damis life apollonius setteth downe sum art riding briefely sit straight vpon horsse rule valiantly turne bridle way soeuer pleaseth beate hee stubborne auoyde ditch gulfes whyrpooles rideth water going vp hill lengthen raines restraine draw going hill stroke haire alwaies vse stripe martial hath excellent epigrame vppon one priscus rashheadedhunter neither feared hedge hils dale ditch rockes riuers peril vsing bridle horsse none affection therefore telleth may sooner break hunter necke take away hare life ther deceit rock hils plaine fieldes shake rider horsebacke earth thus followeth epigram parcius vtaris moneo rapiente veredo prisce nec leopores tam violentus ea saepe satisfecit praedae venator acri decidit excussus nec rediturus equo insidias campus habet nec fussa nec agger nec sint saxa licet fallere plana solent non deerunt qui tanta tibi spectacula praestent inuidia fatised leuiore cadunt si te delectant animosa pericula thuscis tutior est virtu insidiemur apris quid te frena iuuant temeraria saeptus illis prisce datum est equitem rumpere quam leporem best place riding barren plaine country reported claudius roade great way country vpon enemy met body returned backe againe owne campe blamed sluggishnesse enemy one seene abroad reported aristotle man rideth apt hee shall weepe reason motion body riding wholsomest stomach hippes man must sit horsebacke hee carried coach rather keepe backebone vpright onely moued horsse beareth also himselfe therefore hee must sit close horsses hip extending legges vttermost vsing onely eies looke also lifting vp neck help sight soft pace horsse doth corroborate spirit aboue al exercise likewise body stomack also purgeth sens maketh sharp yet sometimes violent course horsse breast man part raines receiue damage haue obserued yet much ascribed motion riding vneasie pace rather vneasie seat rider scythian aboue nation haue loosest broadest body reason wrap child swadling cloathes people likewise haue regard vnto sitting vpon horseback lastly continual sloath easie men vse much ride chariot litter get horsebacke accustomed thereunto ride much hip bone fal ful ache also thereby made vnfit generation iourney hundred mile neuer light ease themselues beastes men hereafter named excellent rider tamer horsses antomedon seruant achilles idaeus seruant paraimus metiseus seruant turnus myrtilus seruant ocnomaus ceberes seruant darius anniceris seruant cyreneus picus mesapus lausus silius remembreth cyrnus durius atlas iberus instrument riding appertaining horsse good rider must consider hardnesse softnesse horsses mouth hee may temper bit stiffe necked horsse much guided rod spur bit bridle wherefore must sometime hard sometimes gentle hard bit called lupati vnequal indented like wolues teeth wherevnto horsse accustomed groweth tractable obedient gentle bit according saying ouid tempore pareot equus lentis animosis habenis et placido duros accipit ore lupos virgill againe speaketh like effect prensisque negabunt verbera lenta pati duris parere lupatis asper equus duris contunditur os lupatis silius saith quadrupedem flectit non cedens virga lupatis also another instrument made yron wood called pastomis englished barnacle put vpon horsses nose restraine tenatious fury biting kicking especially time shod dressed indian wer wont vse bridle like graecians celt put vpon horse mouth piece raw oxe skin fastened round containing certaine yron prick standing horsses lip putting long round trench mouth edge whereof fasten raines wherewithall guide beast turkish horsses spanish iennets haue bit open circle middle consisting leather iron restraine horsses fury raines called habenae make horsses habeles tractable rulable turned restrained put forward pleasure according saying cilius ferrato calce atque effusa largus habena cunctantem impellebat equum virgill ipse ter aducta circum caput egit habena neither horsse swift slow noble vnnoble guided without must held continually hand rider must vnequal one longer another neither thicke neither weake brickle certaine golden chaine called ampix wherewithall foretop horse wont bee bound tyed vp thereupon homer calleth horsse mar crysampix hence came custome woman frontlet adorned gold pretious stone also ornament horse called trapping latine phalerae deriued phalon greeke signifying bright wont put great deale gold siluer liuius saith horsses trapped present great prince kind achates stone wherwithall indian adorne horsse trapping apparent homer time vsed little bel sounding piece brasse bee fastened horsses bridle trapping hanged likewise iewels pearles breast horsses virgill expresseth manner instratros ostro alipdes pictisque tapetis aurea pectoribus demissa monilia pendent tecti auro fuluum mandunt sub dentibus aurum good horseman must also haue paring knife wherewithall purge open horsses foot called rusius rossneta others scalprum kind manicle pasternes horsses called numella moreouer good rider must prouide stirrops called subsellares staphae although bee new deuise yet necessary euery ryder without cannot long continue must made straight foot doe onley hinder motion part make benummed colde also giue occasion great hurt ryder case horsse fall except temper himselfe put little part foote therein also spur requisit rider called calcaria fastened heele man wherewithall pricketh dull horsse would haue hasten iourney greekes deriue muops signifieng pricking flye imitation creature may seeme tooke inuention must bee remembred prepared dull sluggish horsse free full life horsse pricked therwith runneth forth rather rage disdaine loue iourney many time torment thereof maketh kicking heeles cast rider lastly must haue regard saddle whereon hee must sit barbarian vse ride vpon bare horsses backes since time wiser sort horseman haue inuented seate owne security martiall writeth heereof thus stragula succincti venatur sume veredi nam solet nudo surgere ficus equo hunting horsses hvnting horsses swiftnesse wont called veredi according saying sunt et veredi cursu pernices although vse kind also post performance speedy iournies male much better female therfore seldome vse mare hunting well able leape endure woodes cause gratius writeth manner restat equos finire notis quos arma dianae admittant non omne genus audet artes est vitium ex animo sunt quos imbellia fallant corpus praeueniens quondam est incommoda virtu oppianus discourse hunting horsses wee haue said already aduiseth make choise
