colour vnto gratius consenteth saying venanti melius pugnant color optimum nigri blewish colour hauing variable spotted leg saith fittest hunt hart bright gray hunt bear leopard bay readish colour hunt boar blacke hauing glazen eye good lyon thus much hunting horsses courser swift light running horsses vse wagon chariot men inuented ease trauel growing bee weary therof reason many discommodities came also vse single horsses therefore called courser day horsse saddle whereupon men performe iournies poet say inuenter heerof belerophon son neptune father gaue pegasus flying horsse therfore describe winges place star heauen like angell incredible celerity others attribute inuention sesostris otherwise called sesonchosis k egypt orus waged war brother typhon horsses lesse profitable war peace although none vse day common souldiers yet auncient time greatest noble rode vpon emperor probus one horsses nothing comely highe yet would endure ordinary iournies run hundred mile day whereupon maister wont say merily hee better flying fighting souldier horsses spaine kinde call iennets genibus theyr knee rider back must hold knee close saddle side better ease like vnto barbary horsses geld keepe hardnesse nerues happeneth vnto heate trauell kinde horsses called lycospacles reason name say foales escaped teeth wolues set therefore run speedily dying day wound wolues make horsse lightfooted likely feare cannot put bred nature euen say vlisses auoyding circe cup cyclops therfore made wise rather contrary wise therefore hee auoide circe cup likewise wee say horsses lighter foot fuller courage set vpon wolues deliuered feare nature hath framed nimble valiant couragious therefore auoide wolfe aelianus also saith horsses wonderfull knowledge sagacity discerne betwixt graecians nation graecian came vnto loued stood stil tooke meat hand barbarian stranger came vnto discerned nose dog doth footstep beast lifting vp voice ranne fast away would rauening beast loued onely familiar aboue thing neate fine cleauely chariot time came water drawing chariot tooke pride clensing themselues durte filthinesse cleauing leg face strange vnwilling race staied taken therof appeared story related festus saith rom great gate called ratumena tooke name death young man hetrurian whoe perished race chariot conqueror horse would stay vntill came capitoll saw framed earthen chariot placed porch iupiters temple roman appointed fashioned earth hand cunning potter wrought earth put furnace grew great could bee taken whole sight horsses ratumena stood stil first al maister slain course falling horsses tartaria incredibly swift goe twentye germaine mile one day race horsses venice called lupiferae exceeding swift common fame came vpon occasion certaine merry fellow would become surety euery man hee commonly iested whole citty fortuned day trauailed abroade woodes met certaine hunter taken wolfe seeing asked merrily would surety wolfe make good damage done flock foales instantly confessed hee would vndertake wolfe would set liberty hunter tooke word gaue wolfe life whereupon departed without thankes hunter afterward remembrance good turne brought house surety great company mare without marke brand receiued branded image wolfe weretherfore called lupiferae descended gallant race swift horsses among veneti vppon ride postes carrying letter king emperor appointed place said refuse copulation horsses owne kind linage persian horsses also exceeding swift indeede haue giuen name vnto others messenger great cam king tartaria haue postes appointed euery fiue twenty mile end running light horsses ride vpon two three hundred mile day pegasarian courser france like change horsses run lyon rome fiue sixe day epethits swifte running corser winged wingbearing larkefooted breathing speedy light stirred couetous race flying sweating slow victorious rash violent pegasaean virgill also describeth swift sluggish horsse excellently verse sending one ring victory running without respect countrey foode praised enriching maister dulnesse mill verse following nempe volucrem sic laudamus equum facili cui plurima palma feruet exultet vanco victoria circo nobilis hic quocunque venit degramine cuius clara fuga ante alios primus aequore puluis sed venale pecus corithae posteritas hirpini sirara iugo victoria sedit nil tibi maiorum respectus gratia nulla vmbrarum domino pretijs mutare iubentur exiguis tritoque trahunt epirhedia collo segnipedes dignique malam versare nepotis one swift light horsses admitted race course vntil past three yeare old may safely brought ring put stretching leg composed violent pace virgill saith carpere mox gyrum inicipiat gradibusque sonare compositis sinuetque alterna volumina crurum pliny affirmeth teeth wolues tyed horsses wil make neuer giue ouer race sarmatians take long iournies day gaue horsses little drinke meat al would ride hundred fifty mile right arabian also many region vse ride vpon mare vpon perform great iournies king darius also fight battailes vpon mare foalesvartomanus time affaire went wrack danger mare remembrance foales home would carry away speedily horsse thus much light swift horsses gelding haue vsed lib horsses take away stone one caled latine canterius cantherius deriued cauterium seared whot iron else stronger boughes branch vine called pruned french cheual ogre cantier cheuron soppa doth interpret spanish ianetto gelding said cato censorius carried rode vpon gelding turkish horsses receiue greatest commendation grapaldusforasmuch many horsses seede stone made fierce truculent vnruly taking away made seruiceable quiet yealded vnto man little profit inuention may seeme first taken fed diuers together one heard taught intollerable rage stoned horsses towards colleague guide abating wherof tooke maleparts camerariusof manner heereof may reade plentifully rusius hee affirmeth scythian sarmatians keepe horsses heardes first deuisers thereof people vsing robbe forrage many time neighing vnruly horsses discouered property neigh onely mare also euery stranger see winde male head strong would diuers time cary away ryder perforce owne destruction rage naturall lust camerariusif gelded vnder dam sucke reported teeth neuer fal away beside heate course nerues hardened cause best run withall vse geld march beginning spring afterward wel nourished lesse strong able couragious vnlibbed also pretty prouerbe cantherius fossa gelding ditch vsed man vndertaketh busines able manage horsse much plainel nothing al ditch reported iubellius taurea c assellius fought combate horsebacke neare citty capua one prouoked another good plaine fieldes taurea descended hollow way telling fellow combatant except came downe vnto would fight horsses horseman whereunto assellius yealded came downe ditch aduersary iested asking know gelding cold nothing ditch whence came common prouerbe aforesaid also another prouerbe anthenius porta gelding gate signifie man vndertaken performance great exploit hart faileth enterance reported one sulpecias galba riding cittyvestus horse tyred gate likewise another adage plautus crete haec mulier cantherino ritu astans somniat say woman sleepes standing like new dressed horsse applied kind foolish iesture shut eies talke worke thus much gelding carriering horsses pompe triumphe nature horsses lift vp themselues rise standing vpon hinder legges possible doe without generous gallant spirit also nimble strong loines beare vp hinder legges many suppose power rising softnesse legges rather loines hip betwixt hinder leg mouth little checked bridle presently bendeth hinder pastern ancles lifteth vp fore part belly yard doe appeare heerof rider must beare hand hard giue bridle may doe willingly greater grace beholdders teach horsses lift vp themselues knocking pasternes rod horsse vnderstandeth wel doth race hee stroke back rider teaching horse feat must obserued neuer haue rest vntil haue learned certain signes tokensxen ph taught owne accord performe diuers sundry iestures long riding copious labor begin vnderstand maisters pleasure rise twice thrice together may giue raines nothing doubting hee vnderstandeth wil obedient pleasure rider kind acounted best careering horse wil rise high oftnest together neither quality comendable horse draweth imprisoneth eies old young beholder cause marshall horsses seruice war instructed herein thus much horse load packhorsses keep horsses heards flock haue fit saddle war therefore employed carring burthen cart althogh festus saith mule first vsed carrying draught much nation haue mule therfore inforced vse horsses purpose gelding much better stoned horsses wherfore countryman nation take horsses purpose old past breeding haue blemish winde lim wherby disabled trauell vnder man great greedines age horsses spared long able liue according common prouerbe assinis equis mulis feria nullae horsses mule ass keepe hollidaies law god concerning saboth obserued nourishing horsses doth counteruaile charge among may remembred little nag called hinni ginni spoken already discorse ass wherof som generated betwixt horse asse others fal little sicknesse happeneth vnto dam belly vsed shorne mane according saying propertius huc mea detonsis aucta est cynthia manuis vsed pleasure carry young sonnes noble men gentle men also horsses called equifunales triumph led halter next triumph wilde horsses seahorse harthorse called hippellaphus day gordianus brought rome forty wilde horsses map gordianus wood pictured three hundred called latine equiferi greek hippagroi abound spain alpes desert aethiopia many haue two long venomous teeth standing mouth differ also hoofes horse clouenfooted like hart haue long mane growing long backe taileoppianus time inhabitant take ginnes slight fall sullen abstaine meate drinke disdaining kept seruitude bondage wilde horsses india haue one hornealbertus alpes ashcolour blacke list downe backes wilde horsses scythia neare riuer hypanis cleane white wilde horsses syria liue flockes heards togither euery hearde haue one captaine maister ouer residue fortune younger horsses leape vpon mare captainehorsse runneth neuer giuing ouer till hath bit stone wilde horsses brushia like horsses part excepting backesaristotle soft weake cannot endure fat vppon neyther easily tamed people country eat flesh polonia kinde wilde horsse hath horne like hart therefore take bee called hypellaphus whose picture heere described taken heere england learned physitian docter cay figure hipellaphvs beast brought norway hauing mixt form betwixt hart horsse hauing wel compacted body long leane leg clouen hoofe short taile part would iudge hart head eares would iudge mule horn roe vpper lip hanging ouer neather almost much elkes mane like horse thinner standing vpright without alteration shoulder taile haue like bristling mane growing backe bone longe haire bunch vnder chappes vppon bunch shagie haire hair shoulder longer ordinary neckes short neither drinke drinke eat meat vpon ground except bend downe vpon knee male kind doe onely beare horne grow crownes head middle either side litle aboue eies bend side sharp full bunch like hart smooth top speer vaines run carry nutriment whole length couered hairye skin rough beginning first pro specially part second onely full wrinckles bottom middle growe straight thence little recurued haue onely three speer pro two lower turne awry vppermost groweth vpright heauen yet sometimes falleth keeper saide beast affirmed either sicknes else want food left horn hath two branch length one roman foot halfe one finger halfe bredth roote two roman palmes top one horne distant top three roman foot three finger lower speere one horne distant lower two roman foot measured root substance collor like hart horne waied together dry broken spongybone forehead fiue pound halfe halfe ounce meane sixteene ounce pound fall euery yeare month aprill like hart hollow bredth forehead betwixt horne two roman palmes halfe top crown betwixt horn hollow hinder part siecel lieth brain discendeth downe middle region eies theyr teeth like hart inwardly cheekes grow like furrowes bigger horsse tooth rising sharp aboue throat seeme none meate fall thereinto vnbruised beast young age mouse asse colour elder age yellowish especially extreame partes body haire smooth legges vnder belly inner part knee top neck breast shoulder backbone smooth heigth handful three finger much swifter horse female beareth euery yeare keeper said norway two time england brought forth one flesh blacke fibere broad like ox dressed like hart flesh baked ouen tasted much sweeter eateth commonly grasse england seldome fashion horsses forbeare hay may haue bread leaues rindes tree bread oat acceptable vnto reacheth naturally thirty hand breadth high thing higher doth affect standeth vp vpon hinder leg foreleg imbraseth leaneth tree mouth biteth desire drinketh water also english ale great plenty yet without drunkennesse gaue wine drinke plentifully became drunk pleasant creature tamed wilde fierce enemy mankind persecuting men seeth eie also sagacity nose following foote certainly horse cause kept neare high way euery yeare cut horne saw setteth vpon horse footman trampling treading vnder foot ouermatch smelleth man hee seeth hee vttereth voice like gruntling swine without female doth naturally affect woman thrusting genital like hart discernd sex norway cal elke elend plaine deceiued calling hath legges elke neuer bend yet horne conference may appeare muchlesse beleeue hippardius female wanteth horne head like mule yet may kind elke horne alwaies alike rather elke kind horssehart aristotle calleth arrochosius arracotos region assya heerein leaue euery man iudgment referring reader vnto former discourse elke tragelaphus seahorse seahorsse called greeke hippotomos latine equus fluuiatilis vgly filthy beast called voice mane resembleth horsse head oxe calfe residue body swine cause graecians call somtimes seahorsse sometimes seaoxe thing hath moued many learned men time affirme seahorsse neuer seene whereunto would easily subscribe saith bellonias auncient figure seahorsse altogether resembled heere expressed lately bee seene constantinople picture taken liueth part nilus yet doubtful life brings forth breedeth land proportion legges seemeth rather bee made going swimming night time eateth hay frutes forraging corne fieldes deuouring whatsoeuer commeth way therefore thought fit inserted story seacalfe commeth sometimes land onely take sleepe iudge belong discourse feedeth onely water picture taken colossus vatican rome representing riuer nylus eating crocadile thus reserue farther discourse beast vnto history fish adding thus much ought wonder consider monster come sea resemble horsses head seeing therein also creature like vnto grape sword orsean indian hunt beast one horne hauing body horsse head hart aethiopians likewise haue beast necke like vnto horsse foot leg like vnto oxe rhinocephalus hath necke like horsse also part body said breath aire killeth men pausanias writeth temple gabales picture horsse breast backwards like whale lampsacenus writeth scythian ocean ther ilands wherein people called hippopodes hauing bodyes men feete horsses lamya heereafter declared hath feete horsse thing member goat thus much seuerall kind horsses properly called also like bastard retaine resemblance nature noble profitable kind beast diet horsses length life hauing thus discoursed kind horsses seueral accident v war peace pleasure necessity likewise followeth proceed dyet manner feeding wherein wee first consider naturall constitution horsse whot temperate whot leuityrussius velocity length life temperate docible pleasant gentle towardes maister keeper therefore keepe horsses must prouide aboundance meate cattell may pinched without great danger horse endure penury varro saith feeding horsses must consider three thing first foode country wherein wee liue doth yeald secondly must giuen thirdly specially place feeding horsses considered although goates liue mountaines better greene field yet horsses liue better greene fieldes mountaines cause chuse pasture horsses must see fat groweth meddowes winter time may sunny summer may open cold neither soft vnder foot horsses hoofes may feele hardnesse horse mule ass loue wel greene grasse fruit yet principally grow fat drinking stable let haue dry haypalladius mare shee hath foaled giue herbarly generally time winter season bullimung mixture al kind graine fit house according verse nemetian inde vbi pubentes calamos durauerit aestas lactentesque vrens herbas siccauerit omnem mensibus humorem culmisque armarit arista ordea tum paleasque leues praebere memento puluere quin etiam puras secernere fruges cura sit atque toros manibus percurrere equorum gaudeat vt plausu sonipes letumque relaxet corpus altores rapiat per viscera succos id curent famulus comitumque animosa iuuentus haue shewed already must haue straw litter lie vpon pollux doth set downe kind meates horsses barly hay french wheat rise hay hard dry meat fittest horsses doth fill wind al green meat lesse aproued reason inflamation threeleaudgrasse also good horsses especially young chaffe hay grasse oat natural pleasing foode although grasse moist yet young age horsse delight moist meates stretch belly encrease growth elder ought nourished dryer foode chaffe barly oates thing although chaffe reason drynes make horsse fat yet doe preserue perfect strength al hard thing disolued difficulty retaine force nutriment longer softer meat therefore best diet habitude horsses retaine meane betwixt fatnesse leannes fatnesse ministreth many humor nourishment sicknesse leannesse diminisheth naturall strength maketh body deformed country giue horsses vine branch autumne moue belly increase strength hearb medica aboundeth medium nourishable horsses first stalkes refused saith aristotle residue watered stincking watermathaeolus dioscorides commodious italy fat horsses trifoley calabria sulla arthritica thrasians neare riuer strymon greene thistle spring time giue younger horsses bullimung many day together onely make fat also purge belly purgation necessary horsses called soyling ought continue ten day together without meat giuing eleuenth day little barly forward fourteeneth day continue diet ten day longer bring forth exercise little sweat annoint oyle weather bee colde keepe fire stable must remember horsse beginneth purge kept barley drinke giue greene meat bullimumg wherof best groweth neare sea side horsse goe soile aprill fiue day bring forth wash ouer water wiping haire wet filth loose haires poure vpon wine oyle pressing smooth vppon backe downe skinne let wiped ouer againe carried stable dieted masline bullimung except troubled glaunders must feed daye time least heate sunne fall mange madnesse also requisite feede horsses green corne let blood vaines breast also cutte roofe mouth place emptied stuffed corruption vacuety may replenished better blood horsse thus dieted shall onely liue health free sicknesse also stronge vndergoe labour blood commeth mingled niter vineger oyle shall annoint ouer bee subiect glaunders mange keepe stable fiue day together suffering curricombe come vpon vntill sixt day feeding meane time greene corne bullimung bring forth againe washing al ouer water rubbing hard whisp vntill humor moisture wholy wiped fed fourteene day together please keep stable spring time turne meddow greene pasture let feed owne pleasure hath bin often proued dyet hath recouered many sicke horsses reported horotae gedrusij men freeseland macedonian lydian doe feede horsses fish likewise paeonians inhabit prasius neare mountaine orbelus doe feede horsses cattell yoake fish concerning drinke horsses haue spoken elswhere therefore shal need say anything heere except drinking much horsse thrusting head deepe troubled water vnfalible signe goodnesse custome giue horsses mash made water corne sod together else beare ale wine drinking whereof encrease spirit stomach albertus saith make horsses fat take snailes beate piece putting meates whereby grow false fatnesse easily disolued eating blacke hellibor ox horsses swine killed thus much foode horsse concerning voice horsses latines call hinnitum graecians phruma phrumatesta certaine foaling female haue shrill sharper voice male fuller broader vntill two yeare old copulation voice encreaseth continuing vntill bee twenty yeare olde time falleth decreaseth againe length horsses life according aristotle eighteen twenty yeares bee well ended regarded youth hath found haue liued vnto fiue twentythe time theyr life thirty year old femals liue longer male generation immoderate lust horsses shortneth day hath beene found mare hath liued forty fifty yeares horsse three thirty wherefore leaue relation pliny atheneus censured reader affirme horsses time liued threescore seauenty yeares albertus also affirmeth souldiour told certaine truth knew horsse liued till three score yeares olde age seruice field august niphus also affirmeth rider ferdinand first told horsse maisters stable seuenty yeare old age horsse may known teeth persian bohemian epirian sycilian horsses liue longer spanish numidian year female neuer groweth fiue male height length male soner perfited womb femals contrary female sooner grow perfection foalling male male haue teeth female sex haue fewest teeth liue long old age teeth grow white age discerned teeth manner first foure two aboue two beneath changed thirty yeare olde yeare foure next changed like manner againe another yeare foure chaunged foure yeare six month looseth teeth except canine commeth fift sixt yeare afterwards age cannot diserned seauenth yeare al filled vnfained note age hollownesse temple eyelid beginning wax gray teeth hanging mouth also haue litle blackes middle teeth trye age horsses wise learned man writeth considering twelue teeth sixe aboue six beneath old horsses haue longer thinner teeth black top certaine broach wrinckles teeth filled marke said mouth try age horsses cheekes pull vp skin bone quickly fal backe againe former place take assured token horsses youth stande fal slowly downe contrary iudge horsse old thus much age dyet horsses v horsseflesh mare milke part tthere certaine people scythia called hippophagi liued vpon horsseflesh also sarmatians vandal likewise scythia lesse neare taurica chersonnessus people onelie eat flesh horsses also milk make cheese thereof athaeneus also affirmeth manner ancient persian vpon feast natiuities rost oxe asse horsse cammell whole set guest inlike sort eat horseflesh camelsflesh damascus pollonia wilde horsses especiallye part groweth vnder mane sarmatians make meat millet seed mingle mare milk blood taken vaines leg wherewithall make puddingsmat michou pau venetus chiefe food likewise doe tartarians hauing horsse sicke cut vlcer wound kil eat flesh gothes also day virgill drinke blood horsses appeareth verse profuit incensos aestus auertere inter ima fertre pedis salientem sanguine venam bisaltae quo solent acerque gelonus cumfugit rhodapem atque indeserta getarum et lac concretum cum sanguine potat equino poet also faine pelias sonne tirus neptune educated mare metabus brought vp daughter camillus mare milke borne wilde hee also bredde among bush according verse hic natamindumis interque horrentia lustre armentalis equae lacte ferino nutribat teneris immulgens vbera labris tartarians drinke mare milke dresse like white wine call churnis whereof paulus venetus rehearseth story king tartar saith nourisheth aboue ten thousand milke white horsses mare euery yeare vppon eight twenty day august obserue solemn feast wherein milk white mare dressed set forth comely vessel afterward king taketh bowle full thereof poureth ground rounde taught magitians offer sacrifice goddes country perswade god licke vp milke spilt ground afterwards king drinketh vp residew besides body day except king lignage country horiach people country haue liberty tast thereof day battaile obtained great cam property milke loosen belly thin hath fat therefore easily discendeth doeth curdle stomacke sayde scythian keep twelue day togither therwithal satisfying hunger quenching thirst thus much shall satisfie naturall discourse horsses heereafter followeth morrall morrall discourse horsses concerning fiction picture deuises first al morral dignity horsses ther celestiall constellation called hippo according verse arratus thus translated huic equus ille iubam quatiens fulgore micanti summum contingit caput aluo stellaque tungens vna latines call starre pegasus say hee sonne neptune gorgon medusa striking foot vpon rock hellicon mountaine baeotia opened fountaine name called hippocrene others tell tale sort time bellerophon came praetus sonne aba king argiues antia kinges wife fell loue ghuest making knowne vnto promised halfe hir husband kingdome woulde lie like honest man abhorring foule fact vtterly refused accomplish desire dishonesty lustfull queene wherupon shee affraid least disclose vnto king preuented owne complaint enforming king would haue rauished king heard accusation loued bellerophon wel would giue punishment himselfe sent scheno ea father queen antia defence daughter chastity might take reuenge vpon presently cast chimaera time depopulated coast lycia bellerophon helpe horsse pegasus ouercome auoide monster weary life perceiuing good truth vpon earth determined forsake world flye heauen comming neare heauen casting downe eies earth trembled see farre hee distant heart fainting feare fell downe backewarde perished horsse kept flight heauen placed among star iupiter euripides telleth tale otherwise hee saith chiron centaure daughter nourished mountaine pelius called thea afterward hippe exceeding hunting horsse backe shee perswaded aeolus sonn hellen nephew iupiters let lie wherupon conceiued child time deliuerance cam fled father wood feare losse virginity knowne vnto hee followed see cause daughter departure whereupon shee desired goddes father might see trauaile prayer graunted shee deliuery turned mare placed amongst star others say shee prophetesse reuealed counsel goddes therefore metamorphized shape place aforesaid others say shee gaue ouer worship diana lost first presence returne first tale bellerophon death chimaera growing proud valor attempted fly heauen iupiter trobled horsse fury shook rider perished field alecus apo tese alese error pegasus placed heauen come nearer description poetical horsse albertus magnus others say beast bred aethiopia hauing head feete horsse horned wing much greater winges eagle doth lift vp aire like bird onely stretcheth runneth whereby presence terrible creature vnto enemy especially men truth heereof although pliny others seeme affirme much yet set downe nothing trueth certainety poet call euery swifte horsse volutres alipedes errour figure hath rather giuen occasion framing newe monster pegasus anye reasonable aligory likewise knowe cause poet shoulde faine cere turned mare hidde hir selfe heards oncius neptune falling loue followed field perceiuing hee deceiued turned himselfe also horsse doe whereat cere greeuously offended fell great fury cause shee called erinnis yet afterwardes shee washed selfe riuer ladon laying aside al rage fury fulnes time brought foorth arion arcadian also certaine denne wherein great remembrance rauishment cere sitting denne wherein say hidde hir selfe creature whereunto offer diuine worship picture colt skinne sitting like woman part long garment downe ancles head horsse picture many dragon wilde beast holding one hand dolphin doue easie euery man knowe conceiue meaning plenty food signified cere doth maintaine men fowl beast fish also immoderate vse therof draweth men inordinate lust concupisence goddes heathen rather accounted beastes men diana also among arcadian called eurippa finding mare vlysses lost vlysses erected statue neptune greate ryder say hippolitus torne piece horsses loue diana skill aesculapius vertue certaine hearbes hee restored vnto life againe whereupon iupiter sore vexed angry aesculapius inuention deluding fury goddes killed lightning thrust downe hell wretched man woulde feare death deuises might take place fact virgil describeth verse triuia hippolitum secretis alma recondit sedibus nymphae aegeriae nemorique relegat solus vbi siluis italis ignobilius aeuum exigerit versoque vbi nomine king vsed strangle one harlot cupberer cooke horssekeeper messenger also horsses cattell yeare second time taking fifty dearest seruantes natural scythian strangled likewise fifty best horsses whose belly pul bowel guttes filling belly vppe againe chaffe sowe vp make halfe arch vpon two post standing vpright likewise halfe vpon two postes ouer king graue likewise fastening earth diuers sharp post vpon put fifty horsses fastening thicke piece timber al along neck back shoulder horse rest vpon forearch belly hinder leg standing vpward bridle horsses stretch foorth reynes bridle vnto poastes earth afterwards vpon euery one dead horsses lay dead man putting stake backe necke ne ther part said stake fasten poste pierceth goeth thorough horsse thus hauing compassed graue king horsses togither first kind called latines intemper e say euill temperature either simple compound simple one quality onlie doth abound exceed much hot cold compound manie quality exceed body hot drie cold loosening diuision vnitie may chaunce diuerslie hath diuers name accordinglie solution diuision bone called fracture anie fleshie part called wounde vlcer vaines rupture sinnews conuulsion crampe skin hindereth action thereof selfe sicknesse consent deriued one member another neighborhood community betwixt pain head commeth stomacke thus learned physitians write man body diuide sicknesse absirtus writing horsseleach craft saith sicknes rather malady termeth vsing worde generall name manner disease horsse foure kind say moist malady dry malady malady ioynts malady betwixt flesh skin moist malady call glanders dry maladie incurable consumption perhaps would call mourning cheine rightly shall well appeare vnto heereafter malady ioynts comprehendeth al griefes sorances ioyntes malady betwixt flesh skin call scab vnto foure kindes malady vegetius addeth three others farcine paine reynes kidney cankered mangenesse commonly called old writer leprosie maketh seauen kind malady vnder particular disease comprehended againe laurentius russius vseth kind diuision sicknes horsses disease saith naturall accidentall natural come either excesse lacke engendring seed error nature missorming young else defect damme sire perhaps diseased within haue seed corrupted accidentall disease come chaunce surfetting cold heat like thing forasmuch none writer doe follow owne diuisions handle partes thereof accordingly auoide confusion teach plainely thought good profitable therefore vse owne diuision order heere following first disease inward outward inward breede within horsses bodie properly called malady disease whereof ocupy al wholebodie particular part member body occupie body accident priuate member first treat ague pestilence like incident euery particluar member beginning head proceede orderly throughout member euen downe sole foot obseruing therein nie selfe order galen vseth booke de locis male affectis declaring first manner disease called english also italian king stable neuer without italian rider whome ferrers haue borrowed many name shal perceiue heerafter cause whereof proceeds signes know finally cure diet belonging find inward disease enow answeare euery part body doe let enterlace outward disease incident partes yea rather leaue outwarde disease belonging anie particular member entent maie better know disease sorances euerie part member horsses bodie commonly subiect note way call outward disease proceede inwarde cause outwarde cause horsse shouldered meanes outward cause backe galled saddle side spurgalled hooue cloid naile like properly may called sorances griefes thirdly talke disease wel outward inward maie indifferently chance anie part bdie impostumes cankerous vlcers woundes fistules burninges brousinges breaking bone like fourthly disease healed either letting blood taking vp vains purgation el cauterisation say giuing fire talke foure necessary thing seuerally themselues finally shew true order paring shooing manner hooues according diuersity hooues require intent may better vnderstand mee haue perfect shape necessary shooes plainely set forth figure eye thus much touching mine order haue hitherto obserued necessary know euery disease malady belongeth foure seuerall time say beginning increasing state declination time diligently obserued ferrer require diuers applying medicine medicine meete vsed beginning disease perhaps vsed declination thereof requisite needefull applyed state chiefest disease may dangerous vsed beginning therefore ferrer ought man iudgement able discerne one time another intent may apply medicine rightly hither cause sicknesse generall also meete speake generall signes whereby sicknesse knowne signes sicknesse generall undevile sicknesse according learned physitians knowne foure manner way first inseparable substantiall accident shape number quality sight part member diseased bee otherwise formed lesse number quantity else otherwise placed ought well secondly sicknesse knowne alteration quality hot cold moist dry thirdly action member hurt letted eiesight perfect manifest signe eie euill affected sicke likewise breedeth good blood body euidet token liuer wel fourthly sicknesse known excrement come beast dung stale dung strong sent full whole cornes wormes hard soft euill coloured token well body likewise stale thicke thinne white red betokeneth surfet raw digestion else griefe reynes bladder stone vegetius saith best knowne whether horsse sicke toward sicknesse signes heere following slow heauy trotting gallopping harder spurre woont spreadeth litter abroad feete often tumbling night season fetching breath short violently loud snuffling nose c ting vapor nostril lyeth downe immediatly prouender maketh long draught drinking night season downe foot next morning hot pasternes betwixt eares eares hang wont doe againe eyesight dim eies hollow head haires standing right vp flank hollow empty whensoeuer two three signes doe concur together thought saith vegetius horsse well therefore hee would haue immediatly bee separated companyons bee whole bee placed himselfe vntill disease bee perfectly knowne cured especially bee contagious disease haue seene diuers ferrers heere england vse triall horsses sicknesse neuer read author feele stone whether hot cold smell nostril sauour thereof iudge sicknesse horsse hath truely thinke euill waie discerne sense smelling diuersity sauours commeth nostril aptly apply humour whereof sauours bee bred orderly seeke originall cause sickenes feare mee ferrers smell without iudgement iudgement maruell sith none lerned haue beene brought vp skilful maisters hence forth trust trauaile cause ferrers read haue vnderstanding already bee diligent seeking knowledge haue bin heeretofore whereby shall better able serue countrey also profit themselues good fame wheras lacke knowledge incurre much slander feauer diuers kind thereof horsse thinke seeme straunge vnto heare horsse haue ague feauer strange vnto men olde time absyrtus hierocles blundev e xenophon vegetius like olde souldiors thoroughlie experimented horsses griefes feuer according learned phisitians vnnaturall immoderate heat proceeding first hart spreadeth itselfe thoroughout artery vaines bodie letteth action thereof feauers three generall kindes whereof first breedeth spirites inflamed heated nature requireth second breedeth humor also distempered heat third firme part body continually hot spirit humor hath beene told keeper office three generall kind doe spring many speciall kind quotidians tertians quartanes feauers hectique many others whereunto man body subiect whereof none author treat vnlesse vegetius speaketh somewhat feauer quotidian feauer continuall also feauer accidentall speaketh also summer autumne winter feauers without making great difference betwixt one worse another reason time season yeare effect one feauer wherefore according vnto absirtus opinion breefely shew first cause whereof proceedes signes know finally cure feauer chaunceth sometime surfetting extreame labour exercise much trauelling especially hot weather swift gallopping running sometime extreame heat sunne also extreame cold ayre sometime breedeth crudity raw digestion many time happeneth ouer greedy eating sweet green corne prouender throughly dried clensed greedy eating specially meat neuer followeth perfect digestion signes know feauer horsse doth continually hold downe head able lift vp eies euen blown hee cannot easily open yea many time watering flesh lippes bodye lush feeble stone hange low body hot breath hotte strong standeth weakly legges going draweth lazily yea hee cannot goe softly staggering heere lie downe side able turne himselfe wallow forsaketh meat hay prouender desirous nothing drinke absirtus saith assured token feauer also sleepeth little cure diet let blood face temple also pallate mouth first day giue meat onely warme drinke little little afterward giue continually grasse else sweet hay wet water let kept warme sometime walke vppe downe faire softly temperate ayre let rest see beginnes amend giue little little barly faire sifted wel sodden also mundified say huske pulled awaye like blanch almond diuers sort feuers according vigetius first continueth one day feauer one day called geeek name ephemera el latin name diaria chaunceth many time rashnesse small discretion keeper letteth ride horsse vnmeasurably either watering whereby horsse afterward stable entreth extreame heate falleth feuer shall know partly waterish bloodshotten eye partly short violent hot breathing panting moreouer forsake meate leg wil wax stiffe feeble cure let haue rest next day following comforted warme meate let walked vp downe saite softly little little brought againe former estate feauer continuall feuer continuall continueth without intermission called italian latine name febris continuum springeth inflamation extreame heate bredde principall whole body eie skin forehead rootes gue iawes lip arme hand legge say whensoeuer sinnew muscle seruing moouing part euill affected grieued conuulsions though ther many diuers cause yet hippocrates bringeth two say fulnesse emptinesse conuulsion proceedeth either inflamation superfluous eating drinking lacke due purgation ouermuch rest lacke exercise cause referred reple ion fulnesse conuulsion come mean ouermuch purging bleeding much watching extreame labor long fasting wounding pricking sinnewes al cause referred vnto emptinesse conuulsion proceede fulnesse chanceth suddenly emptynesse braunches sinnewes maketh swell like lute string moyst weather though painefull time yet may bee soone driuen away chafing rubbing member grieued warme cloath kind conuulsion cramp chanceth also many time horsses hinder leg standing stable haue seene selfe haue one hinder legges drawne vp crampe almost belly stiffe hard man hath beene able stir neither could horsse himselfe set it0 ground long season think might soone remedied first continuall chafing fretting rubbing leg good wispe tying vp hinder legge else forelegge fore side forced set pained leg thus far haue discoursed conuulsion sinnewes cause therof according opinion learned physitians wil briefly shew cause signes cure thereof according doctrine mine author write horseleachcraft absirtus saith disease doeth come either driuing horsse sweate halteth hath troden vpon naile taking cold iournying sweating winter season whereby lippes clung together long lying rest sweating whereby sinnewes forelegges nummed hauing stripe priuy member long trauelling colde mountaines snowe ise doth abound theomnestus writeth comming paonia king army passing ouer mountaines goe italy fell aboundance snow onely many souldiers dyed sitting still horse back weapon handes starke stiffe cleauing fast saddle cold easily pulled also diuers horsses going nummed could bow leg yea found arke dead standing stil feete horsses none escaped time free conuulsion sinnewes insomuch theomnestus owne horsse loued dearely sore vexed therewith signes know whether horsse bee troubled conuulsion sinnewes bee head necke stiffe starke hee bow manner way eares wil stand right vp eies hollow head fleshy part therof great corner turned backward lip clung fast together hee cannot open mouth tongue nummed neither eate drinke backbone taile wil stiffe cannot moue one way leg stiffe bow layed hee able rise specially hinder legges falleth downe buttockes like dogge hee sitteth ground meanes conuulsion backe bladder also neighbourhoode sake suffereth whereby horsse cannot stale great paine cure put sweat either burying saue head warme dunghill horsse price cary hot house smoak let sweat annoint body heade necke legges oyle cypre oile bay therewith el ointment take new wax one pound turpentine foure ounce oile de bay much opopanax two ounce deere sewet oile storar three ounce melt al together annoint body therewith good also bath head saieth placing warm stable making cleer fire without smoak round horsse able open iawes himselfe hee caused mouth opened put therein sop dipt confection called entrigon conditum also annointed al bodie medicine ointment called acopum making whereof herafter followeth dissolued cypre oile made fal sweat halfe dead brought againe feeling mouing rise eat meat crampe convulsion sinnewes muscle convulsion cramp forcible drawing together sinnewes sometimes vniuersally ouer whole body haue seene one horsse life time sometimes one part member haue knowne helpt diuers convulsion haue two ground namely either natural el accidental natural proceeding cold windie humour ingendred body dispersed partes worke effect greeuance accidental wounding pricking sinnews immediatly ensueth convulsion naturall disease generally dispersed cure thus dig great deep hole old dunghil bury saue head may sweate space two houres least take annoint body ouer narueoile turpentine deares suet mingled together fire bathe heade iuice rue camo mile giue drinke old ale brewd sinamon ginger fenecreeke long pepper three ounce dyet let warme mash sodden wheat hay thoroughly carded paire wool card let kept verie warme ayred abroad daie least convulsion onely one member sufficient euery daye hard rope hay straw rub chafe part exceedingly apply little quantity oyle pepper convulsion accidentall proceeding hurt whereby sinnews wounded prickt shal incontinently take vp sinnew wounded searching wound great discretion cut cleane insunder shal endeuor heale vp vnguents plaisters balm shall hereafter mentioned chapter wound vlcers kind nature soeuer cold head according cold horsse hath taken new old great small also according humor abound head humor thicke thinblundevile disease lesse daungerous horsse casteth little matter nose hath great cough onely heauy heade perhaps lightly cougheth signe stopped head wont call pose head ful humor congeald extream cold taken long time past casteth fowle filthy matter nose cougheth greeuously signe hee hath either glaunders strangullion mourning cheine consumption lung disease doe breed part rhueme distillation commeth head cure whereof leaue speake vntill come talke disease throat minding heere shew heale pose colde mentioned martin saith good purge head perfuming frankencence also prouoke neeze thrasting two goose feather dipt oyle de bay vp nostril trot vppe downe halfe houre feather make cast immediatly nose laurentius russius would haue perfumed wheat penneroyal sage sodden well togither put bag hot may bagge would close fastened head sauour thereof may ascend vp nostril head also would couered kept warme prouoke neeze would haue bind soft clout annointed sope el butter oyle de bay vnto sticke thrust vp downe nostril high may conueniently goe let kept warm drink cold water yea shal good three foure day boile water little fenegreek wheate meale annis seed euerie daie haue purged head perfuming making neeze cause trotted vp downe either italian barbole growing naturally thinke euery horsses mouth vnderneath tongue neather iawes shoot length russius saith wil hinder horsses feeding therefore martin also would haue clipt away paire sheeres horsses mouth washed vineger salt paine teeth gum wolfe teeth iawteeth horse may haue paine teeth partly discent humor head teeth gum perceiued ranknesse swelling gum partly hauing two extraordinary teeth called wolfe teeth two little teeth growing vpper iawes next vnto great grinding teeth paineful horse cannot endure chaw meat forced either let fal mouth else keepe stil halfe chawed whereby horse prospereth waxerh leane poore wil like also vpper iawteeth far growne ouerhang neather iawteeth therewith sharp mouing iawes cut race inside cheek euen raced knife first touching amisse stop temple vains plaister mentioned chapter weeping waterish eies cure wolfe teeth iawteeth according martin sort first cause horsse head tyed vp rafter post mouth opened cord wide may easily outside iaw turning hollow side toole downward holding hand steadily toole may slip foresaid tooth hauing mallet right hand strike vpon head toole one pretty blow therwith shal loosen tooth cause bend inward staying midst toole vpon horse neather iaw wrinch tooth outward inside hollow side toole thrust clean headblundevile done serue wolfe tooth side like manner fill vp empty place salt finely braied vpper iaweteeth also ouerhang neather teeth cut inside mouth aforesaid keeping mouth stil open take toole mallet pare al teeth shorter running alongst euen first vnto last turning hollow side hitherto spoken disease incident horsses head al part thereof natural order requireth shold discend throat part next adiacent mouth forasmuch disease throate haue onely afinity head also lung inward part many time grieued meanes distillation comming head throat wil speake disease incident necke withers backe horsse intent come talke disease rheumes distillation doe cause may discourse orderly without interruption cricke necke cricke thing kind conuulsion haue spoken sufficiently bofore al kind thereof chapter conuulsion purpose heere therefore trouble many wordes onely shewe russius opinion also martin experience therein cricke called italian scima luterdo according russius according martin horsse cannot turne neck maner way hold stil right forth insomuch cannot take meate ground time slowly russius saith commeth meanes great weight laid horsses shoulder else ouermuch drying vp sinnewes necke cure whereof according martin sort draw hot iron root eare side necke midst euen breast straw deep end may meet vpon breast make hole forehead hard vnder foretop thrust cornet vpwarde betwixt skin flesh handfull deepe put goose feather doubled midst annointed hogsgreace keepe hole make bring cricke horsse cannot holde necke straite cleane awry haue seene diuers selfe thinke good horsse drawne hot iron side necke onely contrary side example bend head toward right side draw foresaid onely lefte side vse rest cure aboue saide neede bee may splent also handsome staues meete purpose make necke stand right wennes neck wen certaine kirnell like tumor swelling inside whereof hard like gristle spongious like skin ful wrets wen great small againe painefull paineful physitians say proceede grosse vicious humor vegetius saith chance horsse taking cold drinking water extreame cold cure according martin thus take mallowes sage red nettle one handful boile running water put therunto litle butter hony herb soft take bruise put thereunto oile bay two ounce two ounce hogsgreace warme together ouer fire mingling well together done plaister vpon piece leather big wen lay hot horse may endure renewing euery day sort space eight day perceiue come head lance midst wen downward deep matter bottom may discouered let doone heale vp salue take turpentine quarter wash nine time faire new water put thereunto yolk egge little english saffron beaten powder make taint rowle flax dip ointment lay vnto sore renewing euery day vntil whole swelling necke bloodletting may come fleame rusty causing vaine rankle else meanes cold wind striking suddainely hole cure according martin thus first annoint oyle camomell warmed lay vpon little hay wet cold water bind cloth renewing euery day space fiue day see whether wil grow head else vanish away grow head giue slit lancet open cornet matter may come heale vp tainting flax dipt turpentin hogsgreace molten together dressing day vntil whole staunch blood horsse let blood signe necke vaine perhaps leaue bleeding soone man would haue thing chance russius saith good binde thereunto little new horse dung tempered chalke strong vineger remooue thence space three day else lay thereunto burnt silke felt cloath al thing wil staunch blood falling crest commeth part pouertyblundevile specially fat horse falleth away sodainely cure according martin thus draw crest deepnes straw contrary side hot iron edge iron would halfe inch broad make beginning ending somewhat beyond fall first draught may go way hard vppon edge mane euen vnderneath rootes bearing hand right downward neckeward answer another draught beneath far distant occasioned commonly pouerty yet somtimes haue seen chance il proportion crestmarkham hye thicke heauy necke thin weake vnderneath able support sustaine vp euer remedy proceede pouerty first try good keeping get vp againe wil rise originall disease il fashion crest let cure first hand raise vp crest would haue stand rather side declineth take vp skin betweene finger side crest swarueth sharpe knife cut away breadth neere inch length foure inch doone stitche vp skinne together againe three foure stitch meanes string weight deuises keepe crest perforce leaning side applying thereunto whole manner cure may make laueeard horsse pricke eard comly horse whatsoeuer manginesse maine manginesse proceedeth rankenesse blood pouerty lowsines else rubbing mangy horsse hath rubbedblundevile filthy dust lying mane lacke good dressing signes apparant itching rubbing horsse scabbes fretting flesh skin cure according martin thus take fresh grease one pound quicksiluer halfe ounce brimstone one ounce rape oyle halfe pint mingle together stir continually pot slice vntill quicksiluer wrought rest shall perceiue quicksiluer therein done take blunt knife old horssecombe scratch mangy place therewith vntill bee raw bloody annoint ointment sunshine may intent ointment may sinke else hold fire pan broad bar iron made hot make ointment melt flesh see within space three dayes annointing leaue rubbing marke place rubbeth dresse place againe shall see heale quickly falling haire mane falleth part eaten little wormes fretting rootes sunder according martin shall remedy sort annoint mane crest sope make stronglie wash mane crest withall wil kill wormes within twice thrice washing griefes withers horsses withers backe chance many griefes sorances russius saith sometime proceed inward cause corruption humor sometime outward cause galing pinching naughty saddle heauy burthen laide horssesbacke like griefes superficiall blister swelling light gal brusings easily cured againe pierce bone dangerous especially bee nigh backe bone let v first shew cure smaller griefes greater another blistrings small swelling withers backe gallings whensoeuer see swelling rise martin woulde haue bind litle hot horse dung vnto asswage notblundevile pricke round swelling either fleame el sharpe pointed knife deepe may pierce skin make blood issue forth done take mallowes else smallage two three handful boile running water vntill soft pap straine water bruse hearbs trean dish putting thereunto little hogges greace el sallet oile sheepes sewet fresh greace boile stir togither frying hard may soft supple clout laie warme vpon sore renewing euerie daie vntill swelling gone either driue awaie el bring heade lightlie chaunceth vnlesse bee gristle boane perished russius biddeth soone see swilling rise shaue place rasor lay thereunto plaister take little wheat flower white egge beaten togither spreade little clout beeing laide vnto swelling two three day remoued wil bring heade come take pull away softly possible whereas see corruption gathred togither lowest place thereof pierce vpwarde sharpe yron somewhat hot corruption may come annoint sore place euerie day fresh butter hogges greace skinne onely chafed without anie swelling wash place water salt el warme wine springle pouder thereon take vnsleact lime beaten fine pouder mingle honie vntil thicke paast make rolles bals thereof bake firepan ouer fire vntil hard may brought pouder verie good pouder drie vp anie galling sore pouder mirre burnt silke fealt cloath anie olde post also good purpose whensoeuer vse pouder lime honie let place washed aforesaide great swelling inflammation horsses withers swelling verie great cure according martin thus first drawe round swelling hotte iron crosse yron maner checker take rounde hot yron hauing sharpe point thruste swelling place side vp toward point withers intent matter may issue downward hole done taint hole taint dipt hogges greace kil fire also annoint al oth r burnt place therewith continuing doe vntil swelling asswaged renewing euery day vntil fiery matter clean fallen away taint againe washed turpentine mingled yolkes egges saffron manner hath beene aforesaide renewing taint euerie day vntill bee whole see swelling goe away signe impostumation within therefore shal necessary lance let corruption take hony halfe pinte verdigrease two ounce beaten powder mingle together hony boyle pot vntill looke red lukwarme make either taint plaister according wound shal require renewing euery day vntil whole sore may vehement lacke looking time pierce downeward betwixt shoulder toward intrailes daungerous yea russius saith mortall corruption sore infecting lung h rt vitall partes chiefe preserver life body must need decay therefore martin would haue fil hole salue last mentioned thrust afterwarde peece spunge well keepe hole open also sucke corruption renewing euery day vntill whole horne hard knob growing vnder saddle side dead skin like peece leather called itallans corno say horne hard vnder hand commeth meanes straight saddle pinching horsse one side el side equallyblundevile cure whereof according martin sort annoint fresh butter hogges greace vntil mollified made soft may either cutthem pull away wash wound man stale white wine dry powder vnsleact lime mixt hony wennes knob growing saddle skirt great harde knob growing commonly betwixt two rib apparant eie hardnesse seeme come old bruse called italian le curf cure whereof according martin thus first mollifie annointing hogges greace euery day twice space eight day perceiue come head lance middle downeward matter may come taint washed turpentine yolkes egges safforon mingled togyther aforesaid renewing taint euery daye vntill whole nauill gall nauill gal bruse backe behind saddle right nauill horsse thereof taketh name commeth either splitting saddle behind lacke stuffing meanes hinder buckle fretting place else great weight laid backe shal perceiue puffed vppe spungy flesh looking like rotten lightes lunge therefore called italian pulmone pulmoncello cure whereof according martin thus cut roundabout sharpe knife rasor euen bone leauing rotten flesh behinde done take white egge salt beaten togither lay plaister wise sore vpon little towe renewing day space two day take hony quarterne pint verdigrease ounce beat powder boile togither pot stirring still vntil looke redde luke warme make plaister e clap wound washing clensing well wound first little warme vineger white wine continuing day vntill begin heale skin dry vp sprinkling thereon pouder following take hony quarterne much vnslect lime thicken hony like vnto paast fire pan ouer fi e stir stil vntil hard baked may bee beaten pouder throw powder wash wound first warme vineger continuing vntill perfectly skinned whole swaying backe called italian malferuto blundevile according russius martin opinion commeth either great straine else heauy burthen shal perceiue reeling roling horsses hinder part going falter many time sway sometimes backward sometime sideling ready fall euen ground horsse laide scant able get vp cure according martin thus couer backe sheep skin comming hot sheepes backe laying fleshy side next vnto backe lay howsing cloath vpon keepe backe warme may let continue vntil beginne smel take old skin away lay new vnto continuing space three weekes amend draw backe hot yron side ridge backe pitch buttockes vnto handful within saddle let euery line inch distant one another againe ouerthwart checkerwise let stroks deep burned euery one looke yellow lay charge following take pitch one pound rozen halfe pound bole armony halfe pound made powder halfe pinte tarre boile togither pot stirring vntill euery thing bee molten thoroughlie mingled togither luke warme dawbe al burning therewith thicke thereupon clap many flockes horsses colour make abide remoue falaway selfe summer may turne grasse weakenesse backe doth appeare laurentius russius kind weakenesse backe called italian le gotte morsecatura de le reni say fretting biting reines said russius saith proceedeth abundance humor resorting place whereby hinder partes horse doe leese feeling strength horsse falleth downe ground yea humor resorting hart suffocate two three houres cause horsse die remedie according russius sort let blood abundantlie necke draw backe hot yron sort declared last chapter saith also good make swim riuer rowell hanches nigh huckle bone make haire grow againe good saith aynoint place hogges greace three leaued grasse stamped together hydebound hidebound skinne cleaueth fast horsses backe man cannot pul flesh hand ruellius calleth coriago commeth meth part pouertie el horsse great heate hath beene suffered stand long raine wet weather wil cause skinne shrinke cling rib knowne leannesse horsse gantnes bely fast sticking skin vnto rib pul hand cure according martin thus let blood side bellie flanke vaines betwixt flanke girding place done giue drinke take quart white wine el good ale put thereunto three ounce good sallet oyle cummin one ounce annis seedes two ounce licoras two ounce beaten al fine powder giue luke warme horne hath drunk let one standing hucklebone rub hard hand along back ouerthwart ribbes space halfe houre done set warme stable let stand litter vp belly couer backe rib sacke first thoroughly soked tub cold water well hard wroung ouer caste another cloath girde fast surcingle stuffing well backe fresh straw continuing thus doe euery day space weeke time giue cold water luke warme put therein little ground mault wet sacke wil cause backe gather heat selfe skin loosen flesh bestow cost may annoint body wine oile mingled togither according opinion old writer doubt comfortable thing must need supple skinne loosen flesh disease throat lung griefes shoulder hippes mentioned amongst griefes withers backe blundevilesome perhaps would looke heere much haue declared disease necke withers backe also follow griefes shoulder hip sith svch griefes part doth cause horse halt requireth skill know horse halteth whether fault shoulder hip legge ioynt foot thinke good seperate part assunder specially sith nature hath ioyned togither say shoulder foreleg hip hinder legges therefore according nature order treate proper place say haue shewed al disease inward horse body onely aboue midriffe disease throat lung breast hart also vnder midriffe stomacke liuer gut rest first touching disease throat glaunders strangullion al horse common glanders strangulion called according italian name strangui lion ferrers take glanders strangullion bee one disease glanders physitians call tronsillae strangullion call latine angina greeke synanchi commonly call english squinnancy qunzie tronsillae interpreted inflammation kirnels called latine glans italian glandulae lie side throat vnderneath roote toongue nigh vnto swallowing place word gland gl ndulae thinke borrow name glanders horse troubled disease hee hath great kirnels vnderneath iawes easie seene felt paining easily swallow meat commeth first cold distilation head kirnels inflamed perhaps goe away themselues else laying little hot horsedung strawe vnto warmth thereof wil dissolue make vanish away inflamed go away encrease wax greater greater painful euery daie cause horsse cast continually filthie matter nose cure whereof according martin thus first ripe kirnels plaister take bran two handful much thicken quart wine ale put thereunto halfe pounde hogges greace boile togither lay hot sore cloath renewing euery day vntil ready breake lance let al matter taint taint flax dipt salue take turpentine hog greace like quantity little waxe melt togither renew taint euerie daie vntil whole laurentius russius saith disease verie common colt doth abound flexible moisture apt dissolued euerie little heat turne putrifaction therefore horse ouer young would haue first let bloode necke vaine lay vnto sore ripening playster made mallowes linseed rew wormwood ground iuy oile bay add dialthea annoint throat also sore place fresh butter sore ripe lance el rowel matter may come forth kernel wil decrease pul away rootes dry vp vlcerous place ointment made vnslect lime pepper brimstone nitrum oile oliue shall also good purge head perfuming euery day sort hath beene declared let horsse kept warm head stand warme stable let drinke cold water see haue taken away kirnels horsse doth leaue casting filthy matter nose feared hee hath spice mourning chine disease proceed one cause therefore thinke good speake heere presently first set downe drinke haue seene prooued vppon horse thought could neuer haue bin recouered disease yet recouer short space trauelled immediately many mile without helpe medicine drinke strangullion glaunders take warm milk wil speake somwhat strangullion according opinion author though satisfaction perhaps english ferrers strangullion squinancy strangullion called latines angina according physitians inflamation inward partes throate saide called greek synanchi much say english strangling wherof name strangullion thinke deriued disease doth strangle euery man beast therefore numbred amongst perilous sharp disease called latines morbi accuti strangilng physitians man body make foure difference first worst part within mouth without appereth manifestly inflamed yet patient great perill strangling second inwarde part throat onely inflamed third inward outward partes throat inflamed fourth muscle necke inflamed inward ioynts thereof loosened straiten thereby throat wesand windpipe short breath incident foure kind recited proceede one cause say collerick bloodyfluxion come branch throatvaines part breedeth hot inflamation proue horse subiect disease shall hear absirtus hierocles vegetius others doe say absirtus writing friend certaine ferrer horseleach called aistoricus speaketh manner horse hath strangvllion quickly killeth signes whereof temple hollow tong swell hang mouth eies also swollen passage throat stopt neither eat drinke signes also confirmed hierocles moreouer vegetius rendereth cause disease affirming proceedeth aboundance subtile blood long trauell inflame inward outward breast paining horsse cannot well go cure whereof according russius thus let bloode side breast accostomed vaines rowell vnder breast twice daye turne rowells hand mooue humour may yssue forth let goe roweled space fifteene day paine heart called anticor say contrary heart proceedeth aboundance ranke blood bred good feeding ouermuch rest blood resorting inward part doth suffocate heart many time causeth swellinges appeare breast grow vpwarde necke killeth horsse signes horse hang downe head manger forsaking meate able lift vp head cure according martin thus let blood side aboundantly plat vaines giue drinke take quart malmesie put thereunto halfe quarterne sugar two ounce cinamon giue lukewarme keepe warme stable stuffing well stomach wind offend manner way giue warme water mault first loathing meateblundevile loathing meat horsse may loath meat imtemperature stomack hot cold stomacke hot commonly either inflame mouth make breake blister yea perhaps cause cancker breed cure thing hath beene taught forsake meat onely heat shall perceiue hotnesse breath mouth coole stomack giuing cold water mingled little vineger oile drinke else giue drinke take milke wine one pinte put thereunto three ounce rosatum wash al mouth vineger salt stomacke colde haire wil stare stand right vp absirtus others wont cure giuing horse good wine oile drinke would seeth wine rew sage would adde time cast mouth remedy whereof let blood necke giue cordiall drinkes say made hotte comfortable spice also annoint al breast vnder shoulder hot oyles purge head blowing vp nostril pouders prouoke
