suddainely labour whilst horse hot pantingblundevile whereby meate digested breedeth euill humor little little spread thoroughout member length oppresse body doe cleane take away strength make case neither goe bow ioyntes laide able rise againe neither stale great paine may come also saie drinking much trauelling waie horse hot dangerous commeth eating much howsoeuer commeth saie humour immediatelie resorte downe horse legges foot make cast hooues therfore must need iudge thing plaine foundering word foundering borrowed take french word fundu say molten foundering melting dissolution humor italian cal infusione martin maketh diuers kindes foundering foundering bodie french men call commonly morfundu foundering leg foot also foundering behind author doe denie magister maurus laurentius russius affirming fewer humor behind cannot easily dissolued molten far distant hart vital part whereunto man might answere natural heat hart doth cause dissolution humor vnnaturall accidentall heate spred throughout member daily proued good experience see horse foundered behind also al foure leg commonly chanceth either taking cold sodenly great heate standing stil vpon cold pauement abroad cold wind el perhaps horse trauelling way sweat suffred stand cold water whilst drinke worse drinking mean time cold entering foot ascended vpward congealed humor heat dissolued thereby commeth rest waxeth stiffe lame leg leauing speak foundering leg wel behind vntil come grief leg foot intend talk foundring body according martin experience signes know horse foundered body haire wil stare wil chil shrug cold forsake meat hanging head quiuer cold water day wil begin cough cure according martin thus first scour belly glister last mentioned giue comfortable drink made sort take malmsie quart sugar halfe quartern hony halfe quarterne sinamon halfe ounce licoras annis seedes two spoonful beaten fine powder put malmsie warme togither fire hony may molten giue luke warm done walke vp warme stable space halfe houre let stand bit houres without meat let warme couered wel littered giue hay sprinkled little water clean sifted prouender little let water warmed little ground malt therein see somewhat cheered let blood neck also perfume day little frankincense vse walke abroad weather faire windy el house weather foule thus vsing shal quickly recouer hungry euill verie great desire eat following great emptinesse lacke meate called olde authorus greeke name bulimos much say great hunger proceeding physitians say first extreame outward cold taken long trauelling cold barren place especially snow aboundeth outward cold causeth stomacke cold inward power feeble cure according absyrtus hierocles beginning comfort horse stomacke giuing bread sopt wine place rest giue wheat flower wine drinke make cake bals flower wine kneaded togither feed wine nuttes pine tree hierocles saith thing chaunce way whereas flower shall best giue wine earth wrought togither either drinke else eate bals disease liuer olde author speake much paine liuer none declare whereof commeth meanes sauing hippocrates saith horse get violent running vpon stony hard ground part thinke liuer horse subiect many disease liuer man therefore may pained diuersly sometime intemperatnesse perhaps hot cold moist dry sometimes meanes euill humor choler flegme abounding according liuer eyther hot cold heat breedeth choler cold flegme mean intemperature proceedeth weakenes liuer may pained also sometime obstruction stopping sometime hard knob inflammation apostume vlcer bred therein sometime consumption substance thereof signes heate hot humor loathing meat great thirst loosenes belly voiding dung strong sent leannesse body signes cold cold humor appetite meat without thirst belly neither continually loose stiptike betweene time strong sent dung leannesse body kind signes firste last mentioned like weakenesse greefe liuer also bee learned sought obstruction stopping commonly chanceth trauelling laboring vpon full stomacke whereby meat perfectly digested breedeth grosse tough humour humour vehemency labour also driuen violently small vaines whereby liuer receiue good nutriment breedeth obstruction stopping signes whereof man body heauinesse distension swelling griefe right side vnder short rib especially laboureth imediately meat thing beleeue diligently obserued easie enough find horse heauie going setting forth often turning head side greeued olde obstruction especially humor cholericke breedeth many time harde knob liuer called physitians schirrus man body may felt body bee ouer fat easie lie right side lefte lying left side weight knob would oppresse stomacke vitall partes verye sore signes methinkes dilligent ferrer may learne whether horse hath disease inflammation liuer commeth meanes blood either abundance thinnesse boiling heat sharpenes thereof else violence outwarde cause breaketh vaines floweth bodie liuer proper vessel doth immediatly putrifie inflamed therewith corrupteth much fleshie substaunce liuer imbrewed withall therefore part hollow side liuer consumed yea sometime full side hotte bloody matter properlie called inflammation naturall heate afterwarde turned plaine corruption called impostume breake run called vlcer filthie sore thus see one euill fountaine may spring diuers greefs requiring diuers cure thogh none mine authours anie ferrer know haue waded thus farre yet thought good writing thus muchblundevile giue ferrers wise discreet diligent occasion seeke knowledge vnderstanding taught methinkes great shame ferrers age know much ferrers old time sith besides olde men knowledge hidden haue also experience time also bringeth euery day new thing light proceede discoursing liuer according physitians doctrine haue begunne say inflammation hollowe side liuer signes loathing meat great thirst loosenes belly easie lyeng right side paineful lyeng left inflammation full side swelling side liuer patient trobled difficulty breathing dry cough greeuous paine pulling twitching windpipe lie vpon right side painful left swelling may felt man hande must vnderstand way al thing last mentioned signes great inflammation smal inflammation haue signes iudged onely griefe vnder short rib fetching breath signes apostumation paineful great heate signes vlcerations decrease heat feeblenes fainting filthy matter flowing abroad euil vapour corrupteth heart many time causeth death signes consumption liuer shal bee declared next chapter curing al disease mentioned experience must first teach ere write notwithstanding cannot thinke thing good heale like disease man body also good horse liuer like substaunce shape man liuer differing nothing onely greatnesse therefore would wish learne physitians hand sure first touching weakenes liuer proceeding vntemperatenes thereof wil bid heale euery vntemperatnes contrary say heat colde drinesse moisture contrary therefore shal bee verye necessary learne quality nature vertues hearbs drug al simple apply time heale obstruction liuer wil counsel perhaps make horse drinkes simple agrimony fumitory camomile wormewood licoras annis seed smallage persly spiknard gentian succorie endiue sperage lupin vertues whereof shall learne herbal amongest simple none praised liuer woolfe beaten powder mingled medicine made disease liuer cure inflammation consisteth letting blood bathing fomenting sore place hearbes oyles may mollifie disperse humor abroad wherewith simple astrigent would alwaies mingled yea al medicine applyed liuer manner disease simple mollifie disperse linseed fenegreeke camomel annis seedes meliot like thing simple astringent red rose leaues bramble leaues wormwood plantaine mirrhe masticke stirax like apostumes ripend voided vlcers must clensed scowred downward either belly vrine therefore vse simple prouoke vrine case necessary olde writer horseleach craft say horse greeued liuer wil forsake meat body wil waste mouth wil dry tongue rough harsh yea wil smel wil refuse lye side griefe cure whereof according absirtus sort let drink stampt ireos wine alayed water hee praiseth also hearbe much like vnto calamint called pliny polymoria let drinke sauerie wine oyle thinke agrimony liuerwoort good best absirtus would haue body chafed wine oile mixt togither wel littered may lie soft prouender giuen steeped first warme water nitrum put drinke consumption liuer beleeue inward member horse doth suffer much lung liuer much continual vnordinate vntimely trauaile labour exercise whereby either horse lunge liuer commonly perish consumed yea sometime consumption lung haue talked sufficiently therefore let v shew heere cause whereof consumption liuer proceedeth physitians say may come anie humour chiefelie commonlie cholericke matter shed throughout substance liuer putrifieng little little leisurely doeth length corrupt perish substance liuer thing man body doth first proceede physitians say either eating corrupt meates else continuall drinking sweet wine methinkes consumption horse liuer come extream heat inflaming blood afterward putrified doeth corrupt exulcerate substance liuer inflammation saide commeth apostumation exulceration hard cure substance liuer spongeous like vnto lunge whilst liuer corrupted bee good digestion lacke whereof body receiueth good nutriment therefore must needes also languish consume signes according martin horse forsake meat wil stande stretching himselfe length neuer couet lie downe breath strong man abide wil continually cast yellowish matter one nostrill else according one side lyuer corrupted side casteth haue vnder iaw euen midst thereof knob kirnell much walnut martin findeth hee committeth carcasse crowes taking bee past cure let blood time drinkes giuen good comfort strength liuer thinketh horse might recouered neuer read medicine wasting liuer remember onely diet found olde english booke let drinke space three day thing warme wort let eate meat oates baked ouen let stand meatlesse first night giue woort thinke amisse put wort drinketh euery morning good confection powder made agrimony red rose leaues saccharum rosaceum diarchadon abbatis diasantalon licoras liuer woolfe simple doe comfort strengthen liuer else giue thing goates milke lukewarme disease gall opinion gall horse subiect diuers disease wel gal man obstruction whereof commeth fulnesse emptines bladder likewise stone gall obstruction may chaunce two manner way first waie whereby choler proceede liuer vnto bladder gall vnto receptacle stopped thereby bladder remaineth empty whereof may spring diuers euill accident vomitting lax bloody flix secondly way whereby choler yssue forth bladder gall downe gut shut vp wherby bladder ouer full aboundeth much choler causeth heauinesse suffocation belching heat thirst disposition angrinesse signes kind obstruction gall costiuenes yellowishnes skin infected yellow iaundis stone gall somewhat blackish proceedeth obstruction conduites bladder whereby choler long kept waxeth dry turneth length harde grauell stone whereof neither signes greeuous accident knowne physitians leaue talke anie farther thereof rather none mine author make anie mention gall notwithstanding giue light vnto lerned ferrers may better vnderstand inward partes horse thought good write thus much thinking time lost may profit anie way disease spleene splene haue said many place receptacle melancholy dreg blood subiect like disease liuer say swelling obstruction hard knob inflamation substance splene spongeous sort apt sucke al filth dilate selfe wherefore ful must need swel wil appeare left side vnder short rib swelling causeth also shortnesse breath especially body doth labour trauel painful also lie right side splene swollen oppresseth midriffe especially stomacke ful meat patient hath worse disgestion appetite troubled much winde vpwarde downeward moreouer vapor humor doth offend hart making faint causeth al body heauy dul swelling suffered go vncured melancholy humor abounding ouermuch waxeth euery day thicker thicker causing obstruction onely vaines artires perceiued heauinesse greefe left side also splene self whereas vertue heat hardned euery day little little waxeth hard knob doth occupy al substance splene also many time al left side wombe thereby maketh euil accident griefes recited much touching inflammation splene chaunceth sildome much euery inflammation proceedeth pure blood sildome entereth splene shal need make many word refer ouer chapter liuer case differ proceeding like cause haue also like signes require like cure old writer say horse often greeued griefe splene specially summer season greedy eating sweet green meat cal horse lienosos say splenetike signes whereof say hard swelling left side short breath often groning greedy appetite meat remedie whereof according absirtus make horse sweat day certaine time riding otherwise trauelling poure left nostril euery day iuyce mirabolans mingled wine water amounting alto quantity pint methinks would good drank hierocles would haue eumelius praiseth drinke take cummin seed hony six ounce lacerpitium much beane vineger pint put al three quartes water let stand al night next morning giue horse thereof drinke kept ouer night fasting theomnestus praiseth decoction caper especially barke root thereof may gotten sodden water sirrop else make drinke garlick nitrum horehound wormwood sodden harsh wine would haue left side bathed warme water hard rubbed al wil helpe giue fire absirtus doth allow saying splene lyeth cannot easily bee fired anye good much liuer splene member much occupied ingendring seperating humor many euil accident griefes doe take first beginning iandis called horse yellowes drinesse body consumption flesh without apparant cause phisitians call atrophis also euill habite bodie called chachexia dropsie first wee speake iaundis yellowes yellowes physitians man body make two kind iandis say yellow proceeding choler dispersed throughout whole body dieng skin yellow blacke proceeding melancholie dispersed likewise throughout whole bodie making al skin blacke yellow iaundis commeth part either obstruction stopping cundits belonging bladder gall said receptable choler inflamation liuer wherby blood conuerted choler spreadeth throughout body euen black iandis cometh meane obstruction liuervain goeth splene suffering spleene office receiuing dreg blood liuer wherin abound much else spleene already ful dreg sheddeth backe againe vaines blacke iandis haue bin obserued horse ferrers day learn yet old writer horseleachcraft seeme make two kindes iandis called cholera say dry choler also moist choler sign dry choler absirtus saith great heat body costiuenesse belly wherof said dry moreouer horse wil couet lie pained body mouth hot dry commeth saith obstruction cundit wherby choler resort bladder gal obstruction also vrin vessel cannot stale cure according experience giue glister made oile water nitrum giue prouender haue raked fundament power decoction mallowes mingled sweet wine nostril let meate grasse else sweet hay sprinkled nitre water must rest labor often rubbed hierocles would haue drinke decoction wild colewort sodden wine moist choler iandis signes horse eies looke yellow nostril open wide eares flank wil sweat stale yellow cholerick wil grone lieth downe disease said absirtus wont heale saith giuing horsse drinke made time cumin like quantity stampt together mingled wine hony water also letting blood pastern last disease seemeth differ nothing ferrers cal yellowes sign wherof according martin horse bee faint sweat hee standeth stable forsake meat eies inside lip mouth within yellow cure whereof according sort let bloode necke vaine good quantity giue drinke take white wine ale quart put thereunto saffron turmericke halfe ounce iuyce wroong handfull celendine lukewarme giue horse drinke keepe warme space three foure day giuing warme water little bran yellowes yellowes general disease horsses differ nothing yellowiandise men mortall many horse die thereof signes know thusmarkham pull downe lid horsses eies white eie bee yellow inside lip wil yellow gum cure followeth first let bloode palat mouth may suck vp giue drink take strong ale quart greene ordure goose strained three foure spoonefuls iuyce salendine much saffron halfe ounce mix together warme giue horse drinke euill habit body dropsie touching drines consumption flesh without apparant cause whyblundevile called physitians said atrophia know say haue already chap consumption flesh therefore resort thither euil habit body euil colored heauy dul force strength liuelines commeth lack nutriment lack good nutriment blood corrupted flegme choler melancholy proceeding either fro spleene else weakenesse stomach liuer causing euill digestion may come foule feeding yea also lacke moderate exercise euill habit body next cosin dropsie whereof though ferrers haue experience yet mine old author writing horselcachcraft speak much thereof thinke good heere briefely shew experience therein say know also cure sith none shew cause whereof proceedes thinke meete first therefore declare vnto cause therof according doctrin learned physitians man body make three kind dropsy calling first anasarca second ascites third timpanias anasarca vniuersall swelling body aboundance water lying betwixt skin flesh differeth disease last mentioned called cachexia say euill habit bloode sauing body swoln cachexia albeit proceede like cause coldnesse weakenesse liuer meanes hart spleene stomack member seruing digestion grieued diseased ascites swelling couering belly called physitians abdomen comprehending skin fat eight muscle filme panicle called peritoneum aboundance whayish humor entred besides cause alledged proceedeth chiefely mean vessel within broken rather cracked though blood somewhat grosse cannot yssue forth yet whayish humor subtil may run belly like water distilling cracked pot timpanias called v commonly timpany swelling aforesaid couering belly aboundance wind entred wind ingendered crudity euill digestion whilest aboundeth stomach intrals finding yssue breaketh violently smal cundits among panicle aforesaid couering without great paine patient tossing fro windeth length space couering selfe surely wind cannot altogether void moisture notwithstanding body swelleth much kinde dropsie kind called ascites sign dropsie shortnes breath swelling body euil colour lothing meat great desire drinke especially dropsie called ascites also belly wil sound like bottle halfe ful water timpanie wil sound like tabar though mine author make many kind dropsy yet say al generally horse much subiect dropsie sign according absirtus hierocles belly leg stone wil swollen back buttock flank wil dryed shrunke vp bone moreouer vaines face temple also vaines vnder tong wil hidden cannot see thrust finger hard body shal leaue print therof behind flesh lacking natural heat wil returne place horselyeth spreadeth himselfe abroad able round together belly haire back rubbing wil fal away pelagonius shewing sign dropsie much differing physitians first recited seemeth make two kind therof calling one timpany difference sake may called english wind dropsie water dropsie notwithstanding haue one cure farre perceiue sort let bee warme couered walked good together sun prouoke sweat let body wel often rubbed alongst haire let seed vpon colworts small ge elming bough al thinges may loosen belly prouoke vrin let common meat grasse may gotten hay sprinkled water nytrum good also giue kinde pulse called cich steeped day night water taken laid water may drop away pelagonius would haue drink parsly stampt wine root herb called latin panax wine swelling belly wil decrease al slit litle hole vnder belly handful behind nauil put hole hollow reed ome pipe water wind may go al litle little diuers time beware make hole ouer wide least caule belly fal downe thereunto al water cleane run heale vp wound al wound let horse drinke little possible euill habit stomacke horse either inward sicknes present surfet grow loath meatemarkham weakenesse stomak cast vp meat drinke shall cure first drinke drink let haue powder hot spice namely ginger annisseeds lycoras sinamon pepper blow vp nostril powder tobacco occasion neese instantly hath eaten meat houre together let one stand hold nose piece sower leuen steept vineger annoint breast ouer oyle ginnuper pepper mixt together disease gut horse first colike guttes horse may diseased diuers griefes collickblundevile costiuenesse lax bloodyflixe wormes collick greeuous paine great gut called physitians colon whereof disease taketh name gut large ample ful corner apt receiue diuers matter becommeth subiect diuers griefes somtime tormented aboundance grosse humor gotten betwixt panicle said gut sometime winde hauing yssue sometime inflamation sometime sharp fretting humor far learn horse commonly troubled colike commeth wind therefore ferrers tearm wind colike signes whereof horse forsake meat lie downe wallow walter vpon ground standing foot stamp paine forefoot strike belly hinder foot looke often towards belly also towards flank wil swell seeme greater eie wont cure wherof according martin sort take quart malmesie cloues pepper sinamon halfe ounce sugar halfe quarterne giue horse lukewarme annoint flank oyle bay bridle trot immediately vp downe space houre vntil dung dung rake neede prouoke dung putting fundament onyon pilled iagged knife crossewise iuyce thereof may tickle fundament space three foure day let drinke cold water let kept warm russius wont vse kind cure take good big reede span long annointed oyle thrust horse fundament fastning outward end therof vnto taile cannot slip hauing first annointed chafed al horse belly hot oyle cause ridden hastily vp hilly ground make voide winde belly reed done let kept warm fed good prouender warm mash made wheat meale fennell seed let drink cold water vntil whole absirtus would haue giue glister made wilde cucumber else hen dung nitrum strong wine costiuenesse bellybound costiuenesse horse bound belly cannot dung may come glut prouender ouermuch feeding rest whereof haue talked sufficient also wind grosse humor cold causing obstruction stopping gut cure whereof according martin sort take decoction mallowes quarte put thereunto halfe pinte oyle stead thereof halfe pinte fresh butter one ounce benedicte laxatiue poure fundament little horne meete purpose doone clappe taile fundament holding still hand whilest another doth leade hand trot vp downeblundevile medicine may worke better hauing voyded belly bring vnto stable let stand bitte wel couered warme littered giue little hay let drinke warmed shall amisse also giue night warme mash laxe italian call disease ragiatura horse hath disease cauallo arragiato sforato may come aboundance cholerike humor discending liuer gall downe gut russius saith commeth commonly drinking ouermuch colde water immediately prouender sudden trauelling vpon ful stomach meat dygested hasty running galloping immediately water disease continue long wil make horse weake feeble shall able stand leg notwithstanding sith nature feeling selfe oppressed endeuoureth thus ease selfe expelling humor grieue wold wish suddenly stop least som worse inconuenience grow thereof see horse looseth flesh waxeth dul feeble wont giue drinke often experimented martin shal stop take beaneflower bole armony quarterne mingle thing together quart red wine giue lukwarm let rest kept warme let drinke cold drinke lukewarm put therein little beane flower let drinke day ouer much spece three foure day bloodyflixe seemeth old writer horse also subiect bloody flixe absirtus hierocles democritus say one voice gut horse may exulcerated wil voide bloody matter fundament yea fundament therwith fal disease cal disenteria much say painful exulceration gut vnder old men seemeth wordes hierocles absirtus would comprehend disease called physitians tenasmus say desire dung often little great paine also another disease called procidentia ani say falling fundament physitians account seueral disease notwithstanding somuch dysenteria tenasmus spring like cause yea also falling fundament hath affinity wil follow mine author ioyning altogether one chapter physitians make diuers kindes bloodyflixe sometime fat slimy filth voided sprinkled little blood sometime matter voydeth mixt scraping gut sometime waterish bloode like water wherein flesh hath beene washed sometime blood mixt melancholy sometime pure blood mixture matter shall know man body whether vlceration inner smal gut bee matter blood wil perfectly mixt togither outward gut mingled together come seuerall blood commonly following matter kind disease called tenasmus vlcer right gut seruing fundament doth proceede euen flixe doth sharpe humor violently driuen hauing passe many crooked narrow way cleaue gut sharpenesse fret causing exulceration grieuous paine flixe also may come extreame cold heat moistnesse meane receiuing violent purgation hauing therein ouer much scamony like violent simple weakenesse liuer member seruing digestion touching falling fundament physitians say commeth resolution weakenesse muscle seruing draw vp fundament resolution may come partly ouermuch straining partly may loosened ouermuch moisture cause child ful moisture subiect disease men selfe cause thinke horsses hauing moyst bodyes subiect thereunto thus hauing shewed cause disease recited wil shew cure prescribed old writer absirtus would haue fundament outside cut round inward ringe thereof touched dangerous would kil horse much fundament would neuer abide within body done would haue giue drinke powder vnripe pomgranat shels called latine malicorium together wine water indeede astringent misliked cutting fundament assure cannot iudge meane thereby vnlesse widen fundament giuing long slit cut outside well know may cause paine greater inflamation therefore methinkes better case follow physitians precept first consider whether fundament fallen bee inflamed bee inflamed shall bee good annoynt first oyle rose somewhat warmed else wash warme red wine inflamed bath wel first spunge dipt decoction mallowes camomile lineseede fenegreek also annoint wel oyle camomile dill mingled together asswage swelling thrust againe faire softly soft linnen cloth done shall good bathe place red wine wherein hath beene sodden acatium galles corne cup paring quince like simple astringent throw astringent powder made bole armony frankincens sanguis draconis myrrh acatium like yea also giue horsse drinke much praised old writer take saffron one ounce myrrh two ounce hearb called latine abrotonum named english herbal sothernwood three ounce parsly one ounce garden rue otherwise called herb grace three ounce piritheum otherwise called people spittlewort isope two ounce cassia like cynamon one ounce let al thing beaten fine powder mingled chalk strong vineger wrought paast paast make little cake dry shadow dryed dissolue sufficient quantity barly milk iuyce called old writer also physitians cremor ptisane giue horse drinke thereof horne medicine author write doth onely heale bloodyflixe two disease recited also giuen quart warme water heale al griefe pain belly also bladder commeth lacke staling giuen sweete wine heale biting serpent mad dog wormes horsses gut breed three kindes wormes euen doth man bodyblundevile though altogether like shape first long round euen like child commonly voyde called generall name wormes second little worm hauing great head small long tailes like needle called bot short thick like end man little finger therefore cald troncheons though haue diuers shape according diuersity place perhaps breed else according figure putrified matter whereby breede yet doubt proceede one cause say raw grosse flegmatike matter apt putryfaction ingendred commonly foule feeding proceede one selfe cause also haue like signes like cure usignes horse wil forsake meate troncheons bot wil couet alwaies maw paine sore also lye downe wallow standing stamp strike belly hinder foote looke often toward belly cure according martin thus take sweet milke quart hony quarterne giue lukewarme walke vppe downe space houre let rest day little meate drinke may bee suffer lye downe next day giue drinke take berbe grace handful sauin much wel stampt put therunto little brimstone little foote chimny beaten fine powder put thing together quart wort ale let lye steepe space houre two straine well faire cloath giue horsse drinke lukewarme bridle walke vp downe space houre done bring stable let stand bit two three houres giue little hay laurentius russius saith good giue horse warme gut young hen salt three day together morning let drinke vntill bee noone say good ride hauing bit first annointed dung comming hot man againe vse giue quantity brimstone halfe much rozen beaten powder mingled together prouender must eate good drinketh haue found often triall giue horse horne good pretty dishfull salt brine flesh brine cheese brine wil kil three kind worm make horse auoide dead short time wormes generall besides bottes worm lie great paunch belly horse bee shining colour like snake sixe inch lengthmarkham great midst sharpe endes much spindle cause great paine horsses belly shall perceiue continuall striking himselfe belly foot cure thus giue two three morning together new milke garlike boyled together chopt hay prouender either serue killeth wormes maketh void paine kidneynes methinkes kidnies horse subiect many griefes kidnies man inflamation obstruction apostumes vlcersblundevile specially obstruction commeth meanes stone grauell gathered together kidnies whereby horse cannot stale paine haue seene diuers horsses selfe haue voided much grauell stale without doubt come kidnies author doe referre griefes bladder vrine write disease onely inflamation kidnies called nephritis cald physitians commeth say great straine ouer ditch else bearing great burthen signes whereof horse go rolling behinde staggering stone shrinke vp stale blackish thick think disease differeth called swaying back talked griefes backe loines therefore resorte thither cure disease according best old writer sort bath backe loines wine oyle nitrum warmed together haue bathed let couered warme cloathes stand littered vp belly straw may lye softe giue drinkes may prouoke vrine bee made dill fennell annis smallage parsly spikenard myrrhe cassia say good giue kind pulse called cich wine againe doe praise ewe milke else oyle deere sewet molten together giuen drink roote herbe called asphodelus englished daffadill sodden wine disease belonging bladder vrine horse hierocles saith horse subiect three kind disease incident bladder vrine firste called stranguria second dysuria third iscuria stranguria otherwise called latine stillicidium old ferrers according french name chowdepis horse prouoked stale often voideth nothing droppes commeth physitians say either sharpenes vrine exulceration bladder else meanes apostume liuer kidnies apostume broken matter resorteth downe bladder sharpenes thereof causeth continuall prouocation pissing dysuria horse cannot pisse great labour paine difference sake wil cal hence forth painepisse may come sometime weakenesse bladder colde intemperature thereof sometime abundance flegmatike grosse humour stopping necke bladder ischuria horsse cannot pisse therefore may called pissupprest suppresseion vrine whether methinkes alwaies shorter proper name better easie pronounce may come phisitians say weaknesse bladder water conduit stopt grosse humor matter discending liuer kidnies stone yea sometimes meanes inflammation hard knobbe growing mouth conduit sinnewes bladder nummed bladder without feeling may come retention long holding water cause hierocles also reciteth adding thereunto may chaunce horse thorough ouermuch rest ydlenes also meanes extreame cold especially winter season warmth fire present remedy mine author shew euery one three kind disease seuerall signes onely say horse cannot stale wil stand thogh would stale thrust yard little also paine stand beating tail betwixt thighes neither seeme appoint seuerall cure make hochpoch mingling altogither praising one thing another say good mingle iuice leekes sweete smelling wine oile together right nostrill walke vp downe vpon make stale say good giue swallage seed else root wilde fennell sodden wine drinke put fine sharpe onion cleane pilled somewhat brused fundament chafe immediately vppon either riding otherwise shall cause stale presently good also bath al back loines warme water scraping inward part owne hooues beaten powder mingled wine powred right nostril make stale chafe vpon rather hierocles saith carry sheepes coat place sheepe wont stand smel whose dung pisse without medicine saith prouoke stale giue horsse white dogges dung dried mingled salt wine amoniacum drinke hogges dunge onely wine dregges horsepisse wine many medicine leaue rehearse feare tedious especially sith martin experience doeth follow heere hand agreeing point laurentius russius cure sort first draw yard wash well white wine scoure well many time stopped durt baggage togither hardned like stone put little oile cammomile conduit wax candle brused cloue garlick prouoke stale helpe take parsly two handful coriander one handfull stampe straine quart white wine dissolue therein one ounce cakesope giue luke warme vnto horse drinke keepe warme may let drinke cold water space fiue six dayes would haue stale let eyther vpon plenty strawe vpon greene plot el sheep coat sauor whereof wil greatly prouoke stale hath bin aforesaid pissing blood pelagonius saith horse ouermuch laboured ouercharged heauy burthen ouer fat many time pisse blood rather thinke vaine broken within horse body cleere blood come forth many time physitians say without pisse blood perfectly mingled togither stale signe commeth kidnies hauing stone therein vehement labour doeth fret kidnies vaines thereof cause bleed vrine passeth must need infected died blood may come also stripe muscle incloseth necke bladder cure according pelagonius absirtus hierocles rest thus let horse blood palate mouth conuert blood contrary way take tragagant hath steeped wine halfe ounce poppy seede one dram scruple stirax much twelue pineaple kirnels let thing beaten mingled wel togither giue horse thereof euery morning space seauen day quantity hasellnut distempered quart wine methinkes quantity walnut little much wine write good make drinke root hearbe asphopelus call daffadil mingled wheat flower sumach sodden long water bee giuen horse wine added thereunto make drinke goat milk oile straining thereunto little fromenty anatolius saith good giue horse three day togither sodden beanes cleane pilled whereunto would added deere sewet little wine colt euill blundevilethis name colt euil iudgement doeth properly signifie disease physitians cal priapismus continual standing together vnnatural swelling yarde proceeding winde filling artires hollow sinnew pipe yard else abundance seed chance oftentimes man think sometime stoned horse notwithstanding martin saith colt euil swelling sheathe yard part belly thereabout caused corrupt seed comming yard remaining within sheath putrifieth gelding commonly subiect disease able lacke natural heat expel seed horse martin saith sieldome troubled disease heat vnlesse haue beene ouer trauailed otherwise weakened cure according thus wash sheath cleane within lukewarme vineger draw yard wash also done ride running streame vppe belly tossing therein fro alay heat member vse thus two three day hee shal whole another colt euill colt euill disease commeth stoned horse rankenes nature want vent appeareth cod sheathe wil swell exceedinglymarkham cure nothing wil euery day twice thrice driue midside pond running riuer swelling fall horse wil doe wel horse yeeres troubled griefe put mare amisse standing stil stable without exercise great occasion disease mattering yard commeth couering time horse mare ouerhot perhaps burne themselues cure according martin thus take pinte white wine boile therein quarterne roche alome squirt thereof yarde three foure squirtfuls one another thrust squirt far liquor may pierce bottome scowre away bloody matter continuing thus day vntil whole shedding seed disease called physitians gonorrhea blundevile may come sometime thorough aboundance rankenesse seed sometime weakenes stone seed vessel able retaine seed vntill digested thickned vegetius saith disease make horse faint weake especially summer season cure whereof said vegetius would haue horse ridden cold water euen vp belly stone may bee couered water fundament first bathed warme water oile would haue thrust hand arme euen bladder softly rubbe claw part thereabouts seed vessel done couer warm take cold euery day woulde haue giue horse hogges dung drinke red wine vntil whole part thought came weakenes aforesaide would iudge waterishnesse seed vnlustines horse would giue red wine drinke put therein little acatium iuyce plantaine little masticke bath backe redde wine oyle rose mingled togither falling yard commeth take weakenes member meanes resolution muscle sinnewes seruing caused first perhaps great straine stripe backe may come also wearines tiring remedy whereof absirtus wont wash yard salt water sea may gotten water salt preuailed would al pricke outmost skinne yard sharpe needle deepe wash prickes strong vineger make horse saith draw vp yarde againe immediately yea also remedy falling fundament pelagonius would haue put pipe yard hony salt boiled togither made liquid else quicke fly graine frankencense cloue garlicke clean pilled somewhat brused also powre back oile wine nitre made warm mingled togither martin experience sort first wash yarde warm white wine anoint oyl rose hony mingled togither put vp sheath make codpeece canvas keepe still vp dresse thus euery day vntil whole case let backe kept warme either dubble cloath else charge made bole armonie egges wheateflower sanguis draconis turpentine vineger el lay wet sacke couered another dry cloath wil keepe backe warme swelling cod stone absirtus saith inflammation swelling cod stone commeth meanes wound stinging serpent fighting one horse another remedy whereof hee woont bath cod water wherein hath beene sodden root wilde cucumber salt annoint ointment made cerusa oile goates greace white egge againe would haue cod bathed warme water nitrum vineger togither also annointed ointment made chalke potter earth oxe dung cumin water vineger else annointed iuice herb solanum called nightshade iuyce hemblocke growing dunghils yea also let bloud flankes martin saith swelling cod commeth part sicknesse surfetting colde signe amendment cure according experience sort first let blood side flanke veines take oile rose vineger halfe pinte halfe quarterne bole armony beaten powder mingle togither cruse lukewarme annoint cod therewith two three fea bound togither next day ride water coddes may within water giuing two three turnes therein returne faire softly stable dry annoint againe continuing thus euery day vntil whole said martin saith also cod may swollen meanes hurt euil humor resorting cod would haue couer cod charge made bole armony vineger wrought togither renewing euery day vntil swelling go away breake selfe breake taint mel rosatum make breech canuas keepe renewing taint euery day vntil whole incording brusing terme incording borrowed italian word incordato plain english much say burstenblundevile might rightly tearmed v vncodded horse bursten gut falleth downe cod making swell italian take cal incordato gut followes string stone called ilcordone lachorda whereof incordato seemes deriued reason according reason cal rather instringhed inchorded chorda doth signifie string chord notwithstanding sith incording already receiued stable part well content therewith minding contend haue note either man beast may bursten diuersly according name partes greeued physitians doe giue diuers name shall vnderstande next vnto thicke outward skinne belly also another inward thin skin couering al muscle caule gut belly called anatomist peritoneum skin commeth partes side backe fastened midriffe aboue also bottome belly beneath keepe al content neather belly therefore skin broken ouer sore strained stretched either part caule gut slippeth downe sometime cod sometime farre gut slip downe cod called physitians greek name enterocele say gutbursten caule fall downe cod called physitians epiplocele say caulebursten either disease properlie incident male kind femal kind hath cod notwithstanding may bursten either gut caule may fal downe nature hanging like bag fal downe lowe remaineth aboue nigh vnto priuy member flankes place called latines inguen place bursting called physitians bubonocele whereunto knowe english name giue vnlesse cal flankebursten moreouer cod flanke may bee sometime swollen meanes waterish humour gathered together called physitians hydrocele say waterbursten sometime cod may swollen meanes hard peece flesh cleauing thin skin panicle stone called physitians sarcocele say fleshbursten forasmuch none mine author martin anie ferrer day knowe haue intermedled anie kind bursting onely wherein gut falleth downe cod leauing rest apart wil onely talke according martin experience assure differeth much precept old writer first shal vnderstand gut bursten flanke bursten doth proceed one cause say meanes skinne called peritoneum either sore strained else broken either stripe another horse el strain leaping ouer hedge ditch pale otherwise yea many time passing carier carelesnes rider stoping horse sodenly without giuing warning wherby horse forced cast hinder leg abroad straineth bursteth skin aforesaid meanes whereof gut falleth downe cod signes horse forsake meat stand shoring leanning alwaies side hurt side search hande betwixt stone thigh vpward body somewhat aboue stone shall find gut selfe big hard feeling whereas side shal find thing cure according martin thus bring horse house place hath ouer head strong balk beame going ouerthwart strew place thicke strawe put foure pasternes foure ringes feete fasten one end long rope one ringes thread ring loose end rope drawe foure feete togither cast straw done cast rope ouer baulke hoise horse may lye flatte backe leg vpward without struggling bath stone well warme water butter molten togither stone somewhat warme wel mollified raise vp body hand closed finger fast togither holding stone hand manner worke downe gut body horse striking downward continually two thumb one labouring immediately another vntill perceiue side stone bee smal hauing discorded say returnd gut right place take list two finger broad throughly annointed fresh butter tie stone togither nigh may bee ouer hard may put finger betwixt done take horse quietly lead faire softly stable whereas must stand warme stirred space weekes forget next day discording vnloosen list take away wel time euery day twice cast dish two cold water vp cod wil cause shrinke vppe stone thereby restraine gut falling downe three weekes end sure amisse geld stone side away shall neuer encorded againe side let eat much drinke much let drinke alwayes warme botch graines horse horse full humour suddenly laboured humour resort weakest part gather together breede botch especially hinder part betwixt thighes farre cod signes hinder legges wil al swollen especially houghes vpwarde feele hand shal find great kind swelling round hard wil gather head cure according martin thus first ripe plaister take wheatflower turpentine hony like quantity stirring together make stiffe plaister cloth lay vnto sore renewing euery day vntil breake subiect certaine disease though many wombe woman ascent descent falling convulsion barrennesse aborsment yea aristotle others let write menstrual blood doth naturally void mare woman though bee little eyther shoulder leg foot shoulder new hurt horse wil lift leg traile nigh ground old hurt wil cast leg going turned foreside wil halt much horse halteth leg either knee shank el pastern ioynt either knee pastern ioynt bow leg going like go stifly vpon halteth shank mean splent windgal apparant griefe apt seen felt halt foot either cronet heele toe quarter sole foot cronet griefe wil apparant skin broken swolen manner way heele ouerreach otherwise wil tread toe vpon quarter going edge bank hilly ground halt plain ground horse comming toward going vpon edge banck shall easily perceiue whether griefe inward quarter outward quarter quarter vnderstood midhooue heele halt toe commonly seen wil tred vpon heele griefe sole foot wil halt al one sort vpon ground vnlesse vpon stone sure part foote particular griefes sorances whereunto forepart horse subiect together cause sign cure thereof done speak halting behind shew first generally griefe particulary declare vnto euery griefe incident hinder part horse lastly speake griefes sorances commonly part say wel foreleg forefoot hinder leg hinder foot griefe pinching shoulder commeth either laboring straining horse young else great burthen shal perceiue narrownes brest consuming flesh shoulder insomuch forepart shoulder bone wil sticke great deal higher flesh long continuance wil hollow brisket towards armeholes wil go wider beneath cronets remoued euery two day continuing vntill whole time let rest vnwalked feare loosening hooues see begin amend may walke faire softly day vpon soft ground exercise leg foot let eat much drink cold water fundering breake aboue hooue shal perceiue loosenesse coffin aboue cronet pare sole must take al forepart sole cleane away leauing heeles whole intent humor may haue freer passage downeward stop dresse cronet said foundring sorances foundering soonest got hardlyest cured yet may perceiued twenty foure houresmarkham taken hand meanes heereafter prescribed shal cured twenty foure houres notwithstanding receit hath cured horse hath bin foundred year longer bringing passe foundering commeth horse heated grease fat taketh thereon suddaine cold striketh downe leg taking away vse feeling thereof signe know horse cannot go wil stand cripling al foure leg together offer turne wil couch buttock ground horse haue seene sit buttock feede cure thus let blood two breast vaines two shackle vains two vaines aboue cronets hinder hooues vaines wil bleed take pint least wil bleed open neck vain take much thence saue blood let one stand stir bleeds lest grow lump hath bleeding take much mash three foure houres take garter set pond water vp midside let stand two houres take set vp next day pul shooes pare foot thin let blood heeles toe set shooes stop hog grease bran boiling hot saith trauelling horse younge oppressing heauy burthen offending tender sinnewes causeth halt easie know apparant eye pinch thumbe finger horse shrinke vp leg cure whereof according martin sort wash wel warm water shaue haire lightly scarifie al sore place point rasor bloode may yssue forth take cantharides halfe spoonefull euforbium much beaten fine powder mingle together spoonefull oile de bay melt little pan stirring well together may boile ouer boiling hot take two feather annoint sore place therewith done let horse stir place dresse one houre intent shake ointment carry fair softly stable tye may reach head beneath manger otherwise hee wil couet bite away smarting pricking medicine touch lip would quickly fetch skin also let stand without litter day night next day annoint sore place fresh butter continuing euery day space day shal allay heate medicine cause crust fall away selfe therewith either cleane take away splent least remoue knee leg much diminish horse shal goe right vp halte occasion thereof laurentius russius would haue splent cured fiering longst wise ouerthwart haue seen splent cleane taken away thus first hauing clipt away haire growing vpon hard place must beat good big stick hasill almost foot long sticke somwhat distant one end thereof would set fast sharp pricke little piece steele pricke sore place therewith twice make bloode yssue neuer leauing beat first softly harder harder vntil waxeth soft euery place feeling thrust bloud partly sticke leaning hand partly thumb done wind sore place piece double red wollen cloth holding may lye close thereunto feare vpon cloth flat side fearing iron made hot redhot may burne cloth done take away cloth lay vpon sore peece shoomakers wax made like little cake broad sore place sear leg searing else splent cannot bee cured splent spungy harde grissell bonemarkham growing fast inside shinbone horsse little making stark sinnewes compels horsse somewhat stumble cure diuers thus splent young tender new breeding cast horse take spoonefull oyle called petrolium oyle rubbe splent till make soft take fleame let horse bloud withall strike splent two three place two thombes thrust hard shal see crusht matter blood come splent set vp let rest run grasse weeke others young spleent thus take hasell sticke cut square therewithall beate splint till soft take blew cloath lay vppon splent take taylor pressing yron made hot rub vp downe vpon cloath ouer splent shall take cleane away splent old great growne perfection hardnesse must cast horse sharp knife slit splent take cantharides euforbium like quantity boyle oyle debay fill vp slit renewe three day together take away anoint place oyle debay oyle rose tar vntill whole malander blundevile malander kinde scab growing forme line stroke ouerthwart bent knee hath long haires stubborne rootes like bristle bore corrupteth cankereth flesh like rootes child scabbed head bee great make horse go stiffe setting forth also halt disease proceedeth sometime corrupt bloode commonly lacke cleane keeping good rubbing cure according martin thus first wash well warm water shaue haire scab clean away leauing nothing bare flesh whereunto lay plaister take spoonefull sope much lime mingle together may like paast spread much clout couer sore binde fast list renewing euery day space two three day three dayes end take away plaister annoint sore oyle rose made lukewarme shall fetch away crustscurfe bred meanes plaister taken away wash sore place well euery day owne stale else man vrine immediately straw vpon powder burnt oystershels continuing thus euery day vntill whole another mallander mallander peeuish sorance commeth ill keeping foreleg iust insidemarkham bending kne make horse go stark stumble much cure sorte cast horse instrument pluck dry scab wil sticke thereon rub till bleede take bind thereto three day space shall see white asker sore take annoint oyle rose fresh butter vntill throughly cured vpper attaint according martin thus cut away skinne hangeth downe binde little flaxe dipt white egge mingled little bole armony renewing euery day space three foure day heale false quarter rifte sometime outside commonly inside hooue inside euer weaker part side commonly cald quarter therof sorance taketh name called false quarter say crased vnsound quarter name indeed borrowed italian calling toong falso quarto commeth euil shooing partly euil paring signes horse wil part halt rift wil bleed apparant eye cure according martin thus horse halt pul shooe cut much away side shooe griefe shooe immediately put againe rift may vncouered open rift rosenet drawer fil rift role towe dipt turpentine waxe sheepes sewet molten renewing euery day vntil whole rift closed top draw betwixt haire hooue hot yron ouerthwart place intent hooue may shoote al whole downeward horse goeth vpright ride shooe vntil hooue throughly hardened againe page duplicate page duplicate halting behind griefe blundevileif horse halt behind griefe must either hip stiffle hough hamme legge neather ioynt pasterne foot halt hippe new hurt horse wil go sideling followe well legge old hurt sore hippe wil shrink lower best seene hee goeth vp hil vpon edge banke woorste legge may go higher side wil halt much paineful vnto go vneuenly wrinching legge griefe bee stiffle horse going wil cast stiffle ioynt outward bone inside wil farre bigger griefe bee hough meanes spauen hurt apparant eie like may said ham wherein may seene selander like apparant sorance causing horse halt griefe eyther leg pasterne foot shal finde signes haue bin taught therefore let v speake sorances properly incident hinder leg stringhalt stringhault disease maketh horse twitch vp legge sodenly hault much commeth sometimes naturally sometimes causually mean great cold whereby sinnewes strained best cure thereof dig pit dunghilmarkham deepe horse hie set horse couer warme dung let stande space two houres take make cleane bath al ouer traineoile made warme wil help horse hipped hurt hippes horse said hipt hipbone remooued right place griefe called italian mal del ancha cummeth commonly great stripe straine slipping sliding falling signes horse wil halt going wil go sideling sore hip wil fal lower flesh processe time consume cleane away suffred run long wil neuer restored vnto prestine estate best way martin sayth make go vpright charge hip backe pitch rozen molten togither laid warme flox owne colour clapped vppon let run grasse vntil go vpright sore hip wil neuer rise againe high horse hipped onely hurt hip newly first take oile de bay dialthea nerual swinesgreace melt altogither stirring continually vntil throughly mingled togither annoint sore place haire ointment euery day space fortnight make ointment sinke wel flesh holding hot broad barre ouer place annointed weauing hand fro vntil ointment entred skin fortnight end see horse amendeth whitte slit hole downward skin inch beneath hipbone making hole wide may easily thruste rowel finger little broade slice yron losen skin flesh aboue bone round broad rowel may lye flat plaine betwixt skin flesh rowel would made soft caluesleather hole midst like ring hauing thred tied vnto pul would clense hole rowel rowled flax fasttied anointed thointment vnder written wil draw much thrust rowel first double spred abroad finger done tainr good long taint flax tow dipt little turpentine hogsgreace molten togither made warme cleanse hole rowel euery day also renew taint euery day space fornight dresse cause euery day ledde vp downe foot pace quarter houre make humor come downe fortnight end pul rowel heale vp wound salue making taint euery day lesser lesser vntil whole soone whole draw hot yron crosse line eight nine inch long right ouer hipbone rowelled place may bee midst thereof burne deeper skin may looke yellow charge al place ouer al buttock charge take pitch one pound rozen halfe pounde tarre halfe pinte boile together good warme spred clout tied riuen sticke clap flockes horse colour summer let horse runne grasse trauelleth owne wil better stiffling hurt stiffle horse said stiffled stiffling bone remoued place remoued loosened yet horse halteth meanes griefe say horse hurt stiffle stiffled stiffle commeth mean blow great straine slipping sliding signes stiffled one bone wil sticke farther apparant eie martin woulde haue cure stiffle al point like vnto shoulderpight sauing pin need bee long stifling place broad shoulder standing stable let haue pasterne ring forelegge thereunto fasten cord cord must go necke let much strained may bring forelegge forward keepe bone starting horse bee hurt stiffle stripe straine bone wil stand perhaps place may swollen cure according martin thus first annoint place ointment mentioned euery day space fortnight horse amend rowel hearen rowel else quil let neather hole somwhat sore place clense hole euery daye turning rowel continuing stil annoint place ointment aforesaid wil make whole foundering behind happes commonly horse fat hath greace moulten within soone done euery little heate shal perceiue going wil afraide set hinder foot grounde wil bee weake behind wil stand quiuering shaking couet alwaies lie downe cure according martin thus first garter aboue houghes force go awhile put heat somewhat warme let bloode thigh vaines reseruing blood pottle make charge sort put vnto blood wheatflower beaneflower quarter pecke bole armony one pound sanguis draconis two ounce six egges shels al turpentine halfe pound vineger quart mingle al thinges togither therewith charge hinder legges reynes flankes al haire horse cannot dung lette raked giue glister take mallowes three handful boile wel faire water pottle quart straine put thereunto halfe pounde butter sallet oyle quarter pinte hauing emptied belly giue also drinke comforte take malmesie quart put thereunto little cinamon mace pepper beaten fine powder oyle quarter pinte giue horse drinke lukewarme horne let walked vp downe good togither able go tie vp racke let hanged canuas rope may stand vppon ground foot lesse lieth better pare hinder foot thin vntill deaw come tacking shooes againe stoppe hooues bran hog greace boiled togither let foot hauing geere wrapped vp cloath euen pasternes tie clout fast let diet thinne let drinke colde water giue winter wet hay summer grasse dry spauen blundevilethe dry spauin called italian spauano sparauagno great hard knob big walnut growing inside hough hard vnder ioynt nigh vnto maister vaine causeth horse halt sorance commeth kind horse parent perhaps like disease time generation sometime extreame labour heat dissoluing humor descend thorough maister vaine continually feeding place euil nutriment causeth place swel swelling continuance time becommeth hard bone therefore called bonespauen needeth signes token knowe much apparant eie therefore ferrers doe take incurable notwithstanding martin saith may bee made lesse remedy heere following wash warme water shaue haire farre swelling extendeth scarifie place may bleed take cantharides one dozen euforbium halfe spoonefull breake powder boile togither little oile de bay two three feather bound togither put boiling hot vpon sore let taile tyed vp wiping away medicine within halfe houre set vp stable tie may lie downe al night feare rubbing medicine next day annoint fresh butter continuing thus euery day space fiue sixe day haire growne againe draw sore place hot yron take another hot sharpe yron like bodkin somewhat bowing point thruste neather end middleline vppeward betwixt skinne flesh compasse inch halfe taint little turpentine hoggesgreace moulten together made warme renewing euery day space nine day remember first immediately burning take vppe maister vaine suffering bleed little aboue tie vp vper end vaine leaue neather end open intent hee may bleede beneath vntil cease selfe shal diminish spauen else nothing wil spauen bone blood doubtlesse spauen euil sorance causeth horse hault principally beginning griefemarkham appeareth hinder legges within ioynt bee little swolne horse haue thorough spauen appeareth within without spauen two kindes one hard soft bonespauen bloodspauen bonespauen holde harde cure therefore lesse necessary dealt withal except great occasion vrge thus may holpen cast horse hot yron slitte flesh couereth spauen lay vpon spauen cantharides euforbium boyled together oile de bay annoint legges round either oile rose vngue tum album camphiratum dresse thus three day togither afterwarde take awaye three day lay vnto onely vpon flaxe vnsleact lime afterward dresse tarre vntil whole cantharides euforbium wil eat kil spungy bone lime wil bring clean away tarre wil sucke poison heale al vp sound cure dangerous incision done vnskilful man either ignorance swaruing hand burne twaine great vaine runnes crosse spauen horse spoiled blood spauen easily helpt haue knowne diuers haue beene newly beginning helpt onely taking vppe spauen vaine letting bleed wel beneath stop wound sage salt great blood spauen sharpe knife cut burnt bone spauen take spauen away heale vp hoggesgreace turpentine onely wet spauen spauen soft swelling growing side hough seemes goe cleane hough therefore may bee called spauen part swelling inside continually fed master vain greater swelling outside italian cal sorance laierda gierdone seemeth come fluxible humor viscous slimy spauen doeth therefore waxeth harde groweth nature bone doeth curable needes signes apparant eie easie know description thereof made cure according martin thus firste wash shaue scarifie place take cantharides halfe ounce euforbium ounce broken powder oyle de bay one ounce mingle wel together colde without boiling dresse sore therewith two day togither euery day vntil haire growne againe annoint fresh butter fire without within without tainting immediately take vp maister veine space nine day annoint euery daye butter vntil fiered place beginne scale wash bath take mallowes three handful sage one handful much red nettle boile water vntil soft put thereunto litle fresh butter bath place euery day space three foure day vntil burning whole let horse come wet selander kind scab breeding ham bent hough like al point malander proceeding like cause requireth like cure therefore resort malander hough boonie hard knob round swelling boony like paris bal growing vpon tippe elbow hough therefore thought good cal houghboonie sorance commeth stripe bruse martin saith cured thus take round hot yron somewhat sharpe ende like good bigge bodkin let somewhat bending point holding sore left hande pulling somewhat sinnewes pierce yron first made red hot thrusting beneath bottome vpward belly intent ielly may yssue downeward hole hauing thrust al ielly taint hole tainte flaxe dipt turpentine hogges greace moulten together also annointe outside hogges greace made warme renewing euery daye vntill hole ready shut vp making taint euery day lesser lesser intent may heale vp curbe blundevile long swelling beneath elbow hough great sinnewe behind causeth horse halt hath laboured thereby somewhat heated sinnew strained greater griefe againe rest eased commeth bearing great weight horse younge else straine wrinch whereby tender sinnewes greeued rather bowed russsius saith whereof called italian curba curuando say bowing anguish whereof doth swel swelling apparant eie maketh legge shew bigger cure according martin thus take wineleeze pinte porringer ful wheat flower cumin halfe ounce stirre well togither made warme charge sore day swelling almost gone draw hot yron couer burning pitch rozen moulten together lay good warme clap thereon flockes owne colour nigh may gotten remoue vntil fal away themselues space nine day let horsse rest come wet another curbe markhama curbe sorance maketh horse halt much appeares vpon hinder legges straight behind vpon cambrell place little beneath spauen wil swolne big halfe walnut cure followeth take small cord bind legges hard aboue beneath beat rub heauy sticke til growe soft fleame strike three foure place thumbes crush filthy brused matter loose corde annoint butter vntil whole paine blundevilethis kinde scabbe called italian crappe full fretting matterish water breede h pasternes lacke cleane keeping good rubbing horse hath beene iournied mean wherof sand dirt remaining haire fretteth skin flesh breedeth scab therefore horse haue long haire rough foot soonest troubled disease cleanlier kept signes leg wil bee swollen hot water wil yssue scab water hot fretting wil scalde haire breed scab farre goeth cure according martin thus first wash wel al pasternes beere butter warmed togither leg somewhat dried cloth clip away al haire sauing fewter locke take turpentine hoggesgreace hony like quantity mingle togither pot put thereunto little bole armony yelkes two egges much wheatflower wil thicken thing aforesaid make plaisterlike cause need wel wrought stirred togither slice strike plaister vpon peece linnen cloath wil serue go round pasterne bind fast rowler renewing day vntil whole let horse trauelled stand wet another paine paine sorance commeth hot ill humor il keeping appeareth fetlockesmarkham wil swel winter time wil send foorth sharpe water haire wil stare cure thus wash euery day twice thrice gunpouder vineger wil whole one weeke mule kibed heeles called italian mule kind scab breeding behind somewhat aboue neather ioynt growing ouerthwat fewterlock commeth commonly bred cold ground else lack good dressing hath bin labored foule mire dirty way durt lying stil leg fretteth skin maketh scabby rift soone bred soone gotten away anguish wherof maketh leg somtime swell specially winter spring time horse goeth stifly great pain sorance apparant eie cured according martin sort take piece linnen cloth salue recited last chap make plaister may couer al sore place binde fast may fall renewing euery day vntil sore leaue running beginneth wax dry wash euery day strong water vntill cleane dryed vp sorance breeding raw flesh shal suffice anoint sope two three day three day end wash little beefe broath dish water frettishing frettishing sorance commeth riding horse til sweat set vp without litter wher taketh suddenly cold foot chiefely beforemarkham appears vnder heele hart foot grow dun wax white crumbly like pomys also time wil show wrinckles hoofe hoofe wil grow thicke brickle wil able tread stone hard ground well trauel stumble fal cure thus take pare foot thin may rost two three egs ember hard extream hot taken fire crush foot clap piece leather theron splint egges may fal let run sound sorances griefes common foure foot hitherto haue declared vnto cause sign cure griefes properly incident either foreleg hinder leg therefore speake griefes common first windgals windgalles windgall called italian galla bladder full corrupt iellyblundevile whereof great bee small grow side ioynt painfull especially summer season wether hot way hard horse able trauell halteth downe right come part extreame labor heat whereby humor dissolued doe flow resort hollow place neather ioynts congealed couered thin skin like bladder bee apparant eie therefore neede signes know cure whereof according martin thus wash water shaue haire scarifie point rasor dresse cantharides selfesame manner splent knee taught annoint afterward butter vntil skin whole heale draw hot iron like ragged staffe done slit middle line passeth right downe windgall sharpe knife beginning beneath vpward length halfe inch intent may thrust ielly hole lay vnto little pitch rozen molten together made lukewarme put floxe heale may dry vp windgall manner heere followeth first chop haire far windgall extendeth hauing striken fleame thrust ielly finger iron made ouer hot streek softly vpon fro vntill said wax throughly melted sore wherupon lay flox let go flock afterward fall away owne accord windgals wingals easie cure little swelling like bleb bladder either side ioint next vnto feuterlocks wel behind come occasion great trauellmarkham hard grauelly sandy way cure take pitch rozen mastick like quantity melt together stick lay round horse leg whilest hot lay flock theron nature plaister neuer come away whilst windgall horse leg dried vp fall away itselfe wrinching neather ioynt commeth many time treading awry cart root otherwise sign ioynt swollen sore horse halt cure whereof according martin thus take dialthea halfe pounde much neruall mingle together anoint sore place therewith chafing well hand oyntment may enter continuing euery day vntill oyntment spent let horse rest preuaile wash warm water shaue away haire sauing fewterlock scarifie lay cantharides heale splent knee enterfering bicause enterfering holpen shooing wee purpose speake vntill come talke order paring shooing manner hooues another enterfering enterfering griefe commeth sometimes ill shooing somtimes naturally horse trot narrow hewes leg vpon another appeareth behind betweene feete fetlockes remedy shooing shooes made thin flat outside narrow thicke within shakell gall horse galled pastern shakell locke pasterne halter anoint sore place little hony verdigrease boiled together vntill looke red good ointment gallings withers immediatly strow vpon ointment first laid vpon leg little chopt flax tow stick fast continuing euery day vntill whole hurt leg commeth casting halter collar undevile chanceth many time horsse hauing itch vnder eares desirous scratch hinder foote whilest reacheth fro doth fasten coller halter wherewith striueth galleth legges many time chanceth tyed long mean wherof laid halter slack foot rising perhaps turning snarleth himselfe able get vp hangeth either neck legges vvhich sometimes galled euen hard bone russius calleth kinde galling capistratura wont heale ointment heere following praising excellent good cratches scab bruise wound take oile oliue one ounce turpentine two three ounce melt together ouer fire put thereunto little wax work well togither annoint sore place therwith martin saith good annoint sore place white egge salletoile beaten together commeth scab annoint butter molten vntill haire cure according martin thus take turpentine halfe pound hony pint hogsgrease quarterne yolk egs bole armony quartern beaten fine powder bean flower halfe pinte mingle well together make salue thereof finger annoint sore place sheading haire go intent may easier find also make salue enter skin let horse come wet vntill whole scratch scratch cause horse halt sore come naughty keeping appeare filthy stinking scab breeding round feete vpon cronetsblundevile eluish painful disease called italian crisaria seemeth come meanes horse hath bin bred colde wet soile striking corrupt humor vp foot therefore horse hath griefe worse troubled winter summer sign haire cronets wil thin staring like bristle cronets wil alwaies mattering run water cure according martin thus take sope hogsgrease halfe pound bole armony little turpentine quartern mingle together make plaister bind fast renewing euery day vntill leaue running wash strong vineger lukewarme euery day vntill sore cleane dryed vp let come wet vntill whole hurt vpon cronet crossing one foot ouer another italian call supraposte mart saith wash wel white wine little stale lay vnto white egge mingled little chimny soot salt dry vp three foure day renewed euery day quitterbone hard round swelling vpon cronet betwixt heele quarter groweth commonly inside foot commonly called italian setula seta commeth meanes grauell gathered vnderneath shooe frerteth heele else cloying pricking naile euell dryuen anguish whereof looseneth gristle breedeth euill humor wherof quitterbone springeth signes horse halt swelling apparant eie foure fiue day comming head wil breake matter little deep hole like fistula cure acording martin thus first burn quitterbone hot iron manner halfe circle yron draw another right strike midst thereof hole cure thus take hot yron made fashion knife burne flesh compasse moone till come feele grissell burne take vardigrease fresh butter tar molten together dippe fine tow therein stop vp hole lay thereon searcloth deeresewet wax let rest first day next day take melrosarum oyle rose wax turpentine like quantity infuse al fire together salue dresse sore morning euening till whole find proud flesh grow forget lay thereon red lead vardigrease withall haue especiall regard vpper part wound heale faster bottom feare fistulating grauelling fretting vnder foot commonly insideblundevile sometime outside sometime side together heele commeth meanes little grauell stone getting betwixt hooue calking spunge shooe continuall labor treading horse doth eat quicke rather heele soft weake shooe doe lye flat foot grauell gotten cannot get signes horse halt couet tread vppon toe fauour heele cure according martin thus first pare hooue get grauel cornet drawer leauing none behind doe breede quitterbone done stop turpentine hogsgrease molten together layd towe flax clap shooe keepe stopping renewing euery day vntill bee whole suffer horse come wet vntill throughly whole grauelling well stopt keepe downe flesh ir wil rise higher hooue onely require businesse bolstering also put horse paine grauelling gravelling hurt make horse halt commeth grauell little stonesmarkham goeth betweene shooe hearte foote cure take shooe let well pared set shooe againe stop pitch rozen tallow shall help surbating beating hooue ground called italian sobatitura commeth somtime mean euill shooing lying flat foote going barefoote sometime hardnesse grounde high lifting horse horsses bee flat footed coffin whereof tender weake commonly subiect sorance signes horse halt foreleg goe stifely creeping though halfe foundered cure according martin thus take shooes pare little may bee shooes easie say long large hollow inough make tacke againe foure fiue nailes done stop feete branne hogsgreace boyled together hot may also couer coffin round binding together cloath list fastened ioynt renewing euery day vntill bee whole giue horsse warme water let stand dry warme trauelled vntil whole pricke sole foote treading naile sharpe thing doth enter foote signes man backe treadeth thing shall feele horsse lift vp foot couet stand still haue helpe chaunce timeblundevile halting horse hurt selfe shew cure according martin thus pull shooe pare foote drawer vncouer hole making mouth broade two penny peece tacke shooe againe done stop powring hole turpentine hogsgreace molten together lay flaxe towe vpon stop horsses foote horsedung rather cowdung get splent either stickes else old shooe sole stopping may abide renewing euery day vntill whole let horsse come wet well cured looked time cause hooue breake aboue loosen round perhaps fall cleane away see begin break aboue make greater yssue beneath opening hole wider taking sole away flesh may haue liberty take bole armony halfe quarterne beaneflower two egges beate mingle well together make plaister thereof vpon towe lay round cronet bind fast let remaine space two day renew againe failing euery two day vntill see waxe hard firme aboue plaister restrictiue force humor resort downeward must drawne turpentin hog greace vntill leaue mattering dry vp burnt alum beaten powder strowed vpon little flaxe laid againe vpon continuing euery day vntil hardened let horse come wet vntil whole accloyd prickt accloyd hurt commeth shooing smith driueth naile quicke rkham make halt cure take shoo cut hoofe away lay sore bare lay wax turpentine deeresewet wil heale figge horse hauing receiued hurt said nail bone splent stone otherwise sole foot well dressed perfectly cured grow place certaine superfluous piece flesh like figge haue little grain like fig therefore rightly called italian vn fico say fig cure whereof according martin thus cutte cleane away hot iron keepe flesh downe turpentine hog greace little wax laid towe flax stop hole hard flesh rise renewing day vntil whole retreat pricking naile wel driuen shooing therefore pulled againe smith called italian tratta messa cause pricking may partly rash driuing smith partly weakenes naile hollownes naile shank weake point many time bendethawry quicke go right forth slatteth shiuereth driuing two part wherof one part raceth quick pulling else perhaps breaketh cleane assunder remaineth stil behind kinde pricking worse cloyeng wil ranckle worse reason flaw yron remaining flesh signes bee smith driueth naile lewd wil looke vnto horse depart way know halting horse serching hooue first hammer knocking vpon euery clinging knock vpon naile greefe horse wil shrinke vp foote wil seru pinch gripe hooue paire pinsons round vntil haue found place greeued cure according martin thus first pul shooe open place greeued butter drawer may perceiue feeling seeing whether peece naile pul stop hole turpentine wax sheepes sewet moulten together poured hot hole lay little towe vppon clap shooe againe renewing thus euery day vntil whole time let horse come wet must stopped though prickt without peece naile remaining lack loking time retreat cause houe break aboue cure plaister restrictiue order mentioned laste place sauing one cloying cloying pricking whole naile called italian inchiodatura passinge quicke remaining stil clenched nailes causeth horse halt greeued place knowne searching hammer pinsons said horse halt immediately pul shooe open hole vntil begin bleed stop ointment aforesaid page retreat clap shooe againe hooue may good harme little may trauel immediately vppon bee ranckled renew stopping euery day let come wet vntil bee whole loosening hooue parting hooue cronet called italian dissolatura del vnghia round commeth meanes foundering part anguish caused pricking canel naile piercing sole foot quitterbone retreat grauelling cloying like thing signes loosened foundering breake first forepart cronet right aagainst toe humor doth couet alwaies descend towards toe againe pricking canel naile like cankered thing cause hooue wil loosen round equally euen first proceedeth hurt last mentioned hooue wil breake right aboue place offended commonly wil proceed cure according martin thus first soeuer cause proceeds sure open hoofe sole foot humor may haue free passage downeward restraine aboue plaister restrictiue mentioned order written also heale vp wound taught chap pricke sole foot casting hooue coffin falleth clean away foot commeth cause last rehearsed aparant eie needeth signes know cure according martin thus take turpentine one pound tarre halfe pinte vnwrought wax halfe pinte boile thinges together stirre continually vntil throughly mingled compact together make boote leather good strong sole meete horse foot laced buckled pasterne dresse foot salue aforesaid laid vpon flaxe tow bolster stuffe foot soft flaxe boot may greeue manner waye renewing euery day vntill whole put grasse hooue bound shrinking whole hooue commeth drought hoous perhaps kept dry horse standeth stable sometime meanes heateblundevile ouerstraight shooing italian call horse thus greeued incastellado signes horse wil hault hooues hotte knocke hammer wil sound hollow like empty bottle foot hoouebound sore foot lesser indeed appeare eie cure according martin thus pull shooes shooe halfe mooneshooes called lunette order shape wherof round ointment prescribed chapter casting hooue continuing euery day vntil begin amend space moneth goeth well month ende take halfe shooes pare sol frushes thinne may see deaw come forth tacke whole
