together renewing day ouer hard intent sole may haue liberty rise growne againe let shod lunets sent grasse running frush frush tenderest part hooue towardes heele called italian fettone fashioned like forked head french men cal furchette word ferrers either knowing rightly pronounce else perhaps easinesse sake pronuntiation make monasillable pronounce frush frush breedeth many time rotennesse corruption proceeding humour commeth legge whereby legge kept cleane windgals humour swelling meanes humor haue passage way notwithstanding discommodity sorance greater commodity maketh horse foot weak tender able tred vpon hard ground signes horse wil haul specially passage humour stopt anye grauel gathered frush stopt wil continually runne sauour whereof wil bee strong man able abide place wil looke raw cure according martin thus first take shooe pare away corrupt place make raw may see water yssue raw place tack shooe againe first made wide large inough done take foote one handfull salte much bruse well togither dish putte thereunto white three egges temper togither little towe dipt therein stop foote especially frush splent may fall renewing day space seuen day bee whole time let horse rest come wet seauen day end leaue stopping ride abroad alwaies commeth let sore foote cleane washed grauell remaine therein without vnto frush frush tendrest part sole foot humor distilling many time downe legges occasion inflamations partmarkham may easily perceiued impostumation cure first hauing taken shooe pare away corrupted naughty matter vntil sore looke rawe naile hollow shooe made purpose take soote handeful iuyce houselicke creame white egge two much wil thicken stop vp sore splint may fal renewing vntil whole cure haue regard sore foot touch wet much hurtfull disease griefes indifferently incident part body first leprosie vniuersall manginesse called old writer elephantia cankered manginesse spreading ouer body commeth abundance melancholy corrupt filthy blood signes horse al maungy scuruy ful scab rawe plot necke euil fauoured looke alwayes rubbing scratching cure according martin thus let blood first day one side necke within day flanke vaines last vaine vnder taile wash sore place salt brine rubbing hard wispe strawe hard twisted may bleed well raw doue annoint place ointment take quickesiluer one ounce hoggesgreace one pound brimstone beaten powder barre yron touch againe space two three day time see rubbeth still place rub place againe old horsecombe make raw annoint fresh ointment helpe hot yron blunt point big man little finger burne mangy place making round hole passing thorough skin intent shall needefull pull skinne first flesh left hand holding still vntil haue thrust hot yron thorough let euery hole bee spanne one another neede may annoint hole little sope let horse thinne dieted curing time farcin called italian il verme farcina kind creeping vlcer growing knot following along veine proceedeth corrupt blood ingendred body else outward hurt spurgalling biting horse biting tick hog louse like causualties legges may come interferring easilye knowne partly former description also apparant eie cure according martin thus let bloud vaine commeth nigh sore place may let bleed well fire euery knot one one taking knot left hand pulling hard body intent maye better pierce knot blunt hot yron bignesse man forefinger without body hurt let mater leauing none vnburnd little much done annoint euery knot burned hoggesgreace warmed euery day vntill coares ready fall away meane time prepare good quantity old vrine see coares ready fal boile vrine put therein little coporas salt strong nettle water warm wash coares corruption done fill euery hole immediately powder slect lime continuing thus euery day vntill hole closed vp ranker fill verdigrease cure let horse thinly dieted say straw water onely vnlesse nowe giue loafe breade lower kept sooner whole wise let necke yoked olde bottomelesse paile else short staues keepe licking sore lesse rest hath better thus take good great dockroot clean scraped cutte thereof fiue little rundels cake vsed followeth first knife make slit right horse forhed three inch longe cornet loosen skinne within flesh may easily put therein fiue rundels docke say two side slit one aboue another put fift rundle midst betwixt foure done fasten slit two short shoomakers end serue lace tie foresaide rundle may fall clense sore euery day vertue root draw al filthy matter part body yea though farcin hinder legges matter wiped away time time new rootes thrust slit according see needefull farcion farcion vilde disease ingendred ill bloud flegmaticke matter vnkindly feeding appeareth horse like vnto little knottes flesh bigge hasell nuttemarkham knottes encrease daily inflame impostume breake knot amount threescore wil euery night breed many till haue ouerrunne horse bodye poison mighty also strong soone bring gim death disease infectious dangerous horse yet taken time easie holpen cure thereof manner take sharpe bodkin thrust neather part nose may bleede let bloude neckevaine shall amisse feele knot many soft launce let runne take strong lye lime allum bath sore shall short space cure also another manner curing disease thus take sharpe launceknife top horse forehead iust betweene eies make long slit euen scull blunt instrument purpose lose flesh scalp pretty compasse better according finenesse thinnesse skin shall require iudged haire haire short fine signe fine skinne longe rough betokeneth thicke skinne fine skinne requireth lighter hand burned deepe thicke also alay heat fire drawing therfore haue say heere onely admonish acccording vegetius precept fire anie sinnewie place bone broken iointe feare weakening whole member bear heauy vneuen hand thereby many horse go lame vncured diuers disease p ctise selus therefore giuing fire needful time iudgement discretion shall horse benefit owne great praise profit cautery potentiall cautery potentiall iohannes vigo saith medicine corosiue putrifactiue causticke word corosiue deriued latine word corrodo much saie gnaw frette corosiues simple compounde simple vigo saith roche alum well burnte burnt spunge sea somewhat burnt lime redde corall powder mercury compound corosiues vnguentum apostolorum vnguentum aegyptiacum vnguentum ceraceum medicine putrifactiue called learned sort septica according auicen haue strength corrupte complexion member induce scarre like dead flesh causing great pain yea feuers therefore ought ministred strong body strong disease carbuncle canker vlcers like bee arsenicke sublimat resalgar medicine compound therwith siluius also addeth thereunto sandaraca chrysocolla aconitum doth agree auicen description putrifactiue medicine saith haue little paine none neither bee hot drie called escharotica say crustiue hot forth degree breed crust scarre cause great paine vnslect lime burned dregges wine wherefore seemeth auicens description belongeth rather crustiue putrifactiue medicine notwithstanding must need say chirurgions also ferrers find arsenicke resalgar sharpe hotte burning thing minister part body forced alay sharpenesse thereof chirurgians iuyce plantaine daffadill else houseleeke ferrers hoggesgreace medicine causticke say burning whose operation strong inclineth natute fire yet easily alayed vigo writeth medicine putrifactiue therefore may safely vsed bee made saith strong lie called capitellum magistra vitriolae romanae sal nitri aqua fortis sort al vigo calleth blistering medicine apium cantharides ciclamine onion strong garlicke melanacardinum stone graines vitis alba otherwise called brione moreouer vigo maketh euery one cautery potentiall excel one another certaine degree saying corosiues bee weaker putrifactiues putrifactiues weaker causticke therefore corosiues worke vpper part soft flesh putrifactiues hard flesh deepe caustickes haue power breake skin hard flesh enter deepely vse moste part thinges haue beene taught sundry place according martin experience therefore leaue trouble wishing desirous know matter read taugantius writing de piroticis siluius de medicamentorum compositione iohn vigo writing instantly death cure thereof sort let bleed may bleed abundantly sharp knife diuers place cut swelling done set cuppingglasse theron cup till glasse filled foule water fall away selfe giue horse fall apeare horse foreleg cure thereof take sharpe knife cut slitte euen tip nose iust point grisle open slit made shall perceiue white string take vp bore tooth crooked bodkin cut insunder stitch vppe slit annoint butter horse doubtlesse shall recouered millet millet griefe appeareth fetlockes behinde causeth haire shed three foure inch long quarter inch bredth like bare ill cure thus cure first wash well strong lye rub till bleede binde vnto hony vnslect lime deares sewet boiled mingled together space weeke shall whole serew serew foule soraunce like splent little longer commonly outside fore legge splint inside cure thus take two spoonefuls strong winevinegar one spoonefull good salletoyle mingle together euery morning bestow one houre rubbing sorance altogether downeward til gone long going medicine arising horse graecians haue written nothing concerning wilde horsespliny country none vsually bredde gotten yet notwithstanding wee ought thinke medicine anye thinges proceed strong operation haue greater force power anye common horse haue falleth sortes beast blood horse pliny affirmeth doth gnaw deade flesh putrifactiue force vertue hath blood mare haue bin couered horse also bloode horse especially one breeder doeth verye much make helpe againste impostumes small bunch arise flesh moreouer said bloud young asse good iaundice ouerflowing gall also force effect blood young horse horseleaches vse blood horse diuers disease incident vnto annointing rubbing outward part also within body furthermore one cut vaines pallet horse mouth let runne downe bellytheomnestus presently destroy consume maw bellyworms within horse sicke pestilence draw blood veines spurring place mingling vpon stone salt make licke vp blood horse also mingled medicine annointed vpon armes shoulder men beast veg tiu broken ioynt doth much helpe horse weary tyred must cure manner firste draw bloude matrixe wombe mingle oyle wine put fire till bee lukewarme rubbe horse ouer againste haires sinnewes horse wax stiffe shrink together necessary sicke part annointed hot bloode doeth proceede himpliny horse also fed field vse flesh dung biting stinging serpent also find flesh horse well boiled medicinable diuers diseasesfurnerius moreouer vsuall common woman occitania take fat greace horse annoint heades make haire head multiply increase certaine later phisitians mingle marrow horse ointment remedy crampe marrow horse also good loosen sinnewes knit fastned together first let boiled wine afterwards made cold anointed warmly either fire sun horse labor kind impostume vulgarly call worme either well nose open skin searirg yron doe sprinkle verdigreace within horse mouth brent added thereunto sometimes seed henbane teeth male horse gelded labor made feeble put vnder head ouer head troubled starteth dreame doth withstand resist vnquietnes time rest might happen vnto himalbertus pliny also doeth assent flower dooeth heale sorenes horse teeth gum cleft chinkes horse foot teeth also horse verye profitable curing chilblanes rotten full corruption swollen full ripemarcellus marcellus saith toothe horse beaten crushed small powder sprinkled vppon man genitall doth much profit effectually helpe teeth first ingendered horse haue vertue touch teethe man woman molested grieued toothache shal presently find finall ende paine like manner childe doe kisse nose snowt horse shal neuer feele paine teeth neither time shall childe bitten horsesextus teeth first fall horse bound fastned vpon child infancie easily procure breeding teeth speed effectually haue neuer touched grovnd wherefore poet doth wel apply verse saying collo igitur molli dentes nectentur equini qui prima fuerint pullo crescente caduci also said haire horse fastned vnto house man enemy wil meanes neither little fly small gnat shall flie dwelling place aboad tongue horse neuer accustomed vnto winepliny present expedient medicide alay cure milt man woman caecilius bion reporteth vnto v learned barbarian marcellus saith horse tongue ought dried beaten small pouder put drinke except wine onely foorthwith shew commodity riseth thereuppon easing either man woman paine spleene milt diuers also thinke horse tongue vsed manner good meanes preseruatiue biting serpentes venemous creature curing sore griefes inward partes genitall horsse commended pliny supposeth genitall horse medicinable loosing belly also bloud marrow liuer goate thinges doe rather dry vp close belly haue taught concerning goatplinius heart horsses found bone like vnto dog tooth saide doth driue away griefe sorrow man heart tooth pulled cheekes iaw bone dead horse doth shew full right number sorrowes party grieued dust horse hoofe annointed oile waterplinius doth driue away impostumes little bunch rise flesh part body soeuer dust hoofe asse annointed oile water whot vrine doth vtterly expell wen kernel rise neck armeholes part body either man woman genitall gelded horse dryed ouen beaten powder giuen twice thrice little whot broath drinke vnto party grieued pliny accounted excellent approued remedy secunds woman foame horse dust horse hoofe dried good driue away shamefastnes annointed certaine titulationmarcellus scraping horse hoofes put wine poured horsses nostril greatly prouoke vrin ash also horsses hoofe mingled wine water doth greatly ease helpe disease called collicke stone also perfume may made hoofes horse dryed child still borne cast milke mare excellent vertue doth quite expell poyson seahare poison whatsoeuer drink also mingled mare milk doth make body loose laxatiue also counted excellent remedy falling sicknesse drinke stone boare mare milke waterhippocrates filth matter lying matrice woman lether take mare milke boiled througly strained presently filth excrement void cleane away woman barren cannot conceiue let take mare milke knowing let presently accompany man wil conceiue milk mare drunk doth asswage labor matrice doth cause still child bee cast forth seede henbane beaten small mingled mare milke bound hart skin may touch ground fastened bound woman hinder conception thinnest latest part milke mare doth easily gently without danger purge belly mare milke daily annointed little hony doth without paine punishent take away wound eies new made cheese made mare milke doth represse take away wringings ache belly whatsoeuer anoint combe foame horse wherwith young man youth doth vse comb head force cause haire head neither encrease whit appeare foame horse also much commended haue either pain difficulty hearing ear else dust horsedung new made dryed mingled oyle rose griefe sorenes man mouth throat washed annointed foame horse hath bin fed oates barly doth presently expell paine sorenesse time washed ouer iuyce young greene seacrabs beaten small together cannot get seacrabs greene sprinkle vpon griefe smal powder doth come dried crab baked ouen made brasse afterward wash mouth paine shall finde present remedy fome horserasis time taken drinke doth quiet expell driue away cough marcellus doth affirme whosoeuer troubled cough consumption lunge doth drinke foame horse selfe alone without drinke shall finde present help remedy sextus saith horse presently die also mingled hot water giuen one troubled diseasesmarcellus manner past al cure doeth presently procure healthrasis death horse doth instantly ensue sweat horse mingled wine drunke doth cause woman big great labor cast still childealbertus sweat beast albertus saith onely horse doth breed wind man woman face put thereuponrasis besides doth bring squince squincy also filthy stinking sweat sword kniues point speares red fire hot annointed sweat horse venemous full poison man woman smitten pricked therewithrasius wil neuer cease bleeding long life doth last horse wounded arrow haue sweat another horse bread hath bene brent mingled man vrine giuen drink afterwards mingled horsegrease put wounde short time procure ease helpe wil assure v man troubled belly wormes haue serpent crept belly hee take sweate horse mingled vrine drinke presently cause wormes serpent yssue forth dioscorides plinythe dung horse asse fedde grasse dried afterward dipped wine drunke good remedy bitings blowes scorpion medicine doe also vse mingled genital hare vineger scorpion shrewmouse force great poyson madde dogge bitch pargeted vrine doth much hurt especially vnto haue sore bile vpon chiefest remedy therefore dung horse mingled vineger warmed put scab sore dung aswel ass horse either raw colde burned excellent good breaking forth yssues bloodmarcellus dung horse ass newe made warme clapped put green wound doth easily speedily stanche bleeding vaine horse bee cut blood doe yssue great aboundance apply dung horse vnto place veine cutrussius bleeding wil asse regarding nothing societie friendship honor dignitie parted three equall share one lyon fox third himselfe whereat lyon disdaining hee made equall vnto residue presently fell vpon toare peeces whomsoeuer find deuoure teare piece ship also go vp downe riuer tyed bankside feare lion night time come downe waterside find passage barkes enter destroy euery lyuing creature wherefore ride ancor middle riuer colour lyon generally yellowe spoken blacke whitethe colour lyon red exorbitant haire curled long shaggy thin standing vpright falling flatte longer shorter behindecardanus although curling haire token sluggish timidity yet haire bee long curled top onely pretendeth generous animosity also haire hard beast haue soft haire hart hare sheep timerous harder haired boare lyon audacious fearelesse fourefooted beaste hath haires neather eyeliddes like man steede thereof either face rough ouer dogge else haue foretop horse asse mane like lion lyonesse hath mane proper male long haires ornament horse mane necke shoulder lyon neither eminent full age therefore pliny said turrigeros elephantorum miramur humeros leonum iubas wonder towerbearing shoulder elephantes long hanging mane lion aelianus orationis expertibus maripraestantiam quandam natura largita est iuba leo antaecellit foeminam serpens christa nature hath honored male euen creature without reason distinguished female mane male lyon combe male serpent female martiall writeth thus lion mane quantum per colla decus quem sparsit honorem aurea lunatae cum stetit vnda iubae lyon hath valiant strong headthe seueral part occasion nymphes terrified lyon fled carystus promontory wherein dwelled called co leon lyonshead afterwards built goodly citty fortuned themistocles went thether manage affaire graecians epiries persian president phrygia intended destruction therefore committed busines vnto one pisis charge shold behead themistocles came thither execute murder happened themistocles slept noone day hee heard voice cry vnto themistocles effuge leonum caput ne ipse leonem incurras sayplutarch themistocles get thee lyon head least thou fall lyon teeth whereupon arose saued life face lyon round haue imagined therefore compared vnto sunne compasse thereof haires stand eminent like sunnebeames rather square figured like forehead aristotle saith may chuse whether cal forehead epipedon frontis superficies forehead like cloud seemeth hange ouer eies nose therefore german call man looketh countinance niblen nubilare cloudy betokeneth either anger sorrow also called scithicus aspectus scithians alwaies wont looke though ready fight eies lyon red fiery hollow round long looking part awry wherfore poet stile lionesse tocua leaena pupil aples eie shine exceedingly somuch beholding man would thinke hee looked vpon fire vpper eielid exceeding great nose thick vpper chap doth hang ouer neather meete iust mouth great gaping wide lippes thinne vpper partes fall neather token fortitude teeth like wolues dogges like sawes losing changing onely canine teeth tongue like cat leopard sharpe file wearing skinne man licking necke stiffe consisteth one bone without ioynts like wolfe hyaena flesh hard sinnew ther knucles turning ioyntes called spondyli therefore cannot looke backward greatnesse roughnesse necke betokeneth magnanimious liberall mind nature hath giuen short necke vnto lyon vnto beares tygers haue need put downe earth feede like oxe lift vp catch prey shoulder brestes stronge also forepart body member hinder part degenerate pliny saith leoni vi summa pectore chiefest force lion breast part throatebole loose soft metaphrenon part backe hart called betwixt shoulderblades broad backbone rib strong ventricle narrow much larger maw subiect wound flancke part weakest part body endure many blowes loines hipbone hath litle flesh lionesse hath two vdders midest belley bringeth forth two time somtimes bringeth aboundeth milke meat getteth seldome parte fleshe turneth milke taile lyon long shake oftentimes beating side therewith prouoke themselues fight graecians call alcaea alciatus maketh excellent embleme thereof vpon wrath alcaum veteres candam dixere leonis qua stimulante ira concipit ille graues lutea quam surgit bilis crudescit atro felle dolor furias excitat indomitas neather parte taile full haires gristle opinion therein little sting withall lyon pricketh selfe afterwards bone lyon haue marrow else small seemeth nothing therefore strong solide greater anye beast stature male haue euer harder bone femaleaelianus aristotle striking together may beget fire percussion flint like may said beast liue vpon flesh yet bone hollow leg lion strong full nerues instead ancklebone hath crooked thing pasterne child vse make sport also hath lynx forefoot haue fiue distinct toe clawes foot hinderfeet fourepliny cardanus clawes crooked exceeding hard seemeth little miracle nature leodards tygers panther lion hid clawes within skin goe run might dusted neuer pull forth except take deuoure prey also huntedsolinus tailes couer footstep earth may bewrayed epithet beast many whereby author haue expressed seueral nature curst kind lyon ful stomacke sharp bold greedy blunket flesheater caspian claeonian lord king beastes woodes fierce wild hairy yellowe strong fretting teethgnashing naemean thundering raging getulian rough lowring wryfaced impacient quicke vntamed free mad according saying poet fertur prometheus insani leonis vim stomacho opposuisse nostro foras eagle fained feede vpon heart prometheus also lion ruler heart man according astrologians hence commeth man said beare stomacke angry bee subiect anger hungry full meat also epethets lion wrathfull maned libian deadly stout great masilian mauritanian parthian phrygian molorchaean carthaginian preying raueningthe epithet lyon stubborne snatching wrinkled cruell bloody terrible swelling vast violent marmaruan also epethites lionesse affrican bold stonyharted vengible cauelodging fierce yellowe getulian hercanian vegentle libian cruell frowning terrible nature beast seuerall property thereof compendiously expressed one word voice lion called rugitus voice lyon roaring bellowing according verse poet tigrides indomita rancant rugiunt que leone therefore commeth rugitus leonis roaring lyon called also gemitus fremitus virgill fremit leo ore cruento againe hinc exaudiret gemitus irae que leonum vincla recusantum serum sub nocte rudentum young lion haue gotten prey token whereof roare like bleating calfe thereby calling elder participate place aboad mountaines according saying leo cacumina montium amat sight smelling excellent sleep eies open brighnesse eye canot endure light fire fire fire cannot agree also smelling cause called odorati eminent lionesse haue committed adultry leopard male discouereth sence nose cause also tamed tartaria vsed hunting boarespa venetus beares hart roebuckes wilde ass also wilde vtlandish oxe wont carried hunting two lyon cart together either litle dog following beast vehement shee femalelyon cause semiramis babilonian tyrannesseaelianus esteemed slaughter male lion libbard hauing gotten lyonessethe estimation lyones uerall rage lyon aboue reioyced therein lyon hee eateth fierce also hungry satisfied filled hee layeth aside sauage quality sheweth himselfe meeke gentle nature lesse danger meete filled hungry neuer deuoureth till famine constraineth aristotlei haue heard story englishman barbary turned moore liued king court day said presence lion within little space court place named lodged englishman halfe drunke offered goe kill lyon hand hand therewithall armed himselfe mvsket sword dagger complement hee also long knife forth went renegate english moore like mad man aduised champion kill lion came found sleep peril might haue killed musket saw like foolehardyfellow thought little honour kill lyon sleeping stout champion doth strike enemy behind backe therefore musket top smote lyon awake wherat beast suddenly mounted vp without thankes warning set forefoot squire brest force body ouerthrew champion stood vppon keeping holding grim face bloody teeth ouer face eies sight doubt made wish himselfe thousand mile likelihood bee grinder flesh bone first executioner send cursed soule deuill denying iesus christ sauiour yet fell otherwise lyon hauing beene lately filled liberall prey presently fall eate stood vpon owne safegard ment stand till shee hungry time poore wretch liberty gather wit together last seeing could haue benefit musket sword dagger perceiuing nothing vnauoidable death thought sauing credit might dye foolish infamy doe exploit vppon lion whatsoeuer betide thereupon seeing lion bestride standing ouer vpper partes handes liberty drew longe barbarian knife thrust twice thrice lion flanke lion endured neuer hurting man supposing woundes came way would forsake booty looke meanes whereby shee harmed last finding selfe sicke bowel cut asunder within hot body wound work presently departed away man two yard distance lay downe dyed wretch thus deliuered iawes death must thinke made small brag thereof court notwithstanding beholding good nature lion doth kill eate except hungry owne wit strength vallour male lyon doeth feede female either apart themseluestheir foode eating eate rawe flesh cause graecians call omesteres omoboroi omophagoi younge one themselues cannot longe bee fed milkealbertus whot dry libertie neuer want meate yet eate nothing take hunting hunt day mostauicen eate euery second day whatsoeuer leaue meate returne againe eate afterwardes whereof assigned cause bee meate endure nothing vnsweete stale stinking opinion throgh pride naturs resembling al thing princely maiesty therefore scorne haue one dish twice presented table tame lyon constrained hunger eate dead body also cake made meale hony may appeare tame lyon came appollonius sayd haue soule amasis king egypt story related philostratus manner saith certaine man leame led vp downe tame lyon like dogge whethersoeuer would lyon onely gentle leader person met meanes man got much gaines therefore visited many region citties sparing enter temple time sacrifising neuer shed blood cleare slaughter neither licked vp blood beastes touched flesh cut piece holy altar eate vpon cake made meale hony also bread gourd sod flesh customary time drinke wine appollonius satte temple hee came vnto humble manner lying downe feete looking vp face euer speciall supplycation vnto people thought hope reward commaund gaine maister last appolonius looked vppon lyon tolde people lyon entreat signifie vnto hee wherewithall hee possessed namely soule man say amasis king egypt raigned prouince sai word lyon sighed deepely mourned forth lamentable roaring gnashing teeth together cry aboundance teares whereat appollonius stroked beast made much telling people opinion forasmuch soul k entred kingly beast iudged altogether vnfit beast go beg liuing therfore well send leontopolis nourished temple egyptian agreed thereunto made sacrifice amasis adorning beast chaines bracelet branch sending inner egypt priestes singing way idolatrous hymnes anthem transfiguration men lion shall say afterwardes onely story rehearsed place shew food tame enclosed lyon substance transfiguration hold either poetical else diabolicall foode therefore lyon commonly meeke gentle beast eate wolues beares beastes liue vpon rauening begette melancholy eate meate greedily deuoure many thinges whole without chewing fast afterwards two three day together neuer eating vntill former digested fast day drink next day eate seldome eate drinke one dayaelianus philes sticke stomacke cannot digest ouercharged doth thrust nailes throate straining stomacke pulleth selfe thing doth hunted vpon full belly also must forgotten althought come twice one carcasse yet hauing eaten belly full departure wilfull breathing vpon residue corrupteth itsolinus neuer beast tast thereof great poyson breath putrifieth flesh also owne body sodainely rypped vppe intrals stinke abhominablypliny aristotle reason whereof take great voracitie cannot corrupt stomacke also seldome emptying belly vtter excrement aboue three day also exceeding dry like dogges stinking abhominably sending forth much winde vrine smelleth strongly also render like dogge holding vp one legges neuer make water first smell tree meane male lion fall vpon creature desire meate especially old able hunt goe townes village stable ox foldes sheepe sometimes men deuour wherefore neuer eate hearbes sicke lion leo afer philes herodotus deuouring men beastes setting vpon troupe horseman depopulating flockes heards cattell carrying aliue yoonge one killing fiue sixe one time whatsoeuer lay holde carry away mouth although bigge camell loue camel flesh exceedingly therefore lion set vpon camel xerxes neither medled menthe hatred lyon seuerall enemy ox victuales onely camel seemeth meate acceptable vnto hate aboue measure wilde ass hunt kill according saying wise man leonum venatio onager wilde asse game lion ecclus hate also thoes fight meate liue vpon flesh gratius writeth thoes commisses clarissima fama leone et subiere asto paruis domuere lacertis eate also ape phisicke nourishment set vpon ox vsing owne strength prudently come stall heard terrifie allaelianus may take one eate also liues passe ouer beleeue list also saidambrosius beastes doe heare voice doe keepe standing dare stirre foote assertion wanteth good reason terrour dread stand amazed writer glosse vpon prophet amos vpon word prophet nunquid rugiet leo saltu nisi habuerit praedam lion roare except haue pray leo saith tum famem patitur si videt praedam dat rugitum quo audito ferae stant fixo gradu stupefactae say wildernesse hee happen stand neede meat purpose end life meanes hee scortched heate sunne last finding caue couer himselfe heate therein caue lyon den lyon returned hunting much pained reason thorne fastened bottom foote vttered forth great lamentation pittifull roaringes reason wound seeme hee want body make moane vnto remedy last comming caue finding young man hid therein hee gently looked vpon began flatter offered foote well hee could pray pull peece splint fastened man first sore afraid made reckoning death saw huge sauage beast meeke gentle beganne thinke himselfe surely sore bottom foote beast lifted vp foote vnto taking courage vnto himgellius lifted vppe lyon foot found bottom great peece splint plucked forth meanes eased lyon paine pressed forth matter wound curiously without great feare throughly dry wipe away bloud lyon eased paine laide himselfe downe rest putting foot hand androcles cure lion wel pleased handled curtiously friendly onely gaue recompence life also went daily abroad forrage brought home fattest prey androcles euen space three yeares kept familiarly without note cruelty euill nature den man beast liued mutually one common man roasting meate whot sun lyon eating part raw according kinde thus liued space three yeares grew weary habitation life society bethought himselfe meanes depart therfore day lion gone abroad hunting man tooke iourny away constant loue frendshipa story iustice lyon ready reuenge breach amity kindnesse lion appeareth story eudemus writeth certaine young man nourished together many year dog beare lyon liued perfect peace concord without breach snarling apparance anger day bear dog played together biting one another gently happened dog fastened teeth sport deeper beare could digest therefore presently fell vpon clawes tore soft part belly whereof presently dryed lyon sitting seeing cruelty breach loue amity concord among long liued together fell inflamed reuenge perfidy like true king beastsaelianus measured prophesie afterward went homeward lion met killed stood corp asse eating till old prophet came took away bury twentieth chap book king ther another story prophet hee went way hee met man bade name lord wound smite would preferring pittie seruice lord well said prophet vnto seeing thou refusest obey voice lord behold soone thou art departed lyon shall meete thee destroy thee came passe presence cause one affection drawen one place one feare wrought one destruction also sacrificed selfe vpon point one sword also scythia cruell tyrant called therodomas wont cast men lion deuoured cause nourish truth aiax valiant souldier warily carried himselfe many battailes neuer receiued wound last slew himselfe owne sword thrusting thorough necke cause fabled neuer could wounded vertue imagined conferred hercules ouid hath wittie fiction one phyllius fell deepely loue little boy pleasure tooke many wilde beast bird lion tamed delight amasius length infatiable boy required doe like bull hee nature lion foode fashion little base dogges come liue house take meate hand men woman like word enchanteth mind lyon like reasonable person ouercome strong argument notwithstanding owne want hunger extremity casteth eies ground ashamed aflicted departeth away without enterprise neither ought iudicious wiseman thinke thing incredible see horsses dogges liue among men heare continuall voice concerning rage force frendship society lion beast whereof memorable first hare sport crept mouth tame lion whereof martiall writeth sort teaching fly lion teeth rage dog verse rictibus tauros non conditur ille fide si vitare canum morsus lepus improbe guaeriis ad quae confugias leonis habes another poet society rame lyon wherein hewondereth different nature liue together lion forgetteth prey wood also ram eating green grasse hunger constrained tast dish yet foretold holy scripture lion lambe play togither epigram maessyli leo fama iugi peicoris que martitus lanigeri mirum qui posuere fide nothing fearcely falleth vpon euery prey according verse mannilius quis dubitet vasti quae sit natura leonis quas que suo dietet signo nassentibus artes ille nouas semper pugnas noua bella ferarum apparat pecorum viuit spolio que rapinis hoc habet hoc studium postes ornare superbos pellibus captas domibus configere predas que parare metum syluis viuere rapto concerning hunting taking lionsthe hunting taking lyon indian dog strong hunter set vpon buls bore lion haue said history dog dog begotten tygers amongst indian hyrcania especially doe thing noted mantuan concerning fortitude courage dog saying et truculentus helor certare leonibus auden prouince ginezui subiect great cham king tartaria many lion great cruell region dog accounted bould stronge feare inuade set vpon lion oftentimes commeth passe two dog hunting archer sitting horseback kill destroy lion dog perceiue lion bee neare set vpon great barking especialy know themselues backed help man cease bite lyon hinder part taile although lion doth oftentimes threaten frouning terrible countinance turning himselfe way way might teare piece notwithstanding dog looking warilie vnto themselues easily hurt especially hunting horseman following doth seeke best meanes fasten dart lion hee bitten dogges wise enough consider owne help lyon flyeth away fearing leaste barking howling dog may bring company men dog vnto betaketh himselfe rightly vnto tree may enioy place defence backe turning himselfe scornfull grinning hee fighteth withall force doggespaulus venetus hunter comming nearer vppon horsse ceaseth throw dartes lyon vntill kill neither doth lyon feele force dartes vntill bee slaine dogges doe vnto great hurte trouble lion seene time hunting ashamed turne backe doth little turne away himselfe oppressed multitude remoued sight hunter doth hastily prepare flight thinking shame cleared concealing himselfe therefore knoweth wood cannot giue testimony feare doth want flight leaping vseth pursuing beastes doth craftily dissemble abolish footesteps deceiue hunter pollux affirmeth hunter fight wilde beast bore must straddle legges wide abroad keepe together within compasse foote hee may keepe ground stedfast sure euen manner wrestling wild beast panther lyon hunted hindred course hunter thing neare doe presently leape vppon stroke giuen ought directed leauelled right breast hart striken incurable mysius pindus mysa aboue syria mountaines fit breeding nourishing beastes kind taken partly mountaines poyson wolfebane sharpnesse region admit kind hunting net dogges mingling thing euery wilde beast delighteth hunter doe cast vnto neare water also discende downe night time taken regard way ascend vnto mountaines stopped huntsman weapon neither excluded taken without great perill vnto huntsman also make pitfals great ditch ground catch lyon middest whereof leaue profound stony pillar vpon night time tye goat hedge pitfals round boughes least might seen leauing entrance lyon hearing voice goat night doe come vnto place walke round hedge finding place may enter leape ouer taken oppianus doth describe three manner way hunting lyon also bellasarius doeth doeth describe mind vnskilfully first rehearsed xenophon three way take lyon notwithstanding also adde thereunto oppianus doth vary second made fire third whip scourge first manner way therefore gillius part translateth oppianus sort hunter lybia doe obserue beaten path way lyon going den vnto water make broade round ditch neare vnto midest wherof raise vp great pillar vpon hang sucking lambe compasse ditch round wall stone heaped together least wilde beast commeth neare hee perceiueth deceite lambe fastened vppon top pillar doth incitate hungerstaruen hart lyon bleating therefore comming neare able stay longer wall doth presently leap ouer receiued vnlooked ditch included vexeth himselfe partes body lifting himselfe vp rather lambe go forth againe ouerthrowen maketh force thing gillius affirmeththe second manner hunting fire deuise people inhabite ryuer euphrates hunt lyon manner hunter vpon stronge horsses vpon gray horsses glasen eies swift dare onely meete lion horsses dare abide sight lyon foote set net three placed snare remaine vnderprop net stay stake one middle rest bendinges turninges middle heare farther endes setting round warlike manner holding pitchy firebrand right hand buckler left make great noyse clamor shewing firebrandes put wilde beastes incredible feare therefore horseman spred abroade inuade beastes footemen likewise doe follow great noise lyon terrified cry hunter daring resist giue place aswell feare fire men runne net taken like fish night time fire compelled driuen net fisher thirdthe third manner hunting done lesser labour foure strong men armed shield fortified ouer thonges leather hauing helmet vpon heades onely eye nose lip may appeare brandishing firebrand rustle vpon lyon lying den bearing indignation gaping openwide mouth lightning burning eye inflamed breaketh foorth great roaring celeritie rustleth vpon storme tempest firme constant courage abide brunt meane coueteth catch teeth clawes another prouoking behinde doth smite loude noise clamour doth vexe lyon hast leauing first taken mouth turneth backe mouth vnto hinder seuerall part doe vex breathing foorth warlike strength runneth man leaueth hee snatcheth vp high length broken long labour wearied foaming mouth lyeth downe straight vpon ground quiet binde take earth ramme doe also finde lion intricated snare trap bound vnto poste pile nigh vnto narrow place wont passe pliny saith time past hard difficult manner catch lyon chiefest catching ditch mountaine zaronius affricke strongest men doe continuall hunt lyon best taken send vnto king fesse king ordereth hunting manner spacious fielde little hutch built height man may stand vpright euery one shut little gate within standeth armed man lyon raysed forced place dores open lyon seeing dores open runneth great force shut againe hee prouoked anger afterward bring bull combate beginneth cruell fight bull shall kill lyon honour day finished lyon ouercome armed men number almost twelue come foorth fight lyon hauing boare speares sixe cubit long armed men shall seeme ouercome lyon king commaundeth number diminished contrarieleo afer armed men ouercome king noble sitting high place see hunting kill lyon crossebowes commeth often time passe euery one slaine lyon reward combate lyon ten golden crownes together new garment neither admitted vnto fight except praegnant vailorous strength borne mountaine zalag doe first prouoke giue onset lyon borne mountaine zaronius conclude discourse hunting lyon fortune hee followed men doggespliny yet plaine fieldes hee neuer mendeth pace writer affirme oftentimes turning looking vpon pursuer dare approchment giue defiance vnto pretence yet hauing gotten thicket looketh safetie best celeritie speede wisely tempeering feare foe may seeme boldnesse politiquely thinketh eye seeth longer dissembleth himselfe runneth away like fearefull hartaristotle albertus hare laying downe eares striking taile betwixt legges like curredogge seldome time looking behind irefully vpon come especially receaue wound wherevnto horace alluded saying quid vt nouerca intueris aut vt petita ferro bellua course spareth beast meeteth falleth vpon like maddogge except swine afraid bristle man doe attempt wounde snatch ouerthrow doe little harme according verse ouid corpus magnanima satis est prostrasse leoni pugna suum finem cum iacet hostis habet obserueth vigilantly hand woundeth laboureth take reuenge euill turne remaineth minde till opportunitie send aduersaries head may appeare story following iuba king moore father child brought triumphe trauailed wildernesse army soudiers represse certaine rebel one part dominion shaken gouernement settle againe first allegiance noble yoong souldier traine race nobilitie strong also well experienced hunting way fellowes met lion presently cast dart gaue sore wound mortall wound receaued lyon went away guiltie hurt yoong men prosecute went forward iourney whole yeare king returned homeward way company carried among yoong gallant wounded lyon lion hauing recouered hurt hauing denne neere way place harme perceiuing returne armie went furiously among found man whose hand wounded could help associats stayed reuenge tore yoong souldiour peeces departed away safe residue seeing rage ran away thinking deuill likenesse lyon taking lyon followeth intreat tamingof taming lion first tamed infancy whelpes meeke gentle full sport play especially filled meate without danger stranger may meet hungry returne againe owne nature true seneca saith leonibus manus magister inserit osculatur tigrim suos custos say maister lyon may put hand mouth keeper tyger may kisse yet also feard tigres leone que nunquam feritatem exuunt aliquado submittunt cum minime expectaueris toruitas maligna redibit lion tygers neuer leaue wildenesse although somtimes yeeld seeme submisse yet vpon suddaine man expecteth malignant wrath breaketh forth exasperated wherefore grow old impossible make vtterly tame yet read diuers story tame lyon whether made littering el constraind art man follow hanno certain lyon expedition war carried baggage cause carthagenians condemned banishment said male credi libertus ei cui tantum c cissit etiam feritas safe trust man gouerment common welth wit pollicy strength able ouercomecoelius vtterly alter wilde nature lion thoght wold proue tyrant could bring lion meekenes waite table licke face toongue smooth hand backe liue presence like little dogge indian tame lion elephant set plough onomarcus aelianus tyrant cattana lyon ordinarily conuerse countrey elymis temple adonis wherein kept many tame lyon farre wildnesse fiercenesse would imbrace salute people came offer also one called giue meate would take gently depart quietnesse likewise kingdome fe plaine called adecsen certaine forrests wherein liue tame gentle lyon man meete may driue away small sticke wand without receauing harme region affrick lyon tameleo afer come dayly citties goe one streete another gathering eating bone whose presence neither woman child run away likewise many part india haue lyon tamea lianus leade vp downe leames accustome hunting bore buls wilde ass like dogges nose well fitted purpose best hound haue shewed king tartary best meanes tame lyonsand best meanes taming rule apolonius said precept pharaotes neither handled roughly mildly beaten stripe grow ouer stubborne kept continuall flattery vsed ouer kindly grow ouer proud held opinion equall commixtion threatning faire speaking gentle vsage meanes easily brought good desired condition wisedome auncients onely vse taming lyon also restraining tyrant putting bridle mouthes hooke nosthrils restraine fury madnesse albertus saith best way tame lyon bring vp little dogge oftentimes beate dog presence discipline lion made tractable keeper said heliogabalus nourished many tame lyon tygers noysome beastes calling himselfe great mother made friend drunke night time hee shut vp together quickly fell asleepe heauinesse head asleepe turned amongst foresaid child lyon beares tiger like whose presence morning drunken frinds grew amazed oft time fell dead feare conclude story certaine epigram lyon wandring abroad night time auoiding frost cold came fold goates sight whereof goateheards much afraid calling question onely liues flocke also owne euery one thought himselfe bound fight vnto death defence hereof whereupon according manner men extremitie made prayer desiring god deliuered lion according wish came passe lyon lodged warme folde goates whole night departed morning without harme man beast wherefore take lyon tame kynde beast difference nature inclination may see dog apt manner men ruled others also see reason fierce royall nature lyon inclinable obedience subiection submission whereunto woon neuer great maned lyon loose alwaies time turned bound mufled king bochus sent many valiant archer dartcasters fight destroy pompey great place brought combate consisting six hundred great lyon among three antonius pliny ciuill warre battaile pharsalia first cause lyon yoaked draw chariot triumphes wherein himselfe sate one citheris iester thing done without shew obseruations prodigeous monsterous action especially time wherein interpreted noble spirit lyon much abased vassalaged insteede horse draw chariot nature king beast feared auncient nobilitie rome graue senator gallant gentleman commaunders whole commonwealth time come ciuill war pride people depriued honor brought basest office whole state antoninus pius nourished hundred lion domician emperor called acillius gabrio consull albania time game celebrated prosperity youth young men called iuuenalia fight great lyon acillius comming wisely combat easily kil ancient time lion could tamed discerne teeth nailes taking sting poyson serpent weapon wherein consisteth strength without perill sent publike assembly time generall meeting great feast martiall hath excellent epigram great lion exhibited publike spectacle domitian wondering masilian ausonian shepherd afraid lion made great noise murmvr presence bin heard lion therefore commendeth libian country breeding beast withall expresseth ioy shephards death showne verse following auditur quantum massyla per auia murmur innumero quoties sylua leo ne furit pallidus attonitos ad plenum mapalia pastor cum reuocat tauros sine mente pecus tantus ausonia fremuit modo terror arena quis non esse gregem crederet vnus erat sed cuius tremerent ipsi quod que iura leone cui diadema daret marmore picta noma quantum per colla decus quem sparsit honorem aurea lunatae cum stetit vnda iubae grandia quam decuit latum venabula pectus quantum que de magna gaudia morte tulit vnde tuis libie tam felix gloria syluis cybele nunquid venerat ille iugis magi herculeo germanice misit ab astro hanc tibi vel frater vel pater ipse feram haue shewed already lion although neuer well tamed become wilde againetame lyon become wild againe hunger breaketh stone walles according common prouerb therefore maketh destroy whatsoeuer commeth way according verse virgill impastus ceu plenum leu per ouilia turban suadet enim vesana fame mandit que trahit que molle pecus mutum que metu fremet ore creuento one lyon borsius duke ferrara caue would deuore buls beares boares hare little whelp would play doe harme last leauing al tamable nature destroyed young wench oftentimes came vnto combe stroke mane also bring meat flower vpon stroza made two verse sustulit ingratus cui quondam plurima debens pectendas que iubas fera colla dabat like vnto also tame lyon martiall speaketh returning first nature destroyed two young child therefore saith iustly cruelty exceedeth cruelty war epigram verbera securi solitus leo ferre magistri insertam que pati blandus os manum dedidicit pacem subito feritate reuersa quantum ne libicis debuit esse iugis nam duo de tenera puerilia corpus turba sanguineam rastris que renouabat humum seuus infoelix furiali dente peremit martia non vidit maius arena nefas hauing thus spoken taming taking lion also followeth entreat length lifethe length lyon life disease disease incident vnto seuerall cure first therefore held liue long threescore fourescore yeares hath beene seene lion hath bin taken aliue taking receiued wound wherby became lame lost teeth yet liue many yeares also found haue bin taken without teeth fallen theyr head age aelianus saith lion dolphin doe consume away multitude year sickness wherwithal anoid many haue continual part intrals inward partes neuer sound subiect corruption may appear spittle also bitingalbertus scratching nailes man lightly touched sometimes much poysoned biting mad dog also reason extreame hot nature euery day suffereth one sicknes time lyeth prostrate vpon earth roaring al day long certain houres wrath consumed heat inclosed bodycardan best estate afflicted quartan ague euen seemeth bee health except disease restraine violence mallice weakning body would farre hurtful mankind vnderstood summer time falleth disease sometimes sight man cured bloud dog according albertus physioligus feeleth himselfe sick throgh aboundance meat faleth vomiting either strength nature else helpeth himselfe eating kind grasse green corne blade else rape none preuaile fasteth eateth till find ease else hee meete ape deuoureth eateth flesh principall remedy medicine hee receiueth disease youth age groweth old able hunt hart boares beast exerciseth whole strength hunting taking ape whereupon liueth totally cause comparison betwixt lion dolphin aelianus leoni delphino multa sunt communia vter que imparat ille terrenis hic aquatilibus beslijs senectute ambo tabescunt cum sunt aegritudine illa terrestris simia medetur huic marina quod que simia remedio est lion dolphin agree many thinges king ruleth ouer beast earth ouer beast sea consume age long life lion recouereth eating ape earth dolphin cured eating ape sea thus much disease cure lion vse lyon seural partsvnto naturall discourse lyon belongeth vse partes outward inward also seueral picture statue erected singular monument first therefore skin lion ancient moore barbarian enhabyting betwixt mountaine caucasus riuer cophena appeared apollonius companion also skin panther onely cloth themselues day time also slept vppon night therfore hercules pictured wearing lion skin world might bee admonished ancient attire forefather virgill describeth auentinus couered lion skin sort quem fulua leonis pellis obit totum praefulgens vnguibus aures againe ipse pes tegmen torquens immane leonis terribili impexum caeta cum dentibus albis indutus capiti c aeneas sleeping vpon lion skin saying fului que sternor pelle leonis aeneas praecipium que toro villosi pelle leonis accipit aeneam adrastus commaunded oracleto marry daughter boare lyon came wooing vnto whereupon tydaeus came boares skinne pollynices lyon skin vnto gaue daughter marriage taking meaning oracle men clothed skin husbandes daughter hence came common prouerbe attire hee went downe hell fetch cerberus afterwards ther one bacchus clothed weede armed weapon like sort imitation hercules went hellridiculous imitation heare fayned disputation betwixt two poet domineerd good time vntill last came stranger cumae seeing counterfeit personate asselyon way hauing oftentimes seene lyon ass knew asse lyon skinne coniectures failed yet proued true namely length garment saying lysander lacedemonian doth sufficiently proue hee blamed outward pompe wherby beguiled others therfore condemned foolish hipocricy made answer quo leonis peruenire pellis non potest greatest notable amongst signes zodiack containing three star head one cleare one breast sun commeth signe happeneth month iuly time vehement heat summer burneth earth dryeth vp riuers therefore lyon also hot nature seemeth pertake substance quantity sun hath place heauens heate force excelleth beast sun doth star breastes forepart hee strong hinder part weake sunne encreasing vntill noone forepart yeare vntill summer afterwardes seemeth languish towards setting latter part yeare called winter lyon also seemeth alwaies looke vp fiery eye euen sunne patent perpetuall infatigall sight take baboone satyre linx generally creature extremity whose sinnewes ioynts diuided fiue finger toe haue thought panther pardals linxes tygers hadde bin kind cat mutuall resemblance greatnesse strength nailes distinction skinnes partye coloured faire hauing also round head short face long taile nimble body wilde mind gette meat hunting heerein leaue euery man owne best liking opinion haue done best expresse nature seuerall property shalbe ydle spend time disputation ranke order euery beast ought referred euery one readeth story seeth picture may either bee satisfiedthe el amend labour linx therefore biteth cruelly deepe therefore accounted rap animal instar lupi sed callidius beast rauening wolfe crafty get vp tree leape downe vppon great beastes destroy beeing enemy men beast pleasure according necessity set vppon boththe taken somtimes germany dutchy wertinberg credibly affirmed one leaped downe tree vppon countrey man passed vnder tree weary hauing axe necke receiued sharp edge thereof killed otherwise woulde soone haue killed meat foodethey liue mountaines also killed poison else hunted armed men horseback included multitude hunting perilous therefore must inclosed great company take ditch heard lyon taken others snare ginnes laide vppon rockes stone whensoeuer hunted dog run directly wood next tree wherein killed gunshot summer time weake liue among rockes neuer strayinge farre owne lodging hurting man vntill autumn hunt wilde goat follow rocke rocke leaping fast faster goates hunt also wilde cat hare little beast greatest linxes hunt harte assesola mag manner wee haue saide already get vp tree ly waite prey vntill espy vnder boughes suddenly leape necke thereof whether man great beast wherein fix clawes fast violence shake sharpenesse teeth bite scull eate braines vtter destruction man beaste whomsoeuer light vpon small beast eate whole body thereof onely braines singular note forgetfulnesseyet wonderfull secret nature although belong afflicted hunger yet eate meate heare noise chaunce cause turne meat sight forgette prey notwithstanding theyr hungerpliny goe seeke another bootey neuer remembring themsolinus yet returne backe againe eate thereof voice beast called speciall worde latine orcare corcare may english croaking whining voice thereof great therefore author philomela saith dum linxes orcando fraemunt vrsus ferus vncat linxe croaketh wilde beare whineth arlunus saith corcare vox lupae ceruarij croake voice linxthe voice linx sight linxes thought beastes seeme brightly poet faine eiesight pierceth euery solid body although thicke wall yet offer vnto thinge transparent much offended sometimes blinded cannot tell whether sight attributed linxe truely accordinge nature fabulously imitation poeticall fiction lynceus whome saide auncient time hee sawe thorough stone walles whome horace writeth thus non possis oculo quantum contendere lynceus non tamen id circo contemnas lippus vngi marcus tullius also saith mannero pheus admiration lynceus eyesight thogh darkenes hinder quis est tam lynceus qui tantis tenebris nihil offendat apollonius saith great perfection man eyesight beleeued see perfectly downe earth hell plutarch saith could see thrugh tree rock pausanias writeth king raigned danaouita pyndarus writeth ida lynceus son aphaneus contention growing betwixt ida castor pollux marriage helena twaine would haue rauished phoebe ilayra wiues ida fable poet linceus lynceus therefore slay castor afterwards lynceus slew pollux spyed lie vnder oake mountaine taygetus wherefore iupiter slew ida lightning placed castor pollux heauen among star another lynceus husband hypermnestra theocritus daughter danau danau hauing commanded daughter night time kill husband onely spared hir husband lynceus truth lynceus many fable eiesight first found mine goldcoelius siluer brasse earth therefore simple people seeing bring golde siluer earth comming vpon digging deepe vsing light candle neuer brought pit foolishly imagined sight eies first led seeke treasurespalaephatus hence came common prouerb lynceo perspicacior man excellent eyesight conclude others say lynceus could see new moone day night changed therefore fame eyesight came celebrated neuer mortall man saw sight himselfe excepted fable lynceus came opinion singular perspicacity beast linx said sight excellent farre excelling men galen saith like also sight egles hold extraordinarie miraculous sence beast manner poet feigne lynceus except said omnes imbeciliore sumus cernendi potestate si aquilarum et lyncis acuminibus conferamur therefore prouerb spoken may well bee applyed metaphecically beast linxe poetically man lynceus much may suffice sight reported also see themselues taken send forth teares weepe plentifully vrine render backewards n spreng vrine teares weeping vrine congeled medicinal sto e onely female male also wherein differ beast said knowing certaine vertue vrine hide sand thereof commeth certaine pretious stone called lyncurium brighnesse resembleth amber yet congealed hardned sand carbuncle harder shining like fire wherewithall make sealing ring caused ouid write thus victa racemifero lyncas dedit india baccho equibus vt memorant quicquid vesicaremisit vertitur lapides congelat aere tacto say male commeth fiery yellowe amber female commeth white pale amber italy call langurium beast languria lange lyncurium called electrum pterygophoron say draw vnto leaues strawe plate brasse yron according opinion diocles theophrastus drunke water good stomacke conuenient fluxe belly according dioscorides cureth paine reines healeth king euill according solinus theophrastus goeth establish opinion reason laboreth perswade probable vrine linx congeale stone among sand well vrine man ingender stone raines bladder opinion pliny theophrastus hesychius varinus zenothimis plutarch aristotle opinion fable theophrast himselfe confesseth lyncurium caleth lyngurion amber hualos digged earth lyguria sudines metradorus say certain tree lyguria amber taken tree blacke popler also probable seeing amber first brought greece lyguria according denomination strange thing called lyngurium name country whereupon ignorant la ines feigne etimology worde lyncurium quasi lynxis vrinam vppon weake foundation haue raised vaine buildinge demonstration truth dioscorides saith discourse popler growing riuer euridanus sendeth forth certaine humor like teares groweth hard whereof make called electrum rubbed smelleth sweete hath onely power draw vnto brasse iron thinges gold also called chrysophoton vnto lucianus subscribeth whereas said italy amberstone begotten neare riuer padus stand many white poplers coniecture like humor may issue onely accident affinity nature condensate stone people finding couered sand vnder tree former perswasion might easily take stone ingendred vrine linx hermolaus also writeth lycurium groweth certaine stone kind mushrom padstoole cut yearely another groweth roome part roote foot left stone groweth hard flint thus doth stone encrease naturall fecundity admirable thing saith could neuer brought beleeue vntill eate thereof myne owne house euax recyted syluaticus saith vrine linx domi seruatus generat optimos sungos supra se quotanis reserued home one house bringeth forth euery yeare best mushroms also called lapis litzi lapis prasius deuided three kindes iaspis armeni cu lapis phrigius called also belemintes wherewithall chirurgians prussia pomerania cure greene wound phisitians breake stone bladder true lyncurium extant day currant among apothecary light pummisstone big filleth man fist blackish colour russet russet solide sandy fat bruised eaten tasteth like earth kind couered little white skin apparant spungy tenatious substance take mushrom whereof hermolaus speaketh little stone small skinnes may coniectured corpus heterogones interracoalescens hetrogenian body encreasing earth wherewithall hath affinity another stone vrine linx seen sauoy substance wherof clearely christal forme triangular hardnes might strike fire colour partly white partly like wine mingled water conclude vrine linx may engender stone though manner saide arabian iorath affirmeth seauen day rendring turneth stone lyncurius property called amber gum spoken although catacrestically called true bee certaine mushroms neare redsea heat sunne hardned stone also may follow naturally stone may produce mushroms againe dissolution constitution thing thought grounded vpon principle thus much shal suffice vrine linx stone made thereof skin noble peece amulet bee worne falling sicknesse loue beast young one great like pardals lion tygers king tartaria hath tame linxes vseth hunting instead dog ancient pagan dedicated beast bacchus wilde tree woodes agricola calleth woodmartin baummarder bycause liueth part tree saith neuer forsaketh woodes sildome therefore thing differeth firremartin heerein seemeth deceiued ascribeth firremartin excelentthe vse skin chuse best prince picture marten great noble clothed therwith euery skinne woorthe french crowne foure shillinges least much beter whit haires aspersed among yellowe ordinary colour deep browne yellowe cleane white foure time worse former therefore solde aboue three foure groat peece howsoeuer saying martiall venator capta marte superbus ad est heere commeth proud fire annointed vpon eielids one pield bare presently procure haire grow thereon mousedung dried shade excellent remedy voyding spetting blood floweth part body especially bellyalexius pedemontanas also good staunch blood issueth woundes new made white scenyseede dung mouse hare put broath stem stalke fennell boyled together afterwards giuen vnto woman drinke destitute milke breastes presently speedily procure milke great aboundance dung mouse steeped washed raine water doth ease refresh swelling woman dug time deliuery dung mouse giuen drinke liquor one troubled disease called collick stone drinke short space time cure mouse dung also taken drinke doth loose body either man woman fast soeuer bound excellent remedy arising mousedung sciatica hipgout take nine graines mouse dung mixed mingled halfe pinte winemarcellus giuen party grieued vpon bench footestoole drinke drinke standing vpon foot paineth euen sun rising hauing drunke let leape downe afterwardes let leape three time let three day together hee shall haue present help remedy diseasedioscorides auicenmousedung mixed frankincense sweete wine drunke one troubled collick stone presently ease dung mouse mingled frankincense water hony boiled together drunke doth onely driue away paine aforesaid disease also doth breake quite dissolue stonepliny mousedung also taken drinke selfe alone doth dissolue melt stone bladder also boyled water good profitable cannot make water new made annointed vpon belly one troubled collicke stone shall finde present ease remedy thereby yet moreouer another excellent medicine say rat water hereunto agree pliny theophrastus likewise riuer cassinus auncient wisemen follower zoroastres made great account hedghog hated deadly waterrats said could kil deare acceptable god according seueral name alpinemouse alpine mouse taketh name alpes wherein bred althogh many kindes mouse bred alpes yet principal thereof receiueth denomination mountaines bred top mountaines sildom neuer come root italian cal marmota murmont according matheolus marmontana rhaetians montanella part italy varrosa fraunce marmote although marmot word also among munkey german especially heluetians corrupt word drawne mouse mountain murmelthier murmentle mistbellerle reason sharpe whining voyce like little dog latine called also emptra seemeth compounded embdor least kind alpine mouse found german region wee wil speake end story som take called taxus amongst brassauolus one yet hath property alpine mouse except lying caue doeth sleepe winter hath outward resemblance mouse neither haue affinity disposition maner liuing therfore canot assent thereto grapaldus alununs learned italian say armelins called alpine mouse wherunto led sleepe al winter long like alpine mouse wee shall shew binis pedibus gradiuntur prioribus que vt manibus vtuntur say mouse egypt like alpin mouse sit vpon buttock goe foremost two foot also vse insteed hand collect like alpine mouse quantity beast seuerall partsthe alpine mouse quantity like hare least betwixt hare cony fat thicker body cat shorter legges outward appearance like mouse therefore called alpine mouse backe broad haire harder harsher cony colour part yellowmathaeolus cleare others obscure browne eye reasonable quantity standing farre head eares short like cropt eares head like hare foot long nail foreteeth like squirrel taketh meat like squirrell ape sitting meane time vpon buttockes backe also fatte although part body leane yet backe cannot said fat rather like cowes vdder neither fat flesh encrease grow bredth length description great alpine mouse scaliger describeth manner marmot saith tearmeth alpine mouse french beast bignesse badger hauing haire tayle much like manner short legges little eares long sharp firme crooked strong blacke clawes numbred amongst kind mouse holdeth little correspondence except like squirell taketh meate forefoot hand eateth sitting vppon taile agree also dormouse sleepe passe ouer winter sleeping teeth like teeth hare mouse made tame hurtfull men child except prouoked kept house eat gnaw linnen woolen cloath thus farre scaliger haue shewed already outward appearance tayle mouth residew draw caue cannot affirme certainely whether truth falsehood reason leadeth author thereunto haue beene found bald backe certaine snow begin couer mountaines doe enter dennes shut vp close passage stickes grasse earth hard thicke easier breake solide ground mouthes caues safely encluded feare hunter raine snow cold liue vntill spring without manner meate drinke gathered round together like hedghogge sleeping continually therefore people inhabiting alpes haue common prouerbetheir continual sleepe al winter time expresse drowsie sleepy fellow german tongue thus er musse notwithstanding close stopping mouth caues yet bee depriued refrigeration fresh ayre expiration respiration considered haue beene long tamed sleepe much wild thinke continuall eating rawe greene hearbes ingendereth many humor cannot bee dispersed without along continuing sleepe afterwardes dieted meate prouided nourishment man eased cause effect ceaseth time sleepe grow fat awaked aduantage especially presence men dog dare resist defend themselues wilde also killed asleepe putting knife throate whereat forefeete stirre little dye bee awaked blood saued vessell afterwards mouse translateth akbar hebrew word mouse glirem dormouse giueth reason country east meaning graetia doe say myoxus dormouse myoxus epiphanius ankerot alleadged prooue resurrection myoxus saith animal semestre moritur rursus post tempore sua revivisset dormouse halfe yeere olde dyeth hir full time reuiueth againe booke heresy speaketh thus origen description dormouse epiphanius tradunt naturae rerum experti myoxum latitare foetus suos sinaul eodem loco multos parere quinque amplius viperus autem ho venari si inuenerit totum latibulum ipsa vipera quum non posset omnes deuorare pro vna vice ad satietatem cdit vnum aut duo reliquorum vero oculos expungit cibos affert excaecatosque enutrit donec voluerit vnumquem que eorum deuorare si vero contigerit vt aliqui inexperti ho incidant ipsos que cibum sumant venenum sibi ipsis sumunt eos qui viperae veneno sunt enutriti sic etiam tu origines groeca doctrina mente excaecatus venenum qui tibi crediderunt e omuisti factus e ipsis edulium venenatum ita vt per quae ipse iuiuria affectus e per e plus iniurta afficeris philosopher cunning nature thing doe write dormouse doth lye hid bring forth many yoong one place lyeth fiue time viper doe hunt destroy viper finde nest cannot eate one time first filleth hir selfe one two putteth eye residue afterwards bringeth meat nourisheth blind vntill time stomack serueth eat euery one happen meane time man chaunce light vpon vipersnourished blinde dormise kill eat poyson themselues venom viper hath left fareth thee origem thou art blinded graecians doctrin dost vomit poison hart beleeue thee thou art made vnto venemous meate whereby thou dost wrong others thou hast bene wrongd thy selfe manifest myoxus neither toad frog dormous charme made ass vrine haue shewed already story gallus bibit non meijet myoxus meijet non bibit whether render vrine drinke cocke drinketh maketh water dormous maketh water neuer drinketh whether true neuer drinketh dare affirme certain drinketh sildome ought wonder make water tame cony long feed vpon greene hearbes render abundance vrine yet neuer drink graecians also call beast elayos although word likewise signifie squirel maesia wood italy neuer founde dormous except time littering bigger quantity squirrel colour variable somtimes blackthe quantity colour seuerall partes somtimes grisled sometimes yellowe backe alwaies white belly hauing short haire thinner skinne pontike mouse also found heluetia clarona biting angry beast therefore sildome taken aliue beake snowt long eares short pricked taile short hairy ende middle belly swelleth downe betwixt breast loyns narrow trussed vp together alwaies fat cause called lardironi buckemast acceptable meat vnto doth greatly fatten themtheir food much delighted walnut climbe tree eat apple according albertus saith truely delighted iuyce apple hath bin oftentimes sounde vnder apple tree haue opened much fruite taken nothing kernel wit policie hauing gathered aple presently put twist tree betwixt bowes sitting vpon vppermost bough presse assunder also grow fat meanes auncient time wont keepe coopes tunnes also garden paled boord beech walnut tree growingnorishers nourishing dormouse straungers come among seperated either mountaine riuersociety charity pliny discry fight death nourish parent old age singular piety haue shewed already howe destroyed viper certaine serpentes lie wait old age doth end euery winter exceeding sleepy therefore martiall saith somniculosos illi porrigit glires grow fat sleeping therefore ausonius hath elegant verse dic cessante cibo somno quis fat like swine flesh ammianus marcellinus wondereth delicacy age table called ballaunces weigh fish member dormouse done saith hee without anye dislike present thinges heretofore vsed comended daily bite fight ful courage therefore hath receiued nature ornament defence hath bonie helmet couering head braine standeth vp vppon hinder legges resembleth colour proportion bearof arctomys cause writer haue interpreted beast called arctomys thus described saint ierom creature saith abounding region palastina dwelling alwaies hole rockes caues earth exceeding quantity hedgehogge compounded fashion betwixt mouse beare haue shewed already alpine mous therefore wee stand confute name crycetus seemes deriued illirian word read gelenig skuzecziek beast saith common northern part world also place figure shape resembleth beare quantity neuer exceedeth great sorex hath short taile almost like taile goeth vpon two leg especially mooued wrath vseth forefeete steade handsthe voracity cricetus much strength hath courage would fiercefull beare little beast afraide leape hunter face although doe great harme either teeth nailes argument exceeding hot bold eager vppermost chap hath long sharp teeth growing two two hath large wide cheekes alwaies fill carrying carrying eate whereupon deuouring fellow one stasimus seruant plautus called crycetus hamster filleth mouth well pingler meate forefeete like mould short altogether broad digeth earththe making den maketh hole den diggeth far cannot cast earth hole carrieth foorth mouth den within maketh large receiue corne prouision fruite sustentation whereinto diggeth many hole winding turning euery way may safe beast hunt neuer killed den also man digge earth may find lodging difficultie haruest time carrieth graine sort author saith neque minus colligendo industrius quam eligendo conseruandoque est astutus optimum enim reponit lesse industrious gathering prouision crafty pollitike choice keeping lay vp best lest rot vnder earth biteth fibre taile graine laying vp residue amongst grasse stubble lie gaping ouer gathered graine euen couetous man described satyre sleeping vpon money bagges groweth fatte sleepe like dormouse cony hole caue narrow sliding wear haire earth commeth hole doth lie heapes like molehils despersed abroad fittest multitude hole hole passage covered earth hole part goeth knowne footepathe hath hinderaunce place goeth obscure hid shee goeth backwardes male femal enhabit one caue younge one brought forth leaue old den seeke new habitation male perfidity haue prepared al sustenance brought hee doth shut female suffereth approch nie reuengeth perfidiousnes deccipt going adioyning caue doeth likewise perta e fruit laid vp store secret hole caue male neuer perceiuing nature hath wonderfully foreseene pouerty al creature neither otherwise amongst canot equity perform fraud also commeth speech common people one wil thriue yong country wench concerning matter chaunt verse vnpleasant contented expresse iambickes consisting foure foot hamester ipse cum sua prudens catus que coniuge stipat profundum pluribus per tempus antrum frugibus possitque solus vt frui lectis aceruis hordei auarus antro credulam extrudit arte comugem serua inquit exiens foras coeli serena pluuias sed foeminis quis insitam vincant dolis astutiam nouum parans cuniculum furatur omne triticum egens maritus perfidam quaerit per antrum coniugem nec se repellat blandulis demulcit inuentam sunis ille esse iam communiae seruata dum sinit bona perfidus multiplices opponit intus obices rursus fruuntur mutuis antris cibis amplexibus beast doth deuoure kinde fruitehis meate foode nourished house eateth bread flesh also hunteth fielde mouse taketh meate raiseth himselfe vpon fore feete also wont forefeete stroake head eares mouth thing squirrell cat doe also beauer amongest creature liue well water land although bodie seemeth small notwithstanding nature apt fight furious prouoked carriage mouth beateth away feete resisteth directly inuading enemiethe anger furie beast spirite assaulting mouth wayward threatning whence countreymen accustomed say one angry breatheth wrath mouth like hamster dis spruest vuie ein hamster neither easily affrighted although far vnequall vnto strength combate wherefore doe giue place prouerbe countreymen doe call man madly rash ein tollen hamster foolehardy hamster flieth one doth sharply resist doth greedily follow flie selfe saw one assaulting horse gat nose would neuer leaue holde vntill killed sword taken diuers meanesof taking beast expelled either hot water powred den choaked within diged vp mattocke spade killed dogges sometimes pulled foxe hurt oppressed snare great waight put conclude taken art aliue night time goeth seeke prey day time part lyeth hid vsuall caue haue said taken path worne pot put earth afterward made plaine like place fielde earth cast bottome pot deepenesse two finger aboue euery couering pot placed stone helde vp peece wood bound fragment bread space betweene caue pot crumes bread scattered following leaping pot wood falling taken taken manner beastes toucheth foode broad stone one couer pauementes make roofetiles shall ioyned vnto pot beast taken hardly knowne morning spirit beast shut waxing wroth pearcing thinesse doth moisten stone skin hamster durable certaine long coates come downe vnto heeles diuers coulored cloakes made woman misena silesia doe vsethe vse skin account honorable blacke red coulour broad gards edge skinnes otter coates part vallued price fifteene twentie renensian crownes doth outweare length three foure garment made either linnen wollen cloath turingia misena beast frequent notwithstanding place turingia chiefest abode efurdanus salcensis misena lipsia field pegensis euidently may distinctly handle thinges pliny hath shewed v concerning woodmouse write downe seperately selfe afterwards concerning mouse hath name deriued filburds german haue left writing selfe haue
