strength body latines cal mule mulus semiasinus halfe asse one side horse side asse therefore condicions resembleth asse horse whereupon lyeth tale certaine lydian mule eeing image water grew afraid greatnesse thereof thervpon tooke heeles ran away fast could neither could stayed al wit keepersplutarch length mule remembring son asse staied course came backe againe neighing italian call mule mulo female mula like latines spaniard french mulet female mule whence commeth english word mule german multhire mulesel illirians meseck fleming mul kind mulesthere another kind mule syria diuers procreated copulation mare asse receiue name fro similitude face cause wilde ass called ass onely similitude tame ass among wilde ass singularly swift also among syrian mule excellent speedy courser mule procreate owne kinde admit mixture aristotle proued nine brought phrygia day pharnacas father pharnabazi theophrastrus also reporteth cappadocia mule engender among themselus aristotle remembreth wonder hee might well haue spared kind cat el among themseluesaelianus flock ass mare india mare willingly admit ass copulation bring forth red mule best running generation burdensbut among indian phyllians ass mule ox horse bigger ram mule begotten betwixt asse mare burdon begotten betwixt horse sheeasse wherefore italian call mulo bastardo isthe p t mu bastard mule mule resembleth asse horse burdon resembleth horse asse reason kind followe father mule hath part proper asse long eares terrible voyce crosse vpon shoulder small foot leane body al thing resembleth horse length eares serueth instead foretop colour somewhat browne varieth roman cardinal haue mule ashcolour great one long tailes change teeth haue number sixe thirty necke like neck ass long standing vpright belly simple one quantity want gall like fourefootedbeastes thing heart like bone haue shewed story asse foode assesthey eate food horsses ass grow fat drinking yet drinke like horse thrusting nose water onely touch lipsmizaldus dioscorides loue cucumber aboue meates flower leaues rododaphne poyson mule assesthe lenght mule life many fourefootedbeastes mule horse grow first comming forth teeth age discerned teeth come forth hard know age female kind greater liuely liue longer male hath beene found haue liued fourescore yeares age one presented athens time pericles builded temple minerua reason age dismissed labour yet afterwardes would forsake companion went exhorting neighing vndergoe labour cheerefully wherevpon publike decree saide mule haue ordinary prouender appointed prytanium aristotle aelianus body driue away corne eate although market place generatio muleswe haue shewed already beast engendered betwixt assea mare therefore man would create vnto himselfe notable breede mule must looke choyce male female first female shee great bodythe election mare beare mule sound bone singular good shape wherein must much expect velosity aptnesse runne strength endure labour especially beare wombe discordant foale begotten asse confer vpon property bodie disposition mare vnwillingly receiue genitall seede asse fole doth grow perfection mare bellypliny vntill haue borne thirteene monthes whereby resembleth sluggish dul nature father vigor mother helping copulation pull certaine haires taile female afterwardes binde together therewith choice mulethere lesser regarde stallion lest want iudgment choyce frustrate experiment seeing therefore engendered betwixt mare asse betwixt mare wildeasse mule begotten betwixt wilde asse mare doth excell others swiftnesse course hardnesse foote generosity stomack yet tame asse better breed wilde asse beautifull outward forme tractable disposition mule engendered wildeasses may compared yet neuer tamed retaine quality wildefather therefore mule begotten betwixt meane betwixt wilde male asse tame female asse fitter nephewes sonnes foales may beget good mule tamable tractable descent breaketh corruption nature themselues neuer proue profitable therefore commodious necessary gett stalion asse procreation mule whose kinde experiment excellent outward partes euery way acceptable long great body stronge necke stronge broade rib wide breast full muscle loines full sinnewes stronge compacted legges colour blackish spotted mouse colour vulgar fit mule folly man allow approue euery colour looketh vpon therefore collumella writeth spot vppon tongue pallet ram also found wooll lambe begetteth also asse haue diuers coloured haires vpon eye browes vpon eares foale bringeth forth hath colour skin hereunto agree paladius absirtus saying wil haue good breed mule must get asse elegant forme great stature square member great head like horse face cheekes lip smal eies standing head little hollow broad nosthrils great eares hanging standing vpright broad long necke broade breast rough pleights muscle strong endure kicking mare great breastes plate partes vnder shoulder downe legges ought strong broad corpulent standing farre assunder may easily couer mare great backe broad backebone neither hollow standing vp bunch bearing direct line vpon middle shoulder low standing vp hipbone ful longe bending narrowely pinde buttockt standing sharpe best haue shortest tailes furthermore let stone great knee great round standing alike legges bony without flesh nothing appearing nerues skin standing awry yet diuers colour pastern high yet ouerlow foot low bending inward hoofe thicke hollow within inward part cleare according saying iuvenall nam que hic mundae nitet vngula mulae voice cleare hoarse mare wil terrified copulation colour ought likewise cleare black hauing white belie somewhat looking towards purple hauing one blacke spot vppon mouth rather blacke tongue haue bin brought vp horse fashion take wilde ass tame make stalions generation beget best mule liberally fed enclosed neuer waxe wilde againe bee put among tame ass young one gotten like syer haue desire make mule strange coloursabsirtus must couer female cloth colour wherewithal desire young one foaled haue shewed already discourse horsses whereby raysed many excellent kind ras else bring presence time copulation great male horsse asse fight whereof made fruitfull againe base dispisable beast offered view doth make conceiue noble mule wilde ass time heauy willing couer mare let another female asse brought presence sight whereof lust burneth rageth almost madnesse copulation therefore denyed asse doth willingly leape vpon mare loathed againe must regarded stalion bee tyed bound fast may couer mare foal yet haue accesse vnto least kicking biting cause abortment many time breake bond asunder greatly trouble female young therefore accustomed labour taketh downe heate lust yet time couer mare must vse diligence awaken drousie nature beast greater spirit seede male female may meete together ass lybia wil couer mare haue mane vntil shorne seemeth disdaine female shoulde haue ornamentes themselues theyr husband haue shewed already discourse asse mare doe willingly admit stalion asse couer except one sucke mare called horsesuckling equimulgus cause men propound vnto themselues nourish ras mule take colt asse soon foald put mare giuing milke darke place wherein mare doubting fraud deceiued willingly yealdeth vdders ass foale whereunto accustomed ten day together last taketh stalion asse loueth mare exceedingly side mare refuseth say although sucke mother milke yet time weaning bee brought vp among horssecolts good sucked mare asse small stalion quickly waxe olde yssue worse therefore must prouide largest strongest ass nourish best hay barly strength may abound copulation ought vnder three yeares olde yet brought vnto mare neuer knew male one beate away heeles mouth bring perpetuall hatred kind wherefore vse bring vile vulgar asse presence mare woo prouoke copulation beate away may hinderance stallion seem admit desirous copulation take away bring appointed stalion roome mule engendered effecting copulation must place appointed purpose betwixt two wals hauing narrow passage mare may haue liberty fight asse mare head must tyed downe manger racke ground fashioned forefoot may stand much lower hinder ascend backward intent asse may easily leape vpon back receiue seed deepely mare hath brought forth mule giueth suck halfe yeare driueth away ought brought vp mountain hard place hoofes may grow hard indurable thus discoursed generation mule followeth enquire whether mule thus engendered betwixt asse mare doth likewise bring forth owne kind obseruatumest saith pliny e duobus diuersis generibus tertij generis fieri neutri parentum esse similia ea que ipsa qu ita nata sunt non gignere omni animalium genere id circo mulas parere say hath beene obserued two diuers kind third hath beene engendered yet like neither parent engendered procreate others vniuersall kind beastes among al creature therfore mule conceiued betwixt ass mare bring forth young whereupon camerarius made pretty riddle mule dissimilis patri matri diuersa figura confusi generis generi non apta propago ex alijs nascor nec quisquam nascitur ex democritus opinion also mule cannot conceiue secret place like beastes issue confused kind neuer engender especially mule made diuers seedes meane diuers quantity almost contrary seede asse cold seede mare hot aristotle disputing matter concerning kind procreated diuers parent writeth sort beast ioyne copulation whose kind although diuers yet nature disagreeable quantity stature alike time going young equall yet remaine barren begotten cause empedocles democritus yeald reason empedocles obscurely democritus plainly neither wel alledge demonstration beast kind democritus saith passage mule corrupted wombes beginning doth consist one kind reason happeneth also beastes engender empedocles yealds reason plutarch ioyning together seedes therefore compareth commixtion tinne brasse together hee saith doth vnderstand meaning therefore proceedeth expresse owne opinion word frist saith euery one male beget one owne kinde female cannot conceiue great wonder horsses alwaies fitte generation mare bring forth coltes beyng couered therfore ass mare doe couple together issve may barren receiue greater hinderance diuersity kinde besides coldnesse ass seed may bee one great cause barrennesse haue another property doe breed engender casting theyr coltes coltsteeth remaine steril barren al life long doth generatiue power ass body rest vpon tickle nicepoint apt rise easie fal away nothing like sort horse prone barrennesse wanteth nothing cold substance mingled seede commeth passe seede asse mixed wanteth little ass seed waxeth barren owne kind therefore much meeteth beside nature kind also hapneth mule body grow exceeding great especially haue menstruous purgation therefore annual breeding procreation helpe refreshing flower conceiue nourish wanting vnto mule vnfitte procreation excrement body kinde purge vrine apeareth malemules neuer smell secret female vrine residue voided vrine turneth encrease quantity greatnesse body whereby commeth passe female mule doe conceiue foale yet able bring forth perfection thinges dispersed norishment owne body imployed nourishment foale cause egyptian describe barren woman picture mule alexander aphroditius writeth thus also sterility mule orus emblem mule saith seeme barren consist beast diuers kind commixtion seedes differ habite nature doe euermore worke something contrary nature abolishing generation mingling together blacke white colour destroy blacke white produce swart brown neyther appeare browne generation mule whereby habituall generatiue power nature vtterly destroyed created compounde eminent kindes simple seuerall thing saith alcmaeon related plutarch saith male mule barren reason thinnesse coldnes seed female wombes shut vp veines carry seede expell menstruous purgation vtterly stopt empedocles diocles say wombe low narrowe passage crooked leade therefore cannot receiue seede conceiue young whereunto also wilingly yeeld b cause hath bin often found woman haue beene barren cause conclude therefore mule beare sildome particular nation natural else coltes prodigious accounted monster concerning natural birth hot region exterior heat doeth temper coldnesse ass seed may bring forth therefore columella varro say many part affricke colt mule familiar common colt mare part europe reason probable vnto memules engender mule may engender hotte country mule engender often rome else cause engender affricke may affrican mule like syrian mule spoken special kinde themselues called mule resemblaunce nature hath beene seene mule hath brought forth twinnes held prodigy herodotus fourth book recordeth two story mule procreation darius saith besieged babilon babilonians scorned army getting vp top tower pipe dance presence persian also vtter violent oprobrius speeehes darius whole army amongest one babilonians said thus quid istic desidetis persae quin potius absceditis tunc ex pugnaturi no cum peperint mulae ye persian sit heer wisdome would teach depart away mule bring forth young one may ouercome babilonians thus spake babilonian beleeuing persian neuer overcome common prouerbe epean emionoi tekosin mule beareth young one poore man spake truer aware followed yeare seuen monthes siedge yet lasteda history mule hapned certain mule belonging zopyrus sonne megabiz brought forth young one whereat maister much mooued hee remembred aforesaid song babilonian therefore might made author fact communicated matter darius presently entertayned deuice therefore zopirus cut owne nose eares ranne away babilonians telling darius thus vsed perswaded depart whole armye babilon hee saide inexpugnable inuincible babilonians seeing wound trusting owne strength easilye giue credence vnto nature men best way beguile tel thinges desire hope perswaded receiue assurance proceed zopyrus insinuated himselfe fauor babilonians many valiant actes persian whereby got much credit last made generall whole army betraied citty vnto handes darius thus babilon taken mule brought foor h another mule brought forth young one time xerxes passed ouer hellespont go graecia innumerable troopes souldiors said mule broght forth genitals male female vnto may adde another story swetonius life galba caesar father procuring augurismes brings forth young one thing afterwardes happened vnto galba birth mule confirmed enterprise hee attempted empire thing prodigy cause sorrowe wonder people vnto ominous confirmation ioye gladnes hee remembered grandfather sacrifice saying therefore ill saide democritus mula non naturae opus sed humanae machinationis adulterinum inventum furtum esse videntur mule proper worke nature adulterous rather beleeve ass horse ranne wilde wildernesse among themselues wilde ass first beganne race male seuen yeares old may engender hotter nature female also doth generation conferre part bodily groath yong one sometimes engendereth hath lost foremost teeth first copulation neuer engendreth aristotle quantity mule oa e young one generated called ginnus pumilio dwarfe according obseruation martiall tibi de mulis non est metuenda ruina altius terris pene sedere sol kept court duke ferraria although al thinges resemble mother yet named father also burdones spoken story horse mule begotten mare sheasses bulles yet best begotten betwixt asse mare thus much generation mule nourished meate horse ass annoyed sickness cured mean generaly bloodletting good dyet bullimunge scythia ablde cold therefore horse vsed instead mule country horse abide colde ass mule beare herodotus writeth haue shewed story asse graecians troy destroyed consuming pestilence firste company dyed dogges mule reason pestilence arising earth sence smelling quicke kind first draw poysonne earth collumella saith medicine ox doe also cure mulessicknesses mule cure yet speciall medicine bee neglected expresse place mule hath feuer giue raw cabbadge one short winded vse blood letting drinke giue pinte wine oyle mixed halfe ounce frankinsence halfe pint iuyce horehound scratch disease hooues lay barley meale make fashion commaunded souldiors fetch burden vilde seruice himselfe would put hande vnto signifieth properly bearing backe coltstaffe say english whereuppon poore men carry burden thence translated prouerbe signifie obey commaunds giue another reason prouerbe say scipio besiege numantia onely determin looke weapon souldiours also horse mule chariot marius brought forth horse nourished himselfe delicately besides horse mule comely body farre excelling mule gentlenesse strength therefore seeing emperor delighted beast marius would make mention mule length came common iest call double diligent seruant mulus marianus italian doe commonly call men mule base borne lawfull marriage concerning disposition mule well obserued aristotle mule alwaies tame alunnus inward disposition mule time wilde abate vntamable nature drinking wine operation wine heeles hard part resolue grow soft reason ape drinking wine loose nail men accustomed drunkennesse fal palsy dispersing discussing nature wine dissolueth nerues harde thinges body beast euen water dissolueth hard fruit pea vineger maketh lead soft egge may drawne thorough ring nature mule haue drunke wine feele themselues disarmed therefore giue ouer resist kicking backewardes receiue harme giue thus guiltines owne weakenes maketh gentle willes otherwise hate mankindpliny nothing tractable horse varro saith haue much confidence heeles alone kil wolues come among vse mule seueral workes cardan mule wont vsed plowing carying men burthen part europe iudges great prince ride vppon vntill olde sell poore men turne mountaines suffer runne wilde til hoofes hardned long trauailes take vppe againe haue beene also accustomed ploughing according verse quantum mularum sulcus praecedit aruo tantumis praecurrit mule plough speedily come landes end quickly either oxe horse martiall saith vsed cart draw timber according verse vix que datur long mulorum vincere mandras quae que trahi multo marmora fune vides also vsed race game olympus custome whensoeuer came loaded salt ouer water fell downe easing cariage master perceauing craft day loaded woole spunges beast comming ouer water fell downe wont doe salt comming water felt load grow heauier wont doe steed lessening whereat beast much mused therefore neuer afterward durst lye downe water feare like increase load obseruation loue friendship ariseth prouerbe mutuum muli scabunt mule emperor eye rubbed themselues vpon marble thinking get much fauour libertie fellow gotten emperor seeing perceauing fetch bid rub one another thereupon came prouerbe thus much naturall discourse mule lodging another houre reuiued againe like cat taken hutch chest constrained likewise astonish club afterwardes grew inuent engine put beast take hutch rope cord remoue place place keeper affirmed seeme much disdaine lion oftentimes endeuored fight kept asunder grate would hurt little dog put hungry great dog wer put vnto tore piece although belly neuer ful angry vter voice like angry dog double arr twice also bigger dog proceeding large breast wide artery much like howling great mastiue shut vp close roome alone say longer dog appeare england many mastiue dog long yet euery way greater kind dog vaine report haue said man beast bitten ounce presently mouse flock vnto poison vrine seene england two keeper wounded shreudly bitten one ounce followed harme followweth biting ordinary dogge like small incision knife hee neuer fighteth head trecherously perceiue aduersary strong great counterfetting quietnesse beneuolence peace hee ment harme serued great mastiue dogge england first sight seemed applaud comming looking cheerefully vppon wagging taile presently fell downe belly inuite dogge com neare submission lastly got close vnto creeping though hee would play putting one feete cat play wherewithall great dogge grew secure began nothing mistrust beast length ounce saw opportunity suddenly leaped vpon necke tooke throate pulled killed nailes opened dogges breast taking heart eate people cruell manner thus far docter cay speaketh ounce beside author know gall beast deadly poyson hateth creature destroyeth especially men therefore may wel said possessed dauid kimhi better learned men interpret wilde oxe haebrew dischon may opinion bee translated yet heerein referre learned reader certaine kinde wilde goates description differing nothinge haire groweth auerie like beast falling backeward hinder partes forward toward head also affirmed aethiopian bul saye rhinocerot bred lybia egypt either country yedeth testimony rare proper quality quantity resembleth roe hauing beard vnder chinne colour white pale like milke mouth blacke spot vpon cheekes backebone reaching head double broad fat horne standing vpright blacke sharpe cannot bee blunted brasse yron pierce readily aristotle pliny opinion beast bisulcus vnicornis clouenfooted one horne original opinion came wildeonehornedgoat whereof schnebergerus late writer writeth thus certum est minineque dubium carpatho monte versus russiam transyluaniam que reperirifer simile omnino rupicapris exc pto quod vnicum cornu ex medium fronte enascitur nigrum dorso inflexum simile omnino rupicaprarum cornibus say without al controuersie wilde beast mountaine carpathus towards russia transyluania like wilde goates except haue one horne growing middle head blacke bending backward like horne wild goat true oryx described oppianus differeth pliny stature horne aelianus saith orix hath foure horne speaketh indian orix whereof yearely presented king may elsewhere diuersity region breede diuersity stature colour haire horne simion cethi affirmeth muskat hath one horne vnlikely hath seene one orix may kind concerning horne related herodotus pollux laur valla made instrument musicke cithern lute vppon whose belly musitians played musicke striking hand beast great ox al may true notwithstanding wee haue shewed alreadie big roe plinie speaking relation sight likelie seene young one also seabeasts called oryges orcae egipt orix rising canis syrius little dogge perpetually sorrowful cause lybians mock egyptian fable day little dogstar riseth orix speaketh contrarie themselues acknowledge often said starre ariseth sunne al goates turne east looke vpon obseruation goates certaine anie rule astronomer lybians affirme doe presage great store raineplutarch elianus change weather egyptian also say moone commeth neare east looke intentiuely vpon vpon sufferaign goddesse make great noise yet say doe loue hate appeareth knocking legges ground fastening eies vpon earth like angry moones appearance selfe thing rising sunne cause auncient king obseruer one tell time day sitting vpon one beast whereby accurately perceiued sun rysing turning taile emptying belly cause orix egyptian discipher impure godlesse wretch seeing creature nourished sunne moone therefore ought reioyce appearing onely filthy wretch disdaineth scorneth reason reioyce little doggestarre body doe perceiue euident alteration time yeare cold weather raine ouerpassed vapor warm sun descending vpon earth cloth withall manner greene pleasant hearbs flower another kind orix according columella wont impaled among deere hart flesh whereof eaten vsed commodity maister impatient cold grew til foure yeares old afterwardes age decreased lost naturall vigor returne orix entended haue digressed horn whereof late spake onely stronge sharpe like horne vnicorne rhinocerot also solide hollow like horne hart courage inward disposition beast fearefull cruell valiant meane fearefull men beastes fearelesse selfe saith author ne que enim canis latratum timet ne que apri efferuescentem feritatem ne que tauri mugitum refugit ne que pantherarum tristem vocem ne que ipsius leonis vehementem rugitum horret ne que item hominum robore mouetur ac saepe robustum venatorem occidit say feareth barking dogge foaming wrath wilde boare flyeth terrible voyce bull yet mournefull cry panther vehement roaring lyon himselfe conclude moued strength man many time killeth valiantest hunter pursueth seeth boare lyon beare presently bendeth horne downe earth whereby conformeth establisheth head receiue brunt standing manner till assault made time hee easily killeth aduersary bending downe head setting horne receiue beast behaueth himselfe skilfully hunter receiueth lion vpon speare horne easily runne brest wilde beast piercing causeth blood issue whereat beast moued forgetteth combate falleth licking vp owne blood easily ouerthrowne fight begunne none may runne awaie standeth vntil one bee ground dead body many time found wilde sauage men fight kil one another also annoyed lynces meane greater lynces cruelty beast martiall made distichon matutinarum non vltima praeda ferarum saevus oryx constat qui mihi morte canum reported beastoppianus pliny albertus liueth perpetual thirst neuer drinking reason water place bred certaine bladder lickor whereof whosoeuer tasteth shall neuer neede drinke beast liueth wildernesse notwithstanding magnanimious vnresistable strength wrath cruelty yet hee easily taken snare deuices men god hath armed take elephant tame lyon hath likewise iudewed knowledge aboue tame destroy al noisome beast concerning picture beast liuely vissage exterior outward part cannot expresse neither owne sight writinges anye credible author doth giue sufficient direction deliuer shape thereof vnto world succeeding age vppon credit therefore reader muste pardon heerein also read vse flesh partes beast onely horne already expressed whereunto may adde relation strabo affirmeth aethiopians silli vse horne beastes warres insteed sword speares incredible hardnes sharpenes caused iuvenall write thus et getulus oryx hebeti lautissima ferro coeditur althogh owne length able match pike yet fit put vpon top pike well artifical thing made steel yron thus conclude story beast otter doubt beast kind beuers liueth water land outward form part beareth similitude beast italian doe vulgarly call beast lodra na e thereof latines besides lutra fluuiatulis canicula dogg water cal cat water italian besides lodra call also lodria lontra french vne loutre vnge loutre sauoyans vne leure spaniard nutria ilyrians widra graecians lytra shereth assunder root tree bankes riuers graecians cal enhydris although properly bee snake liuing water called theodorus hermolaus lutris albertus calleth luter anadrz enydris also boatus syluacicus graecians cal filthy thicke water lutrai cause noble ancient woman went bathe themselues waterstephanus bound skinnes called oan loutrida sheepes skin vsed water french men call dung otter espranite de loutres pliny steppe otter leise march whelpes otter cheaux word call also whelpes wolues fox badger although kind beauer haue saide already yet neuer goe seathe place heir bod abound almost nation riuers fishpooles namely italy france germany heluetia england scandiuania likewise sarmatia bay boristhines plentifull italy riuer padvs ioyned sea also abound naples outward forme like vnto beaverhermo au sauing taile taile beaver fish taile otter flesh lesse beaver compare vnto cat vnto fox cannot consent vnto foxolaus bigger cat longer lesser fox therfore opinion well called dog water exceede length swetia northern riuers three time long beauer haue rough skinthe seuerall part haire soft neate like haire beauer different shorter vnequal also colour like chesnut brownish beauers white ashe colour hath sharp teeth biting beast likewise short leg foot taile like dog caused bellonius write taile part like beauer differing nothing habitation beauer goeth salt water fresh otter neuer salt although liue water yet doth sucke water aire isthe framing den doth breath like fish benefit water therefore maketh den neer water wherein also wont bring forth young one make den artificially euen beuer bowes sprig stick couching together excellent order wherein sitteth keepe wetnesse hunteth fish although breatheth like another fourefootedbeast yet remain great vnder water without respiration greedinesse fish runneth many time net set men water take fish whereinto enteredhis prey foode suffocated want breath sheare asunder net make way himselfe come hunting fish must often put nose aboue water take breath wonderfull swiftnesse nimblenesse taking prey filleth den full fish corrupteth aire men take den likewise infecteth himselfe pestilent noysome sauour whereupon latin say stinking fellow smels like goat german say smels like otteragricola winter time come caues water hunt vpon land wher finding foode eateth fruit barke tree bellonius writeth thus himalbertus keepeth pooles quiet water riuers terrifieng flockes fish driuing banksides great number hole creekes earth hee taketh copiously easie want prey water doth leape vpon land eate vpon greene hearbs swim two mile together streame putting himselfe great labor hunger belly full currant streame may carry downe againe designed lodging female nourish many whelp together vdders vntill almost big themselues hunter search dam among leaues boughes ouerflowings water winter time haue gathered together laide heapes sharpbitingbeast hurtfull men dog neuer ceasing loosing hold hath laid mouth vpon vntill make bone cracke betwixt teeth whereupon well said olaus mag lutrae mordaces quadrato ore otter accomplished biter crafty subtill beast yet sometimes tamed vsed northern part world especially scandinauia driue fish fisher men net great sagacity scence smeling beast directly winde fish water mile two therefore fisher make great aduantage yet doe forbeare vse deuoureth needeth neuer tamed forgeteth old rauening tamed lande full sport game maruaile came writer head affirme beauer constraineth otter winter time trouble water taile intent may frieze opinion haue confuted already discourse beauer herein agree albertus fiber fortior est lutra acutissimis dentibus qua propter eam vel expellit vel occidit beauer much stronger otter hauing also sharp teeth therfore either expelleth water liue vpon one kind food else destroys wherefore vnreasonable beleeue preserueth keepe taile freezing flesh beast cold filthy feedeth vpon stinking fish therefore fit eaten tragus writeth notwithstanding dressed bee eaten many place germany hear carthusian fryer monkes whether wil forbidden touch al manner flesh fourefootedbeasts yet prohibited eating otter paragraph otter hunted speciall dogges called otterhoundes also speciall instrument called otterspeares hauing exceeding sharp point hardly taken beast doe willingly set vpon specially water feele themselues bee wounded speare come land fight dog irefully except first wounded forsake water ignorant safe refuge water vnto vnequall combat shall sustaine men dog vppon lande yet cold water anoyeth green wound therefore spin liues length thread chusing rather die torment among dog die water kind assa called benioyn strong hearb hung linnen cloth near fishpond driueth away al otter beuers hair skin soft neither doth leese beauty age cause also raine hurt well dressed great price estimationalbertus sold seuen eight shilling thereof also prescribed giuen falling sicknesse paine belly thus much otter certaine beastes kindes otter liue water yet vnknowne v england haue thought good expresse place greeke latine name first place graecians call latax broader thicker otter yet liueth water else goeth water food yet breatheth aire water like otter haire beast harsh betwixt similitude seacalfe hart hath also strong sharp teeth wherewithal night season shere asunder smal boughes twig called also fastoz lamyakyz noertza another called satyrium fassuron chebalus whose skin black pretious much vsed edging best garment liue also pond lake still water third kinde called satherium kacheobeon kachyneen martarus hauing white throate bigge cat finally vnto may added porcos fourefootedbeaste liuing water riuer isther maesolus another fourefootedbeast liuing ryuers india big calfe panther commonly called pardall leopard libbard haue beene many name deuised one beast growen difficult thing either make good reconciliation author wed seueral opinion else define perfectly make good methodicall history yet seeing greatest variance hath arisen wordesthe seuerall name panther deuised first better explication discription hath turned obscuration shaddowing truth trust shall good labour collect euery writer probable concerning beast end expresse best definition thereof wee learne first therefore much question hath arisen greeke latine name requisite expresse shew different construction began graecians indifferently call pordalis pardalis panther latin panthera pardalis pardus leopardus name thus distinguished learned pordalis say signifieth male pardalis female also panthera among latin female pardus male vnderstood simple kind without commixture generation leopardus lepard libbard word deuised later writer compounded leo pardus vpon opinion beast generated betwixt pardall lyon indeede ought properly bee taken pliny opinion pardus differeth panthera nothing sexe say betwixt lyon pardalles confused mixed generation betwixte ass mare stallion ass example lyon couereth pardall whelpe called leopardus leopard libbard pardal coureth lionesse called panthera panther controuersie hebrew arabian name generally indifferently translated panther libbards doe take vp strife almost end controuersie namer hebrew alphec alfhed arabique translated holy scripture also auicen may appeare place following esa farther manifesting heerof good examine said pardal leopard particular hauing expressed may cleare discourse succeeding difference betwixt panther small first therefore said pardus differeth panther onely sexe skin hath receiued naturall tincture diuers spot aristotle writeth thus cutis chamaeliontis distincta maculis vt pardalia skin chamaelion spotted like pardals relation lampridius hee sheweth heliogabalus wont shut vp drunken friendes cum leonibus leopardus vrsis ita vt experge facti cubiculo eodem leone vrsos pardos cum luce vel quod est grauius nocte inuenierent ex quo pleri que ex animati sunt forth word apparant first place calleth leopard last place calleth pardals onely difference betwixt leopard pardall lyon leoparde pardal haue mane therefore called ignobiles leone isidorus solinus write maner pardus secundum post panthera est genus varium ac velocissimum praceps ad sanguinem saltu enim ad mortem ruit ex ad vlterio pardi leenis leu pardus nascitur tertiam originem efficit say pardal next kind panther diuers coloured swift greedy blood ketcheth prey leaping leopard bred betwixt pardal lionesse maketh third kind testimony apeareth name make three seuerall kind beastes distinct nature quantity commixture generation greatest therefore call panther bellunensis writeth second call pardals third least call leopard cause england called cat mountain truely opinion vntill shew better reason subscribe hereunto namely one kinde beast differ quantitie onely adulterous generation affrick great want water therefore lyon panther beast doe assemble themselues great number together running riuers pardals lyon doe engender one another meane greater panther lyonessesbaytius greater lyon panther likewise smaller smaller thereby commeth passe spotted without spot pardal fierce cruell beast violentpliny hauing body mind like rauening bird say ingendred betwixt dog panther betwixt leopard dogges euen lycopanthers ingendred betwixt wolues panther nature pardals affrick get vp rough thicke tree hide themselues amongest boughes leaues doe onely take bird also thence leape downe vpon beast men espie aduantage thing doe belong vnto panther concerning leopard word selfe new lately inuentedof leopard neuer found among auncients iulius capitolinus sparsianus syluaticus maketh difference betwixt pardalis leopardus italian generally call pardal leopardo neuer pardo except poet breuitie sake verse leopard like lyon head forme member yet lesser nothing strong sight leopard skinne gesner made description beast length saith head taile price according region brought come furthest sold dearest come lesse way sold cheapest wrathfull angry beast whensoeuer sicke thirsteth blood wilde cat recouereth sucking blood else eating dung man aboue thing delighteth camphorey tree therefore lieth vnder neath keepe spoile like sort panther delighteth sweet gum spice therefore maruel cannot abide garlicke annoyeth sence smelling reported ambrose wals one howse sheepcoat anointed iuice garlicke panther leopard run away italbertus matter shal saie afterwards leopard sometimes tamed vsed stead dog hunting among tartarians prince carry behinde horsebacke see deere hart conuenient prey turne downe vppon suddainely take destroy yet nature beast also pardall hee doe take prey fourth fift iump falleth angry fierce destroyeth whomsoeuer meeteth yea many time hunter therefore hunter haue alwaies regard carry lambe kid liue thing wherewithall pacifie hath missed game without blood neuer appeased thus much shall suffice haue spoken difference betwixt panther pardals leopard seuerall name greeke latine almost nation doe deriue denominationthe name language italian call leonpardo french leopard lyopard german leppard lefarad word pardes signifying garden colour garden make spotted render fragrant smell panther diuers coloured like garden sundry flower also said carry sweete sauour whither soeuer goeth therfore auncient time made iuory table standing vpon picture panther whereof iuvenall writeth thus one satyres olim ex quauis arbore mensa fiebat nunc diuitibus caenandi nulla voluptas nisi sustinet orbes grande ebur magno sublimis pardus biatu dentibus ex illis quos mittit porta hyenes iam nimios capiti que graues c cause pardalis name notable harlot panther sweete smels drawe beastes vnto destroy also doe harlot decke adorne themselues alluring prouocations inchaunted odor drawe men vnto make spoyle rapine ther pretious stone also called lapis pantherus brought indiaeuax syluaticus albertus vartoman whereupon man looke sunne rising shall see diuers colour namely blacke red greene russet purple rose colour say hath many vertues hath colour list follow name country panthersthe country breeding panther abasia kingdome melacha ile sumatra likewise asia especially syria none europe affricke ouer plentiful lybia mauritania abound al store wilde beast likewise beyond catadupa apollonius companion saw many lyon panther arabia furthest part namly promontory dyra towards south strongest pardals world saith strabo likwise mediteranean region beyond barygaza toward south vnto dachinabades towards east al sort wilde beast tygres panther diodorus writeth part arabia ioyning vpon syria lyon pardals number greater quantity lybia also said volateranus gyllius panther lycia caria verye long yet weake without carriage able leape farre yet skin hard yron pierce betwixt riuer ganges hiphasis apollonius saw many panthersleo affri indian also breed many make tame leopard liue wood barbariathe seuerall part panther apparant already saide panther name greater pardall leopard lesser arabian call alnemer alfhead alnemer bigger linx like leopard hauing greater sharper nailes feete blacke terrible eies therefore stronger fiercer bolder leoparde setteth vppon men destroyeth oppianus describeth kind manner saith two kindes pardals greater lesser greater broader backt bigger quantity lesser lesse quantity inferior strength haue shape colour body except taile greater pardall hath lesser taile lesser greater either haue solid sound thigh long body bright seeing eies apple whereof glister vnder eyelid gray red within like burning coales teeth pale venemous skin diuers color yet bright pleasant spot standing like many black eies vpon thus far oppianus skin oftentimes solde mart europe broght bundle twenty thirty togither forgotten volateran citeth aelianus ther kind pardals beast called bitis vnlike vulgar leopard al part except wanteth tail say beast seene woman instantly make sick proceed residue part beast must remember aristotle writeth physiognomy recorded adamantius leo perfectissimam mari ideam praese fert pardalis vero foemineam formum ex primit crucibus tantu exceptis quibus ad inuadendum fortiter vtitur say among beast lyon doeth resemble male pardall female except leg vseth take prey hath little face little mouth little eies somewhat white plaine much holow long forehead eares rather round smooth broad necke longe slender brest wel set rib small backe long buttockes thighes fleshy partes small belly loines smooth lesse hollow bunchy colour diuers whole body articulate well compounded outward sight remembred saith carden rauening beast like cat lyon panther linces pardals haue common length strength claw beautiful party coloured skin alitle head round face long taile nimblenes body wildnes nature liuing vppon meat get hunting persian call pardall barbact scaliger describeth thus red yellow haire like lyonesse set diuers blacke spot length bredth painted hath browne face aspersed blacke white bee remembred beast either blacke red white one colour nature also natural peacockes panther haue diuers colour hircania panther little round spottes like eies blackealbertus pliny white blew green solinus claudius testifie caused martial write thus picto quod iuga delicata collo pardus sustinet land called terra eremborum inhabited troglodites sarazen lybia vper face earth campared vnto panther skin heat sun burned died diuers color ye shal see diuers spot white black green earth wer done purpose hand man teeth panther like sawes also dog lyon theyr tongue incredible sharpenesse licking grateth like file female haue foure vdders midst belly heart great proportion violent beast terifieng man many fissure feetaristotle former foot haue fiue distinct claw finger hinder foot four litle one among fourefootedbeasts haue fiue finger vpon hinder fret go hide nailes within skinne foot sheath neuer bringing forth prey intent neuer broken dulled tail haue long haires end like lyon ox leopa hath wider mouth pardall female oftener time taken male reason giuen volateran inforced seeke abroad owne meate yoong one place aboad among mountaines woodsthe food panther especially delight tree camphorie rauen vpon flesh birdes beastes cause hide themselues tree especially mauritania swift foote therefore giue themselues take ape attaine pollicy see ape make first approching climbe top tree sit auoyd panther teeth notable follow hie yet cunning ape therefore diuiseth shift take nature hath denied hir bodily power might supply want gift mind forth therefore shee goeth vnder tree ape lodged lieth downe though deade stretching limbes restraining breath shutting eye shewing token expiration ape sitte toppes tree behold high behauiour aduersary al wish dead easily beleeue much desire yet dare descend make tryall end doubtes chuse one among thinke best courage send downe espy certifie al residue forth goeth thousand feares mind leapeth bough bough great hast dread il bargain yet come downe dareth approach nigh hauing taken view counterfeite repressed owne feare returneth backe againe little space descendeth second time commeth nearer panther yet returneth without touching discendeth third time looking eies make h tryall whether hee draweth breath panther keepeth breath lims immouable mean imboldning ape owne destruction spyape sitteth beside panther stirreth aboue tree see intelliger abideth constantly beside aduersary without harme gather spirit togither discend downe great multitude running panther first going vpon afterwards leaping great ioy exultation mocking aduersary al apish toyes testifieng ioy hir supposed death sort panther suffereth continew great reason til perceiueth throughly wearied vpon sudden hee leapeth vp aliue againe taking claw destroying killing teeth nailes til haue prepared rich dinner aduersaries flesh like vlysses endeuored contumely reproach maid wiues suiters vntill iust occasion giuen reuenge doth panther disdainfull dealing ape whereupon came prouerbe pardi mortem assimulat thanaton pardaleos hypocrimetai cunning dissembling fellow one brutus counterfatted madnes might get empire great loue beast spice aromaticall tree come ouer mountaine taurus armenia silia wind bring sauor sweet gum vnto themtheir loue pices pamphilia tree storax whereupon lyeth story certaine panther taken king arsaces golden collor put vpon necke inscription rex arsaces deo nisaeo king arsaces god bacchus bacchus called nisaey citty nisa india beast grew tame would suffer himselfe handled stroked hand men vntill spring time winded sauour aromatical tree would run away acquaintance according kind last taken neather part mountaine taurus many hundred mile distant king court armenia sauor mel pantherswe haue shewed already loue gum camphorey watching tree end preserue owne vse indeed aelianus saith admirabilem quantam odoris suavitatem olet pardalis quam bene olendi praestatiam deuino munere donatam cum sibi propriam plane tenet tum vero caetera animalia eius hanc vni praeclare sentiunt say panther pardall smelleth sweetly sauor hath receiued diuine gift doth onely feele benefit himselfe also bewray vnto beastsaristotle vol teranus feeleth hungry stand need meat doth get vp rough tree savour sweet smel draweth vnto innumerable company wilde goat hart roe hind beast vpon sudden leapeth downe vpon espyeth couenient time solinus sayth sweetnesse sauor worketh effect vppon open fieldes mightily delighted spotted skin fragrant smell wil alwaies come running vnto part striuing shal come nearest satisfied sight looke vppon fierce grim face terrified turne away cause subtle beast turneth away head keepeth sight offering beautiful part body alluring bayt mouse destroy hence opinion receiueth name panthera congregating togither kind beast look pan signifieth therta signifieth beastsisidorus albertus opinion report panther sauour sweet smell fable saith written maximum among philosopher caetera animalia praeter hominem ne que suaviter ne que moleste odoribus affici creature man excepted said smell either sweetly sowerly theophrastus writeth animal nullum penetus odoratum est nisi quis dixerit pardalin belluarum censui bene olere creature said odorifirous except pardal seem smel wel scent beast certain som sauours smels beastes follow refuse led thereunto onely choice meate nose choose conuenient agreeable nature shold drawn smels sauours meerly cause pleasure scent reasonable part man vnreasonable attribute vnto beast yet heerein fauour albertus discent granted men yeeld vnto either spot skin seeme many eies colour el sweet sauour commeth occasion beast assembling followeth earth lodged tree visible eies beast say assemble tree wherein lodgd cause draw beastes vnto attractiue power sweete sauour want reason iustly deemed say beast loue sweet sauours seeing albertus al learned men know confidently affirme many wilde beast forsake meat heare musick also badger doth forsake owne den perceiueth foxe hath emptied bellye therein therefore conclude point admiration worke creator consider wisely hath disposed goodnesse powerfully hee communicateth affection diuinity euen vnto brute beast doth distinguish asunder onely outside exterior partes yet inside quality mind also ayre draw sauour send forth among kind beastes male couragious fierce except beares panther female panther generous male time lust haue peculiar voice caused poet write thustheir time lust panther caurit amans pardus hiando felit sound voice beast come lyon lyonesses wolues thoes neuer bear aboue young one begin stirre dam belly gather strength birth canot tarry iust time deliuery teare womb bag wherein lie sharpnes nail therefore dam forced auoiding pain cast forth womb blind deformed yet norisheth tenderly afterwards neuer conceiue againe reason wombe torne clawes firste whelpes able retaine perfection receiued seed male panther liue togither flockes heardstheir loue hatred enemy friend greatly delight owne kind knowe therefore wonder author isidorus wrote panther omnium animalium amicus est excepto dracone panther friendly al beast except draggon vaine poet feigned nurse bacchus bee turned panther deuoured peutheus railed vppon bacchus lyon doeth thinges imitate resemble nature man selfesame manner doeth panther woman fraudule though beautifull beast adamantius writeth pantherae ingenium molle est effoeminatum iracundum sidiosum frandulentum timidum simul audax moribus corporis etiam forma respondit disposition panther wanton effeminatethe descr pt n outragious treacherous deceiptfull fearefull yet bold occasion holy scripture ioyned lyon wolfe make vp triplicity rauening beast therefore also read wisest among egyptian signifie cunning man couering secret corruption euil disposition mind pretending good yet intending euill picture panther haue shewed already hee doeth couer heade bodie take prey aming panthersthis beast neuer tamed faleth wilde fit againe loue yong one exceeding great time abroad forage meet hunter would take away fight vnto death saue blowes interpose owne body receiuing mortall woundes find young one taken denne absence bewaile losse loud miserable howling demetrius phylosopher relateth story panther lay high waye meet man helpe hir young one ditch deepe pit wherein fallen length appeared hir sight father philinus phylosopher presently began runne away soone saw beast poore distressed panther rouled humble maner though sute vnto took lightly skirt garment one clawes man perceiuing shee gaue sucke greatnesse vdders hanging vnder belly beganne take pitty vpon layed away feare thinking indeed happened young one taken one meanes therefore followed hir drawing one foot vnto caue whereinto hir young one fallen deliuered mother raunsome owne life shee young one follow reioycing daunger beastes wildernesse dismissing without manner harme rare thinge man thankefull much beast vnto story loue kindnesse young one may adde another woorthy bee remembered aelianus notable storie panther ue companionthere saith man brought vp tame panther whelpe made gentle refused society men himselfe loued bin wife also little kyd house brought vp tame purpose giuen vnto panther growne stature quantity yet meane season panther plaied euery day last ripe maister killed layed panther eaten would touch wherevpon fasted till next day brought vnto againe refused last hee fasted third daie making great moane meat according vsuall manner kyd laide third time poore beast seeing nothing woulde serue turne must either eat vppe chamber fellow else mayster would make continually fast ranne killed another kyd disdaining medle former acquaintance yea though dead heerin excelling many wicked men doe spare haue liued greatest familiarity friendshippe vndooe ouerthrow aliue aduauncement haue saide already resemble woman indeed enimies creature leopard barbary little harme men meetthe harmes panther except meet path waie man cannot decline beast beast man leape fiercely face pull awaie much flesh laie hold vpon manie nailes pierce brain man leo afer albertusthey vse inuade force vpon flock sheepe goat yet wheresoever see dogge instantly kill devoure great panther tetror dragon soone dragon seeth flyeth caueauicen lesser panther leopard ouercome wolues single hand hand say multitude ouermaister destroy endeuour run away yet swifter easily ouercome also great hatred enmity betwixt hyaena panther presence hyaena pardall dareth resist admirablepliny peece hyaenaes skinne either man beastorus panther neuer touch skin dead hung vp presence one another haire fall panther therefore egyptian would signifie superiour ouercome superiour picture two skinnesthe ter panther pliny rasis aesculapius thing annointed broath wherein cocke hath beene sodden neither panther lyon euer touch especially mixed iuce garlike leopard afraid certaine tree called leopardi arbor leopardstree panther also afraid scull dead man runne sight thereof yet reported two yeare death francis king france two leopard male female let nothing onely breastes like thinges might expresse many place whereby vengeance almighty god mankind many sin might seeme executed raging ministery wilde sauage vngentle beastes cause read auncient time senatours rome gaue lawes punishment bring panther italylawes panther especially affrican beastes first gaue dispensation lawes cneius aufidius people tribune permitted sake circensian game scaurus office aedility brought also hundred fifty pompey great four hundered ten lastly augustus euer remembred renowned emperor foure hundred twenty thus lawes first made great men good senator safety commonwealth became great valew great greater lawmaker purpose aduance themselues practise thing law iustly forbidden decree stood effectuall victorious champion loste part vaine tryumphes many people afterward beene preserued aliue cruelty beast either torne peeces else receiued mortall wound vaine blessed martyr iesus christ ignatius afterwards torne peeces wilde beastes rome write thus epistle roman christian concerning handling roman souldiers brought prisoner syria rome siria romam v que cum bestijs depugno per terram mare die nocteque vinctus cum decem leopardis hoc est cum militari custodia qui ex beneficijs deteriores fiunt syria saith rome haue fought beastes beeing night day held bondage ten leopard meane ten souldious notwithstanding many benifits bestowed vpon yet vse worse worse thus much cruelty panther leopard haue shewed already become tame vsed huntingthe nature tamed panther vnto discourse somewhat place adde true narration two panther leopard nourished france king whereof one bignesse great calfe great dogge day lesser brought forth king behold tame tractable would ride behinde keeper vppon cloath pillow tyed chaine hare beene let loose presence turn within iumpes leapes would attain take keeper take vp leopard againe come backeward least see face leape vpon wound haue said angry chafed ready flye hunter face therefore turneth face away betwixt legges reacheth peece bread flesh gently taketh chaine callar againe leading away house assoone man mounted beast also knew seate leaped vp party also related lyon turned forth bull lyon quietly without stirring lay downe harme offer violence combate bull afterward two leopardes turned forth bull instantly ran tooke bull throate without doubt strangled pulled throate keeper long chaines tyed neckes handes restrained pulled againe may coniectured great rage wild vntamed leopard panther seeing tame gentle cruell therefore lord prophet wisely compare siedge assirians abovt ierusalem leopard watching gate citty destroy came thereat taking panthershauing thus discoursed nature partes kindnesse loue hatred beastes generall followeth expresse best meanes auoide destroy may onely know enimy also learne way ouermatch curbe kind henbane called pardalianches libbardbane inhabitant pharnacus dioscorides mount ida wont lay mountaines destoying leopard pardals panther hearbe much known day yet take groweth many place france sauoy called tora roote thereof beaten powder stopped vp flesh beastes also wolues swine wilde boares destroyed tast thereof beast perceiueth himselfe poysoned presently seeketh man dung without cannot bee deliuered wherefore hunter also place neere vnto vessell hanging tree mouth way open leadeth wherinto greedy beast leapeth cannot get forth againe rather dyeth hungerpliny aristotle else taken killed else vessell hanged vp high beast strayning himselfe leape get desired medicine vaine spendeth time recouery til poyson hath throughly corrupted body euery part member otherwise great life spirit stomake beast fight yeald aduersary although gut intrals hang leg belly therefore panther hircania often perish poyson violence sword speares dogges poyson beast many time falleth loosenesse belly withall weakenesse thereby taken aliue likewise armenia certaine fish poyson lyon beares wolues lynces panther powder fish inhabitant put side flesh sheepe goates kyd without harme beastes panther rauening beast come deuoure sheep dressed presently die poison hunted forced presence hunter leape directly vnto heades therefore hunter taketh great care standing also holding speare receiue panther leape gore heart else otherwise wound mortally gone life end oppianus also sheweth taken lyon especially meanes following hunter perceiue way path vseth water therein make deepe ditch great make lyon wherein erect wodden pillar great post vnto tie certaine engins withall male little dogge whose stone tender coddes bind string cord young beast may whine cry paine voice hee inuiteth calleth panther destruction greedy beast winding voice dogge bestirreth himselfe meete desired prey booty last finding ditch seeing dogge downe leapeth engins take present hold vpon destroy describeth meanes take great fish sight little fish swimming net hunting wilde beast wary woodman must make good choice horseoppianus onely mettell agility enclose house little house certaine rotten flesh sauour thereof stinketh draweth wilde beast vnto make dore gate reedes vnto said house filthy smell breaketh disperseth selfe wide aire presently wilde beastes take vp follow withall speede muske sweete thing wherewithall men much delighted rauening beastes sauour carrion therefore like amorous cup draweth snare perdition beside rotten flesh erect many engins vnauoidable trap snare beast commeth rauen christian affricke institute generall hunting leopard inclosing end way beastes passe leopard stirred ranne fro distracted passage found horseman ready resist neither left way escape length wearied many windinges turninges prouocations horseman might easily come vnto pearce speares fortuned leopard escaped brake away hunter hee whose corner brake forth bound ancient custome make residue dinner banquet among chaonians certaine young noble man loued virgin called anthippe two louers walking together good season wood happened cichyrus king sonne prosecuted pardall hunting fled wood seeing bent arme cast dart dart missed marke killed virgin anthippe young prince thought hee slaine beast therefore drew neare horseback reioyce ouer fall game according maner hunter approch found far otherwise stead effusio bloud beast lamentable right hand shed bloud virgin came saw dying drawing last breath young man held hand wound stanch bloude first leape sport themselues vntill well wearied lye downe sleepe soundly time hunter lye waite come take without feare perill thus farre oppianus vse partsconcerning vse seuerall partes finde little bunch lip either side mouth groweth forth long blacke bristlesthe quils speares generall proportion body like swine neuer exceede stature swine halfe yeare old foure teeth hang ouer lip admirable quils thornes growing vpon backe stead haire vseth hand armes weapon first grow backe side two colour partly black partly white whensoeuer pleaseth mooueth fro like peacocke doth taile grow length two three foure hand breadth stand confused order colour well formed distinguished rankes sharp point like knife hunted beast stretcheth skin casteth one two time according necessity vpon mouth dog leg hunter follow violence many time stick tree wood wherfore solinus writeth thus also paulus venetus cum capiuntur spinis suis sape homines cane ledunt nam cane eos prouocati adeo irritant fer illas vt stirred cast vpon al stand near therefore sight flying hunter saue dogges doe deuise engins trap wherein take beside quils grow vpon backes haue also vppon heades neckes never cast keepe horsse doth mane pilgrimes come yearly saint ieames compostella spaine doe bring backe generally one quils capsthe den foode cause know pace beast slow troublesome vnto therefore hardly drawne den diggeth like badger neuer goeth farre feedeth vpon thinges neare vnto filthy beast smelling ranke liueth much earth wilde neuer drinketh thinke eateth apple root rindes tree peraduenture snailes reptile creature tamed eateth kinde fruite likewise bread pycrust thinges broken small drinketh also water aboue wine mingled water day time sleepeth night time waketh gather wilde feareth light therefore trauelleth night time meat liuing generall liue creature begetteth owne kinde female bearing yoong one belly long time beare thirtie day also hideth selfe foure monethes winter time like beare whether cold cause author doe expresse opinion cold rather reason although affirme lyeth hid summer time commeth abroad winter time contrary course beast therefore paradox doth want testimony credible writer affirme vpon owne experience else requisite bring sufficient reason lead reader beleeue neither discharged therefore safer v follow aristotle pliny hold first opinion albertus agricola encline later thing lying hid procreation comming caue nourishing yoong one imitate manner condition beares concerning vse part find none onely quils said men scrape teeth neuer loose likewise woman wont auncient time yeare also acording quality place wherein feedeth appeareth found colour ass shortly like harte breast ful long bristlesthe colour seuerall part rough riged legges hairy hoof hollow clouen moouable course spreadeth abroade vppon deepest snowes without pressing footsteppes farre admirable celerity auoideth wilde beast vallies lie waight destroy beareth high lofty horn presently root branch forth two stem pike meane horne seuerally two top disperce themselues pike like finger one hand middle horne little branch standeth like knobbe huckle hinder part beast legge thence againe ascend vpwards great heighth doe grow broad toppe diuided like palme hand horne white distinguished long apparant vaines differing horne elk horn hart elk heighth hart bredth colour multitude braunches runneth layeth backe stand stil lowest braunches comming foorth root horne almost couer face lower braunches winter time thirst commeth frozen water breaketh ycethe vse lowest horn wilde liueth vpon fruit findeth wood especially gum commeth tree also mosse groweth vpon making himselfe shaddowed den resting place mountaines deepest colde weather commeth mountaines norway towards mosiberg hils taken countreypeople priuate v hee profitable tamed plow trauailes iournies people called lappi lappones vse instead horse ox haue kind cart made forme fashion fisher boat whereunto ioyne beast draw carter cart daunger falling course wil continue indefatigable twenty germain mile day threescore english mile night beast vnyoaked owne accord without guide leader wil go feeding place accustomed stable greatest part foode northerne people haue bin seene auspurge germany sadled bridled trauailes need haue prouender carried ye turne midst winter find certaine rootes mosse vnder snowe whereof eat translateth deutro tauri decor eius cornu rhinocerotis cornu eius eis ventilabit nationes ad summum v que terrae beauty like beauty bull horne like horne rhinocerot shall winnow nation top hils tertullian writing heretique praxeas doth translate man compare together greeke word rhinoceros reem karas rimna karas hee easily thinke either graecians haue ioyned together two haebrew wordes rhinoceros quasi reem karas rimna karas else haebrewes haue parted asunder greeke word reem rimna may well come rhino karas keros yet heerein leaue reader owne iudgment indian cal beast tongue oppianus quantity seuerall part scandabenamet festus writeth wee leaue name come description quantity much bigger orix pliny maketh equall length elephant make longer elephant withall say lower hath shorter legges strabo booke speaking ethiopian region neare india calleth rhinocerots aethiopian buls saith bred onely country relation artemidorus writeth thus outoi de micron apoleypont ton elephantoon oi rinokerotes osper artemidoros phesi epi seirau mekei kai per eorakenai phesas alexandria alla schedon ti osoon vpsei apogetou aphemoon oruthentos c say rhinocerotes exceeded elephantes length hight almost equall artemidorus said saw one alexandria colour thereof like boxtree rather like elephantes quantity greater buls greatest bvll outward forme proportion like wilde boares especiallye mouth except nose groweth horne harder bone vseth stead armes euen boare doth teeth hee hath also two girdle vpon body like wing dragon comming backe downe belly one toward necke mane toward loines hinder part thus far strabo whereunto may adde description part oppianus pliny solinus colour like rinde barke boxetree doth differ much elephant forehead grow haires seeme little red back distinguished certaine purple spot vpon yellow ground skinne firme hard dart able pierce vppon appeare many deuisions like shelles tortaeise set ouer skales hauing haire vppon backe like manner leg scaled downe hooues parted foure distinct clawes vpon nose groweth hard sharp horne crooking little towards crowne head high flat round sharp strong vt quicquid impetieret aut ilet aut perforet ferrum etiam saxa transigat saith oppianus aelianus whatsoeuer set either casteth vp aire else boreth though iron stone eucherius saith rhinorerot hath two horne nose vtterly false may see picture although martiall seeme expresse much verse nam que grauem cornu gemino sic extulit vrsum iactat vt impositas taurus astra pilas rhinocerot cast vp beare aire euen bull would ball layd vpon two horne shall neede apply gemino cornu bull politianus doth rather take figuratiuely strong horne must need litterall apparant picture another little horne vpon nose vppon wither beast meane top shoulder next ecke error eucherius lyeth number place may appeare horne fained thing pausanius aboue two thousand yeare ago writeth thus rhinoceroti summo naso cornu singulare est aliud supra ipsum non magnum capite nullum maruaile came passe men mocke deride others cunningly called prouerbially nasuti homines except prouerbe taken rhinoceros reason crooked horne said haue crooked nose indeede deformed nose subiect derision part member body caused martiall write thus maiores nunquam rhonchus iuvenes que sene que et pueri nasum rhinocerotis habent thereupon horace also saith thus naso suspendis adunco oppianus saith neuer yet destinction sex rhinocerotes euer found male female hence let body gather female impossible breede continue without female therfore plinius solinus say engender admit copulation like elephant camel lyon fight whet horne vpon stone discord betwixt beast elephant food naturall description enmity confidently affirmed rhinocerot lisborne brought presence elephant elephant ran away place ouercommeth elephant haue shewed already story namely fastneth horne soft part elephantes belly hee taken meanes vnicorne taken said albertus isidorus alunnus aboue creature loue virgin vnto come neuer wilde fall sleepe asleepe easily taken carried away later physitians attribute vertue vnicorns horne rhinocerots horn deceiued imitation isidorus albertus none auncient graecians haue euer obserued medicine rhinocerot indian make bottels skin wherein put lycion succum medicatum therefore wil conclude story riddle fraunciscus niger made vpon excellency horne groweth vpon nose dic mihi quae superis sint acceptissima dona whereunto answer made next verse principium nasi rhinocerotis amant sheepe haebrewes haue diuers name whereby signifie sheep al kind zon zoneth septuagint alwaies render probata seueral name sheep little cattle arabian genas chaldean ana persian gospand also rachel haebrew plurall whereof rechelim signifieth sheepe kebesch kabsa kibsa esay tahel neelamah dombe sheep hebrewes haue rachel chaldes translate rachlak arabian akalak persian chomeschan thu kebes kibsa signifie sheepe male female vnder year old aijl eel sheep aboue year old sucketh epiphanius writeth word haebrew astronomer signified signe aries zodiacke sarazen day call sheep ganeme cattle garien dung cattle hara garien graecians call sheepe oijs probaton latin ouis
