wife charhippus many necessary story relate trouble reader vnnecessary circumstance wil therfore first al begin relation sheep countriesthe description diuers kid sheep according country strabo end make particular discouery home difference region much enlighten discription history sheep reported erythrea one island gades aboundance good pasture hearbs grateful sheep let blood thirty day perish suffocation milke sheep yeeldeth whay wherewithall make aboundance cheese although poure water herbage island dry yet profitable catle milch beast thence came originall fat cattle geryon sheepe graecia lesser sheep egypt oues pirrhicae like boues pirrhicae namely exceeding stature name deryued pyrrhus maister owner among psillians india ram greater lamb aechylides book husbandry affirmeth sheepe isle chius small yet milke maketh lawdable cheese spain best sheep haue black fleece polentia near alpes gray honywolled asia boetica called erythrea red like fox thence came tearme erythreae oues canusium sheepe yellow lion tauny also tarentum istria liburnia yeald sheep hauing wooll course rough may rather seeme haire wooll therefore neuer fit fine garmentes vse except singular art spinning portugal like wooll sheep piscenae egypt latter said dyed againe thredbare endure almost euer ancientes homer writeth vse heereof although thread rough workes tapistry dressed diuers way french europe dresse one way parthian asia another way sheep apulia gaue name lana italica excellent wooll yet short course good nothing clokes ride weare rainy weather vnto may adde calabrian milesian arentinean sheepe yet dayes varro couered sheepe skin keepe wooll losse infection might better washed dyed prepared nourished house french sheep altinas also scabbed folded plain barren field parma mutina sheep heluetia feed top mountaines while goates keepe beneath among tree gather fruit side hils flemmish sheep haue soft curled haire generall two kind sheep one called tectum colonicum would say housesheep fieldsheep graecian sheep haue called tarentinae also called terintinae soft wool liued house also called pellitae fieldsheepe hauing nature greater courser rougher haire suffered lodge abroad fieldes likewise sheepe myletum attica region gadilonea reaching armenia haue soft gentle wooll thing sildome commeth passe pontus capadocia scotland also place thereof called hector boethius buthuguhania great store sheepe bearing good wooll whence almost country fetch breed sheepe ethiopia beare wooll stead thereof haire rough like camel haire amongest abidene beudiani aelianus nicomachus sonne aristotle testifie sheepe blacke neuer white sheepe bred country gortynis sheepe red haue foure horne fortunate island redsea sheepe white none haue crooked horne beotia foure riuers worke strange effect vpon sheepe drinke namely melas cephisus penius xanthus sheep drinking melas penius grow black cephisus white yet pliny saith riuer commeth forth fountaine melas doth drinke xanthus grow red might adde hereunto another speciall obseruation difference betwixt sheepe pontus naxus pontus haue gaule naxus haue two gaules part india sheepe goates big ass bring forth lambes time neuer lesse three sheepe goates length tailes reacheth downe hinder leg therefore shepheardes cut secret intent may better suffer copulation cut expresse certaine oile also cut asunder tailes ram end whereof afterwards close nearely naturally together appeareth scar note section syria india tailes sheepe cubit broad two kinde sheepe arabia distinguished length breadth tailes one sort haue tailes three cubit long reason whereof suffered draw ground feare wounding therefore shephards deuise certaine engins wood support kind sheep haue tailes like syrian sheepe al sheepe liue hot dry region haue larger tailes harsher wooll liue moyst region fault place haue softer wooll shorter tailes two arabian sheepe brought england yeare whose picture taken docter cay therefore haue expressed page following description arabian sheepe broad taile arabian sheepe long taile description arabian sheepe arabian sheep said little bigger vulgar sheepe enland wooll figure body colour onely shin forepart face litle red broad tail top one cubit lower narrower like end vulgar sheepes tayle brought shipboard england taught thorough famine hunger eat onely grasse hay flesh fish bread cheese butter heroditus saith kind sheepe found arabia longetailed sheepe calleth macrokercos broad tailed sheepe plateukercos yet leo afer saith affrican sheepe thus writeth arietibus nullu ab alijs discrimien est praeter quam cauda qua latissima circu ferunt quae cui que quo opinior est crassior obtigit ad eo vt nonnullis libra decem aut vigintipendat cu sua sponte impinguantur difference betwixt ram except broad tail euermore growes fatnes groweth bredth fat owne accord hath bin found taile one sheepe haue weighed ten twenty pound onely also egypt cram feede theyr sheepe barly corne bran meanes growe fatte notable stirre themselues keeper forced deuise little engine like childrens care whereupon lay tailes remoue beast leo afer affirmeth saw egypt towne called asiota standing vpon nilus hundred fifty mile alcair taile one sheepe weyghed fourscore pound whilst wondred scarcely beleeuing eies saw present affirmed ordinary thing said according writeth se vidisse quae semi ducentes libra expendissent seene waigh hundred pound except kingdome tunis africk egypt none found world appeareth fatte body goeth tailes among garamants sheepe eate flesh milke forgotten aristotle dionisius afer varro doe write namely sheepe wild tame sheepe haue deriued wild sheepe tame goat wild goat therefore varro saithflockes wilde sheepe day phrigia flockes wild sheepe whereof africk region gadits annually brought rome male female strange admirable colour great vncle bought diuers made tame appeareth wilde sheepe ram musmons shall discourse afterwards wild sheepe greater tame sheep swifter run stronger fight hauing croked piked horne therefore many time fight wilde boares kill subus doth also appeare kind wild sheepeoppianus oppianus discoursed sheep creete falleth make mention subus saith bright yellow colour like sheepe creete wooll thereof rough hath two large horne vpon forehead liuing water land eating fish admiration water gather deuoured shall shew afterwards due place colus also spoken called snake seemeth kind quantity betwixt sheep hart hath wooll hunted hunter vse neither dog beast take terrifie ringing little bel sound whereof runneth fro distracted taken thus much thought good expresse generall nature sheepe diuers strange kind nation studious reader may admire wonderfull workes god beast holy scripture hath compared sonne saint much story mingled others would haue exorbitant farre different common nature vulgar sheepe haue beene mixed amongest might haue confounded reader much better opinion expresse altogether proceede particular nature vulgar sheepe first description outward partsthe seuerall part sheep sheepe ought large body wooll may ought soft deepe rough especially necke shoulder belly auntient graetians called apokoi latin apicae peild sheepe want wooll alwaies reiect vnprofitable flockes better signe pliny saith acceptable breede sheepe quam crurium breuitas ventris vestitus shortnesse leg belly well cloathed wooll female admitted male two yeares old till fiue yeare old acounted young seuen vnprofitable breed choise sheep euermore take rough wooll euen eies without baulde place vpon female beare two yeare olde vtterly refuse auoid likewise party colored spotted sheep choose haue great eies large tail strong leg let yong also breed nam melior est ea aetas qua sequitur spes qua ea qua sequitur mors probata est progeny si agnos solent procreare formosos saith petrus crescen age better hope followeth death followeth good breed sheepe bringeth forth beautiful lamb concerning wooll obserued soft wool alwaies best except thicke withal hare haue soft thin wool sheepe ought contrary therefore fearefull haue softest haire sheepe scythia cold country haue soft wooll sauromatia haue hard wool florentinus prescribeth fine wool sheepe curled standeth vpright hee saith curled wooll easily corrupted falsified head sheepe weake braine fat horne female weake haue al many place haue none like hind england male female want horne againe ram england haue greater horne ram worlde sometimes haue foure six horne head hath bin often seene affricke malesheepe ram yeaned horne also female pontus neither male female haue euer horne eies ought great waterish colour beast want handes haue eies standing farre distant head especially sheepe neede looke side simple harmelesse disposition shall shew afterwards little eie lyon panther betoken craft cruelty great eie simplicity innocency teeth stand one continued row bone horse vper chap foreteeth male hauing teeth female write virgill calleth sheepe bidentes haue two teeth doe ignorantly may read seruius nigidius nonius boares called bidentes al beast two year old first called bidennes quasi biennes interposition letter according word say reire redire reamare redamare reargure redargure bidennis biennis sacrifice woont bee made sheepe two yeares old euer happen sheepe hath two teeth helde monster therefore sheep called ambidens bidens hath teeth aboue beneath belly sheepe like bellie beast chew cud milke proceedeth ventricle maw stone hang downe hinder leg female haue vdders betwixt thighes like goat cowes haue galles according ordinary custome nature haue none al pontus reason eat wormewood haue gal likewise calsis haue shewd haue two gal scithian sheep haue gal one time another aelianus writeth saith verie cold country snow winter covereth earth sheepe haue gal keepe within dores vse change meat summer go abroad againe feed field replenished gal region asia called scepsis wherein say sheepe haue little melt raines sheepe equal beast hath couered fat like vnto sheepe also apt grow exceeding fat yeare fat sheepe giuen king france pickardy whereof inward hooues cloues forefoot growne long finger broad toppes whereof recurued backward like horne wilde goat concerning tailes haue spoken already vulgar sheep haue hairy tailes like fox wolues thus much shall suffice haue spoken seuerall part next place consider food diet sheepe inclinationthe food sheepe institution shepheardes vtility ariseth lastly seueral disease medicins cure therefore remembred auncients appointed sheapheardes attend flockes none great account called sheapheardes neatheardes goatheardes bucolisi opiliones aepoli haue shewd already story goat gentile report knowledge feeding ox sheepe came first nimphes taught aristaeus island co graecians therefore call shepheard poimem feeder poimanaime feed poet also vse poimantor shepherd shepheards dog keepe flocke wolfe pominitay kunes sheep kept well ouercome wolues according saying virgill nam lupus insidias exptorat ouillia circum ouid likewise saith incustoditum captat ouile lupus whole care therefore shepheard must first foode secondly folde thirdly health may raise profitable gaine either himselfe oweth sheep begin food diet doth much differ goat yet haue thing peculiar must expressed good therefore pasture feeding place looke toward sun setting driuen ouer far put much labour cause good sheapheard may safely feed sheep late euening suffer go early abroad morning eat maner hearbs plant sometimes kill bitings neuer grow best giue alwaies greene meate feede vpon land falowed plowed sowne corne although feeding fat pasture come haue softer wooll haire according nature food yet moyst temperament better feede vpon salt short pasture dyet better liue health also beare pretious wooll dry pasture healthy fenny cause wholesome keepe plowed groundes wherein meete many sweet pleasant hearbs else vpland medowes moysture breedeth rottennesse must avoid wood shadowy place euen doth fen sun come vpon sheepes food hurtful vnto picked water shepheard must thinke meate gratefull vnto cattle vse continuance wil make loath wherefore must prouide remedy namely giue salt oftentimes summer returne feeding lay certaine trough fold accord wil licke thereof encrease great appetite winter time kept within doores must fed softest hay cut autumne riper lesse nourishable country lay vp leaues especially green ewe leaus elme threeleauedgrasse sowedvines chaffe pea thing faile store vine gather leaues sheep eat thereof without al danger greedily may say much oliue wild planted diuers plant haue vertue fat raise beast aspersed salt humor cause sea wormwood excelleth hearbs food make fat sheep myndius writeth pontus sheep grow exceeding fat bitter vulgar wormwood beanes encrease milke also threeleauedgrasse nourishable ewe young obserued fault latin called luxuria segetum english rankenesse corne better remedy turne sheep may ground hard sheep loueth wel crop stalk also corne thriue neuer worse place eat twice country babilon thrice reason great fertility thereabouts sopliny would turn run al stalke idle vnprofitable leaues extasie reported follow sheep haue eaten eryngia haue expressed already history goat namely stand still haue power goe pasture til keeper come take mouth reported much delighted herb called laserpitium first purgeth doth fat likewise sheepe lydia masidonia sheepe grow fat eating fish aenius also writeth certain fish bignesse frog given vnto sheep eatena eanus arabia prouince ade ox camel sheep eate fish dryed care green like might say many place generally must care shepard auoid thorny stony place feeding sheep according precept virgill si tibi lamitium curae primum aspera sylua lappae que tribuli que absint thing writeth maketh bald oftentimes scratcheth skin asunder word scabras oues reddit cum tonsis illotus ad hesit sudor hir suti secuerunt corpus vepres although sheep neuer sound much subiect pestilence yet must shepard regard feede choice place fat field breed straight tall sheep hils short pasture broad square sheepe wood mountaine place small slender sheep best place new plowed ground although virgil prescribeth shephard feed flock morning according maner country wherein liued middle part day ouer hot fit cattel eat yet nation especially germany england northern part world may whole cunning shephards excellently describedthe discription sheapheardes eare virgil ordering sheepe verse following ergo omni studio glaciem ventos que niuales quo minus est illis curae mortalis egestas auertes victum que feres virgea laetus pabula nec tota claudes foenilia bruma vero zephyris cum laeta vocantibus aestas saltus vtrum que gregem oues capra que inpascua mittes carpamus dum mane novum dum gramina canent luciferi primo cam sydere frigida rura inde vbi quarta sitim cali collegerit hora et ro tenera pecori gratissimus herba est ad puteos aut alta greges ad stagna iubeto et cantu querulae rumpent arbusta cicada aestibus medijs vmbrosam exquirere vallem currentem ilignis potare canalibus vndam ingentes tendatramos aut sicubi nigrum sicubi magna iouis antiquo robore quercus tum tenues dare rursus aqua pascere rursus ilicibus crebris sacrum nemus accubet vmbra temperat saltus reficit iam roscida luna solis ad occasum cum frigidus aera vesper littora que halcyonen resonant acanthida dumi returne feeding shepheard must regard put foldes hot time yeare bee ouer hot let bee driuen pasture far feed neare adiacent fold may easily haue recourse vnto shaddow ought also bee turned clustering altogether disperced abroad little little neither must bee milked hot vntil cold little likewise morning let milked soone day appeareth little lamb turned vnto shut appeare vpon grasse spiderswebs cobweb beare vp little drop water must suffered feede place feare poisoning time heate raine driue hiest hils pasture lie open wind shall cattle feed temperately must auoid sandy place month aprill may iune iuly must suffered feed ouermuch october september nouember let haue full may grow stronger winter time roman speciall regard chuse place summering sheepe place wintering summered apulia wintered samnius therefore varro saith flockes apulia betimes morning summer season lead forth feeding dewy grasse morning much better dry middle day noone season groweth hot lead shaddowey tree rock vntill coole aire euening begin returne time driue pasture againe cause feed towards sun rising general rule among shepehards quod mane ad solis occasum vespere ad solis ortum pascantur oues morning feede sheep towards sun setting euening towardes sun rising reason quia infermissimum peccori caput auerso sole passe cogendum head sheepe weake therefore ought fed turned sun hot country little sun setting water sheep lead pasture againe time sweetenesse seemeth renewed grasse autumnall equinoctium good feede corne field haruest two cause first exceedingly filled hearbs find plough also tread downe stubble dung land whereby becommeth fruitfull next year nothing maketh sheep grow fat drinke therefore read holy scripture iacob watered sheep daughter iethro sheep time moyses came vnto therefore best oftentimes mingle water salt according verse cui lactis amor cytisum lotos que frequentes ipse manu salsa que ferat praesepibus herbas hinc amant fluvios magi magi vbera tendunt et salis occultum referunt lacte saporem bee many trouble themselues question namelythe reason sheepe england drinke cause sheep england neuer thirst except see water also seldom drink yet haue sheep england country world insomuch thinke prodigious thing sheepe drinke true cause english sheepe drinke much dew grasse neede water therefore aristotle deceiued thinketh northern sheep mor neede water southern spaine sheep bear best fleece wooll drinke least iland sephalene haue shewed story goate cattle want water draw could aire hotter country euery day least ten clocke morning water sheepe great operation drinke sheepe diuers author reporte wonder thereof valerius maximus theophrastus affirme macidonia haue sheep bring forth white lamb lead riuer aliatmon haue bring forth black lamb riuer axius haue shewed already also reported riuer scamander doth make sheep yellow drinke thereof likewise two riuers antandria turne sheepe blacke white white blacke like might adde riuer thrases two riuers beotia al thing come passe miracle also power nature may appeare history iacob serued father law laban couenanted laban receaue stipend spotted sheepe scripture saith manner iacob tooke rod greene poplar hayesell chesnut tree pilled white strake made white appeare rod put rod pilled gutter watering troughes sheepe came drinke sheepe sheepe heate rod afterwards brought foorth yoong partie colour small great spot iacob parted lambes turned face flocke towards partiecoloured lambes manner blacke among sheepe laban put owne flockes themselues put laban flocke euery ramming time stronger sheepe iacob layed rod eye sheepe gutter might conceaue rod sheepe feeble put feebler laban stronger iacobs vpon action patriarke iacob cleare testimony holy scripture diuers colour layed sheepe time carnall copulation doe cause bring forth colour see eye force naturall impression reade story faire woman sight blackamores haue conceaued brought forth blacke child contrary blacke deformed woman haue conceaued faire beautifull child whereof could reason giuen nature onely cogitation vpon faire beautifull men blacke deformed moore time carnall copulation would haue seeme incredible wise discrete reader heare power water change colour sheepe granted nature bring forth diuers coloured lamb holpen artificial mean see cause diuersitie water may wholy alter colour elder well whited stick ingender colour yoonger thus much shall suffice haue spoken concerning summering sheepe wintering say come entreate stabling housing copulation sheepenow followeth next place discourse copulation procreation diuers good rule necessary obseruations whereby skilfull shepheard must directed ought obserue better encrease flocke first therefore cleare goates engender yeare old sometime sheepe also follow season difference betwixt lambes engendered begotten elder therefore two yeare old may safely suffered engender continue till fiue yeare old lamb preserued breeding fiue yeare old strength naturall vertue decreaseth neither damme lambe worthy nourishing except knife borne bred old decayed substance also resemble quality sire allow lambe yeaned parent foure yeare olde giue foure yeares engender breede namely till eight yeare olde eight yeares vtterly cast opinion may haue good reason according qualitie region wherein liue sooner begin beare yoong sooner giue ouer herein differ cowes breede till foure yeare olde may continue longer cause expresse testimony albertus writeth thus oues parere v que ad annum octauum possunt si bene curentur vel vndecimum facultas pariendi protrahitur quod tempus est tota fere vita oues quibusdam tamen terris marini vbi sicca salsa habent pascua viuunt per vigintie annos pariunt say sheepe may breede vntill eight yeare olde well kept vntill eleauen time part length day although country vpon sea costes liue till twenty yeare old time breed yoong one feede vpon dry salt pasture therefore aristotle also saith bring forth yoong one time life time copulation pliny varro write may till middle august meaning sheepe hot country england place shepheardes protract time copulation keepe rammes ewe asunder till september october would haue lambes fall cold winter season spring warme weather obserued auncient shepard strongest sheepe doe first begin engender couple one anotheraristotle albertus betokeneth happy fortunate yeare flocke contrary younger weaker sheepe bee first stirred vp lust elder backward slow presageth pestilent rotten yeare drinke salt water prone copulation othershelpes copulation sheep commonly third fourth time female filled male great similitude likenesse betwixt sheep goates first copulation couple together time secondly time beare young fiue month hundred fifty day also many time bring forth twin like goates ram must alwaie admitted lambes may fall spring yeare thing grow sweete greene performed must male seperated female againe time goe young may go quietly without harme conception hindered bee ouer fat among mare horsses barren nature others accident ouer much leanenesse ouermuch fatnesse plutarch maketh mention ancient custome among graecians wont driue sheepe habitation agenor couered rammes know whether relate story prouerbe signifie fruitefull happy ramming time rather encline latter himselfe saith place agenor wise skilfull king maister many flockes whose breede sheepe accounted best nation therefore either sent female couered rammes else signified happy coniunction rammes ewe together pliny writeth right stone ram tyed bound fast leapeth vpon eewmeanes make ram get male female engender male left stone tyed beget female neare citty patrae two riuers one called milichus charadrus cattle drinke water spring time beget male therfore shepheards bring sheep goat riuer driue farther side riuer would haue female male vertue lyeth one side kyne suffer drinke side among heards male best buls ox serue sacrifice till earth therefore male kind al female acceptable male female begotten wel vertues water vertue rammes likewise vertue winde north wind bloweth part male conceiued south wind female therefore aristotle saith admissur ae tempore obseruare siccis diebus habitus septentrionales vt contra ventum gregem pascamus eum spectans admittatur pecus sifeminae generandae sunt austrinos flatus captare vt eadem ratione matrix ineantur say ramming time must obserue blowing northerne wind dry dayes onely feede flocke wind also cause ram leape eew face north would engender female must like manner obserue south winde vnto experiment doe palladius aelianus col umella agree thinges necessary bee obserued engendering lamb ewe filled ram diligent shephard must haue great regard keepe abortement casting lamb therefore aristotle saith presently copulation fal shower great young eat wallnuts acorn wil cast lamb likewise time thunder ewe yoong alone fielde clap thunder wil cause abortmentalbertus remedy thereof auoyding mischiefe prescribed pliny tonitrus saith solitarijs ouibus abortus inferunt remedium est congregare ea vt coetu inventur call together time thunder remedy abortment therefore requireth skilfull shepheard voyce whisell intelligable sheepe whereby call together bee scattered abroad feeding first appearance note thunder also reported certaine vaines vnder tongue rambe colour whereof doe presadge foreshew colour lambe begotten white blacke party coloured also colour engender yeaning lambes bathius ewe bring foorth part one time sometimes two sometimes three sometimes foure reason whereof attributed either qualitie foode whereof eate else kinde deriued bee certaine sheepe orchades alwaies bring foorth two one time many sixe also sheepe magnetia affrick bring foorth twice yeare aristotle wonder writeth sheepe vmbria bring foorth thrice yeare among illirians sheepe goates bring forth twice yeare two time yea sometimes three foure fiue nourish altogether aboundance milke besides milke milked away egypt plentifull grasse sheepe bring foorth twice yeare likewise twice lipped likewise mesapotamia moist hot country many time falleth ewe dyeth yeaning hir lambe many time bring foorth monster also doe beastes multipara betwixt goate rammealbertus musmon begottten betwixt goate bucke ewe beast cinirus engendred among rhaetians many time mixed monster brought foorth hinder partes goates forepart sheepe rammes growe strong olde wanton leape vppon female goates vpon beget monster die part immediatly yeaning sometimes wilde rammes come tame sheepe beget vppon lambes colour wooll doe resemble father afterward beare yongue wooll beginneth like vulgar sheepe ewe ready deliuered trauaileth laboureth like woman therefore shepheard haue midwiues skill case extremitie may drawe lambe member sticke crosse matrix else vnpossible dead dam belly yet cut without perill daunger ewe case graecians call shepheard embruoulcos custody ewe yoong lamb meanes encrease milkehauing thus brought sheepe deliuery multiplication kinde resteth prouide new borne lambe may secured dog wolues fox crowes rauens enemy innocent beast also prouide ewe may render yongue one sufficient foode vdder therefore must bee well extraordinarily fed haue shewed alreadie vse salt also profitable ewe newly deliuered lambe make eate drinke liberally winter time encrease milke steede greene pasture thing haue expressed requisite giue corne especially plenty beanes cause prescribe bee giuen sheepe hearbe lanaria affirme profitable giuen encrease milke stone galacites beaten powder annointed vppon ewe vdder prescribe sprinckle water salt vppon euery morning house fielde sunne rising herein leaue euery man owne iudgement hoping offensiue relate thing expressed resting opinion foode receiued inwardly also ointment applied outwardly sufficient meanes procure aboundance milke sommer winter season therefore followeth entreate likewise wintering sheepeof wintering stabling sheepe cost keepe cold weather warme doth require handes discourse thereof behooueth prouide warme fold stable whereof poet writeth manner incipiens stabulis edico mollibus herbam carpere oueis dum mox frondosa reducitur aestas et multa duram stipula filicumque maniplis sternere subter humum glacies ne frigida laedat molle pecus scabiem que ferat turpeis que podagras whereby euident colde winter doe beget sheepe diuers many disease cause counsell wise learned man sheepe turned feeding neither cold warme weather vntill frost dissolued thawed grasse earth tarentine graecian asian sheepe wont altogether kept stable within doores lying continually vpon planck boords boared throughpalladius pet crescent precious fleece might better safegarded owne filth vrine three time yeare let stable wash annoint oyle wine saue free serpent burned stable vnder cratches galbanum cederwood woman haire hart horne tarentine graecian sheepe columella writeth manner vaine man store himselfe tarentine sheepe aske much attendance costly foode body worth beastes beare wooll tender able endure hardnesse among sheepe none tender tarentine graecian sheepe therefore keeper must looke haue playing day time negligence sluggishnesse much lesse regard couetous minde cattell altogether impatient cold seldome led abroad therefore home fed hand couetousnesse negligence one withdraw ordinary foode shall penny wise pound foolish suffer great losse cattell sauing little meate euery one winter long fed three pintes barley pea beanes three time day beside dryed ewe leaues vine leaues hay late mowen fitch chaffe besides cannot milke taken dam first yeaning serue little least lambes day euen smell tast dammes belly killed want sucke euery lambe preserued breede might haue two dammes ewe sucke poore ewe forced double miserie first loose yoong one afterward lend pap milke stranger moreouer forced nourish male female two yeare olde either gelded killed sell beautifull skin merchant wooll pretious reason neuer seldome went abroad fieldes custodie house serpent annoyance thus described poet disce odoratam stabulis incendere cedrum galbaneo que agitare graues nidore chelydros saepe sub immotis praesepibus aut malat actu vipera delituit coelum que exterrita fugit aut tecto assuetus coluber consideration whereof paine housing tender sheepe poet teacheth shepheard sheepemaster kill serpent dash braines snake saying cape saxa manu cape robora pastor tollentem que mina sibila colla tumentem deijce concerning auncient formes sheepe stablesthe fashion sheepe coates stable find recorded auncients first made low high loftie building stretching length heigth may warme winter time although creature better cloathed nature sheepe yet impatient cold apt take harme thereby must ouerbroad yet ewe lambe may lye together breathing place left open top house side wil let much ayre doore porch entrance low fresh ayre may quickly easily come low head body also breath better auoide stable also care couer flower strawe dry boared boords matter whereby might stand continually dry warm also cleane sweete end might annoyed owne standing therefore floore made sheluing falling low one side else hurdle like basket let vrine often make water often changed cleansed turned stable ought diuisions partition wherein time necessitie sicknesse may easily abide alone parted residue feede without anoyance one another especially one may ride another time winter let cattell drinke aboue day manner olde time bought sold sheepeand cure auncients flock sheepe vppon liued bought sold herein also profitable obserue ancient manner bargaines creature man came bought sheepe made protestation seller tanti sunt mihi emptae seller answereth sunt buyer draweth money word sic illasce e qua de agitur sana recte esse vti pecus ouillum quod recte sanum est extra luscam minam ventre glabro ne que de pecore morboso esse habere que recte licere haec si recte fieri respondes c first buyer saith shall buye sheepe thus much money draweth money marchant seller answereth shal saith chapman buyer againe promise sheepe sound sheepe without fault winde limbe without blindnesse without deafenesse without peild belly comming infected flocke shall lawfull inioy without men contradiction thing true strike vp bargaine yet doth seller change propertie sheepe loose lordship ouer vntill money paid hereupon commeth passe buyer may condemne seller cattell good bargaine doe deliuer euen buyer subiect iudgement doe deliuer price concerning shepheards custodie flockes may adde word two first number sheepe many may safely kept euery flocke neede giue rule businesse auncients wont set one shepheard ouer hundred rough course wolled sheepe two shepheards ouer hundred fine wolled sheepe common flockes seauentie fourescore shepheard followed charged vigilant gentlethe generall disciplin shepheards therefore discipline duci propior esse quam domino incogendis recipiendisque ouibus ad clamatione ac baculo minetur nec vnquam telum emittat neque ab longius recedat nec aut recubet aut concidat nam nisi procedit stare debet quoniam grex quidem custodis officium sublimem celsissimam que oculorum veluti speculam desiderat vt ne que tardiores grauidas dum cunctantur ne que agiles foetas dum procurrunt seperari cateris sinat ne fur aut bestia hallucinantem pastorem decipiat saith columella must rather guide vnto lord master ouer driuing forward receiuing home haue stragled must rather vse chiding voice shake staffe cast either stone dart neither must goe far time sit downe stand stil except driueth flocke desireth direction keeper eye like loftie watchtower suffer separated asunder either heauy ewe great yong slow pace yet light nimble one giue sucke deliuered yoong apt run away lest rauening beast theefe deceaue loytering shepheard taking away fro hinmost formost may also flock sheep flock goat bicause goat wanton disperse themselues abroad sheep meeke gentle part keepe round together yet better make many flockes one great one feare pestilence story dogges haue shewed already necessary sheapheards dog flocke defend wolues fox therefore euery shepheard must obserue rule expressed prouision choyce institution dogge conclude discourse sheapheard lamb young must driue dam farre pasture feede neare towne village house second care must bee picke cull aged sicke sheepe euery yeare autumne winter time least dye infect fellowes least whole flocke go decay want renewing substitution others therefore must still regard one dead supply place one two least chance kil one time houshold counsell antiphanes profitable bee followed illar tantum mactare debes oues ex quibus nullus amplius fructus vel casij vel veleris vel lactis vel agnorum perniet kil sheepe neuer expect profit lamb milke cheese fleece disease sheepe cause generall next place necessary wise discret sheapheard avoide meanes whereby health flocke endangered either reason meate foode eatof disease sheep else reason naturall sickness arising corruption blood third way biting venomous beastes serpent wolues like fourth way scabbes gowtes swelling like outward disease venomous meates hearbes vnto sheepe herb latin cal herba sanguinaria pilosella numularia german english cald faenegreek french hurt doth vnto sheepe vse circumscription lherbe qui tue le brebis hearbe destroyeth sheepe called also serpentine snake adder hurt therewith recouer woundes eating therof sheep hath eaten hearbe belly thereof swelleth aboundantly also drawen together sheepe casteth mouth certaine filthy spume froath smelleth vnsauourly neither poore beast able eseape death except presently hee let blood vaine vnder taile next rumpe also vpper lip yet hearbe wholsome cattle exeept sheepe alone wherefore sheapheards must diligently auoide little low hearbe creeping vpon ground two round leaues much vnlike parsly hath sauour smelleth flower pale smelleth strong stalke much vnlike flower groweth moist place neare hedge wood spring time sheeepe eate dew called honydew poyson vnto dye thereof likewise cane autumne make belly swell vnto death drinke presently haue eaten thereof meat breaketh gut asunder like may said sauine tamariske rhododendron rosetree al kindes henbane female pimpernell doth likewise destroy sheepe except assoone haue eaten meete hearbe called ferus oculus wildeeye heerein lyeth wonder whereas two kind hearb male female earnestly desire male eagerly avoyde female seeing haue tast pallate man tast like raw root beet hearbe normandy called duua much vnlike rubarbe great gentian narrower leaues standing vpright nearue whereof middle red groweth water therefore coniecture may watersorrell waterplanton whereof sheep haue eaten fall disease called also duua bred liuer certain litle black worm leech growing smal bagges skinnes length halfe finger much breadth wherewithall beast infected vncurable therefore remedy take life true butcher themseles affirme many time doe find little wormes sheepes lyuer say come drinking fenny marshywater conclude kinde pannicke also whereof sheepe haue eaten destroyeth hearbes euery common sheapheard knoweh hurtfull vnto sheepe beast selfe though nature bee simple yet wise enough chuse owne foode except vehement necessity famine hunger causeth eate poysoned hearbs case bellyes swell haue wormes belly haue deuoured herb eat poure belly vrin men sheaphard must cut halfe sheepes eare bleede beast shall well bleed must killed eaten else starue owne accord time sheep chance deuoure leach pouring oyle throat shall safe danger cold sheepe sheep bone neare hip bend sound strong feele bend vnder hand hold weake feeble likewise man take head skinne necke follow easily draweth signe weakenesse imbicility doth striue follow great difficulty token altius ad vivum persedit horrida cano bruma gelu vel cum tonsis illotus ad haesit sud r hir suti secuerunt corpus vepres dulcibus id circo fluuijs pecus omne magistri per fundunt vdis que aries fall leanesse want food therefore remedy prouided euill one infected defile residue sheep subiect contagion remedy wherof france vse medicine first sheare sheep mingle together pure froath oyle water wherein hop haue bin sod leeze best wine let soke two three day together afterwardes wash seawater want sea water salt water medicine approued wherby scab tike remoued sheep also wooll groweth better soked water wash therewith make another medicine sulphur brimstone cypresse white lead butter mingled altogether annoint sheep therewith take earth soft durt softned stale asse euermore shaue scabbed watch according turne fell asleep threescore said sheep killed wolues thing came question among common magistrats know reason factcoelius herodotus came passe whether negligence violent incursion permitted vnto iews eaten among comon vulgar meat also burned altar sacrifice whereas said egyptian onely eat sacrifice swine flesh god himselfe forbid people neuer eate taste swine flesh abhominable thing signifieth contrarie precept men owne lawes hee forbiddeth allow allow forbiddeth therefore farre people god ought superstition tradition men manifest comparison neuer sanctified came temple neuer lawfull approoued god thing law haue greatest appearance crueltie yet iust equall indifferent inuentions men seeme stuffed mercie gilted ouer compassion thing worthy reader haue thought good expresse place dignitie honourable account greatest men world former time haue made sheepe thereby would incite stir vp one noble spirited learned man furnished witte meanes opportunitie diue pierce secret english sheepe shepheards manifest vnto world best approoued meanes medicine propulsing driuing away manner disease innocent profitable beast conseruation manner health welfare sorry time farre world professor religion would halfe many true diuell slaunderously obiected iob namely doe serue god nothing rather iues haue diuels fauour rich garment delicate fare lazarus misery contempt enioy fauour god set vp hope world men see sonne loueth father patrimony one man maketh much hope receaue benefite recompence therefore maruell silly beastes haue obtained little mercy loued god creature profitable seruiceable necessity men cause nourish like apolonians aforesaid oracle sake fleece flesh therefore haue compassion learne helpe misery publish world general benefite cannot good mercifull vnto beast mercie doth easily die groweth one hart one mortall man company people egypt called lycopolitae worshipped wolfe god therefore alone among egyptian eate sheepe wolfe eate euen make better reckoning men nourish sheepe profit onely lycoplitaes worshipped wolfe men haue god belly therefore trust reason shall perswade one write large discourse english sheepe next place discourse vtilities commeth sheepof ueral meekest beastes rewarde meekenesse part profitable man flesh blood milke profitable meat skin wooll togither assunder garment gut intrals musicke horne hooues perfuming driuing away serpentes excrement belly egestion dung amending enriching plowed land occasion egyptian worship god could see creature world part altogither vnprofitable vnto men found none first al therefore beginne flesh although physitians haue seuerall conceites thereof galen saith flesh hare better flesh ox sheepe simeon sethi forced confesse goodnesse mutten sheepesflesh beginning middle spring yet writeth ful superfluity euil iuice hurtfull al flegmy moist stomackes crescentiensis also writeth flesh sheepe hath vnpleasant tast ouermuch humidity fit none countrylabouringmen indeed graunt opinion platina writeth thus concerning ram ouem arietem dentibus ne atting non modo enim eius caro non prodest verum etiam vehementer ouest rammes flesh wee ought neuer touch onely vnprofitable much hurtfull yet england flesh rammes vsually eaten either craft subtilty butcher else couetousnes many house haue hearde kind venison made flesh rammes done meanes first take ramme beat stripe part til flesh grow redde nature blood wil gather sicke affected place stande comfort meanes ramme killed flesh looketh like venison discourse namely hare cony wee haue already shewed hatred cruel meates also vtterly dislike sufficient kill eat beast first put tyrrannical torment cannot tell wil suffice except deale beastes pilate christ first whipped crowned thornes yet afterward crucifie taking away rammy humour ranke moistnes founde malesheep vse geld young sucke dammes else within compasse yeare yeaning whereby flesh becommeth temperate sweet sauoury flesh worlde passe yeare vse knit time stone depriued nourishment body reason knitting drie consume away vtterly fall whereby whole flesh beast made seasonable wholesome granted al young say yeare old flesh wholesome fit norishment man nature increase much phlegme euil alaied eating viniger drinking wine vnto many place salt muttens killed eat pickle else roast smoake like bacon within territory helvetia publicke law whereby butcher forbidden buy forren sheep feast saint iames fiue twentie day iuly although time grow fat yet flesh lesse wholesome fatte hurtful gotten springe yeare needlesse set downe diuision deade sheepe quarter shoulder legges loines rackes heades purtinances commonly knowne relation minister smal learning reader euery part hath vse euen blood taken throat cut hath peculiar vse norishment man aboue al thinges fat loines commonly called sewet wherein excelleth al beast whatsoeuer reines couered al ouer fat milktheir lesse vse milke onely young old person aswel rich beautifie table poore serue hungry appetite people affricke haue corne al country therefore insteede bread common food milke goodnesse whereof thus expressed fierra quod praestat caprae post oues inde boues euermore milke ewe best newest thickest commeth blacke sheepe preferred milked white generally beast whereof eate milke thereof good nourishable therefore milke sheepe preferred second place cause put second place fatnesse thereof otherwise deserued first fatnesse maketh lesse pleasant palate stomack man yet pretious making cheese haue shewed already place island erythrea milk sheep yeildeth whaie make cheese therof mingling abundance water make abundance cheese apenine hils lyguria cheese sicilia made goates sheepes milke generally cheese made sheepes milke better new nature sheepe giue milke eight moneths togither italy make butter also milke sheepe al summer time vnto feast saint michaell milke twice day vntil coople rammes milke day fault cheese made milke either ouer dry hollow full eye hole else clammy like kind satyrium salt water haue said discourse afore going time copulation haue peculiar voice draw allure female differing common bleating wherof poet speaketh bloterat hincaries pia balat ouis beast obijce postes rage ramming ime siluis dioxippus arietat primo obijcit que immania membra seneca booke anger magno imperatori aretequamacies inter se arietarent cox exiluit indeed great violence ram reported many time rhatia try violence hold betwixt fighting ram sticke bat cornetree bout two vtterly diminish bruse peeces knowne fable abstenius wolfe found coople rammes told must haue one dinner bad hem agree betwixt themselues whose lot death happen one must die two ram agreede togither wolfe stand middle close twain part one one corner corner field com running wolfe came last loose life wolues mercy wolfe agreed deuice chose standing ram consented horne came vpon make sure inough hurting sheepe forth therfore went ram vnto quarter one east west wol e standing ioyfully midst laughing ram destruction began two ram set forward violence one attending obseruing might meet togither vpon wolfe vengeance enimy hauing betwixt horn crushed rib piece fel without stomack ram flesh inuention althogh haue another morrall yet material inserted place shew violence ram came many warlike inuentions called arietes wherwithal push wals cittiesmartial warlike inue tions called rammes reader may see vitruuius valturnis ammianus say warlike ram made wood couered ouer shels torteyses intent burned set wall also couered skin sackecloath rowes artificially contriued within beame pointed crooked yron therefore called ram rather front hard ouerthrew wals violent strength men forced vpon wheras shaped ouer tortoise shels true resemblace bare therewith like torteise doth sometime put forth head somtime pull also doth ram sometime put forth sickle sometime pul hide within frame engine ouerturn wals also caused stone flie vpon enimies liue thunderbolt striking downe euery side wounding fal stroke like blowes armed man force counterforces deuised part besieged greatnes thereof could moued without singular note ostentation gaue besieged time oppose instrument war safegard called culcitrae laquei lupi ferrum made like paire tongs wherby polyaenus writeth many time came passe wall ouerthrowne enimies durst enter saying cerle hostes sponte ab obsessis destructa moenia metuentes ingredi vrbem non audebant thus much force ram true naturall strength also artificial imitation men otherside wise shepheards want deuises restraine wrath impetious beast epicharmus syracusan saith ther hole regione camandu vrietes non minores asinis sunt cauda tam longu lat vt triginta librarum pondus aequent camandu territory tartaria ram like ass stature quantity whose tailes long broad ballance waight thirty pound vartoman writeth adibus regis arabium fuisse praepingus veruecem cutus cauda adeo obesa fuit vt libra quadraginta appenderet propi reame vrbem arabiae foelicis veruecum genus reperiuntur quorum caudam animaduerti pondo esse librarum quadragintu quatuor carent cornibus adeo que esse obesi pingues vt vix incedere possunt circa zeclam vrbem aethiopiae verueces non nulli ponderasissimas trahunt cauda vt pote pondo sedecim librarum caput collum nigricant caeteris albi sunt sunt etiam verueces prorsus albicantes quorum cauda cubitatis est longitudinis modo eluboratae vitis palearia vt bubus mento pendent quae humum prope verrunt say house king arabia weather fat whose taile waighed forty pound neare vnto reamia citty arabia foelix breed race weather whose tailes part waied foure forty pound want horne fat scarcely go also citty zecla aethiopia weather draw long tailes waighing sixteene pound whereof haue head necke blacke part body white againe al white hauing taile cubit long like curious planted vine crestes haire hanging chinne grounde thus farre arabian weather indian hee writeth thus another place circa tanasuri vrbem indiae tanta est pecudum copia vt duodeni veruices singulo aureo vaeneunt conspiciuntur illic verueces alij cornu haud ab similia daemis habentes nostris longe maiores ferocioresque candae veruecem perigrinis regionibus tantae sunt quantus nullus apud no veruex contingit hoc quia hutindissimum hoc animal inter quadrupedia frigidissimum eum que coetera essa vetendi nequeant ne pinguedine immensa extensis etiam assibus neruis non parum quae humida natura velut pisces semper incremento apta sunt citty tarnasar india great plenty cattell sell twelue weather noble yet weather haue horne like horne deere longer greater fiercer ram aboundance therefore nature hath prouided remedy sende forth taile whereby flesh fat groweth exceedingly bone nerues whereof little extended also moist nature like fish therefore apt encrease grow water vntill al water boiled away afterwards must put thereunto pinte sheepes milke goates also honey euery day together men commaund take one dram swallowes dung three cup ful goat milke sheepes could coniecture reason age long vse piece defaced nose dried vp also haire worne away bald apparant vnto rather inclined resembled hart hence drawer made nostril lesse might answere proportion face among forefather especially handle taken away face beast placed instead thereof vnto may adde another horn seene castle l william wernhere count cimbria blacke hollow length one arme thicke great staffe said beast beareth two bee seene amonge rare monument ferdinandus emperor sqvirrell name beast graecians called sciuros giuen fashion proportion theyr taile couereth almost whole body fabulously saide sciapodes haue seete couer whole body truely verified squirrel taile day time nest hideth selfe vnder sunne raine first author euer wrote beast oppianus liued day antoninus caesar latines haue proper natiue name borrow graecians although later writer cal pirolus spiurus thinke would say sciurus vulgarly termed latine also call sculurus currendo nimble running vppon boughes nation world deriue seuerall denomination graecians english squirrell sciurus farre fetched french word escurieu escureau german borrow word eychorn eichorn eych horn ich hermlin weasill tree da eychorn italian call schiriuolo venetian massarius testifieth schiriati spaniard harda esquilo interpret coma dreia squirrel illyrian weweeka polonians wije wijerka turne mouse varius haue said elsewherein story german call werck veeh fech albertus agricola say difference betwixt mouse varius squirrel onely region altreth colour therefore haue expressed figure thereof remitting reader said history say germany red yeare old time blackish till yeare old polonia redashcolour branded grysell russia ordinary ash colour quantity food maner natural inclination hath part mouse varius varinus hesychius say graecians call beast also campsiouros hippouros call cappadocian mouse neexis squirrell iewes daye call squirrell coach apparant auncient time til came part world graecia europe neuer knew saw beast shall suffice haue said name squirrel greater compasse weasil weasil longer squirrel backe part body red except belly white heluetia blacke branded hunted autumne fal leafe tree growe naked run leape bough bough admirable agile manner leaues cannot bee wel discerned three colour first age blacke second rusty yron colour last al striken age ful white hoare haires teeth like teeth mouse hauing two vnder teeth long sharpe taile alway big body lyeth continually vpon backe sleepe sit still seemeth giuen couering haue said already mawgut differeth al coecum take without passage part gut like man bladder great ventricle dissection hath bin found ful stuft excrement genital like bone vesalius writeth vse forefoot instead hand sit vppon buttockes mooue meat mouth point resembling euery little vulgar mouse yet put mouth hold teeth wil eat nut almondes greedily also apple buckmasts acornes sometimes hearbes especially lettuce al sweet fruit foot clouen like mouse hinder part fleshy sit vpon summer time build nest countrey called drayes top tree artificially stickes mosse thing wood affoord mouth nest variable sometimes side sometimes top commonly shut winde therefore thinke shee maketh many passage stopping opening winde turneth summer time gather togither aboundance fruit nuttes winter euen much little dray holde containe carrie mouthes lodge manie time two togither male female suppose sleep great part winter like alpine mouse soundely haue seene noise hunter could awake al cry beating nest outside shootinge boltes arrowes thorough vntil pulled assunder wherein many time found killed awaked incredible agility motion neuer standing stil appeareth tamed leape tree tree vse taile instead wing apparant many time leap great distance supported without sinking man appearance againe haue seene leape toppe high tree downe grounde ordinary pace birdes flie tree light earth receiue harme al hunted men must goe multitude many men cannot take one bowes bolt dogges except start rouze little smal slender wood man may shake hand seldome taken bowes requisite remoue rest twistes tree much terrified al hollowing except bee struck one meanes wel know harbour high oake vnto secure lodge therein men dogges therefore seeing troblesome climbe euerie tree must supply businesse labor bow bolt squirrel resteth presently shee may feele blow cunning archer neede feare much harme except hit head reason strong backebone fleshy part abide great stroake dogge yea haue seene one remoued bough shot ground driuen ground tree creepe hedge token wearinesse stately mind little beast limbes strength lasteth tarrieth saueth self top tal tree discended falleth mouth euery curre vse dogges hunting admirable witte beast appeareth swimming passing ouer water hunger conuenient prey meat constraineth passe ouer riuer shee seeketh rinde smal barke tree shee setteth vppon water goeth holding vppe taile like saile letteth winde driue side witnessed olaus magnus description scandinauia ordinary among squirrelles reason many riuers otherwise cannot passeouer also carry meate mouth preuent famine whatsoeuer befall peacockes couer themselues tailes hot summer rage sunne vnder shaddow disposition doth squirrell couer body heate cold growe exceeding tame familiar men accustomed taken young runne vp men shoulder oftentimes vpon handes creepe pocket nuttes goe doores returne home againe taken aliue olde get loose neuer returne home againe therefore may wel bee called semiferi rather cicures harmeful wll eat al manner woollen garment discommodity sweetesportfulbeastes pleasant playfellowes house saide tast garlicke wil neuer bite thinge prescribd cardan tame skin exceeding warm wel regarded skinner heat verie agreeable body men therefore mixed also skin fox flesh sweet wholesome except squirrel blacke one tender comparable flesh kid cony andl tailes profitable make brush medicins part expressed dormous sauing may adde archigenes writeth fat rauening creature dogges taste dogges flesh beares beares yet hogges eat swine flesh yea many time damme eateth hir younge one found swine haue abstaind flesh men child haue slaine theeues could foundalbertus aelianus greatest part body torne piece eaten wilde swine indeed see hen eat vp egges themselus haue layd shal obserue sow deuoure frutes owne wombes whereat ought maruel monstrous prodigious thing rather acknowledge naturall voracity constrained thorough famine impatience also eat snailes salamander especially bore mountaines cilicia although salamander verye deadly poison yet doeth hurt afterward men beast tast swine flesh operation poison worketh vpon mortally neither maruaile frog eateth toad whereas man eat hemlocke presently al blood congealeth body dieth hogge eat thereof hee onely dieth thriueth groweth fat thereby aristotle reported one great wonder place thracia saith wherein compasse twenty pace groweth barley whereof men eate safely ox sheep creature auoid mortall poyson swine wil vouchsafe tast men excrement haue eaten thereof auoide carefully swine delight meat also delight drinke especially summer time therefore keepe sucking sowes must regard giue belliful drinke twice day generally must lead water goat sheepe heat summer rising dogstar must keepe altogether water side may owne pleasure drinke lie downe wallow mire coast dry cannot bee obtained without resistance beast like reported pliny sonne l apronius bin consul bodie grew fat taken body remaining immouable spring time swine owne accord grow fat many time cannot stand leg body heauy go whit remoued drouen carried cart varro crescentiensis report admirable thing fatnes swine first varro saiththe great fatnes swine hee receiued knowledge credible honest man portugall swine killed vppe fatting whole yeare together much profit gather feeding verye easie obserue daily keep attend haue charge ouerseeing must great care drinke thracia put vp hog fatting giue drinke first daie let generation copulationof copul tion b eed swine noted bore male swine wil remaine validity good breed past three yeare old opinion auncient engendereth age weake profitable kept nourished eight moneths olde beginneth leape female good keepe close kinde two moneths feede barly raw sow barly sodden one bore sufficient ten sowes heare voice female desiring bore eate vntil hee admitted wil continue pining indeed hee wil suffer female haue al bee groweth leane fatten cause homer like wise husbandman prescribeth male female swine kept assunder till time copulation continue long act copulation reason thereof lust hot yet proceeding heat yet seed verie plentiful time copulation angry outragious fighting one another irefully purpose vse harden rib rubbing voluntarily vppon tree choose part morning copulation fat young endure euery part yeare day leane weake old able satisfie female lust cause many time sinketh vnderneath yet filleth lyeth ground buttock together engender oftentimes one yeare reason whereof ascribed meat extraordinary heat comon thing al liue familiarly among men yet wilde swine couple bring forth yeare seldome filled meat endure much paine get much cold venus men beast companion satiety therefore onely bring forth springe time warme weather obserued night soeuer wilde hogge sow farroweth storme raine bee many cause tame domesticall hog bring forth engender often wilde first fed ease secondly liue togither without fear society often prouoked lust otherside wilde swine come sildome together often hungrey cause dull lesse venereous yea many time haue one stone cause called aristotle ancient graecians chlunes monorcheis time ows bo gbut concerning sow beginneth suffer bore eight moneths age although according diuersity region aire differ time copulation begin foure moneths againe tary till yeare old maruell euen male engendereth yeare olde begetteth weake tender vnprofitable pigges best time admission calends february vnto vernall equinoctiall hapneth bring forth young summer time foure month goeth young good pigges farrowed haruest purpose keepe al yeare store perceiue sowes haue conceiued seperate bore least raging lust prouoking troubled endangered abortment say sow may beare young till seauen yeare olde striue whereof euery poore swineheard may giue ful satisfaction yeare olde sow may well shee couered bore month february begin beare til twenty moneths old two yeares wil onely bring foorth stronger also beare longer time euen seauenth yeare time good let go riuers fennes miery place euen man delighted washing bathing doth swine filthy wallowing mire therein rest ioy repose albertus reporteth place germany sow hath bin found beare young eight year till fifteen year old fifteene yeare neuer seene sow brought foorth younge pigges sowe bee fatte alwaies lesse prone conceiue young whether shee young old first beginne seeke bore leape vpon swine processe cast foorthe certaine purgation called apria sow hippomanes mare also leaue heardfellowes kind behauior action latines call peculiar verb subare applied harlottes wanton woman horace iam que subando tecta cubilia tecta que rumpit english call boaring neuer resteth shew desire till come bore therefore olde woman lusteth man past lust natural possibility cald anus subans beast delighted pleasure carnal copulation many time falleth asleepe action male young dullplinius wil female leap vpon prouoketh yea rage tteth manie time vpon men woman especially doe weare white garment rage lust abated apria priuy place wet moistned vineger haue proper voice cry time boaring bore male vnderstandeth presently filled one copulation yet better safegarde preserue abortment good suffer bore couer hir twice thrice ouer conceiue first may safly permitted three foure time together obserued except eares hang downe flagging carelessely filled reiecteth seed eares fall downeward hang time boare vpon certaine token filled hath conceiued young foure monthes haue saide sow farroweth pig say fifth month seuenteenth weeke beast enabled nature beare twice yeare yet sucke young one two monthes together clouenfootedbeast beareth many time except sow except age beginneth loose apria purgation many time miscarrieth many time beare one yet maruailous beareth many engendereth perfect without blindnesse lamenesse distresse although wee haue saide place shall see swine whole hooued like horsse yet commonly naturally feete clouen therefore wonder accounted greater manifolde multiplycation reason thereof may arise multitude great quantity foode humour cannot well auoyded dispersed little bodye swine haue mare cowes therefore humour turneth multiply nature naturall kind commeth passeniphus ouermuch humour turned naturall seede breedeth much young little humour bringeth forth pigges also perfect also sufficiently furnished milk nourish till able feed themselues fat ground soyle plant groweth euen fruitefull sow pig hath brought forth aristotle number sow beareth ordinary number bring forth nourishe twelue sixteene rare see sixteene brought vp one sow howbeit hath beene seene sow hath brought forth twenty far often seuen eyght ten story festus sow brought forth thirty time word sow aeneas lauinius bring forth thirty white pigges one time wherefore lauinians much troubled signification monstrous farrow last receiued answer citty thirty year building called alba remembrance thirty white pigges pliny affirmeth image pigges sow damme seene day publique place body damme sowe preserued salt priestes alba shewed desired bee certified truth story returne number young pigges ordinary without miracle bred dammes belly find many sow hath dugges many may well nourish giue sucke vnto seemeth speciall worke god hath made tame beast fruitefull better recompence man meate custody first farrow may gathered fruitfull second third commonly exceede first last old age inferior number first iuuenal hath comparison betwixt white sow heighfar scropha foecundior alba fruitefull white sow belike white sowes bring colour reason poet speech heighfar day ptolomy younger one time brought forth sixe calues whereuppon came prouerbe regia vaccula fruitefull cow helenus telleth aeneas vpon sow thirty pigges aunswer oracle lauiniens concerning alba cum tibi sollicito secreti ad fluminis vndam littoreis ingens inuenta sub ilicibus sus triginta capitum foetus enixa iacebit alba solo recubans alibi circum vbera nati lecus vrbis erit requies ea certe laborum iuuenal saith thus conspicitur sublimis aper cui candida nomen scropha dedit laetis phrygibus mirabile sumen et nunquam visis triginta clara mamillis young one commeth forth dammes belly wounded imperfect reason harme therein receiued called metacherum many time swine engender monster commeth passe oftner little beastes greatest multitude cels appointed receipt seede reason wherof sometimes two heades one body sometimes two body one head sometime three legges sometime two none behind pigges without eares farrowed time dionisius tyrant went war dion partes perfect eares teach inconsiderately good counsell tyrant vndertooke voyage commonly found bee bred amonge also vnspeakable smalenesse like dwarfes cannot liue hauing mouth eares called latines aporcelli sow great pigge eate aboundantly acornes causeth cast farrow suffer abortement grow fat lesse fruitfull milke choyce pigge keepe store must chosen lusty strong damme bred winter time say bred heate summer lesse value prooue tender small ouermoyst yet also bred cold winter smal reason extream cold dammes forsake want milke moreouer bycause hunger pinch bite dugges vnprofitable nourished preserued winter time rather fit killed eaten young bee obserued reconciliation opinion namely hot country hogges preferred bee bred winter colde bred march aprill within tenne day farrowing grow haue teeth sowe euer offereth foremost dugge pigge commeth first belly residue take fortune falleth one one another another seemeth shee regardeth first naturall instinct much prefer example thereof residue may inuited like sucking imitation yet euery one tzetze saith keepeth first choice taken away dugge killed sold dugge presently dryeth milke turneth backewarde vntill bee gone one excepted nourished ordained beginning olde sow want milke time supply must made giuing young one fryed parched corne raw corne drinke procureth loosenesse best suckled place damme vsually abideth weaning good let fiue sixe sucke one time although every one sucke owne dug yet multitude milke dryed vp two month old may safely disioyned dame weaned euery yeare sow may breede eight monthes giue sucke foure best let feed asunder dam till haue vrterly forgotten sucke thus much procreation nourishment old young swine office first institution swineheardesthis beast loueth society liue heardes flockes together therefore auncients haue inuented hoggekeepers call swyneheardes wherein wont considered instruction first accustomed sound horne called abroad foldes feeding neuer suffered aboue twelue together trough parcell meate becommeth swyneheard saith collumella vigilent diligent industrious wise hee must carry head state nourisheth old young barren fruitfull consider time farrowing wheather neare hand far none may bee lost want obseruation farrowed hee must consider looke vppon see fit store nature probability much milk dam able afford many bring vp especially regard euery sow bring vp pig swine sty mingle one another loose owne young one lyeth downe giue sucke lendeth pap well stranger owne therefore herein must care wit heardsmen appeare many must shut vp euery sow young cannot little pitch tar let giue seueral markes seuerall farrowes memory may confounded another remedy auoyd confusion young pig one among another frame threshold stye pig may able go sow easily goe ouer may bee eased company safely included home shall stranger breake euery one nest expect returne dam ought exceede number eight although soecundity swine bee great yet better kil two three number bee aboue eight permit sucke dam multitude sucker quickly draw away nourishment dam eight regard must bee sow welfed sod barly like least couetous pinching beast leanenesse follow ouerthrow destruction another point good swineheard sweepe oftentimes sty although nature beast defileth thing wallowing mire yet look ouer tel chance missing else help poore pig ouer laid dam whensoeuer swineheard clenseth sty let cast sand drying thing moysture wetnesse may drunke vp damme ought permitted first ten day go forth stable except drinke afterward let go abroad adiacent pasture far often return may better giue suck young one litle one fortnight three weekes old desire follow parent wherfore must shut vp mother feed alone absence may better endure afterward shalbe weaned must fed summer time morning heat bee strong heate day led watry shadowy place may freed fro extreamity til coole day return must suffered feed winter time bee led abroad till frost yce thawed dissolued ten boares sufficient hundred sow although keepe fiue six hundred heard may read scripture great heards swine sauiour christ thus writeth agriculturae ab initio sui studiosus nec de pecore suillo mihi mino cura est quam vobis magnis pecuarijs cui enim eares non est communis quis enim nostrum fundum colit quin sue habent qui non audierit putras nostros dicere ignanum sumptus sum esse qui succidiam carnario suspendit potius ab laniario quam ex domestico fundo say haue beene long giuen follow husbandry alway great care garment many fiction transforming swine homer faineth companion vlisses circe turned swine interpreted manner circe signifie vnreasonable pleasure vlisses signifie soule companion inferior affection yeares strength oxe far dry temperament hog goate lesse dry oxe yet compared man swyne excelleth great resemblance similitude betwixt man flesh swine flesh haue proued tast haue eaten one table could find difference one euill innkepers hoasts haue deceiued men continued great descryed punished vntill last finger man mixed therewith found authours receiued reward swine flesh also lesse excrementall pigges flesh therefore nutrible moyster flesh sooner dispersed vertue auoided olde swine notwithstanding primitiue naturall moisture yet grow dry flesh worst al nature humidity helpeth concoction thereof swine flesh concocted engendereth many good humor yet withal ontaine kind glutinous humor stoppeth liuer rein especially nature apt infirmity althogh opinion wilde bore norishable tame swine laborous course life getting prey yet appeareth tame swine resty life easie gathering meate made fit nourishment man moist swine flesh without conuenient moisture many time wanting wilde bore poison stomacke yet man hath propounded himselfe thin extenuating diet would wish forbeare one except vse exercise may eat eares cheekes foot haslet well sod dressed prouided fresh sauced powdred maruell swine flesh shoulde well agree apparant liue dirt loue muddle man aske commeth passe swine feed liue filthily norishable nature man make answere reason good constitution body turne ill nutriment good flesh men sounde perfect healthy disposition temperature hurt little euill meat hard digestion euen well constituted tempered swine continuall feeding vpon euill thing grow onely harme also good estate nature processe time draweth good euill men haue moist stomackes eat swine flesh suffer thereby great harme water powred vpon wet ground increaseth dirt moistnes put vpon moist stomacke increaseth feeblenesse man dry moist stomack eate heereof like rain falling dry ground begetteth engendreth many wholesome frutes hearbes swine fatted dried figges nut much wholesome wine swine flesh nourishable therefore vniuersity salernum prescribed verse king england also commended loynes gut ilium porcorum bona sunt mala sunt refequorum fiera describeth eating hogsflesh manner sus tibi coenoso coena domesticus ore grata ferat nobis mensa hyemalis aprum ille licet currat de vertice montis aquosae carnis erit pluri sed tamen aptacibo est hinc feritas siluae que domant inania saxa post vlcerated let abstaine swine flesh especially eldest youngest good man taste eat flesh summer time hot weather onely allowed extreame frostes haue tempered man stomacke stomacke flesh wilde swine vndermost day salting tooke al tub trough rubbing al salt hanged vp two day winde third day anoint oile hange vp two day smoke afterward take downe againe hange lay vppe larder meat preserued still looking warily vnto preserue mouse wormes thus much shall suffice time flesh hogges porke bacon milk sow fat thick apt congeal needeth runnet turne breedeth little whay therefore fit stomacke except procure vomiting hath bin often proued drink eat sow milk fal scurffes leprosy disease asian hate aboue therefore egyptian added residue reason condemne sow vnclean filthy beast peculiarly saying manethon skinnes swine graecians call phorine vse skin made shooleather day reason tendernesse loosenesse thereof vse leaue sadlers couer bookes cause much better eyther sheepe goates skinnes hath deeper graine doeth easily fall paring skinnes make kind glew preferred taurocollum similitude call choerocollum fat swine precious lickor shooes bootes therewithall amber common vse groweth rough rude impolished without clearenesse sod greace sow giueth sucke getteth nitour shining beauty find mixe blood hogges medicine cast water take fish hunter country would take wolues fox make traine hogges liuer sodde cut piece annointed ouer hony annointing shoos swine grease draw dead catte cause beast follow speedily haires swine vsed cobbler shoomakers also euery boy knoweth make nosebleede dung sharpe yet iustly condemned columella vse fatten earth vine also burned therewithal except diligently watred rest fiue yeares without stirring pliny time studied enlarge make luttuce grow broadtheophrast close together slitting little stalke thrusting gently hog dung tree especial vse vsed ripen fruit make tree plentifull pomegranats almondes sweetned nut easily caused fall shell likewise fennel vnsauourie laying root thereof eyther hogsdung pigeon dung may cured apple tree affected razed wormes taking swine dung mixed made soft like morter vrine man layed vnto root recouered wormes driuen away bee rente stripe visible vppon tree endangered lost thereby cured applying vnto stripe wound dung swine apple tree loose poure vpon root stale swine shall establish settle wheresoeuer swine kept good keepe lodge horse smell breath voice hatefull magnanimious perfect spirited horsses thus much place concerning vse seuerall part swine whereunto may adde english experiment swine suffered come orchard digge vp root apple tree keeping ground bare vnder open nose benefit arise thereby increase frute verie inestimable heere saue selfe labor english hogges describe vsage maister tusser husbandrytus husb word followeth first al breeding spring yeare writeth generall let lent well kept offend thee march aprill breeder september writeth thus gather mast shall stand thee vpon seruant child yer mast gone left among bush shall pleasure thy swine feare mischiefe keepe acornes fro kine rooting pasture ring hog ye haue neede well ringled better doth feed though young elder lightly keepe best yet spare ringle great rest yoke sildome thy swine shacke time doth last diuers misfortune happen fast fancy whole eare hogge giue eare ill neighbor eare dogge keepe hog aduise thee meddow corne alowd cry ere borne lawlesse haunting often long dog set chaunting doth thee wrong againe october husbandry writeth though plenty acornes porkelings fat taken season may perish ratling swelling get throat thou loosest thy porkling crowne groat euer thing fat againe fall thou venterest thing fatnesse withall fatter better sell kill continue make proofe wil nouem writeth let hog fat loose none mast gone hogge falleth anon still fat vp till shrouetide come porke sowce beares taske house thus farre english husbandry swine followeth disease particular disease swine hemlocke bane panther swine wolues beast liue vpon deuouring flesh hunter mix flesh spreading casting flesh poysoned abroad bit morsel deuoured root white chamaelion mixed fryed barlyfloure water oyle also poison swinepliny aelianus blacke ellebor worketh effect vppon horse ox swine therefore beast eat white forbeare blacke wearisomenesse likewise henbane worketh many strange painfull conuulsions belly therefore perceiue haue eaten thereof run water gather snailes seacrabs vertue whereof escape death againe restored health hearb goose foot venemous swine also bee therefore neuer light vpon touch blacke nightshade present destruction vnto abstaine hart tongue great bur certaine instinct nature bitten serpent seacrabs snailes present remedy nature hath taught swine scythia relation pliny aristotle hurt poison except scorpion therefore soone euer stung scorpion die drink thus much poison swine cold beastes impatient best remedy make warm sty taken cleane faster good thing nature beast neuer eate feele himselfe sicke therefore diligent maister keeper swine must vigilantly regard beginning disease cannot euidently demonstrated forbearing meat measils measilles called greeke chalaza latine grandines like hailestones spred flesh especialy leaner part hog disease aristotle writeth proper beast world troubled herwith cause graecians call measily hog chaluros maketh theyr flesh verye loose soft germaines call disease finnen pfinnen italian gremme french ursume spot appeare root tongue like white seed therefore vsuall buying hogges nation pull tongue looke measils appeare one vpon tongue certaine whole body infected yet butcher affirme cleanest hog al hath three neuer hurt swine flesh swine may full yet none appeare vpon tongue voice altered wont abound hog haue fleshy leg shoulder moyst ouer plentifull make flesh sweeter abound tasteth like stockefish meat ouer watered appearance vpon tongue chapman buyer pulleth bristle backe blood follow certaine beast infected also
