impetuous mountaineliuer armed side like epithites onely three erimanthean calidonean myssean offer vnto v peculiar story according find poet wee prefix way morral discourse enter natural story beast first erymanthus hill arcadia wherein wilde bore continually descend depopulate cornfield hercules comming way hearing mischiefe kill said bore carryed vpon backe eurystheus whereat eurystheus much affraid went hid himselfe brazen vessell whereof virgill speaketh thus erymanthi placaret syluam lernam tremefecerit arcu erymanthean bore martiall speaketh quantus erat calidon erymanthe tuus calidonian bore story homer oeneus prince aetolia sacrificed first fruit country goddes forgot diana wherewithall angry sent among people sauage boare destroyed countrey inhabitant calidonians pleuronians went foorth hunting first al wounded wilde beast meleager sonne oeneus reward wherof receiued head skin bestowd atalanta virgin arcadia whome hee loue accompany hunting withall sonnes thyestius vncles meleager greatly offended brother mother althea men lay waite destroy whereof hee aduertised killed putte residue flight cause pleuronians made warre calidonians beginning warre meleager fell mother help hir country last citty almost taken perswasion wife cleopatra hee went fight enemy valiant maner flew many others put flight chase running away fell downe vpon steepe rockes perished althea mother meleager began rage sonne flunge fire torch fate giuen vnto lengthen day saw sonne dead repented flue herselfe afterwardes cast selfesame burning fire hunting bore ancaeus companion iason colchis slaine bore also called meliagran attalantean bore martiall writeth thus qui diomideis metuendus setiger agris aetola cecidit cuspide talis erat againe another place lacte mero pastum pigre mihi mortis alumnum ponat aetolo de sue diues edat said bore teeth cubit long maner huting expressed pinnicle temple tegea cause called tegean bore vpon one side bore middle painted atalanta meleager theseus telamon peleus pollux iolaus companion al hercules trauels prothus cometes sonnes thiestius brother althea side bore stood ancaus wounded epecus sustaining hunting speare next vnto stood castor amphiaraus sonne oicleus hippothus sonne cercion agamedes sonne stymphelus lastly pirithous teeth bore taken away augustus time ouercome anthoney hung vp temple bacchus standing garden emperour thus much calidonian bore concerning myssean bore find story recorded adrastus phrygian king blood vnawares killed brother fled sardis expiation dwelt cresus hapned time wilde bore came olimpus wasted great part countrey myssea people oppressed many loss terrifyed presence beast besought king send owne sonne attys much company hunt kil bore king affraide thereof dreame saw vision sonne perishing iron speare yet last vvas perswaded committed safegard body adrastus came wilde beast adrastus bent speare bore hee cast kill sonne cresus came betwixt slaine spear according dreame father adrastus seeing misfortune handes haue defended young prince taken away life fell extreame passion sorrow although king knovving innocency forgaue fact yet hee slue himselfe funerall attys vvas burned vvith fire thus much myssean bore proceede particular story wilde bore first country breeding bore spaniard say new found world wilde bore much lesse haue tailes short one would think bin cut offof wilde bore part accident differ also foot hinder foot clouen stand vppon one claw forefoot clouen like common swine flesh also sweet wholesome common swine flesh whereof peter martir giueth reason ocean decads feed vnder palme tree neer seashore marsh olaus magnus writeth diuers place scandinavia hunt wilde bore twelue foot long wilde bore india according pliny haue teeth compasse contain cubit besides teeth growing chap haue two horne head like calues horne island medera abundance wilde bore likewise heluetia especially part ioyne vppon alpes would much abound magistrate giue liberty euery man kill destroy bore affricke except aethiopia bore haue horne lycotas countriman saw publicke spectacle rome niueos lepores non sue cornibus apros hare whire like swine bore haue horne wonderfull thinge boares creet lesse admirable bore macidonia dum haue voice thus much concerning country bore concerning colour obserued wilde bore part blacke browne colour especially top haire somewhat yellow vnderneath yet pausanias writeth hath seene boares white howbeit ordinary blood sharpe blacke like blacke wine wil neuer bee thicke eies like eies wrathfull beast wolues lyon tuskes admirable aliue cut like sharpe kniues dead haue lost cutting property reason heat tooth certainely affirmed hunter wilde bore beast falleth first earth downe dogges hunter one pull bristle backeoppianus nu lay vpon tuske heat thereof wil make shrinke vp turne togither like hot yron dogges doe chaunce touch burne haires backe whereby ardent fiery nature beast manifest euerlasting monument work god yet notwithstanding wrath haue gall pliny writeth head face strongest part therefore vpon receiue hunter blowes vpon bucket teares send forth eies verie sweet thinges cannot abide owne vrine thought hotte burneth neuer runne away flight de till haue emptied belly thereof place abode part marsh wood scythian hunt hart wilde bore marsh roe wilde ass plaine field sometimes hide themselues among fern haue gathered together field dig hole ditch themselues wherein rest obserued loue much wallow mite tame domestical swine although hotte fiery nature voice like voice common swine female somewhat shril liue part solitary alone heards feede vppon meates vulgar swine tragus saieth kind greene corne germany armed verye sharpe stalkes pointes end like barley people seeth eate like pea forasmuch wilde bore destroyer corne sowe graine neer wood side bore abide whereby defend safegard better corne bore also eat wormes earth dig nose pamphilia mountaines cylicia eat salamander without hurte danger themselues yet men chance eat flesh haue deuoured die afterwards poison wherby manifestly appeareth danger eating wilde hog flesh hemlock henbane also poison swine neuer eat vnawars hauing eaten presently loose strength hinder part whereby faine draw maner craul water side gather together snailes seacrabs eating wherof restored former health iuy also medicine disease boares old age maketh altogether vnfit preserued therefore auncient time kept bore park whereof fuluius hirpinus first beginner lucius lucullus quintus hortentius immediate follower say neuer kept bore past year old time waxed leane pined away concerning generation copulation engender certaine couple often year tame swine beginning winter middlethe generation wilde swine may bring forth spring time yeare chuse vnused narrowe hollowe steepe place couple male abideth female thirty day together female beareth young one number time answerable vulger swine boare copulation hand worketh sow carrieth mouth white horse horse riseth vehement stirring bore riseth vehement heate fearuer time lust sharpe eager cruell fighting withall male come presence therefore arme body rowling durt also rubbing tree may hard withstand one another fight bore thus described virgill per syluas tum saeuus aper tumpessima tigris ipseruit dentes que sabelicus exacuit sus et pedibus subegit terram fricat arbore costa que hinc que illinc humeros ad vulnera durat inflamed venerial rage setteth vpright bristle neck would take sharp fin dolphin champeth mouththe fight boares grateth gnasheth teeth one another breathing forth boyling spirit eies foaming white mouth desireth nothing copulation female endure quietly doth shee satisfie lust kill anger refuse doth either constraine else layeth hir dead vpon earth somtime force tame sow pig begotten cald hybridae way contumely bastard bee obserued neuer wilde beast tamed doth engender copulation except bee tamed young onely wilde bore quickly mingle vulgar swine female kinde hath teeth standing mouth like male except short one therefore residue like saw teeth boare generall rule nulli dentes exerti quibus serrati concerning disposition bore generall brutish stubborne yet couragious wrathfull furious bloud full fibre ministreth vnto sudden matter anger neither ther beast clothed haire lyon bore wherefore like fierce angry nature yet haue shewed story hart drawne meat den voice musick said capable discipline instruction yet scaliger affirmeth saw bore belonged lord saluimont exceeding great stature tamed maister sounding horne would come running like dog hunting go abroad maister among dog contending swift race attaine prey naturally desire bury owne footstep wet miry place may bee found hunter rage boares greatest time lust sowes farrowing therfore excellent speech cyaxares vnto syrus swyne see hunter although many yet run away pig hunter follow one young one doth dam turne againe withall force endeuoure destroy would depriue hir yong one bore fight go whet teeth contention happen wolfe commeth sight forsake mutuall combat ioyne together driue away wolfe beare dareth enter vpon wilde bore except behind vnawares hesiod saith vulcan pictured vppon shield hercules image shape many wilde beastes fighting one another neither yealding till fell downe dead caused alciatus make emblem vulture stading see contention suffered kill one another without parting whereby afterwardes enioyed dead carkases dum saeuis ruerent mutua vulnera telis vngue leaena serox dente timendus aper accurrit vulter spectatum prandia captat gloria victoris praeda futura sua est reported bore swim single alone like fish two togither like woluesswimming boares many time flock heards like roe ardent nature desire meat feare highest mountain deepest water concerning flesh wilde bore although haue spoken aboundantly former discourse swyne yet must adde something place although generally flesh tame swine viscous colde yet flesh wilde temperate nourishable therefore lighter concoction stronger nourishment therefore timpany prescribed eate bore flesh wilde sowes dryeth strengthneth moueth men vexed saint anthony fire forbidden eate salt meates leauened bread yet permitted eate bore flesh reported publius seruillus rullus verye first among roman set table whole boare delicately dressed stuffed variety diuers costly dish bore bore flesh hunting wilde boresnow next place wee proceede talke concerning hunting boares onely pastime lord prince also necessary labour meaner men harme commeth bore exceeding great much greater much poorer doth sustaine vtility learne meanes destroying beast commodious common prouerb true vulgar swine neuer good till dead reported dioclesian agent roman france came olde woman called dryas vnto reproued couetousnesse telling ouersparing persimonious answered iest empe wil liberal dryas replyed vnto noli iocare dioclesiane na imperator eris cum apru occideris iest dioclesian thou shalt emp thou hast killed aper bore thought therefore gaue himselfe hunting bore neuer sparing time offred vnto alwaies expecting euent speech whereof vvas frustrated vntill killed arius aper gouernor iudgement hall afterwards emperor knew woman meane boare man therefore hunting boares manner taking many way either violence chase pollicie ditch trap else impoysoned baites best time hunting middest winter say thinke winter worst time strongest seeing swine impacient heate summer quickly end life bee chased behooueth therefore hunter boares wary therefore auncientes ordayned one weare rough garment broune colour likewise horse yellow firy colour boare spear shold strong sharp beast armed strong head skin besides couer themselues dryed durt coate male blunt weapon therefore runneth willingly either without dread feare vpon hunter encounter receiueth deadly wound hee ouerthrovveth aduersary except fall flat ground boares teeth cannot cut vpward downevvard therefore hunter footeman must seate himselfe neere tree also prouide misse boare may easily climbe boughes saue himselfe swyne raised female teare bite hunter teeth get within hir clutch wherfore speedy ending hunting good raise beast earely morning hath made water burning bladder doth quickly make weary boare haue either made water got liberty rest chase ease himselfe taking difficulte tedious nature couragious beast neuer ceaseth running till bee weary wearied desembleth sitting vpon buttock offereth combat hunter yet wont strike man vntill wounded first boare first raised wood snuffeth winde lifting vp nose smell hunting speare must sharp broad branching forth certain forkes horne meanes boare shall breake vppon hunter bendeth beast hee must stand one leg another like wrestler holding left hand vpon middle speare direct right hand behind thrust forward violence hauing eye intent vpon beast boare wound middle forehead betwixt eyelid else vppon shoulder place wound deadly hee chance hit cheeke greatest harme hee doth maketh vnfit vse tuskes must careful boare leap vpon likewise must giue backe draw sword chaunce bee ouerturned lye downe hollow place boare cannot come vvith teeth concerning instruction dog choyce hound appointed hunting boares must note euery dog fit great mastiues vsed baiting beares boare first terrifyeth dog voice bee ready fight run away hunter worse case beginning therefore must sure haue well instructed giue onset bee likewise hand encourage come fyrst place wherin coniecture boare lodged appearance either footstep woundes teeth vpon tree boughes let let loose one best houndes casting wood follow residue weather cry goeth dogge presseth thickest bush commonly boare lodgeth hath found beast standeth still bayeth must hunter come take vp dogge boare stir easie lodging goe set vp net toyles place whereby likely beast passe must hang tree postes earth suffice alwaies make king inside light beast may suspect harme net thus set vp let returne againe dog loosing euery hunter arming himselfe dartes boares speare let skilfull followe dog close exhort set residew followe one another good distance scattering themselues sundry angle better safegard end sport come together boare might light vppon wound vppon whosoeuer falleth rage hee hurteth furthermore dog beginne come neere lodging must bee set eagerly hartened way appalled rasing boare manner make force formost dogge nearest must hee bee followed chase euen vnto net net stand vppon side hill steepe rocke insnared get difficulty stand vppon plaine ground toiles hold till hunter come must presently take care wound dart speares meddle compassing round warily hurt dogges especially must wound face shoulder wound mortall haue sayd happen beast getteth loose hee feeleth blowes hunter must start avvay strongest meete vvith speare setting body vve haue formerly expressed hauing especiall eye beast head way soeuer windeth turneth nature bore sometimes snatcheth speare hunter hand else recoyleth force backe againe vpon smiter meanes hunter ouercome ouerthrowne whensoeuer happneth one meanes saue hunter life another companion must come charge boare making though hee would wound dart casting feare hurting hunter vnder feete boare seeth forsaketh first man rusheth vpon second must looke defend himselfe dexterity composing body ordering weapon according artificiall borehunting meane season vanquished hunter must arise againe taking fresh hold speare courage setting vppon aduersarie beast wound either shoulder head credit escape life except kill ouercome boare hee feeleth himselfe thus wounded hee cannot liue vvere cross forkes vppon boarespeare hee vvould presse vppon vanquisher take reuenge death great feruent wrath beast spareth kill wound although feel vpon pang death place soeuer biteth either vpon dog man heate teeth inflicteth dangerous inflaming wound cause doth touch haire dog burneth female raised great rage female male though great power must hunter take heede neuer fall ground male hurteth man standeth lyeth high female hurteth man falleth lyeth low therefore hunter chance fall must rayse himselfe withall speede vsing lesse dexterity courage female hee doth male also another manner hunting wilde swyne first set vp net passage likely beast goe men dog gallant cry filling wood fieldes raise lodging meane season setting valiant hunter keepe net beast perceiueth sought vp starteth looking like euill spirit may deuoure terrified cry men pursued multitude greedy dog forth runneth vsuall way carefully looking behind auoide traine followeth vntill fall fast enclosed hunter net commeth keeper net woundeth boarespeare sayde fortune hee fall nettes neuer commeth must prosecute men dogges vntill haue wearied heate body cannot long stand although shall lodge himselfe marish woodes hunter haue vse net yet must afraid approch vnto hunting instrument haue shew magnitude courage mind attaining game strength hand depriued help art conclude deuises qui variare cupit rem prodigialiter vnam medicine wilde swine declared thing concerning remedy goat larger ample power shalbe shewn wild beast kind also regard shalbe concerning remedy tame sow wild boare yea tame wilde beast thing like either may ended differing onely according lesse part wilde beast liuing lesse moist colde tame repeat heere concerning common remedy bore sow tamed part wit blood braine cheeke bone lung light liuer gall anckle bone hoofe dung vrine sow repeated braines bore taken blood much commended bitings serpent againe braines blood boare doeth helpe feare comming carbuncle lard fat bore sodden bound fast together doth wonderfull celerity make firme bone broken fat abore mingled hony rozin much commended bitinges serpent fat wild bore mingled fat lung light doth much profit haue foot broken brused mischance fat bore mixed oile rose good troubled blister push annointed thereupon braines bore profitable carbuncle paine man yard braines boare brused small hony put thereto doth wonderfully make sound braines bore sodden drunke wine doth ease paine greefes thinges spoken concerning remedy braine medicine sowe ash cheekebone boare doeth cure vlcers doe encrease bigger little little also thing doth make firme bone broken lung light bore mixed hony put vpon foot manner mollyfieng emplaister shall bee freed exulcerations dioscorides also doth commend lung lightes sowes lambes beares liuer bore new killed scorched fire beaten powder taken wine especiall remedie bitings serpent dogges liuer bore olde drunken wine rue much commended bitings serpent fibre liuer bore especially nearest enteraunce gall liuer taken vineger rather wine much profitable bitings serpent liuer bore good reuiue whose spirit drousie liuer bore doth much profit stopped eares trobled apostumes running sore therein liuer bore new killed drunken wine effectual loosenesse belly certaine little stone liuer bore common vulgar sow leastwise like vnto little stone also white sodden taken wine effectuall disease stone thou shalt read many thinges concerning remedy liuer bore medicine sow gall bore much commended wennes swelling necke gall bore mingled rosin waxe doth cure vlcers encrease bigger bigger gall bore lambes milke mingled together dropped eares profitable paine therein body man annointed gall bore doth stirre vp carnal copulation gall bore mingled suet applyed vpon euery ioynt body doeth immediately cure paine gout haue declared also many thing medicine sow concerning remedy gall bore stone boare eaten good fauling sicknesse stone bore taken mare milke water also effectual disease hoofes bore burned ash sprinkled vppon drinke taken doeth much helpe cannot easily make water hooues bore burned beaten powder giuen drinke effectuall stopping vrine hooues bore sow burned giuen drinke wine much commended cannot holde vrine sleepe dung sow liueth wood belng dryed drunke water wine doth stay voiding blood doth ease also old paine side againe taken vineger doth stay al rupture convulsion also mingled sirrup rose doth remedy helpe place ioynt dung bore new made hot speciall remedy flux blood yssueth forth nostril dung bore mingled wine applyed forme emplaister presently draw away make sound thinge cleaueth body also brused sodden hony afterwards kneaded like dow applyed ioynts doth ease paine arise therein emplaister made dung bore profitable venemous bitings draweth forth poison vlcers filled vppe clensed dung bore except arise thighes dung bore dried beaten pouder sprinkled vpon drinke doth cure paine side againe beeing dryed beaten pouder administered wine doth onely cure paine spleene also paine kidnies dung bore burned ashespliny marcellus giuen drinke wine doth ease paine knee legges dung bore new made annointed vpon place ioynt verie profiable dung fieldbore mixed brimstone taken wine strained pitch commendable paine hip dunge bore mingled wine afterwardes strained giuen drinke measure two little cuppefuls time doth speedily helpe trovbled scyatica also sodden vineger honey doeth mittigate paine rise foot anckles dung bore burned ash sprinckled vpon wine lukewarm giuen drinke doth helpe troubled bloody flixe rest remedy concerne dung bore thou shalt finde medicine sow vrine bore mingled hony water taken speciall remedy troubled fauling sicknesse againe vrine bore taken sweet vineger doth driue thing dried bladder vrine bore kept glasse doeth cure disease paine eares especially profitable cannot hear vrine bore kept glassesextus made lukewarme dropped eares speciall remedy apostumes therein vrine bore kept long farre profitable bee kept vessell glasse againe vrine bore dryed smoake moistened hony poured eares doth cure deafenesse eares vrine bore oile cypresse equally mingled made luke warme also good disease vrine wilde bore also force vertue bladder wilde bore doth stay incontinency vrine eaten rosted boiled blather goate burned powder giuen drinke water wine good profitable cannot make water easily vrine bore drunken doth helpe troubled stone bladder effectual first mingled dung bladder bore moistned vrinesextus hung vp vntill waterish humor commeth foorth boiled giuen truculent stranguri verie profitable good marcellusthe bladder boare dried giuen drinke profitable troubled paine bladder wringinges gut vrine tame bore hung vp smoke bladder sow mixed drinke verye profitable troubled strangury vrine bore least wise bladder giuen drinke hath cured haue bin troubled hidropsey say vrine bore taken drinke good troubled stone forasmuch also hunter hurt thought good set remedy fit therefore woundes made daungerous onely deepe also large great also impossible bring agluttination medicine lip wound made contusion cut burned vse mutuall gnashing striking teeth together whetstone take reueng vpon pursue followe therefore cause certaine scab grow vpon lip wound wherefore meet vse suppuratiue gluttinatiue maner cure meet vse running moist vlcers hot thing cold winter summer easie matter boare hurt horsse inside knee time hunting doth breed waterish vlcer doth also follow swelling cold thing applyed cured anointing medicin called diachalcanthes head dog burned without tongue beaten powder applyed manner cataplasme thus much concerning medicine bore tatvs gvinean beast fourefooted strange beast bellonius saith found turchia among mountebankes apothicaries brought part newfound world guinia may therefore safely conueyed part naturally couered harde shell deuided interlined like fin fish outwardly seeming buckled backe like coatarmor within beast draweth vp body hedghog doth within prickled skin therefore take brasilian hedghog much greater little pig snout ear leg foot thereof seemeth kind sauing snout litle broader shorter pig tail long like lizard rat couered al ouer crust shel gaping mouth wider swine one brought france liue vpon eating seed frutes garden appeareth picture rather skinne stuffed adrianus marcillius apothecary vlmes sent vnto gesner whence pictture heere expressed taken feete thereof clouen two partes like swine rather many like dogges vpon hinder feete fiue toe vpon forefeete fowre whereof two smal scarse visible bredth skin seuen finger length two span shell crust vpon backe reach downe vnto rumpe taile broke vpon hip foure finger taile merchant haue herd cittizens london keepe garden wormes aiochtochth another beast may bee compared whereof cardanus writeth hee calleth name aiotochth strange creature found hispania noua neare riuer aluaradus greater cat hauing bil snowt mallard foot hedgehog long necke couered al ouer shell like trappinges horsse diuided lobster continued oyster couered heere neither necke head appeare plainely onely eares spaniard cause call armato contaexto doe affirme hath voice like swine foot thereof indeed clouen remaine vnequal like horse meane seueral cloues haue hearde seene garden london kept destroy garden wormes tiger name tiger worde tigris armenian worde signifieth swift arrow great riuer seeme name riuer tigris therefore called swiftnes thereof seemeth deriued haebrew word gir griera signifie dart munster also dictionary three language doth interpret tigros tiger alai iob word laisk septuagint translated murmeleon ierom tigris iewes call beast phoradei graecians call tigris al people europe beast stranger call greeke name italian tigre tigra french vn tigre germaines tigerthier riuer tigrys concerning name riuer tigris ioyneth affinity beast necessary say something place wee finde holy scripture one foure riuers runneth paradice according iosephus maketh many compass winding world last fauleth redde sea say riuer world runneth swiftly therefore tigris vocatur id est sagitta quod iaculum vel sagittam velocitate aequet called tiger dart arrow runneth fast arrow flyeth cause wee finde theocritus riuer sicilia called asis thrt spiculum dart poet doe deriue name riuer tigris tiger wilde beast whereupon history told say bacchus distracted put wit iuno wandered fro world came riuer ylax first name water desirous passe ouer founde mean accomplish iupiter commisseration estate send vnto tiger willingly take vpon backe carry ouer afterwarde bacchus called swift riuer name swift beast tiger others report tale thus dionisius fell loue nymph alphesiboea mean either promise intreaties reward could allure vnto last turned himselfe tiger oppressing nimph feare carry ouer riuer begot vpon sonne medus came age remembring fact father mother called name riuer tigris father transformation leaue matter woorth standing vpon whether riuer rhynocerots auncient late writer doe mingle vnicorne doe verily coniecture strength pertinent horne thus much shall suffice concerning true vnicornes horne vertues arising place proceed residue history reseruing v horne proper medicine beast swift legges haue articlesthe naturall property vnicornes keep part desarts liue solitary top mountaines nothing horible voice braying voice straind aboue measure fighteth mouth heeles mouth biting like lyon heeles kicking like horse beast vntamable nature therefore lord himselfe iob saith cannot bee tyed halter yet accustomed cratch stable hee feareth iron yron instrument isidorus writeth strange fighteth owne kinde yea euen female vnto death except burneth lust procreation vnto straungerbeasts whome hath affinity nature sotiable familiar delighting company come willing vnto neuer rising proud dependence retinue keepeth quarter league trucephiles aelianus female flesh tickled lust groweth tame gregall louing continueth till filled great young returneth former hostility enemy lyon wherefore soone euer lyon seeth vnicorne runneth tree succor vnicorne maketh force hee may onely auoide horne also destroy vnicorne swiftnesse course runneth tree wherein sharpe horne sticketh fast lyon seeth vnicorne fastned horne without danger fauleth vpon killeth thing reported king aethiopia haebrew epistle vnto bishop rome sayd vnicorns aboue creature doe reuerence virgines young maides many time sight growe tamethe taking vnicornes come sleepe beside nature certaine sauor wherewithall vnicornes allured delighted occasion indian ethiopian hunter vse stratagem take beast take goodly strong beautifull young manalbertus alunnus tzetze dresse apparrell woman besetting diuers odoriferous flower spice man adorned set mountaines wood vnicorne hunteth wind may carrie sauour beast meane season hunter hide themselues vnicorne deceaued outward shape woman sweete smell commeth vnto young man without feare suffereth head bee couered wrapped within large sleeues neuer stirring lying still sleepe acceptable repose hunter signe young man perceaue fast secure come vppon force cut horne send away aliue concerning opinion wee haue elder authoritie tzetze liue aboue fiue hundred yeares agoe therefore leaue reader freedome owne iudgment beleeue refuse relation neither fit omit seeing writer since time tzetze doe constantly beleeue sayd aelianus albertus except bee taken bee two yeares old neuer bee tamed thrasians doe yeerely take colt bring king keepeth combat fight one another old differ nothing barborous bloodie rauenous beast flesh good meate bitter vnnourishable thus much shall suffice naturall storie vnicorne followeth medicinall medicine arising vnicorne concerning horne vnicorne haue sufficiently already written auntientes haue deliuered remedy place handle remedy late writer haue attributed thereunto also owne obseruations remember time past saw peece horn weight nine inch certaine merchant marker blacke plaine wreathed circle turning time much obserue amongst apothecary onely find smal little fragment yssued say certaine marrow rounder whiter softer colour also substance put much eaten easily crummed stuft horne doeth signifie good perfect counterfetted corrupted perhaps horne beast brent fire certaine sweet odor thereunto added also imbrued delicious aromaticall perfume peraduenture also bay mean first burned afterward quenched put certaine sweet smelling liquor great care taken new smelleth sweete either abolished age vertue thereof deminished often frequent cup rich men vsually cast little peeces horne drinking cup either preuenting curing certaine disease also enclose gold siluer cast drinke though force thereof could remaine many yeares notwithstanding continuall soking wine vsed drunke wine doth bring vpon certaine dark obscure colour whitenesse remained vppon quite lost expelled vtterly abolished men remedy arising commaund vse horne simply selfe others prefer marrowe therein cast wine doth boyle men either ignorance deceipt impute signe true horne contrarily horne brent water wine cause bubles arise wicked person make mingle mangle thereof sawe amongst venetian heare say compounded lime sope peraduenture earth stone thing wont make bubles arise afterwards fell vnicornes horne wherefore shall safe buy whole horne may done greater crums may well describe figure horne smal fragment may receiue lesse deceit certaine apothecary noramberg stately mart towne amongst german declared way vnto deface colour adulterated vnicornes horne made iuory either macerated boyled certaine medicine setfoile suppose thing meanes hauing scraped found within true substance yuory antonius brasauol writeth men part doe sell certaine stone vnicornes horne truely deny done haue certainty selfe notwithstanding also may come passe hard solid horne point sword especially part preferred inferior also hart horn either stone yron may yeild author attribut rhinocerot vnicornes may bear shape stone selfe orpheus concerning hart horn rightly doubted whether stone greatest strength think doubted kind vnicornes horne hart onely solide aristotle supposed also horne vnicornes heere haue said horne vnicorne day vsed although age longinquity time bath quite abolished nature horne mingle rhinoceros vnicorne named rhinoceros horne day phisical vse notwithstanding authours haue declared effectual force say vnicornes horn doth sweat hauing poison comming ouer false doth perhaps sometimes sweat euen solide hard light substance also stone glasse external vapor doeth nothing appertaine poison like manner reported kind stone called serpent toong doth sweat hauing poison come ouer haue heard read certaine booke written one hand true horne vnicorne proued maner giue two pigeon poyson red arsnick orpin one drinketh litle true vnicorns horne healed die leaue manner tryall vnto rich men price true reported day bee lesse vallew gold sel waight thereof floren worser thing cured meaning cleane abolished al poyson whatsoeuer horne vnicorn doth heale detestable disease men called iohns euill otherwise cursed disease horne vnicorne beaten boyled wine hath wonderful effect making teeth white cleare mouth well clensed therewith thus much shall suffice medicine vertues arising vnicorne vreoxe beast called latin vrus german aurox seueral name vrox grosse caesar brought aliue rome shew publike spectacle people time taken wilde buls affirme prussia wildcountries breed cruel vntamable feare spare neither man beast set vpon wounded hunter wood among tree foreheades broad large two men may easily sit betwixt horne able take vp armed man horse tosse aire like bull head like beast seene publiquely fixed vp common place mentz wormes worth obseruation neere touch onely speedy swift fury among wood ran horne body okes like whereby hee stayed easie pull forth fixe rugged crooked stand vpward hee ouertaken killed hunter time met hunter fatall deadly spotted strake line goeth al along back vreoxen kept parkes chase hauing peculiar disignment king inhabitantes certaine village keepe watch sometimes meet common vulgar tame cow leape vpon fill calfe bos camelita haire ouer body long especially vnder chin colour like yellow mule beast continuall enemy horse like vnto tame scythian ox asia carry packes vpon bunch backes also bend knee like camel lybian oxe great innumerability libian ox great swiftnes celerity hunter many time deceiued hunting doe certainely chance fall vpon wilde beastes raised meane doth hide himselfe place bramble briar keeping himselfe safe wild beast doth appeare like vnto doe deceiue eies hunter therefore man doth begin follow either labour lost hee able comprehend attaine horse except may take wearied longitude time hunter shall find young calfe spare life thereof shall presently kill shall reape double profit first doth bring profit selfe dooth induce lead dam captiuity hunter hath bound calfe rope enflamed loue affection beareth hir calfe returneth backe againe vnto coueting ardent desire loosen take away calfe bond halter therefore thrusteth hir horne may loosen cord pluck hir young one away whereby kept fast bound hir calfe horne entangled rope commeth hunter killeth taketh forth liuer also cutteth dug vdder doth likewise pluck hir skin leaueth flesh bird wild beast feed vpon another kind oxe libia whose horne doth bend downeward cause faine feed going backwards saying herodotus aelianus haue spoken philes doth write cald ox going backward broadnes horne doth couer eiesight standeth vse go forward commodious go backward oxe liueth wood affrick doth resemble domesticall oxe yet lesse stature browne russet colour also swift foote beast found desarts african march limit desarts flesh also perfect absolute sauour tast good nourishment men indian wild ox horn ox garamantons grow downewards toward earth therefore feede bow hinder part necke solinus writeth haue spoken diuersities wilde ox another fight irefully admirable rage vntill ouercome aduersaries also labour striue withall nerues sinnewes euen champion fought great reward get honor battell wilde bulles tame ram ass one horne hyaenaes lastly elephantes capable reason wound among themselues one doth oftentimes ouercome kill sometimes fall downe togither wounded haue also recited another place intreaty ox indian ox said heluetia alpes weasel winter become white much two kind weasel one vulgar domesticall liuing house citties wild liuing wood mountain find also differ colour neither constant domesticall weasell vpon backe side sandy red sometime yellowish alwaies white throat yea sometimes geor agricola writeth white whereat man ought wonder seeing hare heluetia winter time turne white white weasel armin aboundance northern partes europe summer short winter long white weasel differ nothing common vulgar weaselles colour except haire sticke faster backes obserued russhia noblest woman apparailed skinnes vvoode scandinauia called lanzerucca fourescore mile long wherein aboundance white vveasels king tentes among tartareans said couered ouer skinnes lyon without wals hung armin white vveasels within although price skinnes deere among sometimes many vsed one garment cost two thousand crown yet people earnestly seeke accounting small honor weare much wealth vpon backes reason beast came called armilini armilla chaine weare fringe garment like chaines although alpine mouse bee white likewise pontique mouse yet must difference obserued betvvixt vveasels properly called armin mouse called onely way resemblance haue shevved already story pontique mouse may adde thus much liue winter time hollow tree wherein become white snow oouer except tailes quantity like squirrel end may turn somewhat red giue themselues copulation generation young one lay aside whitenesse liue many dayes together carnall copulation among greene fresh hearbs leauing behinde rancke vnsauory smels odious good scent said euery three yeare skin aboundance foode grow greater greater exceeding commodity marchants skinner norway helsyngia certaine little fourefootedbeastes called lemmar lemmus lemmars tampestuous rainy weather seeme fall downe cloudes neuer yet found whether beginning arose first heauen earth certaine assoone euer haue fallen ground haue bin opened bowel haue bin found greene hearbes therefore maruaile euer beleeued beast bred seculent matter cloudes man aske whence haue beginning answer earth euen locust catterpillers said holy scripture carryed fro wind beast destitute naturall food place generation aduance themselues wind carried strange vnknowne country fall like locust vpon euery greene thing liuing vntill haue deuoured tast new grown hearbs perish dy meanes whereof encrease great pestilence corruption armlins armin eate deuoure skin beast exceeding delicate hauing diuers colour therfore people flea body sel thirty forty bundle great price skin haue sayd forth chrysaor pegasus alledge opinion crovves ibis conceiue mouthes certaine haue place conception vnderneath tail like fourfootedbeasts therefore come passe young one come foorth mouth cannot easily learne may opinion thereof first arose sight old one carrying young mouth young one small like mouse therefore likely remoue fro catres doe young one continuall feare least taken destroied men enimy beast dung weasel doth smel many time like musk reason whereof haue shewed another place al general haue ranke filthy sauour rauening destroying beast although body small yet witte vnderstanding great singular art subtilty compasseth prey wherupon lyeth history galanthis maid alckmena perottus obserueth ouid vvhen alckmena long trauell childebirth said maid perceiuing shee hindered lucina craftily obtained onely knowledge cause lucina also remedy whereupon eased lady like true faithful seruant many paine lucina seeing beguiled galanthis crafty wit ouerreached goddesse shee turned vveasell punnishment sinned reuealing counsel goddesse punnished bring forth al young one hir mouth weasel doe occasion domestical weasel like maide doth continually liue house colour yellowish like haire galanthis thus say metamorphosing transforming others say alckmena trauel hercules hauing indured long torment deliuered sight weasel came presence therefore theban graecians religiouslie worship weasel say norisht heccate goddesse norish hercules heerein take gale galanthis aforesaid weasel alckmenaies maid seeing haue begunne talke transformation wil adde another thinge stobeus impertinent common place writeth dispraise woman diuersitie disposition perswadeth deriued one beast another namely come weasel miserable sullen sorrowful kind woman whome nothing pleasing delightfull acceptable hauing mind pleasure venus loathing hir husband hurteth neighbor robbeth self deuoureth consecrated hallowed thing euen manner weasel take booty altar thus saith beleeue true comparison generation transmutation woman weasel maruaile came passe weasell called vnhappy infortunate vnlucky beast among hunter held opinion heere englandthe signification weasel occurrence meet weasel morning shal speed wel day therefore graecians say galesteir altiatus hath excellent emblem whereby hee insinuateth good haue weasel run vppon one left hande therefore aduiseth man giue ouer enterprize omen although would haue wise man stand feare superstitious conceit yet wil subscribe verse variety elegancie truth auspicijs re coepta mali bene cedere nescit foelici quae sunt omine fact iuuant quicquid age mustela si tibi occurret omitte signa malae haec sortis bestia praua gerit seeme beginning opinion come punishment certain general corinthian nauy periured breaking faith state came running awaie saie afterwards could neuer sleep dreamed weasel came tore flesh bodie last anguish greese mind flue thing reported heraclides whether true false sillie slender foundation build vpon prophetical opinion presage future euils wil leaue morral part weasel returne againe natural haue knowledge like mouse rattes run house downefal liue hatred serpent hunteth mouse eating rue driue house wherein inhabite wonderful worke god silly beast haue knowledge virtue hearbe onely arme selfe hateful serpent wise nature able abide also restore life againe younge one dead poison weasel destroyeth cockatrice vveasel findeth cockatrice hole den layeth poison mouth therof whereby two contrary nature meet fight lesser ouercommeth greater affirmed pliny solinus wherefore maner cattle feare weasel hunt manner bird pulling theyr throate wolfe doeth sheepes play hare till haue wearied destroy perpetual enmity swine rauens crowes cat although cat sometimes set vpon yet cannot ouercome many place italy nourished tame ferret vsed fetch cony earth weasel tying stringe necke fetch young pigeon douecotes bird nest pouder weasel giuen vnto cocke chicken pigeon said shal neuer annoied weasils likewise braine weasel bee mingled rennet cheese keepeth couched mouse corrupted age flesh weasel vsed meat dried preserued medicine powder thereof mixed water driueth away mouse casting gall stellius house vveasels gathered togither oile bitter almond salt ammoniak killed one tailes cut al residue forsake house thus much shall suffice concerning history vveasels followeth medicine arising body medicine arising weasel weasel applied vnto troubled ague quarterne feauersvrsinus doth short time cure doth also mingled thinges make wonderful pleasant mollifying medicine troubled gout infirmity ioyntes easeth haue continual ache head leauing certaine matter top thereof stroking foreheade hinder part head curing also gout excellent remedy take little yong whelp aliue wel fatted liuing weasel nine pintes oile vnto two three pound buttera tiu boile together vntil beastes made lanke lither put hand foot whole daie hot oile wel strained auicenna attributeth certaine thing weasel flesh classical author rather ascribe powder weasel applyed gout drunk wine falling sicknesse headache accounted especiall remedy bitings scorpion flesh weasel taken verie good effectual preseruatiue againste al poison taken meat head foot onely cast awaie doeth helpe troubled vvennes bunch flesh first anointed blood beast blood weasel wel applied broken exulcerated sore fleshauicenna vertue hath whole bodie weasel boiled wine manner plaister placed thereunto expelling gout take dead weasel boile oyle vntil made liquid straine forth oile mingle waxtheophrastus fashioning forme plaister good order applyed wil short time expel quite away house weasel wont burned diuers remedy imbowelled salt dried shade late writer affirmedioscorides weasell better dried burned said disease vsed aforesaid manner also foolish think best onely salted proper vsed first manner body creature dry nature dryed sprinkling salt vpon vnmeete foode certaine man going salt hare made like vnto dryed weasel haue written flesh hedgehog dried doth much profit troubled outward inwarde leprosie effect strongly haue drying force power euen flesh weasell dried drunke wine expelleth poison vulgar weasell kept old drunke vvine quantity two dram accounted present remedy venome sting serpent young weasel prepared said say imbowelled saltegallen good force il medicine weasel vsed maner doth presentlie cure bite cal raech concerning haue spoken horse cured horsecoursers small quantity weasel skinne bignesse foresaide golden crowne giuen inwardly whether potion horne cut small mingled chaffe knowe doe giue pestiferous disease called iohns euil bloode beast excellent remedy expelling fowleeuil blood weasel annointed vpon broken exulcerated bunch flesh doth mittigate paine also heale wound blood weasel anointed vppon iawes doth heale paine sore therein whatsoeuer pouder blood weasel mingled together anointed vpon body leprous man doth short time driue away al scab scurffes thereon blood weasel peculiarly ictinus first vvhich svvift hath greater head vvolues likewise greater leg fitted run white spot belly round member colour betwixt red yellovv bold howleth fearefully hauing firyflaming strongly especially wolfe necke wolfe standeth straight bone canot well bend therefore like hyaena would looke backwards must turne round necke short argueth trecherous nature saide heart wolfe kept dry rendreth fragrant sweet smelling sauor liuer vvolfe like horse hoofe blather found certaine stone cald syrites colour like saffron honny yet inwardly containe certaine weake shining star stone called syriacus indiacus desired vertue stone blather forefoot haue fiue distinct towes hinder foot forefoot serue stead hand lyon dog wolues panther vve haue spoken already celerity running therefore compared lion go foot foot vnto swiftest dog sayd swim go water two two euery one hanging vpon anothers taile take mouthes therefore compared day yeare successiuely follow one another therfore called lucabas successiue swimming better strengthned impression flouds lost water ouerflowing waues billowesthe meat voracity wolues great voracity beast insatiable deuoure haire bone fleshe eat cause render whole againe excrement therefore neuer grow fat well sayd learned man lupus vorat potius quam commedit carnes pauco vtitur potu wolfe rather rauen eat meat vvhen hungry rage much although nourished tame yet abide man look vpon eat satisfiedaelianus philes endure hunger great time belly standeth tongue swelleth mouth stopped haue droue away hunger aboundance meate vnto men beast meeke lamb til hungry neither moued rapine though go flock sheep short time belly tongue calling meat saith mine author antiqua frigra redit iterumque lupus existit returne former condition become rauening neither ought seem strange vnto man like thing formerly reported lyon said vvolues dangerous met vvithal tovvards euening fasting al day alledged saying holy scripture vvhere prophet make mention lupi vespertini vve haue shevved already story hyaena vvhat signifie said wolues doe also eate kind earth called argilla doe hunger make belly waigh heauy intent set vpon horsse oxe hart elke strong beast may waigh heauier hang fast throates till haue pulled downe vertue tenetious earth teeth sharpened waight body encreased haue killed beast set vpon touch part flesh kind natural vomit disgorge themselues empty belly earth vnprofitable food remainder meate alwaies couer earth many hunting together equally deuide prey among sometimes saide howle call fellowes feast absent prey plentifull haue common lyon greatest extremity hunger haue election man beast forsake man take beast opinion olde grow weary liues therefore come vnto citties village offering themselues killed men thing relation niphus fable hee professeth saw old wolfe come village set vpon virgin destroy eate yet old scarse teeth head good hap company hand maid saued wolfe killed wolues sluggish least giuen hunting ready venture vpon men loue take much paine getting liuing wolfe called vinipeta industrious hunting wolfe kunegeiseia reported wolfe neuer venture vpon liuing man except haue formerly tasted flesh dead man thing haue certainety rather doe beleeue contrary like tyrant euill grieued estate pick quarrel euery man rich spoyle good accounting enimies well soeuer haue deserued handes like manner wolues time hunger fall vpon creature come way whether men beastes without partiality fill belly especially winter time wherein afraid come house citties deuoure dogges get alone elkes kingdome norway dogges hath beene seene haue liued kind society fellowship wolues steale deuoure night time like theeues couer mallice secret grudge one going rob true men wolues enimies ass bulles fox feede vppon flesh beast take easily asse killing without daunger haue shewed already story asse also deuoure goates swyne sortes except bore doe easily yeald vnto wolues said sow hath resisted wolfe fighteth hee forced vse greatest craft suttelty leaping best actiuity least lay teeth vpon one time deceiue prey depriue life reported one saw wolfe wood take mouth peece timber thirty forty pound waight practise leape ouer trunke tree lay vpon earth length perceiued ability dexterity leaping waight mouth make caue lodged behinde tree last fortuned came wild w seeke meat along tree diuers pig following different age yeare old halfe yeare lesse saw neare suddenly set vpon one coniectured waite wood carried mouth taken whilest old sow came deliuer pig first cry suddenly leaped ouer tree pig mouth poore sow beguiled young one could leape yet might stand see wolfe eate pigge hee taken also sayd deceiue goates come vnto greene leaues small boughes osier mouthes wherewithall know goat delighted may draw therewith baite deuoure manner fal vpon goat hog beast smal stature kil lead eare withal speed driue fellow wolues beast stubborne wil runne beateth hinder part taile mean time holding ear fast mouth whereby causeth poore beast run fast faster himselfe vnto place owne execution findeth crew rauening wolues entertaine first appearance seize vpon like diuels teare peeces moment leauing nothing vneaten onely bowel swine gotten said lead water kil eat cold water teeth doth burne vntolerable heat hart haue lost horne doelie secret feeding night feare wolues vntil horne grow againe cheefest defence least kind vvolues haue shewed already doe liue vppon hunting hare generally al enemy sheepe foolish sheep day time easily beguiled wolfe sight sheepe maketh extraordinary noise foot whereby calleth foolish sheepe vnto standing amazed noise falleth mouth deuoured wolfe night time commeth vnto folde sheep first al compasseth round watching shepheard dogge whether asleepe awake present like resist departeth without dooing harme absent asleepe looseth opportunity entereth sold falleth killing neuer giuing ouer til haue destroyed al except hindered approch e manner eat til haue killed altextor albertus hee feareth ouerliuers wil tel tale insatiable mind thinketh neuer bee satisfied al slaine falleth eat one although great difference betwixt bul strength stature yet affraid aduenture combat trusting policy vigor setteth vpon bul commeth vpon front feare horne yet behind feare heeles first al standeth loofe himaelianus glaring eye daring prouoking bul making often prosers come neere vnto yet wise enough keepe aloofe till spy aduauntage leapeth suddenly vpon backe bull one side ascended taketh suche hold killeth beast loosen teeth also worth obseruation draweth vnto calfe wandereth dam singular treacherie taketh nose first drawing forwarde poore beast striueth draweth backward thus struggle togither one pulling one way another till last wolfe perceiuing aduantage feeling calfe pulleth heauyest suddenly letteth go hold whereby poore beast falleth backe vpon buttock downe right vpon backe flyeth wolfe belly vpper part easily teareth bowel satisfieng hungergreedy appetite chance see beast water marsh emcombred mire come round stopping vp al passage shold come baying threatning poore distressed oxe plungeth himselfe many time ouer head ear least wise vex mire neuer suffer come aliue last perceiue dead cleane without life suffocation notable obserue singular subtilty drawe mire whereby may eat one goeth taketh beast taile draweth al power wit without strength may better kil liue beast remoue dead one mire therefore looketh behind calleth helpe presently another wolues taketh first wolues tail mouth third wolfe second fourth third fift fourth forward encreasing theyr strength vntil haue pulled beast dry lande whereby may see torment stretch owne body biting tailes mutually pinching straining euery ioynt vntil haue compassed desire man shold thinke strange wolfe kil oxe reported danau build temple apollo argo place saw wolfe destroy oxe receiued instruction thereby king greece wolues also enemy buffes maruaile seeing confidently reported aelianus time great famine get meat destroy one another meet together one bemoaning himselfe consent run round circle wolfe first giddy able stande falleth downe ground deuoured residue teare peeces arise againe aun wolues pliny affirmeth wolues italy whose sight hurtfull men man seeth one though haue neuer much desire cry yet hee hath power meaning find writer wolfe first see man man silent cannot speake man see wolfe wolfe silent canot cry otherwise tale fabulous superstitious thereupon came prouerbe lupus fabula est signifie silence although thing reported plato ruellius vincentius ambros yet rather beleeue fabulous true howbeit albertus writeth man extremity haue power loose cloke garment backe shal recouer voice sextus saith case one wolues see man first haue tip wolues taile shal neede feare anie harme number like tale concerning wolues creature pithagoras beast making water vpon vrine wolfe shal neuer conceiue young domestical fourefootedbeasts see eie wolfe hand man wil presently feare runne away taile wolfe hung cratch ox neuer eat meate horse tread vpon footesteps wolfe vnder horseman rider hee breaketh peeces else standeth amazed wolfe treadeth footsteppes horse draweth waggon cleaueth fast rode frozen mare foale tread vpon footstep wolfe casteth foal therefore egyptian signifie abortment doe picture mare treading vppon wolues foot thing reported cannot tell true supernatural accident wolues wolfe also laboureth ouercome leoparde followeth place place forasmuch dare aduenture vpon single hand hand gather multitude deuoure vvhen wolues set vpon wilde boresor although bee variance amonge themselues yet giue ouer mutual combat ioyne together vvolfe common aduersarie occasion wolfe hath euermore bin accounted fyerce wilde beast may appeare historie followinga history vvhen euristines procles intended marie daughter graecian might ioyne themselues perpetual league amity affinity went delphos aske counsel apollo place meet wiues apollo gaue answere meet extreame wild beast went lacedemonia yet beaste appeare meeke gentle vnto take wiues came land cleonians met wolfe carrying lambe mouth whereupon conceiued meaning apollo met wolfe country might happily successiuely take wiues married daughter thesander cleonimus verie honest man countrey reported milo crotaniata valiant strong man vpon season rending tree sunder wood destroy wolues one armes taken closing tree strength enough loose againe remained inclosed horrible torment vntill wolfe came deuoured like story vnto aelianus reporteth gelon syracusan scholler vnto whome came wolfe sat schoole writing tablescoelius tzetze tooke writing table hand schoolemaister inraged heerewith knowing himselfe valiant man tooke hold table vvolues mouth vvolfe drew maister schollers hope recouery table schoole plaine field sodainely hee destroyed schoolemaister hundered schollers sparing none gelon whose table baite prey hee onely slaine preserued vvolfe singular admiration al world whereby collected accident happen naturally oueruling hand god occasion also wooll skin beast killed wolues good nothing although flesh sheepe sweeter vnprofitable good nothing men haue bin forced inuent find many deuises destroying woluesthe taking wolues reward hunter necessity hath taught men much learning beene shameful misery indure tyranny spoiling beastes without labouring resistaunce reuenge cause propounded also reward killed vvolues law dracho killed young wolfe receiued tallent killed old wolfe receiued two talent solon prescribed hee brought vvolfe aliue shoulde receiue fiue peeces mony brought one dead receiue two apollo himselfe called lycoctonos wolfekiller taught people put away wolues homer calleth appollo lysegenes saide immediately hee borne mother latona chaunged shape wolfe nourished cause image wolfe set vp delphos others say reason ymage temple delphos robbed treasure thereof hid grounde diligent inquisition made theeues came wolf brought place golden vessel couered earth pulled feete say wolfe kil sacriliger lay asleepe mountaine parnassus hauing treasure euery day came downe gate delphos howling vntil cittizens followed mountaine shee shewed theefe treasure together list follow stand vpon fable true cause apollo called vvolfe killer feined shepheard heardsman therefore loue catle wolues enemy onely kil aliue also offered vnto sacrifice wolues sacred apollo iupiter mar therefore wee read apollo lycius lyceus many temple builded iupiter lyceus sacrifice instituted vnto called lycaea game name hollydaies cald luper calia wherein barren woman chastice themselues naked bare child hoping thereby gaine frutefulnesse wombe whereof ouid speaketh thus excipe foecunde pascientur verbera dextrae iam socer optatum nomen habebit saui propertius writer seeme mind first instituted fabius lupercus appeareth verse verbera pellitus setosamouebat arator vnde liceus fabius sacrum lupercus habet inuenal thus nec prodest agili palmas praebere luperco concerning manner taking vvoluesdiuers policy inuentions take wolues auncients haue inuented manic deuises gin first al yron toyle stil fasten earth iron pin vpon pin leaue ring compasse bignes wolues head midst whereof lay peece flesh couer toyle nothing seene flesh wolfe commeth taketh holde flesh feeling sticke pulling hard pulleth vp ring bringeth whole toyle necke sharpe pin first manner crescentiensis repeateth taking wolues saith deuises ensnare foot reader cannot vnderstand except saw eies italian cal net wherein wolues taken tagliola harpago lo rampino lycino french hauspied blondus affirmeth shepheardes italy make certaine ginne net wherein part wolfe taken first put manner taking wolues ditch pit diuers first dig deep ditch wolfe taken may get vpon pitte lay hurdle within vpon pillar set liue goose lambe wolfe windeth prey booty commeth vpon trench seeing little hole left open purpose cast wolfe deepe ditch vse lay vpon weak hurdle wil beare vp either man beast wolfe commeth vpon may breake fal downe best deuise opinion euer inuented kind pertch hurdle may made bait set one wolfe fallen downe may rise againe one accord stand entrap another great care must bee kinde ditch may bee made solide strong earth place affoorde opportunity must inside lined boords intent beast scraping digging foot make euasion rhaetians vse raise vp tree certaine engine like mousetrappe much greater cord hange bate flesh pullin thing wolfe loueth commeth vnto hee suddenly snatcheth pulleth trap vpon owne pate teucreans mysseans thraseans inhabitant asia wont carry short weapon kil wolues vsed also strongest dogges incoragement hunter would tear wolues piece hardly dogge couragious aduenture vppon wolfe single hand dogges haue therefore certaine collers made vnto leather stuft full sharp yron nail intent neck may sauegarded wolues biting blondus saith al hunting wolues doggs vaine except also set vp certaine great net made strong cord stretched standing stiffe may immouably fastned body tree strong pillar earth diuers place nettes must set boughes couer end wolfe descry either end net must made little shedde vvith boughes couer man wherein hunter must lodge speare readie pierce wolfe perceiueth net wolfe instantly wounded hee deliuer himselfe escape also must bee followed cry men dogges may returne backe againe den hunter obserue order hunting wolfe driuing net vvhen farre theyr net hunt gently let go leisure vvhen closer nearer vnto follovv vvith al speed violence meanes many intrapped suddenly killed hunting obseruations find recorded author taking vvolues nature beast feareth kind weapon except stone stone cast presently falleth downe auoide stroke saide place body wounded stone bred certaine wormes vvhich doe kill destroie therefore egyptian vvhen doe decipher man feareth eminent danger picture vvolfe stone orus vvriteth wolues likevvise feare fire euen lyon doe therefore vvhich trauell wood secret place night vvherein anie suspicion meeting wolues carry coople flint withall strike fire approach rauening beast dazleth eies danteth courage runneth away fearefully said wolues afraid noise sword iron strucke indestinctly noise whereof raging wolfe ran away hath bin beleeued voice singing man woman worketh effect horace testifieth much himselfe singing droue away wolfe verse nam que sylua lupus sabina dum meam canto tellagen vltra terminum cur vagor expeditus fugit niermem quale portentum ne que militaris daunia latis alit aesculetis nec iubetellus gener leonem arida nutrix time wolfe follow man far trecherously set vppon suddenly destroy let set vp stick staffe knowledgable marke middle space betwixt wolfe fear away suspitious beast feareth man thinketh carrieth engin trap take away life therefore also said trauailer doe draw long rod pole bundle stick clout wolfe neuer set vpon worthily mistrusting deserued pollicy ouerthrow catch aesculapius writeth man anoint himselfe fat sewet taken raines lyon wil driue avvay kind wolues bee take vvolues poisoning poyson certaine peeces meat cast abroad vvhereof vvolues eate die immediately certaine country men brought skin wolues citty rome carried vp downe street publikely seene affirming killed wolues powder certaine hearb cald cardus varius therewithall also could kil rat mouse pausanius saith temple apollo lyceus sicycon time inhabitant anoyed wolues could receiue commodity flockes wherevpon apollo taking pitty told temple certaine peece dry wood commaunding pull rinde barke wood beating powder mingle conuenient meat wolues cast abroad fieldes people commaunded oracle thereby destroyed al wolues kind wood neither pausanias pristes sicycon could declare one part world ewetree certaine fragment iuniper spindle tree rododaphne yeald poison vnto wolues mixed drinke besides know tree venemous yet plant innumerable especially wolfe bane occasion poysonfull herb tree iuyce liquor whereby nourished iuyce wholesome wolues maner haue taken great many aliue put tub great morter ther kil bruising piece afterwards make fire cole mountain wolues hant putting fish mixed blood peeces mutton leauing haue sauour thereof carryed euery way winde go hide themselues whilst mean time wolues inraged sauour fire seeke fro finde smell fire come quenched goeth naturally wolues smoke therof especially tasting flesh blood fish mountaines wolues hant wolues chance meet traine cat instantly followe inraged without feare man attaine therefore draweth catte accompanied another hunter armed gun pistoll cross bow appearaunce conradus gesner history wolf onely remember place epigram ausonius wherein pleasantly relateth story adulterated woman desiring make away iealous husband speed vehemency gaue drinke wolfebane quicksiluer mingled together eyther single poison compounded purgation epigram followeth toxica zelotypo dedit vxor mecha marito nec satis ad mortem credidit esse datum miscuit argenti letalia pondera best learned concerning truth heereof rauens perpetuall enmity wolues antiphathy nature violent reported philes aelianus rauen eat carcasse beast wolfe hath kild formerly tasted presently dyeth certaine wilde onion called scille say seaonion roote hath similitude onion thinges hatefull wolfe therefore arabian say treading legge falleth crampe whereby whole body many time endureth insufferable torment crampe increaseth convulsion cause worthy obserued vnspeakle lord workes whereas wolfe enemy fox turtle hath giuen secret instinct knowledge beast foule vertu u operation hearbe week bring foorth many blind whelp time according manner haue manie clawes foot legges without article therefore able go time littering vulgar opinion wolfe doth neuer al life bring foorth aboue nine time whereof last bringeth forth hir old age dog throgh weaknes infirmity rhaesians among wolues abound affirme constantly beginning may bring young den lead water sometimes seauen sometimes nine euery yeare increasing number first yeare littereth one whelpe second yeare two thirde yeare three obserueth proportion vnto nine time groweth barren neuer beareth said shee bringeth young one water obserueth drinking diligently lap water like dogge reiecteth vnworthy parentage sucke water like swine bite like beare taketh hir norisheth carefully vve haue said already wolues engender among themselues among beast vnderstood beare young equal proportion time dogges wolues commeth lupus canarius panther crocuta hyaena wolfe come thoes whome wee shal speake due place end story hyaena selfe else consumeth al flesh body leauing much skin couer bone also gal man seat commeth horseriding auncientes called lupi martiall ficus whereof made disticon stragula succincti venator sume veredi nam solet nudo surgere ficus equo also instrument called lupi harpages harpagones wherewithal ankers loosed sea thing taken deepe certaine territorie ireland whereof cambden writeth inhabitant liue till past fifty yeare old foolishly reported turned wolues true cause whereof hee coniectureth patt vexed disease called lycanthropia kind melancholy causing person affected moneth february forsake owne dwelling house run woodes neare graues sepulcher men howling barking like dog wolues true signes disease thus described marcellus saith thus affected haue face pale eies dry hollow looking drousily cannot weep tongue al scabd rough neither spit thirsty hauing many vlcers breaking body especiallie legges disease cal lycaon men oppressed therewith lycaones one lycaon fained poet wickednes sacrificing child iupiter turned wolf vtterly distracted human vnderstanding poet speake may wel agree melancholy thus writeth ouid territus ipse fugit nactus que silentia ruris exululat frustra que loqui couatur strange men thus diseased desire graues dead like vnto another disease called bellunensis demonium leoninum saith confusio rationis cum factis mali noxijs iracundis leone dictum videtur malum quod eo detenti alios homines laedant leonum instar eos saeuiant lyondiuel disease confusion reason ioyned wrathful impious fact seemeth bee named lyon oppressed therewith doe rage men wound like lyon pretty apologie league made betwixt wolues sheepethe apology wolues lamb whereupon came vvord lycophilios author rehearseth thus lupis et agni faedus aliquando fuit datis vtrin que obsidibus lupi suos catulos oues canum cho rtem dedere quietis ouibus ac pascentibus lupuli matrum de siderio vlulatus adunt tum lupi irruentes fidem faedus que solutum clamitant oues que canum praesidio destitutas laniant say peace made betwixt wolues sheepe either side giuing ostages wolues gaue young whelpes sheepe gaue shepheards dog wolues young wolues among flocke sheepe houled dam vvhen old vvolues heard came rushing vppon sheep cry broken league therfore destroyed sheep absence dog keepe whereby notably signified simplicity innocent men impiety wicked whatsoeuer bondes truce peace made euer respect owne aduantage taking smal occasion like wolues cry young one without al offence innocent harmeles breake brazen wals truce peace amity execution bloody vngodly mind particular dispositio woluesvvolues truely said fierce treacherous generous bold noble like lyon especially rage time hunger kil much wil suffice al flocke satisfied haue saide already seeme rather lambes wolues male alwaies carefull young one female shee suckleth younge one hee bringeth meate vnto denne greatly constrained fly away carry young one along great malice towards hurte niphus saith tried one day hunting neare rome dogge fighting wolfe comming multitude hunter alighted horse drew sword gaue wolfe wound wolfe feeling stroke sword forsooke dogge turned vppon man making force could bite professed reported betwixt olde lyon young whether true wolues cannot tell rather thinke contrary insatiable neuer thinke haue enough albertus saith communicate prey like lyon haue fed sufficiently hide residue ground til hunger againe vvhen set vppon horned beast inuade behinde back set vppon sheepe chuse darke cloudy day time may escape freely intent treadinges heard licke bottome sol foot meanes make noise among dry leaues going along chance breake sticke mind make noise presently bite foot guilty offence part set vpon cattle haue keeper rauen secret come vnto flocke sheep dogges first al consider whether bee able make party good see cannot match dogges depart away although haue begun spoile perceiue force equal superiour diuide themselues three rankes one companie killeth sneepe second company fighteth dog third setteth vppon men daunger taken hunter bite tip tailes therefore egyptian woulde describe man deliuered extremity danger picture wolf lacking part taile conclude perill extreamely fearefull astonished affraide especially vnauoidably included seeme harmles argueth basenesse mind subtil cowardlie treacherous daring nothing belly neither vppon singular aduantage manifesting
